(right now).Pros:-1080p but, 720p with 60 frames/second-Tiny, its about the same size as a blackberry or iphone-AUDIO INPUT Jack- This is huge!!-Great rich colors compared to the flip and others-Macro mode for filming close up-Image stabilization (it might not be the best, but it does work just enough to be a good thing, flip or others DONT have this)-up to 32GB SDHC/SD card support (Endless Videos)-HDMI output-Tripod mount, nice big display, comes with HDMI cable-Face Detection (another first for this group)Cons-No way to turn off red recording light (future firmware upgrade?)-1080P has the "Jello" effect when doing fast movement (future firmware upgrade?)-Mono built in mic (but not a huge deal because of audio input and the built in mic isnt bad sounding)-Still camera mode isn't great (but who cares)-menu system is real basic-Final Cut Pro chokes on 720P 60 Frames/sec and must be imported using compressor (all other modes import fine- Future Update?)-Low Light quality is poor (expected for this price range, they all suck for lowlight)-No headphone Jack (to listen to mic input...EEK, wish they could at least make the A/V port live during recording so it could be used, Firmware possible?)

Reviews.Title: Horrid Little Device - My Phone Camera Works Better
Reviews.Author: Apoc "Apoc"
Reviews.Content: I purchased this Zi8 shortly after my first child was born. Knowing my wife and I would want to make sure to have something we could grab quickly to record the many "catch it now or you won't see it again" moments as our new arrival grew older, I decided to drop the money on a handheld camcorder. As a caveat before I get into the details, let me say that it is pretty incredible that you can cram all the tech needed to build a camcorder into a device this small. However, let me also say that's not necessarily a good thing in this case.Of course, the first thing you do with a new device is to set it up. That proved fairly easy. I wanted a camera where I could make minor adjustments needed for the different scenes I might encounter while being easy enough to operate that my wife (who hates menus and tech) could still press two or three buttons and have the camera recording from a dead stop. If you want anything more complex than some simple brightness and quality adjustments, you're out of luck - this is obviously a camera designed for the non-technologically inclined - but the menu system is pretty eazy cheezy.Once you start recording with it, one problem becomes immediately apparent. Without a tripod, and regardless of how the image stabilization is set up, the results from this camera are shaky shaky. Doesn't matter how you try to stabilize it (and I tried so many different ways I lost count) - holding it in your hand stabilizing your elbow, holding it in both hands, laying down on the floor holding the camera out in front of you - it doesn't matter. I was firmly convinced the "image stabilization" was a meaningless tacked-on feature meant to fool the unwary so I turned it off just to see - and it reached even more frightening heights of jitterbugginess (technical term) :). So when it comes to this camera, don't even think about ordering it without a tripod (which I had to immediately order after trying to use it without one).As for the much over-hyped "720 HD" resolution, somewhat of a laugh and a snort from this reviewer on that. I play 720p and 1080p HD video games all the time and watch full HD movies both on a projector and a Sony TV and this 720, while it seems to genuinely be 720 resolution, still looks pretty crappy.So, after getting the tripod set up and recording a few videos of my kid (mainly looking around and drooling since he was like three months old at the time) I figured "Hey, let's get a movie put together and post it on YouTube for the grandparents!" (a feature prominently tooted about on the packaging of the camera - YouTube, not the grandparents). Connecting the camera to the computer was easy (USB to USB....pretty simple), but I encountered my first icky surprise after dragging and dropping all the movies to my computer.This camera records everything in a format called .MOV. Which neither Windows Media Player nor Windows Movie Maker can actually play. In fact, curiously enough, despite the FOUR OTHER PROGRAMS I downloaded from the Internet just trying to WATCH the movies, it seems nearly no other program except for their included ArcSoft Media Impression for Kodak DOES actually work with .MOV format files.Not bad, I figured - tech can be annoying. I loaded up the included ArcSoft Media Impression for Kodak software the camera came with and after some irksome updates, got it opened and running. Turns out the ArcSoft program has a few even more annoying "features":1. Crashes about every thirty minutes (if not sooner)2. Takes anywhere from fifteen to forty five minutes to convert .MOV files into something any other software can actually run.3. When you actually try to string together video clips to make a movie, the program acts like you have beaten it with a Glitch Stick and promptly spasms, collapsing in a puddle of electronic goo and refusing to function.As the ultimate Fatality to compound the frustration, the video camera on my Android phone (which, incidentally, cost me only $150 out of pocket) not only records videos easier (even 720 HD ones), saves them in the easy to use MP4 format, but also can upload my videos straight to YouTube right off my phone. So if Kodak, who has been around for decades, can't make a standalone device that works half as well as the video camera built into my phone (which does a thousand other things too) then I would say things are in a sad state when it comes to optical electronics (aka cameras). You're probably asking at this point why I gave the camera two stars. It got two stars simply because it is capable of recording video and doesn't literally explode when you turn it on.Now, over a year after my son was born, I decided (foolishly) to take this camera along to record his first birthday party. Like an idiot I assumed it would make more sense to use the actual video camera we owned to record the birthday party instead of using my phone. Boy I wish I had used my phone. For "fun" I started tracking how much time it's taking me - as I write this review (burning time as I wait for the ArcSoft program to convert my MOV files to something usable) I've crossed over into the seventh hour now attempting to get these videos to something usable. And that's not even counting the other videos I have archived in .MOV format that I still have to go through.In conclusion, don't buy this camera unless 1. It's 20 bucks, 2. You're brain dead, or 3. You really like tormenting yourself and are looking for a new low in agony. :)

Reviews.Title: Great camera, but keep files small.
Reviews.Author: Larry Stuppy "larstup"
Reviews.Content: Bought this camera after trying another brand and having to return it for poor quality. The quality of the Kodak is great. When recording for an extended period (1 hour)it did not succeed. The picture and the sound were misaligned. Lots of skips also. When recording 15 minutes or less I did not have this problem. I still love the camera.

Reviews.Title: Works Satisfactorily
Reviews.Author: Harry F. Benson
Reviews.Content: Handy little video camera that takes sharp videos.  Only complaint has to do with the LCD viewer, it is difficult to view in strong sunlight.

Reviews.Title: I like it
Reviews.Author: asdfjkl;
Reviews.Content: The main reason for me purchasing the Zi8 was for the mic line out. I am shooting video in a comedy club where I want good audio, image quality was important but not as critical to the shot as the audio for uploading youtube videos. I've been pleased so far with the sound, though the majority of this burden is placed upon the microphone I have plugged into, for me the fact that I can plug a mic in is enough for me to like the product. The video has been good, sometimes a bit blanched under the lights but I've noticed if the camera can be closer to the subject the washed out look is dampened. It starts up quickly and I have been pleased with the battery life so far (lasts about 2 hours).

Reviews.Title: Very nice camera for school projects
Reviews.Author: Q. V. Thomas
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera to record face-to-face interviews with the camera on a tripod. The video quality and ease-of-use make it perfect for this application.  I have used high end ENG BetaCams, Canon HD equipment, Sony handcams and the like for over 20 years and find these small HD cameras to be easy, a lot of fun and give a great image.PROS: Tripod mount, external microphone jack, Macro switch, zoom feature, video format(MOV), recording resolution options, a red LED "recording" indicator on the lens side of the camera, USB download port, 32 GB SD option(the SD card can easily be removed for file transfers to a laptop), the ArcSoft software is handy, but not a "real" video editing tool, HD format for still photos.  A great Amazon price.CONS: 1)The camera powers down automatically after a few minutes even when it is on the AC power adaptor. Unfortunately, powering back on resets all "Setup" values back to their defaults.  This can be annoying between takes when using an external mike when you set the mike record value to the maximum value.  2)The in-camera speaker is almost worthless. This is very annoying when trying to do sound checks (there is no headphone jack).Hints: 1) Long-time videographers know that no camera can be used to do fast panning.  If you want to pan, always do it very slowly. Image stablization cannot overcome the effects of a fast pan, it it only designed to minimize minor shaking in a hand held situation.  2) Buy a spare battery and keep it charged. I get about 2 hours off a fresh recharge. 3) Take it with you for still photos too. The HD format makes nice photos even if they aren't 5 Mpixel. 4) When recording normal speaking voices over 6 ft away, I reccommend using an external mic, just be sure to power it on if it uses a battery. Kids playing and yelling will be okay on the internal camera mic.

Reviews.Title: Good video, So-So Stills, Poor Editing Software
Reviews.Author: Daxer
Reviews.Content: Just got this thing the other day and it's a pretty cool little video camera.  My sister has a Flip and I was looking for something similar to replace my Canon digital tape camcorder which crapped out after many years.  After reading the predominantly glowing reviews both here and in the trade magazines I thought I'd try Kodak even though they're not know for their digital cameras.  After playing with this camera for a few days I think it will fit the bill although I guess I expected a little more based on the rave reviews.Controls are basic, easy to use, easy to access, and easy to understand.  Good thing because documention is pretty sparse.  More on that in a moment.  I especially like the ability to quickly and easily choose between the different video resolutions.I'm a little disappointed at the quality of the still imagery however.  Sure it's a 5 megapixel camera but don't think it will replace your digital point and shoot.  The lens is just not there and there's virtually no settings to adjust.  It is what it is.  The images aren't bad but have a vague opaqueness to them.  Clearly not on par with what you might be used to.The camera includes an HDMI (and composite video) cable which is a nice touch and allows for a direct connection to the idiot box.  Can't pass judgement on the battery life yet but recharging it is no harder than charging a cell phone with the included AC adapter/charger.  Thanks Kodak for not making us have to go out and buy them.The current firmware of the camera (available in the tools menu) is version 1.06 (as of 9 Feb 11).  If you're running something earlier than this there's a firmware patch available on line.  I can't say much for the User Guide that comes with the camera as it really doesn't explain in more than a few words what the features are used for or how to get the most from them.  The User Guide itself references an "Extended Users Guide" available at the Kodak site online and provides the link . . . but the link is broken.  I found the "extended" guide elsewhere at Kodak as a .pdf file and it's just a rehash of the basic User Guide.  I would have liked to have seen a chart showing how much memory is used per minute with the different resolution settings.  That would help with deciding how large an SDHC card to get.  Speaking of which, you definitely need an external card as the onboard memory is negligible and regardless of what size you opt for you'll want one with no less than a Class 6 file transfer rate.The ArcSoft camera-to-computer software package that comes resident, well, it's a basic little package which would probably satisfy most users . . . if it only worked!  The media player (no big deal) and the video editor (a big deal) both load screens that don't fit on your (at least not on my netbook) computer screen, leaving the portion with the controls hanging off the bottom edge with no way to reach it.  This renders any editing or movie creation (including making DVDs) impossible.  I checked the ArcSoft User Forum and found three other complaints on the same issue in the last three months.  No excuse for this, ArcSoft (are you listening, Kodak?).One more little peeve:  Other reviewers mentioned the camera is a little slippery and a fingerprint magnet so I ordered the custom rubber sleeve sold here on Amazon as an accessory.  It greatly improves grip and has holes cut for all the entry and exit points save one, the USB-to-computer arm.  So you have to pull the camera out of the sleeve each time you need to dump video to the computer for editing (assuming of course you have something other than ArcSoft software).So to sum up, this looks like a nice, easy to use digital video camera.  The still camera capability isn't great, the documentation is a little sparse, and the editing software stinks.  But despite all that I think most users looking for an on-the-run compact camcorder that takes great video will be completely satisfied, especially for the price.FOLLOW UP:Heard from ArcSoft Tech Support that the Media Impression software that comes with the camera will NOT work properly unless your screen resolution is AT LEAST 1024 x 768.  Most desktops and laptops have this resolution (you may have to change your settings) BUT some netbooks do NOT have this minimum resolution.  If that's the case, the software will NOT function properly and you won't be able to edit or create movie clips with the ArcSoft software included with Zi8.  And apparently there are no plans to change this.  Hey Kodak, would have been nice to know, eh?

Reviews.Title: External Mic Jack Works Great With My Audio Mixer !!!
Reviews.Author: Ocean Blue
Reviews.Content: It's hard to add anything to what over 500 positive reviews have already said.  This is a great camera at a great price!!!I had one specific purpose in mind for this camera - I wanted to run from my audio mixer (XENYX USB1222FX) directly into the camera to capture the best audio possible (vocals & acoustic electric guitars).  The external mic jack makes the Zi8 PERFECT for this application !!!  For those who may be thinking about doing the same thing - I used the CD/Tape Output on the audio mixer (RCA jacks) and ran directly into the external mic input on the Kodak Zi8.  Initially I was getting a lot of hum, but after some experimentation I eventually determined that the external mic sensitivity setting on the Kodak Zi8 needed to be turned down FOUR NOTCHES !!! Four notches looks like ALOT on the graphic representation of the sensitivity setting, but it did the trick perfectly - now I have crystal clear audio with a great HD pic in all my vids.(p.s., Don't forget to set the sensitivity EVERY TIME the camera is powered back on - the camera does not "remember" the mic sensitivity setting when the power is switched off.  I figured I'd pass this tip along since I discovered it the HARD way.)I am currently doing 99% of my vids in one location indoors (my in-home music studio) using a tripod & using AC to power the camera.  However, I did purchase a number of accessories I think everyone should consider for a complete Zi8 experience:  an additional battery, a separate AC / 12V charger, the black silicone protective sleeve, a larger capcity SD card, the CaseLogic TBC-312 nylon case, etc.  I'm sure as I venture outside (beach, boating, vacations, holidays, etc), these accessories will be important to fully enjoy the Zi8 experience !!!Great camera - buy one today !!!(One final note:  The first Zi8 I received would not charge through the power jack due to a short in the power jack (female - camera side vs male - cable side).  This was quite evident by an intermittent power light /power LED at the slightest touch of the jack.  NO WORRIES !!!  Amazon.com was fantastic - they immediately shipped me a new Zi8 which arrived in 2 days. After MUCH seraching online I could NOT find evidence that this is a known or recurring problem with the Kodak Zi8.  Therefore, this would NOT deter me from purchasing the Zi8 again as a gift for family & friends.  HOWEVER, this experience DID ensure that ALL FUTURE PURCHASES of the Zi8 WILL be made thru AMAZON.COM !!!!  Thank you Amazon.com for the great return experience !!!)

Reviews.Title: AWESOME CAMERA!
Reviews.Author: J. Baggett
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera at a local store because it went on sale and I wanted to be sure to have it for Christmas.  I did alot of online research and you can't beat this for the money.  The video quality is awesome.  Make sure you have the latest firmware - version 1.06.  If not, you can download it from the Kodak website.  One trick I learned online was regarding low indoor lighting.  It said to zoom in on the subject and then slowly zoom out.  voila! At a certain point it will look like someone turned the lights on.  Don't know why, but it works.  Regarding sound, I thought the volume adjustment was just for an external mic, but it's for the internal mic too.  Huge difference when you turn up the volume.  The camera has essentially no internal memory, so be sure to get a good quality sdhc card, class 6 or better...Cards are not rated just by how much memory they have, but how fast they can record (writing speed). Can't blame the camera if you have a slow card.  I bought a 4 GB SanDisk Extreme III(a class 6 card with a writing speed of 20)from Amazon.  It records awesome video.  The ArcSoft MediaImpression software is okay.  I'm still learning how to use all the features.  I just noticed that the video can be broken into still frames.  That's cool if there's something you'd like to print as a photo.  Love this camera!

Reviews.Title: Great little movie camera
Reviews.Author: baltimore book love "baltimore book lover"
Reviews.Content: As someone else posted, you can't compare this with a professional-level video camera. Don't expect to shoot the next Oscar winner with this. But - I have been absolutely delighted with the quality of the video I've gotten. I've been shooting my son's basketball games (using a tripod) at 720/60fps and am amazed at how clear the video is. I also shot a lot this afternoon without a tripod of kids out sledding, and again, the video was quite stable and really clear. I haven't tried it in low-light situations, but I wouldn't be surprised if the quality fell off there. Again, it's not a professional camera! I really didn't bother with the software that comes with it (or rather, that you can download), as I have Premiere Elements, and Windows Movie Maker is just great for editing quick clips. I have recommended this camera to everyone I know.

Reviews.Title: Excellent Pocket Camcorder
Reviews.Author: K. Cole "Namma"
Reviews.Content: I have two Flip Video's, both of which I've used a great deal over the past few years. An opportunity arose to purchase the Kodak ZI8 at a cost less than a new up-to-date Flip, at Amazon during the Christmas season. I purchased the Kodak ZI8 after reading the reviews on Amazon and am very happy with this purchase.Almost everything about the Kodak ZI8 is easier, better and more fun than the Flip HD. The view screen is bigger the controls are easier to use. The features are better..it comes capable of filming in 1080P where as the Flip HD only films in 720. The cost is far lower and the software that comes pre-loaded, although not as sleek looking as the Flip Share software, it allows one to do a great deal more with their video's and it's easy to use!The picture quality is excellent even ok in low light..better than the Flip HD. The sound quality is excellent too compared to the Flip HD.  I purchased a Sony mini microphone to attach to it, but have not yet used it as in all circumstances I've filmed with it, it has produced the sound perfectly.It's easy to upload and share video's to Facebook, You Tube and other sites with the included software. This camera is just plain fun! It's easy to use and takes excellent video for the type of video recorder that it is. If your looking for a pocket camcorder, I would highly recommend that you look at the Kodak line and read the reviews before blindly buying a Flip of any kind. This little camera ROCKS!  And it costs a great deal less than a Flip! Kodak has done an outstanding job in making this camcorder fun and easy to use.

Reviews.Title: Better than the Flip!
Reviews.Author: Michael W. Chambliss
Reviews.Content: I was looking for a camera to capture live performances: lightweight, easy to use, good in low light, with an audio input so I could record better audio. I found it in the Zi8. The camera's far superior to the Flip in low light and uses flash cards which means you don't have to stop recording, just replace a full card with an empty one. The only thing about all of these is the zoom. With a 4x digital zoom, you're viewing only 25% of the pixels in the full frame, blown up in size. There is a noticable jump in the zoom between 2x and 3x, or 1/2 way through the zoom in process. If you require a light, you can mount it on a tripod, or not, with an L bracket and 1 or 2 LED lights by Dynex.

Reviews.Title: Bad still pictures, and bad low light performance
Reviews.Author: demianxyz
Reviews.Content: I go this camera because of the mini jack input. I needed to record audio input and this camera works very well for that.I also wanted a camera that made decent still pictures. But zi8 still pictures are really bad. This product will not replace a still camera. Also, it's really bad under low light conditions.For everything else, I like this camera. The movies are high quality 720p at 60fps is great for recording things that happen fast.

Reviews.Title: Brilliant!
Reviews.Author: Connor Gisby
Reviews.Content: This camera is brilliant, I have had it almost a year now, and NO problems what-so-ever. It's so easy to use, sort files, and upload them straight to facebook and/or youtube, which I do like to do :PHave had no problems with it, no lines, nothing that have been said in the 1-star reviews. I also dropped it from quite a height onto some rocks, yet it still survived with barely a scratch, and it was in perfect condition :)I would definitely recommend this to people, infact I have, my parents have bought one for themselves, and are planning to get my brother one for christmas :)

Reviews.Title: Fabulous Kodak Zi8
Reviews.Author: Lady Lill
Reviews.Content: Just began using my Kodak ZI8 mini camcorder and I love it. The price was ideal. New $119.88 from Amazon.com.  It has features that higher end camcorders do not have. i.e. external mic input. HD It' compact..No bigger than a cell phone but takes good videos. I spent almost 3x as much on another camcorder and the difference was minimal..more zoom and touch screen which is not a big deal to me.  It fits my purpose.

Reviews.Title: EXCELENT for the money
Reviews.Author: Gonzalo Lara
Reviews.Content: Is just awesome, it blows the competiton out of the water for the price.i also use the Zi6 and there is not possible comparationThe Zi8 is* Prettier* Easier* BEtter picture (stabilization)* last longer (Rechargable battery instead of AA)Totally recommended, you wont be sorry

Reviews.Title: Great Affordable HD Camera
Reviews.Author: Dean R. Peterson "Dean"
Reviews.Content: The Kodak Zi8 is pretty much everything I was looking for in a camera. It's small and portable, it shoots 1080p, it has a removable battery, and the kicker for me is the external audio input.For me, the ability to plug in a microphone makes all the difference and I think puts this camera ahead of all others. The biggest problem with a lot of video these days is the atrocious audio. The built in mic on this camera isn't actually that bad, it's better than most other similar HD cameras. But if you're shooting an interview nothing will compare with plugging in a lav. I also bought the Sony ECM-DS70P and used an L bracket that I bought at Radio Shack and it works great.One of the downsides is the menu navigation. It's kind of wonky and certainly not the most intuitive layout I've ever used. It's passable and definitely not a reason to skip this camera. I guess it's more of an annoyance than anything.Overall, the footage this thing shoots looks great. The 720p 60fps mode looks really good, it's a really nice option if you're moving the camera a lot. I would definitely recommend this camera to anyone who's looking for an affordable, portable HD camera.

Reviews.Title: Not Professional, But Close Enough
Reviews.Author: Rosie M.
Reviews.Content: I purchased the Kodak Zi8 looking for a camera that could make good videos. I didn't want it to make short clips of concerts or my friends dancing like the advertisement depicts, but I wanted to make movies that were short (5-15 minutes), and that were a good enough quality to post on Youtube. This camera definitely serves that purpose. The image stabilization makes the picture a little less jumpy, but one of the main things I thought was great was the microphone jack. The microphone that is built in to the camera is totally crappy, you really can't use this camera with out another microphone. I hooked a cheap one up (from the dollar store), and it worked perfectly. I also liked that I could adjust the volume of the microphone using the settings menu. The macro setting is pretty decent, however it cannot go as close as one might imagine (only about six inches away). I would also recommend that if you are going to be using the macro setting a fair amount, look into getting a removable macro lens. Once again, I made one by using a jewelers/geology magnifying glass, and it worked perfectly. Another thing that the Zi8 lacks is a low-light setting. If you're going to be shooting in the dark, a higher-end camera would work better. The still-photo camera that is built into the Zi8 is actually pretty decent, taking pictures that don't look like the crappy stills you get from a Flip (although with a Flip you have to take a video and then take a picture with the software from the video).  And, as I mentioned before, this does have image stabilization, however if you want something to really look pro, you'll have to buy a tripod (I bought one, also from Amazon, for about a dollar). The one thing I really don't like about this camera is the memory. IF YOU'RE BUYING THIS CAMERA, YOU MUST ALSO BUY A MEMORY CARD. The camera comes with about nine seconds worth of video, which isn't much time. Overall, this camera is great. I would definitely recommend it for the newbie, and it is much better than the Flip, in almost all aspects. For the money, it's a great little camcorder.

Reviews.Title: Remarkable for the price.
Reviews.Author: Michael Watters
Reviews.Content: I lot of the negative reviews regarding the video quality are probably due to either a computer with an older processor or video card, or the use of a SDHC card that has too low of a rating. You will need a SDHC card of at least a 6 rating in read/write speed in order to adaquately record HD video on this device. Older computers can have a lot of trouble displaying the HD video properly.Also, the low-light capabilty of this recorder isn't very good. Put some light on the subject or scene if you want the best video possible. Buy a $30.00 camcorder LED light unit like I did and you should be good-to-go. I recommend an external microphone, which is a VERY nice feature, although the internal mic is OK for many occasions. Note that you can get stereo sound from an external mic, but only mono sound from the internal microphone.The software loads off of the device itself -- no CD. It's pretty simple to use, but doesn't have a lot of features. It will allow almost instant posting to YouTube, etc. which is a nice addition.On the slightly negative side, the door to the SD card slot is remarkably flimsy and delicate, and can be broken or lost easily. The lens does not have a protective cover. I use a small rubber band  around the body to hold the puny SD door in place, and cover the lens with an optical lens cleaning cloth when storing or transporting. Don't drop the unit on a hard surface!You probably won't be filming a major motion picture with the Zi8, but for casual and excellent video recording it is exceptional. Get an external mic and a light unit, and you will be ready for virtually any recording situation.

Reviews.Title: Zi8
Reviews.Author: Goldie
Reviews.Content: The size and portability cannot be beat.  I would have an extra battery on hand, as it's life is fairly short and if you're on a trip, it will not last a full day.I haven't mastered the editing yet so I can't say how that is.I would say this is a great value for the money to capture those special moments with convenience.

Reviews.Title: Couldn't be any simpler to use.
Reviews.Author: mw4439
Reviews.Content: This camera couldn't be any easier to use--turn it on, press the button and you're recording.  Press it again to stop.  Press the play button to review.  Pop out the memory card and plug into your computer to download (or use the built-in USB).  No special knowledge needed to take great movies.

Reviews.Title: Great Budget Pocket HD Video Camera!
Reviews.Author: ItsBenReviewed
Reviews.Content: For my Video Footage Test Please Visit YouTube, my video name is Kodak Zi8 Footage Tests and my user name is ItsBenReviewedI gave the Kodak Zi8 5 stars because it does everything I expected and more.**If you are using a tripod turn off EIS (image stabilization) it will save you some battery life time for your recording session**Video quality is great, although it lacks a little in dark situations. I mainly use it in the daylight and i can fix the lighting issues with editing software. The image stabilization on the camera works well as long as you do not use the zoom, and yes everyone says the video quality is lacking when the zoom is used and that is because it is digital and not optical, so it only blows up pixels. I have used the face detect feature but i cannot tell the difference whether it is on or off. I mainly use the 720p/60fps setting; great quality and can capture action without the shot being too blurry. I love using the macro mode as well to get some up-close detail shots in.All in all it is a great camera and i would recommend it in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: The camera is really nice.
Reviews.Author: Karen S. Geick
Reviews.Content: I really like this camera but the editing tools are not the best.  I have used the camera more for filming church services more than anything else.  I have only owned the camera for slightly more than a month.  I have made DVD's of these services.  They are very professional looking, but the editing tools that came with the ArcSoft Media software have a lot to be desired.  You can't see each frame and I have tried to cut out sections before and they are still there when I burned the DVD.  Editing as you can see is my big petpeve with the software.  I would definitely recommend purchasing the camera.

Reviews.Title: Sweet Little Pocket Video Camera!
Reviews.Author: S. Zitofsky
Reviews.Content: I am loving my refurbished Kodak zi8!  I took it to the Grand Canyon where I used it for the first time.  Admittedly, I hadn't read the instructions prior to use (I received it and got on the plane), I found it somewhat difficult to navigate upon first use.  I suggest reading the instruction manual to learn how to use it first!  However, once I grasped the concept, I was able to easily use it to take fantastic video pictures.  It also takes stills.  It has its own USB cable tucked away, so it's simple to upload video.  The quality, even on the low settings, is excellent!  It has image stabilization, too, a great feature to prevent shaky video.  I bought my camera refurbished for well under $100 and it's the way to go!  My biggest complaint is that, as CNET review states, it shows fingerprints all over the camera, leaves smudges.  But that's a very minor con.  It's light weight, great battery life, and well worth the purchase (does HDMI, too)!!  Love it.  It is just what I wanted in a small, portable, hand held video camera.

Reviews.Title: Kodak Zi8
Reviews.Author: fru1tbooter14
Reviews.Content: The Kodak Zi8 is a portable HD camcorder. IT gives you the ability to film 1080p films in the palm of your hand. You can also select 720p video at 60fps (frames per second), or 30fps, and you can also take pictures as well.--The picture quality is pretty good all things considered, It is by no means on par with a DSLR camera or something in the 12+ mp range, but it is fine if you just wanna take some quick snapshots with your friends.-You may also record videos in standard definition if you want to, I'm not sure of the fps, but it does a decent job, especially if you have a smaller memory card, and you are wanting to conserve space.--The 720p/30fps mode is a nice addition for those looking for the slower framerate, but I personally don't get much use out it.--The 720p/60fps option is, in my opinion, the best mode of them all. You get the high resolution 720p picture, with the smooth 60fps look. The picture quality is wonderful. Much better than the Flip hd in my opinion. That's not to say that the Flip hd is bad, I just feel that the Kodak Zi8 is a better buy.--The 1080p/30fps option is also a good option on this camera, and is one of the selling points of this camera. While the framerate will not be the super smooth 60fps, 30fps still provides stunning video quality.--The image stabilization on this camera is not the best, actually its really not that helpful. It's really not necessary when you're using a tripod or when you have a steady hand.--The usb out is nicely tucked away into the camera's side. While the cord itself is VERY short, a USB extender cord will be VERY helpful, if not necessary for this. Luckily, they are cheap and easy to come by.-- Really this camera is just about everything I could ask for in a mini hd camcorder. Wonderful video quality, Great Audio quality.*IT DOES WELL IN CONCERTS* For proof of that, I took it to a CYNIC concert recently and filmed a couple of songs. There was very low light, and it was quite loud. here is the link [...] If any of you out there have any questions about the Zi8, feel free to send me a message, and I'll try my best to help you out.

Reviews.Title: Flip What?
Reviews.Author: Joe Chicago
Reviews.Content: If your deciding between the Flip camera and Kodak you can stop doing research now. I have both, and Kodak wins hands down. Built in mic input jack, 1080p possibility, FREE HDMI mini cable (Flip doesnt come with mini HDMI) and an external battery charger and separate SD card. The only expense out of the box is a decent SD card BUT once you get one their very portable and many vehicles will have the capability to play directly from SD soon as well, so its easy to take your videos on the go. Kodak ZI8 is a win win!

Reviews.Title: great for the electronically challenged
Reviews.Author: MB "musiclove"
Reviews.Content: My husand purchased a camcorder last year and threw out the manual since he just figures these things out.  I would have had trouble even with the manual but now I was totally stumped.I kept reading reviews on the point and shoot camcorders and finally tried the Zi8. It was irrisistable at the price on Amazon.  Even I could figure out some things withot the book. SIMPLE controls and buttons. To comprehend this you shold know I really am a moron when it comes to gadgets. I took it to church and recorded a skit for practice. My husband snatched it to put on the computer and was amazed at the quality, especially since it was my first time holding and following movement with a camcorder. Then he said he couldn't believe it had CMOS (huhh??) at that price. He spun it on a Cd and the pastor said it was good enough to put on the internet.Soon he borrowed it and the battery lasted over 70 minutes of steady shooting at a seminar, although it already had some time on it.Now he borrows it frequently and I would bet we will own another one soon.

Reviews.Title: Won't Find A Better HD Camcorder For This Price!!!
Reviews.Author: Kevin M. Woolery "KMW"
Reviews.Content: // To view this video download Flash Player (version 9.0.115 or higher)'); } } catch(err) { fp_resizePlayerSpace('cv_mo2K3160QZKV5VE', 0, 0); } return false; } function _cv_mo2K3160QZKV5VEloadSwf(movieID, playerVersion) { var swfLocation = "http://g-ecx.images-amazon.com/images/G/01/am3/20120510035744301/AMPlayer._V148501545_.swf"; } cv_mo2K3160QZKV5VEpreplay.onmouseout = function() { cv_mo2K3160QZKV5VEpreplay.src = "http://ecx.images-amazon.com/images/I/818oI02GBsS._SX320_PHcustomer-video-vignette_PIvideo-reviews-bottom,BottomLeft,0,43_OU01_PIcustomer-video-play,BottomLeft,130,-12_CR0,0,0,0_.png";
