logTag.type = "text/javascript"; logTag.src = "/gp/customer-media/du/log.html?ie=UTF8&p=CustomerImage&s=CustomerVideoPlay"; head[0].appendChild(logTag); } if (cv_mo2K3160QZKV5VEcurrentClick) { return cv_mo2K3160QZKV5VEcurrentClick(); } } } Length:: 2:31 MinsI've had my Kodak Zi8 for a little over a week now. I am simply amazed at the video quality for such a cheap camcorder. This is my first HD camcorder (except for my T1i DSLR). I searched around for reviews on which pocket HD camcorder to get for a good 3 weeks until I finally decided on the Zi8.I finally decided on the Zi8 for a couple of reasons. 1. External mic opportunity 2. The ability to use my own memory cards (up to 32gb) 3. I thought the picture quality was better than that of the comparable Flip models when watching over 100 different videosThe results I have got so far are absolutely wonderful in my opinion. There are a couple of things I suggest you steer clear of. 1. Low light. This isn't a $5,000 camcorder. Like most other "cheaper" camcorders the Zi8 does not like low light at all. It's best to be outdoors or in a well lit room. 2. Don't zoom. The Zi8 only has digital zoom. It does not have optical zoom. When you use the digital zoom you can most definitely notice the picture degrading.There are some things I don't like about the Zi8 or wish it had. For one, the lens is always exposed. This can cause dust, smudge, fingerprints, etc. to get on the lens. If you watch the video I posted you will notice a smudge in the upper right hand corner of the video when the bonfire is going. Since the camera is so portable and easily gets put into your pocket, it's quite easy for it to get dirty. I don't want to carry around a camcorder bag as the whole purpose of getting such a small camcorder was it's portability. With that in mind, I did buy a small neoprene carrying case for it, but it's a little bulky in my pocket now. I just wish there would have been some kind of lens eye that would open and close when in use or not in use.I haven't been able to get the software that is preloaded on the Zi8 to install on my PC. I am running Vista 64-Bit and meet all the requirements listed. Since I already had video editing software loaded on my PC I didn't care too much about it not working. Although from reading other reviews, apparently the software on the Zi8 is absolutely worthless anyway. I would suggest purchasing your own video editing software.As far as the layout of the Zi8. It's extremely easy to use and it doesn't take a rocket scientist to figure out how to change the settings. There's really nothing you need to know to make it work better or more efficiently. I pretty much left everything the same as far as the settings. It has the option for "face detection" and "image stabilization" neither of which I believe work that well. There is really no need for these to be on but it doesn't really change anything if you turn them off.Choosing which setting for video is a matter of personal preference. I tinkered around with each and decided to leave it on 720p @ 60/fps. This, in my opinion, gives the smoothest video at the best quality. The 1080p option would be OK if you had the camera mounted on a tripod and were using it for a presentation of some sorts or recording something that didn't have a lot of movement. The 720p 30/fps wasn't too bad. You can notice the video and/or panning isn't quite as smooth. This is why, like stated before, I always keep mine set at 720p 60/fps. The video quality is awesome and when panning, either with a tripod or handheld, it looks smoother than the others. You can see examples of this in the video.The sound on the Zi8 is very sub-par. This is to be expected for a cheaper camcorder. I definitely wasn't expecting great sound recording from the Zi8. It only has mono capabilities, BUT, you can plug in an external mic. I purchased a Sony ECM-DS70p off eBay for around $4. This exact mic sells for around $40-$50 on Amazon. I have yet to test out the mic outside, but inside the sound is vastly improved.Overall, I am extremely happy with the Kodak Zi8. I would recommend this to anyone looking for a well priced HD pocket camcorder. You really can't go wrong with it. Just keep a steady hand and you'll have great results.

Reviews.Title: Kodak Zi8 vs. Flip MinoHD
Reviews.Author: Stephen Evans
Reviews.Content: I have both the Kodak Zi8 and Flip MinoHD at work. When buying one for home use, I chose the Kodak Zi8. The image quality is much better. I like the microphone jack on the Kodak as neither of these cameras have great microphones. Image stabilization is better on the Kodak if the zoom is not used. On both cameras, a steady handheld image is nearly impossible when using the zoom. I like the included editing software too.This is such a good product, the shortcomings are really disappointing. To keep the cost down, the Kodak comes with almost no memory. When adding in the cost of buying a memory card, this is a more expensive camera than the Flip. I wish this recorded mp4 instead of Quicktime. The base of the camera is rounded, precluding the possibility of setting this camera on a table while recording - which can be done with the Flip. If you have a laptop with a USB port exactly where the one in the Kodak instructions indicates, then the USB connection on this camera is convenient. Otherwise...I have to prop up my computer, turn my camera upside down, and use other objects to hold the camera in the awaward position needed to connect this camera to my computer. Wish the editing software included some free stock music like the Flip software has. Many of these design flaws seem so obvious, I am hoping Kodak will fix them on a newer model soon. Despite knowing these flaws, I still bought this over the Flip MinoHD.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: D-Stylz
Reviews.Content: I initially looked at the Flip camera, but after reading multiple reviews there were a few things that led me to the Zi8.1)The use of a memory card does not necessitate downloading often as I can just put in another SDHC.2)The usb port exists within the camera and it's so easy to plug into my PC.3)The price was great!4)It films at 720p/1080p and easily uploads to YouTube/facebook etc.5)It comes with the proper HDMI cable which makes watching it on your TV very easy. (My kids love that!)Other thoughts:1)This camera is super-easy to use. Even my wife who is technologically challenged has no trouble making it go.2)The battery charges quickly and lasts much longer than I expected.3)I would recommend a small tripod for certain contexts as you have to hold the camera fairly steady to get a good shot.4)The digital zoom is limited, but works.5)I like that it also takes still photos.Overall, this is a great value and our family is really enjoying all of its benefits.

Reviews.Title: Kodak Zi8
Reviews.Author: W. Aumack
Reviews.Content: Love this camera. Easy to use. I compared it with the Flip. This one had a better image to my eye.Kodak fixed the an early irritation, it now zooms in smoothly instead of stepping in. That's a very nice thing. The external jack for a microphone is great too. Using a good quality external mic will greatly improve audio quality.This camera doesn't compete with higher end cameras, but if you want an easy to use, easy to carry camera for just taking quick videos - this just simply works. If you are doing "man on the street" interviews, it's great. If you want some basic video of a birthday party or family gathering, it's great.

Reviews.Title: Kodak Zi8 Pocket - Amazon.com
Reviews.Author: Jackie Carpenter "plottdog"
Reviews.Content: I had looked for awhile for a small camera that would take videos and still pictures.  I have used the still quite often and love it.  I work at a school and our computer tech took a class and received one for taking the class and all it does is take videos and she is very disappointed.  She has great reveiws on my Kodal Zi8.  Great to put in shirt or jacket pocket, same size as my cell phone.

Reviews.Title: video camera
Reviews.Author: T. A. Snyder
Reviews.Content: was the best 1080p unit on the market. bought as a christmas present for wife and she carries it along constantly. easy use and great quality pics and video.

Reviews.Title: How to get around ZI8 stability problem.....
Reviews.Author: KGW
Reviews.Content: Bought this pocket cam back in Feb,mainly for the Chicago Auto Show. I agree on all other reviews here about the stability issue, because of the size and weight. I got around this by buying one of those small 4 inch cheapo tripods, installing on the bottom, keeping all 3 legs together, and tilting towards me at a 45 degree angle. Hold the camera by the tripod legs, fore finger in the front on the tripod screw, with thumb on the control on the back. Works great! Did the trick for me. Check out my youtube auto show vids "pixshooter7". Enjoy.

Reviews.Title: perfect
Reviews.Author: R. M. Good "Mike"
Reviews.Content: Just received my camera a few days ago; everything I had hoped for.  Easy to use; small; and great clips and pics.  I purchased (and highly recommend) the rubber sleeve cover.  I also picked up a Patriot 8G SDHC from Comp USA (back up my Transcend 16G) which works fine with this unit.

Reviews.Title: Very Pleased With This
Reviews.Author: Hegemone
Reviews.Content: Its been a long time since I have been pleased with anything from Kodak other then film and paper. It seemed like for a long time they were playing catch up with other companies which were doing digital things better then they were. Like Epson Printers and Nikon Digital cameras for photographers looking to make the transition from film to digital during the infancy of this movement.I was looking for a pocket sized video camera that had more features, better quality, and was easier to use for transferring videos to the computer then my cell phone. I got that and more with this camera. It has a good weight to it (not heavy and not a feather) the controls are intuitive and capturing a clip is a snap. I had gotten a Flip and just wasn't pleased enough with it to justify the cost. The Zi8 seems worth the price and more.The wall charger, cable, and socket on unit itself, don't seem as sturdy as they should. In fact I had to return the first unit I got because it appeared that the socket's solder connection was bad and the connection was spotty. The replacement unit I got the next day from amazon was much better and felt more solid. I think the first one was just a lemon in that respects. Considering that it charges from the computer when it is plugged in means that there are 2 wholly separate ways of charging the unit. Considering this is my biggest complaint and amazon took care of it within 24 hours I am happyBattery life seems decent but charging seems a bit slow but having battery pack is a good trade off. I would suggest buying a back up battery to slip in your pocket but that might just be me liking to be prepared.The supplied editing software (ArcSoft) is a good place to start but I am pretty sure there are other video editors that will be more robust if you need to do more then put clips together and add some transitions to smooth it out.Over all I am very pleased with my experience and glad that I listened to the reviews that put this unit above the Flip and the Sony Bloggie (dumb name). Its going to be a blast posting the next round of viral video's.

Reviews.Title: Worth the money
Reviews.Author: Terry L. Arnold
Reviews.Content: Nice video camera.  Easy to use.  I especially like the 720P 60FPS video.  The still photos are just okay.

Reviews.Title: It's all good. (Plus a tiny bit of room for improvement)
Reviews.Author: D. Charbonneau "~D. Charbonneau"
Reviews.Content: It seemed this camera was so popular that it wasn't widely available for awhile. As such, I purchased another camera.  I made the purchase of the Zi8 when I found it available here on Amazon thinking I'd keep both. The Zi8 was superior; so much so that I returned the other device.  The external microphone jack alone is worth having this over other popular models; it just so happens that all other features are as good or better than it's competitors.  Highly recommended by yours truly.--Dave Charbonneau, Funny Head[...]P.S. Now, if this cam could only double as a webcam...

Reviews.Title: Now I will actually have my youngest son on video!
Reviews.Author: Renee Anderson "mom & Realtor"
Reviews.Content: Great product.  Very nice quality for the price.  Having 3 kids, the youngest has far less "footage" than his brothers.  Kodak zi8 is essentially size of my phone, so I keep in my purse/briefcase and take bits of video of my son here & there (in addition to taking brief videos of houses to aid in the recall of details of properties).  Would have missed quite a few little moments, as I never would have gotten out the "real" camcorder.  Very easy to use & would definitely recommend it.  Nothing but good things to say; have been happy since the first time I hit the record button!  One less thing for my kids to complain about as adults - each of them will have been given video time!

Reviews.Title: Awesome economy camera!
Reviews.Author: J. R. Padar "jrpadar"
Reviews.Content: My camera was delivered a week ago after a 3 week wait for Kodak to catch up with their retailers. Amazon beat the estimated ship date by ten days. Under promise, over perform... I like that. Then I had a busy week and it had to sit in the box until I could get around to it. Bummer!Just finished playing some initial test videos on my 50" Samsung via the HDMI cable. Absolutely awesome for such a small form-factor "economy" camera. I could not be more happy. The built in mic is very acceptable for general use, although the built in speaker on the unit is near useless... good for confirming you have audio, but not much else. Can't wait to break out my Sony Electret Stereo mic.Obviously I have a lot more playing to do, but my "out of the box" impression is a solid "A"I have previously worked with professional grade video cameras ($30,000 body + $30,000 lens) so I did not expect much from this little Zi8 box. It is not a professional camera by any means, but the quality far exceeded my expectations considering it is priced at under $200. In fact, it blew me away!NOTE: Firmware version 1.06

Reviews.Title: Some things to consider
Reviews.Author: R. K. Hall "pianoforall.com"
Reviews.Content: I read ALL the reviews from many sources and I STILL wasn't prepared at just how dark the movies come out. VERY dark indoors!! You know the way most cheap camcorders nowadays compensate quite well for low light - the zi8 doesn't AT ALL. It's a bit of a shock. I know it's not meant for low light but it's still a shock. You can lighten the image to an acceptable level with MPEG Streamclip (great free software) but I'm sure a lot of quality is lost already.Even outdoors the movies are dark - when you shoot on a bright day (not sunny) it ends up looking like a miserable day. Look at the examples on youtube and you will see this dark feeling in most.Another unforseen 'problem' is if you wanted to do video diary type clips (which a small camera is perfect for) you have no idea if you are in frame or not because there is no viewfinder that swivels round - and the lens doesn't have much of an angle to play with - if you stretch your arm right out and try to record yourself you just about get your head in. Needs a wider angle lens.More CONS - Slow to start up and lens unprotected if you have no case - still camera not great.PROS - great size - great movie quality if on a tripod and plenty of light - great price - ext mic socket - easy to use and to transfer images.I got this because I tend not to use my bulkier Canon HV20 much when I'm just out and about - and I wanted something that was small with HD. Now I'm thinking that a smaller pocket size camcorder with a better, bigger lens, turnable viewfinder, better image stabilisation and so on might have been better - I'm seeing now that the zi8's main advantage is that it's the size of a phone (I'm going to keep it for that reason) - but that is also where the drawbacks lie too. Think before you buy what it is you really want.Remember - don't expect to like the results until you have brightened them in some editing software. Mac users using Final Cut Express - Open your clips directly from the camera (which appears like a hard drive on your desktop) into MPEG Streamclip. Then Export as Quicktime movie - 100% quality - compression AIC (Apple Intermediate Codec) before you click on Make Movie open 'Adjustments' and put the brightness up to the next level - you can PREVIEW the results to see what it looks like - if happy cancel the preview and then make movie. That should be it.Sorry for taking up so much space :-)

Reviews.Title: Sturdy mini camcorder with quality video
Reviews.Author: Xina143
Reviews.Content: We picked this up since we've been without a camcorder for a while and wanted something to capture those special moments - other than a cell phone! The video quality on the Zi8 is great. There are only 3 negatives we can really make about this camera and others have already mentioned them.The mic - Audio is not this devices strong point. But you can use an external mic. We haven't tried an external mic yet since we can live with the lower volume audio most of the time.Movement can cause shaky video - After reviewing the current line of mini camcorders, this is a pretty common issue. Especially when speaking of the HD units. While this is noticeable in videos, those saying the video is not watchable are going a little far. Video quality is still great. Of course, if you are running with the unit and shooting video, you may make your audience motion sick. So get to a comfortable position and shoot your video. Or prop the unit on something to shoot your video.Zoom feature - The zoom is good, but it does only zoom in increments. There is no option to gradually zoom in to a scene. This needs to be improved.With the bad points mentioned, we are very happy with this unit. We use it for home video, sports events, and other such uses. The video is crisp, clear, and well worth the price. It fits in pockets or purses very easily. It is very light. And the features all work well. It's certainly no film production HD camcorder, but for the price, you can't go wrong.

Reviews.Title: GREAT HOME VIDEO CAMERA
Reviews.Author: John R. Fawcett
Reviews.Content: I am 74 years of age and have been taking home video for 50 years. My last video camera was a Cannon, MINI DVD. That camera took good video and although small it became too much of a hassle every time I wanted to shoot a scene.After a fair amount of research the pocket video seemed the answer, and the Kodak Zi8 the best of those. Although I have not tried any of the other pocket video cameras this one meets or exceeds my expectations. The picture quality is excellent when played back on a high def TV. Even the 5mg  still pictures are very acceptable, and 4x6 size prints are good. Amazon was out of stock when I ordered, but still received the camera within two weeks. Camera arrived on February 1, so have only had a few days with it.Problems. You cannot show your video as one continuous film. Every time you stop filming a separate segment is created, and you must key up each of these segments to show them. This makes for a stop -start home movie show. Therefore, you must have the remote. Otherwise, your out of your chair every few minutes.Be sure and purchase an extra battery. The life, particularly with the EIS on is perhaps 25 minutes. Overall this is a great handy camera. I don't find that the pictures jiggle that much and the low light, though a bit grainy, is very acceptable for my home movie purpose.

Reviews.Title: Kodak Z18 review.
Reviews.Author: arturo
Reviews.Content: I like the Z18,I suggest getting extra batteries because you will need them for back up. When you zoom in or out,it does it choppy, and if you want good sound quality, get a stereo mic and plug it in on the side,other units don't have this option and it makes a difference.UTube reviews were very helpful in learning.

Reviews.Title: Wonderful product
Reviews.Author: Jessica M
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera as a Christmas gift for my boyfriend.  He LOVES it!  He has used it mostly to record several different music concerts we have attended.  The video and audio quality exceeded both of our expectations.  Everyone we show the videos also comments on how excellent the audio/video quality is.  I would recommend this product for anyone looking for astounding quality at a reasonable price!

Reviews.Title: terible indoor quality
Reviews.Author: Angie
Reviews.Content: it's ok outside, when you are indoors it's another story. Really grainy picture quality, even with all the lights on and next to the christmas tree. Not worth it, spend a little more and get something better, I did.

Reviews.Title: Just got it. Very cool!
Reviews.Author: A. BOSTON "***"
Reviews.Content: I cannot comment on the zi8 in great detail because I just got it for Christmas. It is easy to use and the picture quality does seem nice for the price and size. I shot some test videos outside in the snow in 1080p and 720p/60 frames and they both looked great. I could not tell a huge difference in picture quality between the two resolutions. The 60fps does look smoother when panning the landscape. I plugged the camera into my 50 inch plasma and both resolutions looked fine even blown up that large. I am sure if you spent a ton of money on a better camera you could tell. But this thing is cheap and does the job just fine. The internal mic is not that good, and shooting indoors with lower light is not a strong point.The camera seems easy to upload videos to the web. The Flip is the zi8's rival but if you research the two and read reviews this one comes out on top more times than not. It is a plus and a minus that it requires a high speed SD card. A plus because once it is full you can pop more memory in on the fly (once the Flip is full you are done until you can find a computer to upload the videos). A minus because a good 32gb card cost almost as much as the camera its self. I am taking this to Mexico for my honeymoon and I think it will serve me well.

Reviews.Title: Great pocket cam
Reviews.Author: Brent Finnegan
Reviews.Content: I'm a local news blogger, and I use this for man-on-the-street type interviews. This is a great little pocket camera. The audio quality is much better than other similar cameras I've used, and the mic jack is a huge plus if you have a wireless lav mic.My only complaint is that I wish the angle was a little wider. The original Flip cam has a slightly wider angle, making it easy to interview people at close range without it looking awkwardly close -- but my external mic solves this issue.

Reviews.Title: Great for the money!
Reviews.Author: Allen "Allen"
Reviews.Content: This little camera is amazing!  In good light it makes incredible videos.  Remember, ALL video cameras require lighting.  I ordered a little LED light that comes with a bracket to attach to the tripod mount.  It helps stabilize the camera too!  You can't go wrong if you want to make videos from a pocket sized device.  With the small size you can carry it with you every day.The image stabilization doesn't do a lot of good so a tripod makes for much better video.  Lacking a tripod (not convenient to carry every day) try getting an eye bolt that fits the tripod mount and attach a string to it and a washer to the other end.  Stand on the washer and pull tight on the string attached to the camera.  It will stabilize the camera almost as well as a tripod and it fits in your pocket with little weight.  I put a little white glue on the string ends and all over the knot so it will stay forever and not fray.

Reviews.Title: Good camera, right price
Reviews.Author: M. Snyir
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for a cruise were taking to Alaska next year.I wanted something small, and yet easy to use and travel with, butalso with high quality video. I read a lot of reviews anddid a lot of research.For me this does the trick. At the price of 149 buks and a free caseI could not pass it up here.I strongly suggest that if you buy this make sure you upgradethe firmware to version 1.06 (latest,as of now). It seems to havefixed some sound issues. I also purchased a Kingston 32db HDSD Class4 flash card and it worked nicely.HDMI to TV is a real treat, the sweet spot is 720p/60 fps. I alsobought an extra battery, cause at an 1 1/2, its not much time.Well worth it. All the cales come with it, and the Mediasource softwareis simple, yet easy to use, and does what I need.If your thinking about this, its a good choice somewhere between a "flip"model and a high end system of $500.UPDATE: after using this for a month and getting the latest firmwarefor windows 7, I have found that in low light conditions thisis not the best camera. If you focus in closely, in low light,the video gets grainy and dark.Still a good camera, but for you this may be a deal breaker.

Reviews.Title: Zi8: Bad name-great pocket video cam.
Reviews.Author: Thomas Kerr "Algonquin Patron"
Reviews.Content: Just got my Zi8 from Amazon and can report this is one sweet and cool piece of pocket-able technology. There have been grumblings about a high pitched whine, but I didn't get that effect out of the box. Just the same, Kodak has a firmware update that addresses this and adds a few other nice tweaks to the operation of this camera, one of which is a smooth rather than stepped zoom. Easily installed, so I did it.Here is what I've experience so far with the Zi8.* Good battery life, over 1:40 on a fresh charge recording 720p at 60 frames per second. I got more out of the Zi6, but almost two hours is nothing to sneeze at.* Sound is good and dare I say similar to the Zi6. I cannot wait to try the external jack. Presently I'm trying to figure out the best one to get--any suggestions?* Image stabilization works. Not a panacea for shaky hands, but a clear improvement over the Zi6. Did I mention I had stabilization on when testing the battery?* Awesome screen! It's big, clear and sharp.* 1080p? This is not the feature I bought it for--oddly enough--but in my tests it worked perfectly. Perhaps useful for videos that max out the digital zoom.* Uploads quickly to the computer. Quicker IMHO than the Zi6. Wonder why?* Takes SC memory cards--the new tape of the digital age as prices drop. 8Gb got me about 1:15, recording 720p at 60fps.* Good build quality, complete accessories which included complete video cabling, power supply and a wrist strap.* HDMI connection. The only way to watch your 1080p video IMHO.Over all, a nice upgrade/addition to the Kodak pocket video camera line. The price Amazon had it at was way too good to resist. If it holds up like the Zi6 (two years old now) I should be well served by this product.

Reviews.Title: Kodak Zi8
Reviews.Author: Charles E. Skillin
Reviews.Content: Picture quality is satisfactory but not outstanding when shooting outside. The picture quality when shooting inside is very grainy. My Casio Exilim produces video clips that are comparable to the Zi8 and sharper still photos. Bottom line, save your money and buy a high quality HD camcorder.

Reviews.Title: ¡¡¡ Excellent video camera !!!
Reviews.Author: Moises Rosales
Reviews.Content: Very good image qualityExcellent video and photos in macro modeExcellent video in the afternoon and evening with low lightI take photos or video instead of photocopies of id cards with excellent quality and sharpnessBuy this camera with confidence

Reviews.Title: Quality and Portability
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I owned Canon HV20 camcorder, and its quality is doubtlessly excellent. Moving from HV20 to Kodak Zi8, I don't expect much of anything. How can you compare a $700 camcorder with a $150 Kodak Zi8? Let me tell you that I am totally surprised. After upgrading the firmware to 1.06 (which you can find on Kodak website), the gap is even closer. The only difference that I notice on my Samsung HDTV is that Zi8 has slightly more noisy than HV20; to some, it might be bothering, to me it is very acceptable.Some tips: when you videotape a scene, and you move the Zi8, move it slowly; if you do it to fast, it can look blurry. This is something that you will pick up as soon as you own one.For the price, portability, and functionality, I don't see why average users like me should not go with this Zi8. As a previous owner of Canon HV20 camcorder, all I can say is: I don't really feel there is any significant difference. Of course, I don't say this as a professional. The professionals will be able to tell you the differences. In short, if you consider of using Zi8 for home, outdoor, travel, and other casual uses, or even for family memories, you have come to the right product. Look no further and enjoy!

Reviews.Title: AWESOME Camera, worth EVERY PENNY
Reviews.Author: Jeremy Kowalski "Just Jeremy"
Reviews.Content: I recorded some video with my Zi8 at a live show this weekend. Take a look:[...]I was really impressed with the audio capture. The video looks amazing, shot at 720p/60 Frames.The features allowed me to select the video quality and adjust the microphone sensitivity.  The controls are dead stupid simple to use.I never highly recommend devices.  The Zi8 is much better than the Flip cameras.  Bigger screen, SD card slot, external mic, microphone sensitivity adjustment, still picture capture, and it does everything the Flip does.

Reviews.Title: Audio issue resulted in product return
Reviews.Author: S. Leonard
Reviews.Content: I experienced the high-pitched audio whine during playback.  I tried changing the mic settings/levels and shooting at different resolutions but the results were pretty much the same each time. I called Kodak technical support and they were not aware of any problems and did not have any useful suggestions.It seemed like a great device.  Unfortunately, due to the audio issue, I returned the product to Amazon.com.

Reviews.Title: Kodak has a Flip Mineo HD Killer
Reviews.Author: Steven H. Colditz
Reviews.Content: I love this camera, for the price you can't beat it.  I haven't had a Kodak product in 30 years, this one is great.I had the Flip Mineo HD Camera. Returned it to [...] when I heard about this camera.  The large screen on the back is great especially compared to the Flip.  The Camera has 4 video modes, I only use the 720p/60 frames per second(fps) Mode.  That mode creates smooth Video compared to the 1080p/30fps.  Alright it's not 1080p but many of my high def cable channels come in 720P and they look good.  Another good feature the Zi8 has over the Flip is that the lens is recessed so it is more difficult to smudge or scratch, the Flip lens protrudes.The bad:  No optical Zoom (what do you expect it's $180).  The finish of the camera is glossy, smudges easy and can slip out of your hand, use the included wrist strap.  Memory card not included, get at least 8gb thats good for over an hour at 720p/30fps.The camera is preloaded with ArcSoft MediaImpressions for Kodak.  Don't know how that works, I have an iMac.  The videos load seamlessly into iPhoto without any setup and then can be edited with iMovie.This camera is going to replace my Canon ZR65 video camera.

Reviews.Title: Think Twice - Price is a sucker play
Reviews.Author: Vic
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera new here on Amazon for my son Nov 11, 2010.Sold by: Firemall LLCPrice was 126.10.He's visiting today and mentioned a friend is looking for the same camera so I looked it up tp see if he could get it locally.Saw these high prices and was shocked, because I remembered paying far less.So I looked up my order history on Amazon, and put that above.My son is very happy with the camera and said he has recorded about 8 hours and it's still working fine.So I have to give it max stars.Video quality is covered in reviews here and elsewhere, which is why i picked it for a gift last year.But I sure won't recommend it at the prices I see.That's why I say "think twice."You should research and see if this model is discontinued.  Maybe the price is high because there's limited stock and still demand from old reviews.Might be a just-as-good-or better camera of this category at a better price point now.Just a heads up.

Reviews.Title: Flip killer
Reviews.Author: Robert Swindell "digital man"
Reviews.Content: I was looking for a cheap HD video camera to replace our family's 9-year old (SD) MiniDV camcorder. I first considered the Flip cameras, briefly considered the Creative Vado, but when I learned about the Kodak Zi8's external (stereo) microphone input and external SD storage, that sold me. The fact that it does 720p/60fps and 1080p/30fps was a bonus. I paid $139+tx at Best Buy.I'm a musician and audiophile, so I'm sort of anal when it comes to audio. I have some nice (Sony) stereo mics I use with other audio/video recording devices, so I was also hoping to make some drumming videos for youtube. The video was fine and I ended up using closed mics and mixer to get real professional audio with the HD video, but I couldn't disable the dynamic volume compressor/limiter built-into the camera. And that kind of ruins the whole "professional" audio/video result not matter how good the video and audio source is.So it's been a great inexpensive camera for family/ad-hoc videos (samples at [...]l), but I wouldn't use it for recording a band, even with excellent external audio source/mics.Pros: Excellent video quality (even low-light), 5MP still camera, easy video upload/transfer, external stereo mic input, removable SD storageCons: 1080p has a narrower field of view than 720p, need an external wide-angle lens, minimal user controls (e.g. can't disable internal audio level compressor), EIS is not great and shortens battery life, crappy video editing software, can't be used as a webcam

Reviews.Title: Has its niche...
Reviews.Author: wadrad
Reviews.Content: I'm traveling in Greece right now as I type this, having brought only the Zi8 to document the feta-feasting, Mythos-swilling, and bazouki-blaring experience.  Usually on scenic excursions like this I'll bring a little Sony CyberShot camera (old 3-megapixel model) and a JVC digital video camera that plays mini digital cassettes.  Being a bit more restricted for space and weight (thanks Ryanair!) I decided to see if my fairly new Kodak Zi8 could fill the bill for both.  It will take 5 megapix digital photos, and videos in the following modes: WVGA, 720p, 720p/60 fps, and even 1080p (full Hi-Def)And the results?Well, as long as lighting is good, this thing performs fairly well.  Plenty of sunshine here, so that's not usually a problem...at least during the day.  Want to take some evening pix?  That's a problem.  Not having a flash, the Zi8 uses only available light, and does so poorly.  Worse, the low-light pictures look really grainy, like it's a frozen still from a video feed.  In full light, pix are fairly clear, but the color isn't very vibrant, and neither the color nor the clarity seems as good as my old Sony CyberShot.Video performs ably, and the quality of the 1080p hooked up to our HD television is pretty dang impressive.  BUT, most folks aren't working in HD format for home movies, and even if you have the software and equipment to edit and work with it, many friends and families (mine anyway) don't have the hardware to watch and enjoy it, so I find myself mostly recording in normal WVGA mode.  Lastly, if you're a PC person, the video format (QuickTime favored "*.mov") isn't well-liked by some of my video-editing software, and I have to convert it before I can import it into my editor.Final thoughts:I bought this for about $160, and it's now down to $115 (new model must be coming out).  My other equipment, though performing better, takes up more space and in today-bucks would run about $300-400 to buy.  SO, if you want easy performance with a small foot print on space requirements for a fairly low price, this is pretty awesome.  I'm a little pickier about the quality, and like to edit my own video quite a bit, so it's a little less awesome for me.  Still, all in all, an easy 4-star rating.Oh yeah... a forgotten negative:  though there is a zoom, there isn't a focus feature on the camera other than a switch.  One setting is for "infinity distance" and the other setting is for "about 15 centimeters" distance (paraphrasing what the instruction book says).  The problem is NEITHER setting works for something about 2 feet away.  I've taken several photos at about the 2-3 foot range, and they're blurry using either focus setting.  I guess I could move back to about 6-8 feet and then zoom in to make it LOOK like I'm only two to three feet away, but that's kind of stupid.  SOOOOOOO...as long as things are well-lit, and further away than 4 or 5 feet, the Zi8 works great.  I just finished editing some footage of Greece in Sony Vegas, and I was really impressed by how it came out.  Granted it was a pain in the butt converting all the *.mov files before I could import them, but that's just one of the negatives weighing against the size and convenience...hence that 4-star rating.

Reviews.Title: Kodak Zi8 Worth the money? Yes it is.....
Reviews.Author: CheapGeek "Do it for Cheap, Find it for Cheap...
Reviews.Content: This is not a 4000.00 camcorder.It's a pocket camcorder.Good pointsShoots in HDEditing software comes preloaded in camera.Has Macro mode.Good color balance.Has more controls than just one big red button.Image stabilization.Looks good, feels good in the hand.Standard tripod screw hole. 1/4" 20 thread pitch.Digital zoom, which is better than nothing.Works fantastic on a tripod.Easy video upload to the internets. Yes I added an "S" to internet.SD Card up to 32 GB.Here's the best feature- IT HAS AN EXTERNAL MICROPHONE JACK!You could actually use this for more than just stupid movie clips.Caveat-Kodak is releasing a newer version of this camera that is about 1/2 as thick and about 1/2 as small.You Will carry that camera every where.Bad PointThe video is not as good as a $4000.00 camera.But it's not a $4000.00 camera now is it?It's dam* good for the money.I would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: You Get What You Pay For
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I bought this based on the reviews here at Amazon. I thought it might be able to replace my six year old Sony mini-dv camcorder. Fat chance. The picture is so jumpy and unstable, that I can't imagine what it might be useful for. Perhaps making shaky-cam pseudo-documentary horror movies. Or maybe homemade music videos. The image stabilization feature is a joke - another "feel good switch" (kind of like those buttons at cross walks that make you think the WALK light's gonna appear faster). No difference on or off. I almost got a headache watching my footage. On the bright side, the resolution is pretty amazing for such a small device. If the thing sits on a tripod, it works ok. Just forget about holding it in your hand.

Reviews.Title: 60fps.. not much better.
Reviews.Author: James Cancil "wetstuff"
Reviews.Content: I bought it because the Zi8 should follow action better at 60fps vs. the standard for these small cams, 30fps.  It may follow the action better but the basic image is still so soft you do not get the impression of any improvement.  I have five of these small (<$200) HD cams and if you really want a crisp image - stick with an SD cam.  The image size is smaller (640x480) but in almost every situation the image is more crisp.  It appears you need to step up to something like a Canon Vixia or similar cam to get really decent images.Jim

Reviews.Title: Zi8
Reviews.Author: Amy M. Parker
Reviews.Content: I bought this video camera to take to Paris, France with me.  I did thorough research on all small video cameras.  I wanted one that was easy to use, had image stabilization, portable, and compatible with a Mac.  I looked at Sanyo, Canon, Panasonic, and Kodak.  At the last minute I found an article in MacWorld about Kodak's Zi8.  I generally do not like to buy electronics when they first are released on the market; too many kinks to work out.  However, time was of the essence in my case, so I purchased the Kodak Zi8.  I have never owened a video camera; however, I have had a lot of fun playing with it.  It is very easy to use.  The controls and menus are straight-forward.  I was able to download the videos to YouTube as well as my Mac.  iMovie took it right in and was able to play the video back.  One of the other reviews talked about a problem with their microphone, but so far I have not experienced the same.  So far I love my new toy and can't wait to take it to Paris.

Reviews.Title: Lemon Warning: Do NOt Buy This Piece of Junk!!
Reviews.Author: Reasoner101
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera from Amazon, tested it once and took it with me on a four week trip.  Used it half a dozen times and then it froze up. I cannot use it for anything. Reboorted, drained battery, tried every variable. Completely worthless and I did not have a video camera for my family trip or a still camera. Now Amazon will not take it back for full refund but I am sending the worthless junk back to them anyway to see what I can get as a refund. I bought it for the seeming attributes: external mike jack, still photos, and editable software. The Kodak-supplied software stinks! I wasted so much time trying to download the videos; unlike flip, which worked great. Getting the battery in and out is a major effort. It is shocking that a company of Kodak's stature would release such a piece of junk, to play catch up ball with Flip. I have an old Flip and never had a sinlge problem. I will never buy a Kodak mini-camcorder again. I don;t need this hassle, and nobody is paying me for the inconvenience. Spare yourself the troyble and avoid this product at all costs.

Reviews.Title: The software is trash and Kodak rightfully went out of business
Reviews.Author: Adrenaline
Reviews.Content: Kodak makes it nearly impossible to convert the recordings from this device, which record in .mov format.  If I want to upload anything I record to facebook, Kodak won't let me do it unless I agree to give them access to my personal information on facebook.  Screw Kodak, and screw this crappy camera.  Thank goodness my iPhone takes 5x better video picture than this thing.  I spent $200 on this back when it first came out and I only used it 5 times.  I still have it if anyone wants to buy it lol.

Reviews.Title: Recommended By A Pro, Good For The Beginner
Reviews.Author: Nat
Reviews.Content: I'm a middle aged lady that needs digital cameras to be simple to use. That said, I shopped for quite a while online to find a high definition video camera with an external USB connection. This camera makes things really easy for those of us that do not live for the latest gadget and  are not techno geeks. I just wanted to point and shoot. It does that very well. I personally do not like the joy stick lever. It makes it harder for me to zoom smoothly. I prefer some well planned buttons rather than a lever, to scroll between functions. The feature I would love on this is a light for low light conditions. Well, maybe not at this price, right? My professional journalist friend helped me pick this out. She agreed it has nice features for the price.In response to a question, it comes with AV cables to plug it in to a TV as well as the USB connection for the computer.

Reviews.Title: Kodak Zi8 is a awesome digital camcorder  for YouTube
Reviews.Author: Johnson Yip "Guy who likes games, anime, and ...
Reviews.Content: I primarily use the Zi8 to record YouTube quality videos, and I like how portable, and light it is, and It is very portable, and turns on fast, so I can start recording videos in seconds. HD video on the Zi8 is great quality. The Screen on the Zi8 is also very big and clear.The camera is easy to turn on, and to hold in my hand. I could control the camera with just one hand.The controls on the camera is also very easy to use, and clearly labelled.Charging the Zi8 is also very fast with the charger, and the battery life on the Zi8 is great. Installing and removing the battery on the Zi8 is also very easy, so if I want to, I can buy an extra battery pack to swap out when I run out of battery power on my current battery when I do not have access to a power outlet or my charger.I am also not limited to the internal video memory on the camera since I can use more then one SD card to store my video and photos taken on the Zi8.The built-in USB plug on the Zi8 makes it fast and easy for me to attach it to the front of my laptop USB port, or to my desktop USB port to copy my videos and photos I taken to my computer hard drive.The external mic jack on the Zi8 is also useful when I need a higher end mic, but the built-in mic on the Zi8 is good enough for my needs.There is also a Tripod hole to attach it to a tripod for taking more stable video. The video stabilization is very good.

Reviews.Title: A pretty cool camera for what it is
Reviews.Author: Mr cool
Reviews.Content: I admit im a fan of these toy camera. Ive owned a non hd flip a kodak zi6 and finally this. I was looking for something to replace my zi6 and managed to get this off cragslist for about 40 dollars. Compared to the zi6 its a modest upgrade. The zi6 is really outdated in video quality by today's standards. The zi8 improves on that and packs in more features. it can record in 1080p/30 fps, 720 60fps and 30 fps and WVGA. 1080p i didn't like too much as it zooms in more compared to the other modes. 720/60ps is good for quick action and sports but i found 720p 30 fps the best as that is pretty for web videos such as youtube and its actually what i use it for. A new feature that is included is the external mic jack. You can plug any 3.5mm mic in which can give you a variety of sounds depending on the mic. This is good for the go hard enthusiast and interviewing type i guess. The internal mic is mono and is very ok. You can adjust the mic gain input if you wish. The image stabilization helps a little bit but so much but its better than nothing. A tripod is this camera's best friend well you could say that for all the cameras in this category. Now those that are looking to do serious filming or capture perfect memories may want a well a real camcorder. This is a portable camera for catching the spur of the moment and its also good for vlogging. What i hated about this camera is it shoots in mov format. Kodak at the time may have not realized that mov is a mac format and unforuntately pc is still the majority so putting it in mov instead of say mp4 which is a more universal format may prove to be an headache for some (maybe most in this case). Fortunately i use a program called mp4 cam to avi which rencodes the mov wrapper to something humans can use.Now compared to the flip ultra hd. I found it came down to this.The flip has slightly better video quality but the kodak has slightly worse video quality but got it beat in features. An sd slot that can take up to 32 gigs, an external mic and choices of four video modes and it can shoot pictures but that is garbage. I know people say smartphones have replaced these little pocket camcorders. Im not sure i would want to use my phone for heavy duty filming and besides these things are cheap that if it breaks from falling no biggie. Now if that expensive iphone does that well thats a different story. And also a film recording is not the main purpose of the phone more like a feature. Remember this not a real camcorder its a pocket camera that is good for non serious filming. This in no way should just replace your avc hd camcorder. Absolutely not.

Reviews.Title: Excellent little video camera
Reviews.Author: B. Schmidt
Reviews.Content: // To view this video download Flash Player (version 9.0.115 or higher)'); } } catch(err) { fp_resizePlayerSpace('cv_mo3H1UHXJZ1FIDK', 0, 0); } return false; } function _cv_mo3H1UHXJZ1FIDKloadSwf(movieID, playerVersion) { var swfLocation = "http://g-ecx.images-amazon.com/images/G/01/am3/20120510035744301/AMPlayer._V148501545_.swf"; } cv_mo3H1UHXJZ1FIDKloadSwf_Core(swfLocation, swfWidth, swfHeight, flashVersion, bgColor, swfParams, flashParams, embedAttributes); return false; } function cv_mo3H1UHXJZ1FIDKloadSwf(movieID, playerVersion) { return _cv_mo3H1UHXJZ1FIDKloadSwf(movieID, playerVersion);
