} cv_mo3H1UHXJZ1FIDKpreplay.onmouseout = function() { cv_mo3H1UHXJZ1FIDKpreplay.src = "http://ecx.images-amazon.com/images/I/71cJxweSz9S._SX320_PHcustomer-video-vignette_PIvideo-reviews-bottom,BottomLeft,0,43_OU01_PIcustomer-video-play,BottomLeft,130,-12_CR0,0,0,0_.png"; } var node = cv_mo3H1UHXJZ1FIDKpreplay.parentNode; var cv_mo3H1UHXJZ1FIDKcurrentClick = node.onclick; node.onclick = function () { var head = document.getElementsByTagName("head"); if (head[0]) { var logTag = document.createElement('script'); logTag.type = "text/javascript"; logTag.src = "/gp/customer-media/du/log.html?ie=UTF8&p=CustomerImage&s=CustomerVideoPlay"; head[0].appendChild(logTag); } if (cv_mo3H1UHXJZ1FIDKcurrentClick) { return cv_mo3H1UHXJZ1FIDKcurrentClick(); } } } Length:: 0:10 MinsI bought this camera to use on a trip because I did not want to take my larger expensive camera and risk it getting broken or stolen. I love this camera! It has 2 different options for 720p video you can shoot it in 30fps or 60fps, and of course it also has 1080p and WVGA video modes. I have tried them all, and the one I use the most is the 720p/30fps. Since I got this I find myself filming more activities because it's compact and you can take it anywhere, and I use it more than my expensive camera (which I would get rid of if it wasn't for night-vision).There are a few products you can get that will make this camera even better:-You're going to want an inexpensive external microphone with a windscreen, because if you don't even a slight breeze can ruin a video. I got an inexpensive one on eBay and it works well and the sound quality is a lot better.-You can get an inexpensive lens that is wide angle and macro Kodak Wide Angle Lens and it will improve your video. Plus it is magnetic so you can remove it easily if you want to.-Get some back-up batteries. Again, I got some inexpensive ones on eBay and they hold their charge and are easy to swap out.-Get a silicon case (if you can find them) or a skin-it or something to help protect it. (this is just my personal opinion, I like to take extra care of my electronics because I like them to last)-Finally get a case to hold everything. Case Logic TBC-312 Pocket Video Camcorder Case with Storage (Black) I use that case and it is a nice fit for the camera and it holds my 2 back-up batteries, the microphone AND and lens all in the same case and it can fit in your pocket! (would also hold the remote if you get that)Like I said, I really like this camera, if it recorded better in low-light or had some sort of night feature I would ditch my bigger more expensive camera and just use this one.**Some extra notes**A trick I've done to my camera, if you want to record in low light/at night I've taken a 3 led tap light (similar to these Fulcrum 3 LED 3-Pack Tap Lights) and attached it to the front with velcro (it fits perfectly on the front) and you can just tap it on if the light is too low for what you're recording, and if you attach it with velcro you can remove it whenever you want.You may also want to invest in an inexpensive mini tripod and the Kodak remote for this camera if you want to have steady video and not be forced to always hold the camera.

Reviews.Title: Great HD camera but...
Reviews.Author: S. Scheifley "Texas Drummer"
Reviews.Content: For the record, I was one of the first to purchase the Zi8 back in August 2009.  It has been a decent camera to use overall.  I do love the picture quality.  It's not great under low light, but it does work well under normal lighting.  Image stabilization does work, but it's so so at best.  I mainly got this camera due to the external stereo microphone output jack.  I've been able to make very nice audio recordings using mini-stereo mikes to go along with the HD video.  However, my jack no longer works properly anymore.  I've done numerous tests, and all I now get is the left channel. The right channel either doesn't work or it just cuts in and out.  Believe me, I'm very annoyed about this.  The internal mic does sound okay, but it's still mono.  I've tried working with Kodak on this by updating the firmware, but it didn't correct the problem.  I also downloaded footage to several computers (MAC & PC based) - same results.  I've also tested the stereo mikes by plugging them into a mixer board, and they worked perfectly.  Kodak simply informed me that since my Zi8 is out of warranty, all I can do is send it to United Camera service center in Bensenville, Illinois.  It'll cost a lot just for them to look at it, and to me, it isn't worth it.  So I'll just keep what I got and settle for mono sound.  I'm not happy about it, but what can I do?  I've considered the Zi10 camera.  It's cheaper than what I paid for my Zi8 two years ago; however, Amazon reviews have been more negative for Zi10 vs Zi8.  I guess I'll just wait for the next big thing in video cameras before committing more money.

Reviews.Title: Decent HD pocket cam for the price
Reviews.Author: John.p.williamson
Reviews.Content: I have used it on my trip to Antalya, Turkey and it records decent footage. Doesn't perform so well in less than brightly lit environments, so it is best for outdoors, but if you have to use it for indoors makes sure you have adequate lighting. I wasn't expecting stellar performance for the price I paid, so I am happy with it. I have mostly used the 720P/ 60 mode, which I must say looks pretty impressive. The Arcsoft software that comes with it is decent, it is useful for emailing the videos, will convert it down to a manageable size for emailing. Just dont use the best for email setting, unless you absolutely have to shrink it down that much. I use the custom setting and max it out and it seems to not take too much quality out of the video for when I want to email a video. The battery life seems to be less than expected, but I remember to keep it charged.

Reviews.Title: Kodak Zi8 pocket video easy and small --simple controls
Reviews.Author: D. Christofferson
Reviews.Content: This is a great little camera and I intend to use it to record video speaking engagements and interviews to post online.It's a perfect size and very simple--I have not used it yet, just played with it and set it up ready to use.I like things simple, and Kodak lives up to it's Kodak products here.It was a decent price, but I saw it recently offered significantly less and wish I'd waited!

Reviews.Title: Perfect for us
Reviews.Author: jennrh1
Reviews.Content: I went to the store to play with this and the Flip (i don't know who makes the flip). This was by far better everything than the flip. Sound and picture is great and zooms really better than I thought these could. The still pics look a bit like taking it with a phone, but the video is great for the price. I love just being able to have something in my purse to catch little things about my kids on video. Very easy to use.

Reviews.Title: Excellent product
Reviews.Author: Anthony
Reviews.Content: Product is super easy to use. You do not have to be a video expert. You do not even need instructions to start capturing HD video. The menus and feature set are very simple and easy to use. Extremely portable, as small as a Blackberry or iPhone. I also like that it uses a removable SDHC and USB port; very convenient. The battery life is fantastic. I have had this camera for over two months now and have only had to charge it twice (and I have an infant that just started crawling, so I'm using it). Cool factor is high, most people think it's a phone or a small camera, but when they find out it's a HD video camera, they are impressed. The movie/video editing software is minimal, but it works well for most applications. I have created movies from video clips and photos, added titles, music, and transitions. Then exported it to a DVD and YouTube, and it works great. Another cool feature, is the movie software is on the camera, so there's no need for keeping track of a CD/DVD. You can plug into USB and install the software from the camera. Video is also great for the price. It captures HD 1080p @ 30fps and HD 720p @ 60fps. Comes with HDMI cable to plug directly into your big screen TV. It is important to note that the camera does not have it's own light source, so your video quality is only as good as the lighting in which you are in. With decent lighting, the camera takes excellent HD quality video. Overall, this product is well worth the money. I have honestly never had so much fun taking video.

Reviews.Title: Pricing itself out of the market
Reviews.Author: MM "spotted pony"
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for my daughter and she seems happy with it - and likes the fact it is so "simple" to operate.It does not come w a carry case or memory card, hence, it is not an "option" to spend at least $40 extra...and really more like $50-$60 just to get started.  When I originally decided to purchase this item, it was $114 in black on Amazon.  The NEXT DAY, it was $119, 3 days later it was $138 and two weeks later it was $230????  I have seen the video quality - and for no more than $130 (camera ONLY - not including the case and memory card) - it's an "okay" deal. But for $230 -  I would not consider it.  Kodak has more than lost its market share...it finally gets "winning" innovations, such as the Zi8, then prices it out of the market?  If it is purely dealers that are pricing it to high..then Kodak should monitor this activity and clearly identify a retail price - like Sony did w the wii when it was a "hot item".

Reviews.Title: Boug.ht another Kodak Zi8 camera
Reviews.Author: Edward M. Fishel II
Reviews.Content: I can't believe Kodak is not making this camera any more. My institution, like others, continues to purchase them because of the good picture quality, external microphone jack, and SD flash card memory.  Still love it.

Reviews.Title: Great for loud music recording!
Reviews.Author: William C. Butler
Reviews.Content: I bought this to record hardcore bands. I read up on all the handheld cameras and this I heard does well for low light/loud music. I bought an external mic and another connector to make sure it turned the right direction. AMAZING audio with the Sony condenser mic  (Sony ECM-DS30P Electret Condenser Digital Microphone)I bought. Video is great too, lots of positive feedback on YouTube. Recorded full band sets up to 35 minutes and ended up with 10 gigs full on my 16 gig card I got for this. Fit in my pocket perfectly for biking the five miles I did every day. Check out the video on the link here from Chaos in Tejas 2011, includes daytime show and nighttime, far away shots and close up... lots of different lighting and audio scenerios: [...]My main con is the issue when zooming when it seems to darken but per a review below mine, I'm going to update the firmware and apparently fix that! Also the zoom button being the up and down click of the record button is kind of annoying for us with larger hands.. I accidentally stopped recording a few times by clicking record instead of zooming.Best pro is the fact you can go into the settings and change the limiter on the audio... perfect for bands. The bad thing is if you turn it off you have to remember to go back into settings to turn the limiter back down. If you own this device, it is under settings and it is the icon that looks like a microphone.Last thing, this works great just as an audio recorder. Again, I have an external mic and have never used it without that. I put it in my pocket and started recording it on video on VGA mode (because obviously the video doesn't matter if I'm recording audio) and just left it recording and then later took the audio out of the video and it sounds great.Great device!

Reviews.Title: kodak movie flip camera - good value
Reviews.Author: Ivan Pless "Barry"
Reviews.Content: I thought this was a good buy when the flip disappeared. It is good but there is one main problem: the audio does not synch well with the pictures.

Reviews.Title: Spec's in question
Reviews.Author: jimman10
Reviews.Content: Was watching some recorded videos and noticed that the TV indicated it was 1080i in stead of 1080p.  I contacted tech support and they replied live saying that all recordings are (i) interlaced.  I said but you spec 1080p and the reply was that only means Pixels 1080 and even the 720 is interlaced.  I said that the P stands for progressive and 1080 is the number of resolvable horizontal lines and they said that is not true and it only means pixels and they hung up.  That explains why the picture quality at 1080p isn't as good as Flip's 720p.

Reviews.Title: Must get memory stick
Reviews.Author: M. Furniss
Reviews.Content: I got this camera because I am going on a trip where I'll be doing a lot of walking. I wanted something lightweight and easy to use. The controls are minimal, so it's pretty basic, which is okay. The battery cover is hard to get off, but hopefully I won't do that very often. I was surprised that the internal memory is so small. I took three still photos and tried to run a video at the 720 setting and I could only get 2 seconds before it turned off. I went on Kodak's chat help and found the people there were not helpful. They read off script, which I guess isn't surprising. The first person who 'helped me' said I should expect 22 minutes, but that it was 'recommended' that I get a memory stick. I kept saying 'but I only got 2 seconds' and that didn't seem to compute. When I tried a second person, s/he said that I should expect less than ten seconds of video unless I use a memory stick. Okay, I'm fine with a memory stick, but I think it should be CLEAR in the literature that it's not 'recommended' but required. The booklet says there's enough internal memory for a few test videos, but that's not the case, unless your test video is one second long -- or maybe my camera is defective. I'm going to contact Kodak by phone to see if this really is normal -- hopefully I can get someone who isn't being forced to read pre-scripted dialogue.

Reviews.Title: Simply great
Reviews.Author: Luis
Reviews.Content: This camera does the work, good quality, compact easy to use. No issues since we got it almost two years ago. It froze once and checked support online. Fixed it in seconds. Great little product for everyday filming.

Reviews.Title: Happy with this purchase!
Reviews.Author: P. Feeney "Mominny"
Reviews.Content: I love this little camera! It is light and easy to use. I wanted it for some grad school projects and to use in the classroom setting. It is so easy to use my seven-year old nephew was using it! He liked it so much he said, "Can I have this for my birthday present?"The audio is not as loud as I would like which many customers have commented on and I would probably purchase a tripod too! The thing I liked about this camera rather than other pocket recorders is that this one will take still photos too. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: The awesomeness
Reviews.Author: jsarver
Reviews.Content: This little power house was killer.  It was the awesomeness.  We used it for our rehearsal and our wedding... it was perfect.  Our friends passed it around, my one buddy used it to pretty much document everything that happened the day before and the day of our wedding.  Shoots in 1080p if you like, but we used 720 for extended video possibility.

Reviews.Title: Not equal to first generation Flip Mino HD
Reviews.Author: garypc
Reviews.Content: First of all, I'm not a technical wizard so don't expect a highly technicalreview.  I bought a Flip Mino HD for my wife 3 years ago because she loved totake movies but couldn't figure out all the settings, etc.  The flip fit thebill quite well, but started developing problems with the off/on switch.  Iwanted to be sure that we had a pocket recorder for some upcoming travels soafter reading reviews on all the top selling video camera's, we selected theKodak Z18.  The Kodak was half the price of the original flip, but when youadd the price of the data card and a spare battery it starts to get a littlemore expensive.We compared video taken with the Flip and immediately after with the Kodak setat 720P.  The Flips picture was much better in lower light settings.  The Kodakequalled the Flip's quality when set at 1080P, but I understand at that settingwe will use up the battery and memory space much quicker.  The major differencebetween the Flip and Kodak so far is the lousy sound produced by the Kodak.While I had read that sound was a problem, I didn't realize how bad a problemit was.  In fact, had I known, we would not have purchased the Kodak.  I knowyou can hook up an external mike to the Kodak, but we bought this camera forsimplicity's sake, not to mess around with hooking up a mike each time we use it.I took a guess at the battery life since our use will be at the 1080P setting.In summary, the Kodak Z18 is fairly simple to use, takes very good video at 1080P,image stabilization doesn't add much, but we like the easy to use Zoom.  Too badthey didn't focus on sound quality whatsoever.

Reviews.Title: I like the Kodak Zi8
Reviews.Author: Lar
Reviews.Content: This little camcorder takes a great high def video and fits easy into your pocket. I wish it had a better low lux quality and maybe a led flash but regular video quality can't be beat. Not the best battery life of others I've tried but not bad. I got about 1 hour 20 minutes of straight videoing before it died. I've checked out and owned other pocket cams and this one is best by far for high def quality. Enough said

Reviews.Title: Zi8 is a thoughtfully designed pocket HD video camera
Reviews.Author: chiflatin
Reviews.Content: The only reasons I purchased the Zi8 was for the external microphone input, the tripod socket, the HD video and price; in that order. The optional remote control sealed the deal for this pocket video camera. Even if the videos or pictures weren't perfect the convenience and accessories would make up for it. However the videos are great for the price, the sounds syncs up perfectly, and it has a digital zoom which is not extremely effective but does exist, without the mechanical noise (and effectiveness)of a lens zoom.I purchased a mono external microphone (ATR3350) and it worked perfectly once I adjusted the microphone volume on the Zi8 (remember the Zi8 will NOT provide extra power to your mic if it requires it). There was a small ringing in the background of the video, not very noticeable and I suspect it can be remedied.I've read that for Mac users it's seamless with iMovie but Windows users may have more difficulty. If you have problems editing .mov files with your editing program, you may be a little frustrated. It works fine in CS4 if you got it. It also comes with a basic editing program (cut and filter) when you install the MediaImpressions media player (it installs when you first plug the Zi8 into your computer).I used a class 10 16gb SDHC card although a class 6 would work just fine.The Zi8 also shipped with the current firmware (1.06)The Zi8 also plugs right in to your USB port with it's built-in flexible USB plug. It also ships with an HD-video cord and audio cables so you can play video from it to your TV with sound. Use it with the optional remote and you have a nice little handy video player and card reader for your HDTV or projector.You can charge the battery from the wall, from your USB port to the charging inlet or even just plugging the Zi8 directly into the computer with that built-in USB plug.One negative thing was the poor still-picture quality. On the "scenery" setting, from a range of 3' to 20' indoors, in a brightly lit area, the images were quite bad (blurry), with or without the "face detection" or even the "EIS" which are some of the few settings options available. There is a handy macro switch which gives crystal clear images at exactly 6" away at even low-light; but I'm unable to get images this clear using the other setting. I will experiment with the recommended light and distance; outside during the day, over a much farther distance.The extremely minimized settings menu was surprising at first, there are literally only 8 things to change:TimeNTSC/PALBrightnessAudio on/offMicrophone volumeEIS on/offFace-detection on/offRe-format SD card.All this makes it as easy to use as a phone camera. When you turn it on, you simply choose video size or still picture and start recording. A little zoom and that's all you get. Perfect if it's all you need!

Reviews.Title: Sweet
Reviews.Author: Tony B
Reviews.Content: Reading Reviews is Very Confusing cause you Trying to Differentiate between the Fakes and Haters with the Real and Intelligent, but if you Read all 500++ Reviews(Like I Did), then Very Good for you!!  Now I'm a add my 22 cents worth, I Purchased my Zi8 as a Factory Refurb, I figured if some of these Issues that some Proclaimed was Happening, then they would Fixed them when Kodak Refurbished the Unit, Well, I've been using My Zi8 for a about a Month and Trust, I've been Lighting it up taking Pics and Video in All the Modes and I can Only sum it up in one word "SWEET"!!!!  I mean it takes Beautiful Pics and Videos, Especially in 1080p and 720p @ 60fps, Low light could be a Lot Better, and a Flash would be nice Add Also, but Man, for the Price and compared to the Rest of the Pocket Cams, this is Very Good and is Does what it Do and Does a Great job doing it.  So maybe they did take care of a Few things when they have a 2nd Crack at, Hell, they Probably read the Reviews, but whatever they did, they do seem to have it back on on the Track they had Planned for it, so if you Read this Review, the best I can say is Give it a Real Shot......Cause you can Always Send it back!!  OH, one more word of Advice, for the Sound, I would purchase the Sony ECM-DS70p Mini Microphone that is a Big Step Up from the Internal Mic! :)

Reviews.Title: Kodak Zi*
Reviews.Author: Tom_Bradley
Reviews.Content: I picked the Kodak because I wanted a mic jack.  I shoot videos for marketing [...] and having a unidirectional mic makes all the difference with sound quality, especially outside.I was using an older JVC VideoD set up, no mic, but something I really miss on the Kodak is being able to see myself when recording (the JVC had a flippable monitor).  This makes it a bit trickier to set up solo shots and slows me down because I have to "proof" set ups.  A screen on both side would be super handy but not expected at this price point.Great camera.  Stupid-easy to use.  I highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera, crappy battery (refurbished)
Reviews.Author: Abasi Akan Jonathan Ekpenyong
Reviews.Content: When I purchased this video cam, I was little skeptical because I hadn't heard a lot of reviews about it. It lived up to it's quality and expectations, save for the terrible battery life and the playback audio (on the camera itself). If you can live with that, this is a perfect camera for basic home video's and general shoots in HD. I even shot a music video with the camera with no filters or edits (asides from basic film cuts) but yeh don't get this refurbished....

Reviews.Title: Favorite Electronic
Reviews.Author: Mom of two
Reviews.Content: I love this camera.  I get over 2 hours of recording time and I love that it just fits in my purse.  I always have it with me when my kids do something funny.  And it takes great still pictures too.

Reviews.Title: Fairly good pocket video camera
Reviews.Author: Jae Hyuk Choi
Reviews.Content: Kodak has made a pretty good pocket video camera.  I wasn't expecting the best picture quality from this thing since I primarily use a Canon 7D for video but overall the pocket video camera has surpassed my expectations.The video camera is very easy to use and very straight forward.  The features are minimal but the secondary Audio In is a major plus since sound quality isn't that great on the built in mic.  Using it with my Rode Shotgun mic or my Zoom H1 gives the best sound quality.  It has a expansion slot for a SDHC and supposedly it will take up to 32GB of space.  That alone should bring customers away from other pocket cameras.  Picture quality is pretty good but it's no match for a Canon 7D or a 5D Mark 2.  For the price I paid for this camera, picture quality is pretty good.  The camera is about the same size as an iPhone 4 but almost twice as thick but it doesn't get in the way with portability.  The battery life is on par with any other pocket camera but amazingly, this thing charges really quickly.All in all, this is a fine camera for everyday use but don't think you'll blow away your friends and family.  Great camera and would recommend this to anyone.

Reviews.Title: Awesome recording at daylight... everything else sucks
Reviews.Author: User
Reviews.Content: If you are going to use this camera for something else besides recording at bright daylight, don't buy it. Excellent recording at daylight quality, worse I've seen at poor light. Pictures are not that bad on bright light, but it sucks compared to cameras I've used with less quality. Outstanding quality for a day at the beach.

Reviews.Title: Kodak Zi8 Camera
Reviews.Author: CarolPatterson
Reviews.Content: Great little camera.  I also bought the audio-technia lavalier microphone to go with it, a 16 GB memory card plus a remote control.  I am on my way to great videos.Someone also turned me on to Magix Movie Edit Pro 15 software which I bought.  This software is more professional than the one from ArcSoft that comes with the camera.  Order the software when you buy the camera, you will be very happy.Great camera for the price, and the vendor sent it right away...no problems....

Reviews.Title: awesome camera
Reviews.Author: buster_roo
Reviews.Content: awesome camera, you do have to play with how you record to know the perfect settings, you can not always record in the same setting and expect crisp video, but its not tough to figure out, very handy, videos look amazing, comes with HDMI cable, we leave the cable hooked up to the TV for quick viewing

Reviews.Title: matched my research
Reviews.Author: Gary J Carter
Reviews.Content: Checked it out on many review sites, comparing it to the other slimline HD point & shoots.The 3 features that sold me on the Zi8 were: price, external mic ability, and wvga video.wvga video has smaller file sizes, doesn't need a computer with massive power to edit, and is a wide screen format.It doesn't look bad on the big screen either, for family memories. When new models come out in the near future, I'llstart surfing the net for a replacement, but this little number does the trick for now.

Reviews.Title: Tough to Edit. Bad Close-Up Focus.
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer "kimba"
Reviews.Content: I gave this only 2 stars, because this camera has been such a pain.1) the editing software is so awful (Arc Soft).2) it doesn't focus 3 ft away from subject (or even 2 ft). This fact makes it tough to get good sound in many situations or even a shot.As for the editing: At first I converted the footage and tried Sony Vegas, WMM and even Magix. The quality was awful after hours of recoding with different specifications that I spent hours digging up from various different forums. Sony Vegas did work for a bit, but then just stopped for some reason (even after I tried 3 different tricks including the infamous, just rename the file format). Window Live Movie also worked for a bit. Flip camera is just so much easier to use!! I made such cute films in minutes with it.  This camera should come with the words MAC all over it.I have made 3 short films with the Arc editing software provided and was on the verge of crying a couple of times after it froze up (all other programs were closed) and then shutdown losing my entire movie. The way it saves edited clips makes no sense to me at all. I had to redo every edit. This has nothing to do with the camera, but I'd rather have the Flip for fun, sassy videos.So for reference, I have used the Flip and produced several videos from it (love it. so easy to use.), a professional camera/Canon GL1 (easy to transfer and edit) and I often shoot videos with my Panasonic Lumix digital camera (sound is not great but the video has a nice film quality - great in low light).I was very excited about the Zi8 - I bought a wide-angle lens for it; a Gorilla tripod to stick the camera all over the place (has been really fun); and the remote control was a great purchase too.As for focus: If you are doing interviews, then you can mic the person and move the camera away on a tripod though. I wanted to do some instructional videos for my business and have to get very creative - no holding anything up to the camera. Macro focus is cool, but not realistic. You need the mid-range focus, please!Cons:1. editing software is atrocious!! really drains your storage. Flip is a million times easier.2. Focus distance - such a shame.3. Unit overheats (gets very, very hot) and freezes up. This is a real pain.4. System also freezes up when card is not even that full - then you can't delete from the camera and must plug into computer, after removing the battery, because the unit will not power down (its frozen).Pros1. The video quality is amazing if you are at the right distance2. Far less shaky than the Flip, so the stabilization is working for me and I moved all over this Christmas taking video of the family and dog opening gifts (yes, the dog ripped open a gift), etc.3. Sound is quite good - though I think the Flip has the edge4. external mic rocks.5. the unit balances in your hand, making it easy to shoot.6. powers up quickly for catching moments.Bottom line -- This camera should be getting a better rating, but has been too much of pain for me. Maybe if I buy a Mac, I'll be very excited again, but I think Kodak royally messed up with the file format and Arc Soft as the editing software provider, along with the focus length.If I can't figure out the editing, I'll have to get rid of this camera soon.

Reviews.Title: The Best of the Best!
Reviews.Author: Freakntweak
Reviews.Content: Amazing features for the price. Better video quality than the Flip. Good sound after firmware upgrade. Expand memory via SD all the way up to 32MB. Works with Wifi SD cards. Comes with both composite and HDMI cables. Plugs straight into TV/Projector. Let's you film in 1080p, 720p @ 30 OR 60 frames per second, or VGA to save space. Allows you to take photos from the camera and not just by "screen capture" via software as in the case of the Flip. Software on PC is great but doesn't work with Macs.I love this camera! Can't beat it for the price!

Reviews.Title: Excellent investment
Reviews.Author: Atulkumar Patel
Reviews.Content: This is one of the best pocket hand cam you can possibly find in the market currently. I prefer this over Flip Ultra HD due to room for some customization as well as availability of recording videos at 1080. Video quality is excellent in HD mode. Macro mode is very easy to use. External mic input is very useful. I had to record an interview for a class project, and this camera did a great job. Although built-in mic is decent if you are recording something in a close-door environment, you are better-off buying an external mic if you are recording outdoor. Also electronic image stabilization is a great option, although it will suck up lot of battery. Image stabilization is not as effective when you moving around a lot, but it works great if you taking video while just walking slowly. Also I would recommend people get mini tripod, which is one of the best investment you will make. Another thing that is really good about this camera is that you can record video while charging, which means if you have a long conference that you have to record, you can get away with it if you find outlet close to the camera.

Reviews.Title: Good quality for price
Reviews.Author: Karen,Tennessee
Reviews.Content: Have not used too much yet....a gift for husband, but seems to be easy to use....good quality, and clearness of video

Reviews.Title: Video Camera Meets my expectations
Reviews.Author: John Lowe
Reviews.Content: Read the reviews and made this choice for the option of external microphone.  Very easy to use and happy with my purchase.

Reviews.Title: Great product!
Reviews.Author: user 77777
Reviews.Content: I am very pleased with this product.  The size makes it easy to carry and use and the picture quality is great.  The sound is not that great so you might want to consider that if that is important to you.  Great product!

Reviews.Title: Great little camera
Reviews.Author: Tinkerer
Reviews.Content: High quality camera that is small enough to carry so you have it when you need it. Takes good still pictures also. The only fault is, since it is so small, it is a little more difficult to not shake while panning. I'm happy with it.

Reviews.Title: kodak zi8
Reviews.Author: Joe loves cool electronics...
Reviews.Content: I like this camera a lot, ease of use, very handy, easy to storage when not in use. The video quality is very good, clear image and very good internal microphone.  The only thing that I don't like of this camera is the usb connector, it should be an external cable, so you can connect to any computer, laptop or pc and put it on aside. So I recommend to buy an external usb extension. Construction quality is fine, can't put the camera in standing position, need a tripod. I think for the price that I paid, this camera is a lot more that I was expected (paid about 117.00 in amazon.com) definitely recommended...

Reviews.Title: Great camcorder but close up is lacking
Reviews.Author: Eugene Kolovyansky
Reviews.Content: While we were very happy with the overall performance of the camera, one thing kept causing us frustration. The wide-angle range of the lens just required the holder to stand way too far back to get everything on screen. Overall, it's a great camera and if we didn't have to keep stepping back to make sure the kids were in the frame, we would keep it. Returned it and looking to get something with a better wide-angle.

Reviews.Title: A Steel!
Reviews.Author: dude
Reviews.Content: Everything I needed to do high quality videos with out the added weight. Great for people shooting video on hikes or hunts!

Reviews.Title: Only those accustomed to expensive photo equipment would find fault with it
Reviews.Author: ParrotSlave "GeorgeButel"
Reviews.Content: I am not going to compete with the excellent reviews by Vernon and Wolfe, among others, but I want to mention that I am extremely impressed by this camera.  I'm never the first on the block to buy anything electronic--I always wait until the service packs or equivalent come out--but the cnet and other reviews of this were so favorable that I bought one as soon as it was available at Kodak online, on 8/19/09.  I was not disappointed.The only cons I can find are that there is an annoying lag in trying to change menu options, and the menu set up is bizarre, and totally non-intuitive to me. I still have to think every time I change something about what I have to select to get to the option I want.It does take a while for the automatic light adjustment to take effect, which is most noticeable when you are walking around from place to place with different lighting. Some have complained about imperfect quality when moving, but I cannot complain; perhaps setting the quality to 720 instead of 1080 might have helped for them, but I have had no problem at all. I do notice that when trying to film something with varying light sources, there is noticeable pixelation on the bright part of the image:  in filming my parrot Ziggy and me playing in a corner with normal lighting next to a brightly lighted open window, the window frame is highly pixelated.  The Zi8 cannot do everything at once.The quality is so good that I can even get decent screen capture stills out of movie files (decent for me, an amateur--decent enough for the web, anyway.) It is difficult to take regular stills with the camera, though, because pushing the button inevitably shakes the camera.I personally find it annoying that the camera saves files in the mov format, but I can live with that.  I have several different video editing programs, but the easiest way to do rough edits on mov files is with Quick Time, so I had to buy Quick Time Pro to do that. I have several ArcSoft programs, and even bought an upgraded version of the oem version of Media Impression that comes with the camera, and it is useful for how quickly it loads previews for organizing.Some have complained about "having" to use Arcsoft software, but that's ridiculous.  I just ignore the ArcSoft software and pull the files off by cut and paste for later editing.  After plugging your camera into your pc, open My Computer, ignore the new hard drive, Arcsoft SW, that will show up, and open the new "Removable Disk," which has folders DCIM and MISC in it, ignore MISC and open DCIM, and inside it will be a folder named 130EKZI8, which contains all your jpgs and movs, and you can pull them off the camera and put them on your pc by simple cut and paste, then edit them or convert them to your heart's content with whatever video program you desire--ArcSoft, Adobe, Magix, Pinnacle, Cyberlink, Vegas, whatever.  Some have complained about difficulty installing the non-necessary Arcsoft software, but I would complain either to Bill Gates or the manufacturer of their security programs about that.I have taken a number of videos of my parrots doing various things and posted them to my pwp and FB.  The pwp is accessible via my amazon profile, if you want to see what kind of quality the Zi8 delivers. I have also taken movies while driving--when I see odd behavior on the road, or unusual landmarks, or the scary "runaway truck ramp" signs on US 65, etc.--and the quality is 1000% better than any dashcam video I've seen on tv.NOTE:  If you want the best quality pictures, make sure that you keep your firmware upgraded. It is currently at version 1.06; go to [...].  Kodak, for reasons known only to itself, has not emailed any notices to me about new versions of its firmware.

Reviews.Title: Super easy and fast.
Reviews.Author: Melissa
Reviews.Content: I whip this little thing out and have it recording FAST. My little one's epic moments are all caught on film thanks to this camera. It does not have a lot of features though. Strictly a point and shoot deal. I must admit that having the USB connector swing right out the side is an amazing feature though.

Reviews.Title: Kodak at its' best!
Reviews.Author: W. T. Whelan
Reviews.Content: Wonderful product, excellent gift, provides a crystal clear picture that is hard to believe. Very easy to use, compact and will provide hours of enjoyment.

Reviews.Title: Worth the money!
Reviews.Author: Blues 'n BBQ
Reviews.Content: I'm not a big video junkie. I wanted something that was small, easy to use, and didn't break the bank. This product fits the bill nicely. Good picture quality (at highest setting) and playback is easy enough on my HDTV.

Reviews.Title: Bought for hubby for Christmas last year
Reviews.Author: Tammye Green
Reviews.Content: The only problem that we have had with this camera was that by him taking it everywhere he goes and having it in his pocket constantly, he lost the lens cover. Which Kodak would have replaced if he could have let go of the camera long enough to send it to them. He has since bought another one as that is his only solution to be able to send in the one for repair. Get a carrying case...and use it...He has the case, just never uses it. I just wish that the software that came with it would have not been a trial and now it is impossible to use it. Have since bought a new software so he can still produce his videos. See […]  to view how well the camera works...remember that the latest ones are without the lens cover.Kodak Zi8 Pocket Video Camera (Raspberry)

Reviews.Title: Just Okay, not great
Reviews.Author: Carole C
Reviews.Content: Not a great one, just works okay. Video resolution is fantastic but under low lighting conditions it doesn't deliver. Manual handling for focus stability is a trouble because even a slightest jerk would throw away the image perfection. Battery longevity is average.

Reviews.Title: Camera A+ / Kodak Support F
Reviews.Author: L. Columbus "lou1492"
Reviews.Content: Camera takes wonderful video for the price.  However, while on vacation, I removed the camera from my jacket pocket to find the protective lens cover had come off.  After several minutes of fiddling with it, I got it to snap back into place, but it continued to come off with the slightest bump.  Later on the camera developed a problem with spotting in the video and photos.  After an hour or more dealing with customer service, I was told to send my camera in for repair, which I did.  About 2 weeks later, I received the camera back, but it still had the same problem.  Again I was told to return it and this time I was sent a refurbished unit. Unfortunately, they sent the wrong type of battery with it, so they had to send a new battery separately.  The refurb works, but I was offered nothing for my time and frustration and was without a working camera for over 1 month.  Compared to my experiences with other companies, Kodak ranks very poor.  Hopefully they will improve in that area, so it compares with the quality of their products.

Reviews.Title: great video cam
Reviews.Author: quent "quent"
Reviews.Content: did my home work,this little cam works great.2 hours video w/32 sd.got extra battery but don"t need it.got to find way to get video trans/to dvd.

Reviews.Title: I like!
Reviews.Author: dpad79
Reviews.Content: Just a quick review. For the price......Nice video quality...Audio is okay...Easy to useMake sure you buy one of those memory cards (sdhc I think). The recorder itself won't hold but maybe 30 secs on internal memory.Overall this little thing is pretty sweet.

Reviews.Title: convenient to use, sound quality is poor
Reviews.Author: Ken
Reviews.Content: I bought this so I don't have to lug around my HD camcorder all the time to shoot video of my family.  It starts up super quick, which is very convenient when you're trying to catch your 2 year-old doing something funny.  Picture quality is good, especially given the price.  It's really light weight and easy to use.  You can easily carry it around in your pocket so you're always ready to catch that youtube moment.  The only negative thing I found so far is the sound quality.  Whatever you're recording has to be within a few feet of the camera or you can't hear it when you play it back on your computer or TV without cranking the volume all the way up (literally).  I had one of the first generation Flips that picked up sound much better than this Kodak.

Reviews.Title: Only thing missing is a flash
Reviews.Author: N. Johnson
Reviews.Content: I love this little camera.  It takes excellent video and still shots.  Like the title says, the only thing missing is a flash.

Reviews.Title: sacgirl2
Reviews.Author: Sacgirl2 "Sac"
Reviews.Content: This video camera is easy to use right out the box. It's very small and easy to handle. You can carry it in a small purse or strap it to a belt buckle, no heavy camera to carry. The HD is very clears, and the videos  are easy to upload to You Tube. The sound quality is good.

Reviews.Title: Old or New Kodak ZI8 Video Pocket Camera
Reviews.Author: YumaBajacat
Reviews.Content: Bought this camera last summer when it first came out, because of the reviews and size, it fits into a man's shirt pocket without a problem or into a fanny pack as well. Both my husband and myself have enjoying using the video camera.We have not had any problems, I find that the it was really easy to use the MediaImpression software for making videos.As you can see from my question below, I am having a problem with the new camera and would only give it 2.5 stars.The older model I would give 5 stars all around.Can someone help me, during the summer I dropped our ZI8 camera and broke the lens cover. Always recorded in WVGA and had a record time of 13:30:00 hours (I know more than I should need) . As the price was going down, I deciede to wait to replace the video camera, so I finally broke down and ordered another ZI8 video camera, after charging the battery up and an placing a Sandisk 32gb SDHC card into the camera, it showed a record time of 8:26:00 hours record time in WVGA, this is the record time for 720p in the old camera. I went to the Kodak website and did a live chat for over 2 hours and still the problems was not taken care of. I am now waiting to hear back from Kodak, if I have not hear from them in by the middle of next week I will return the camera.

Reviews.Title: Really like this camera.... but a few things disappointed.
Reviews.Author: Gary in Sun City, AZ
Reviews.Content: I have mixed feelings about this camera. If not for the "issues" I'll address here, I'd give the camera a "4" or "5". I'm experienced in photography, have my own photo gallery website on SmugMug, and shot VHS video years ago when my kids were growing up. I plan to keep this camera for the uses I myself have these days. It shoots good video, maybe just not terrific. But then after all, it's an inexpensive "entry level" camera.I had none of the problems some other reviewers had, maybe because my camera arrived with the latest 1.06 firmware. Directions for the camera are VERY limited. The included booklet, the Kodak on-line help, and above all, the ArcSoftware. Even going on-line to any of them gives sadly little help & direction for the new user. I clicked on help with ArcSoft and a GERMAN page came up, with no obvious way to get it into English. Is that stupid or what?! No corrections have been made by Arc days later, either.While I didn't expect video quality quite like the much more expensive camcorders offer, it was below what they seem to boast of and offer as examples. This camera really requires using "Class 6" SD memory cards. If not used the info from the camera shoots out faster than weaker memory cards can keep up with. That's when the camera shuts down or an error shows up. The camera's built-in mike records in "mono". For stereo you will need to purchase a stereo mike and plug it into the jack. Editing your video clips, it appears, will require purchasing additional software. At least my experience with ArcSoftware hasn't helped me there.Another issue I have is with its "face detection". This is a "fixed-focus" camera, the only choices being distance or close-up (5"-12") controlled by a switch on its top. How then can "face detection" even be possble? How can the lens find & focus in on faces, with a fixed-focus camera? It cannot and does not. A wasted "feature" it seems used in advertising. If I'm wrong, someone explain why.The reviews have been pretty good about this camera, in particular the one from cne*t. This may at this time be the best of its kind. I like how it feels and works, just think a huge company like Kodak could have addressed these issues much earlier.This camera is greatly discounted, check around. And Amazon had the best price, shipped from Beach Camera, a reliable place.UPDATE 09/25/2010: After initial frustration I found a YouTube video which really helped me understand the program that came with the camera. I found it by doing a Google search:[...]

Reviews.Title: Impressive Pocket Video Camera
Reviews.Author: Daniel S. Wolfert
Reviews.Content: I purchased this product so I would have a high quality video camera that I could take with me everywhere. The idea being that when life's little moments happen, the smaller the camera, the more likely I would be to have it with me. I am very happy with all aspects of the camera except for the following:When panning with the camera the image distorts. Zooming with the camera results in significant picture quality loss. The battery life seems limited to about 1/2 hour shooting.If it weren't for the above mentioned deficiencies, I would give this product very high marks. And it should be noted that all cameras this size and in this price range probably have these same limitations.

Reviews.Title: Good Buy, Flip
Reviews.Author: J. Macedo "string jockey"
Reviews.Content: Awesome camera, only downside is the audio. I'm in a band and use it to record our shows, but it does have a port for an external mic that will greatly enhance the audio. Buy it.

Reviews.Title: A nice little camera
Reviews.Author: jason
Reviews.Content: Bought this camera because of a recommendation from a friend. Its nice compact great for leaving in your bag. Lens is not as wide as i would hope it would be and it doesn't do well in dark light, its an awful shame there is no flash or light. Be aware though i had this delivered to Ireland and it cost 35 euro delivery and another 40 euro import so you might wanna shop locally as you may find it cheaper here.

Reviews.Title: Nice Camera
Reviews.Author: Robert Squire
Reviews.Content: This is a nice compact camera for shooting video, or still shots. We did purchase an external mic for better sound quality and it works great. I would recommend this camera, especially for parents on the go.

Reviews.Title: Kodak pocket cam Z18
Reviews.Author: Bevelrymae
Reviews.Content: I love my zi8 Pocket cam, I bought the Rasberry one for my self as a Christmas gift, I liked it so  muchthat I recenly bought my Daughter the teal one  for her Birthday in July, and she is just as happy with it,is is small enough to fit in my purse, it is light weight, its around the size of a cell phone. the strapis vey handy.. I am not impressd with the zoom, pictures do get darker as you zoom all the way out, so I avoid useingthat feature when possiabe.  ITs built in usb port is easy to use, I face book and utube alot, so this is quick and easy,and I don't have to search for chords,  l love it and it's worth the money.. and the scren is bigger than the flip pocket cams, which is a  pluss..

Reviews.Title: Best video camera I've ever owned
Reviews.Author: tch6th
Reviews.Content: This is the best video camera I've ever owned.  I've owned several video cameras over the past couple of decades and none function as well or as easily as this one.  It's a simple turn-it-on and press the red button and you're filming.  The high resolution is great and even the built-in microphone is quite adequate.  We've filmed some videos of our band, and the sound quality is okay.  My biggest disappointment, aside from the vague responses I got from the Kodak support, is the fact that even filming in the lowest 720 mode, which is the one recommended by Kodak, the files are too large to post to YouTube, which was the whole reason I bought the camera in the first place.  There is really no editing software that comes with it, but for the low, low price for the camera, $128 (and I paid $625 for my last Sony, and it doesn't compare, in my opinion), I wouldn't expect editing software to be included.  I can carry this little thing in my shirt pocket, and it's always ready to take shots wherever I am.  My wife loves it because there's no complicated process to go through to take pictures.  As I said, turn it on (and it comes to life quickly) and press the red button, and you are shooting high res videos.

Reviews.Title: Happy Happy.
Reviews.Author: Sara B. Cooper "Sara"
Reviews.Content: I bought one of these recently because my sister had gotten one and I didn't believe her how nice it was.There's only two cons I've found with it. The first, it only comes with a 4 gb sdhc card and there's only about an hour of battery life with it, but otherwise, I love the silly thing. I just need to get another battery and a solar charger.

Reviews.Title: Overall Very Good for Price
Reviews.Author: Matt "Knowledge for the sake of knowledge."
Reviews.Content: Pros:1. Portable.2. Very good video quality for this range of product.3. Very low price and good value.4. SDHC allows you to use as much memory as you wish.5. Image stabilization (See below) works pretty well.Cons:1. Battery life is dismal, only accepts proprietary batteries.2. Image stabilizer works alright, but could be much better. It is suppose to "stabilize" footage, but there is still massive shake and blur if you are not careful. I am very disappointed in this feature as Kodak could have done so much better.3. The HD mode is good, but the 60fps mode is much better and sharper.4. The USB plug is convenient, but is on a cheap piece of bendable rubber that I cannot imagine lasting long. The idea is to give you more angles to plug it in, which is nice, but it just seems non-durable.5. Still-camera mode is terrible and takes fuzzy pics.Overall: The pros outweigh the cons. For this low price, you are getting very nice video, even excellent at the right settings. Image stabilization, while not very good, still at least exists, and this is the only such product with that feature. Upload to my Mac could not be simpler: I did not even install any software. I just plugged it in and there it was on the desktop. If you are interested in an entry-evel but good video camera, you could not do better than the Kodak.

Reviews.Title: An Amazing Camera for What It is Worth
Reviews.Author: smarksman "smarksman"
Reviews.Content: I wanted to get a camera for home movies, filming places around town, and going to events. I am very happy with this camera. I have had this for about 6 months now and here are my pros and cons about it.Pros:- It has great picture quality. For the size and price of this i am very pleased with who the picture looks. Inside shots can look grainy on my computer but they look good when i burn it on to a dvd and watch on my tv.- It is very portable. I am to the point now where i throw this in my pocket with me every time just in case something exciting or interesting happens. I love the ability to be able to take this things anywhere. I have taken this with me to concerts to film the show and various other things like waiting in line, filming drunk people, and getting video of what the place looks like like. With this camera people usually can't tell i am filming them. It looks like i am holding a cellphone.- I like the ability to add things to this camera. I can buy extra batteries and extra SD cards which means there is no limit to how long i film. I have a 16 gb card and two batteries. I will go through two batteries and start running out of memory after filming for 40 minutes or so. Which isn't bad considering in most cases i don't have the camera on and film something for 40 minutes. I usually film a minute or two of something then turn it off and then repeat that till i run out of space. But again, if i am worried about that i can buy another 16gb card and another battery or two. I also like that there is an external audio jack or microphones.- The audio is great on it. On my computer i can everything really well but sometimes not so much on my tv. The concerts i have recorded have sounded and looked fantastic- USB. I like that the usb is built in and it doesnt take long to get the files on computer. It can charge through the USB as well. When i went camping for three days and had not outlets, i brought my laptop and used it to charge the battery and take the files off of my camera, which i loved.Cons:- Shaky video. Walking or moving around a lot with this makes the picture very shaky. I did notice that some of the shakiness went away when put the videos on dvd and watch it on tv. I try not to film while i am walking because it looks horrible. When i pan the camera around i do it extra slow to make sure it looks good. I highly recommend a tripod for this camera. People moving in front of the camera looks fine, the problem is when the camera itself is moved.- Add ons. While it can be great, like i mentioned above, it also sucks that i needed to buy so much extra. I got a mini tripod, regular tripod, extra battery, 16gb SDHC card, camera bag, light for night shots. It maybe a 150 dollar camera, but if someone doesnt have these extra features already and feels like they need them then it can get pricey- Software. The movies are in .mov format which sucks for windows. Like others have said it means that you can't make quick dvd's using Windows DVD Maker. I have a different video editing software which crashes when i use .mov files. So, i got something to convert .mov files to .avi files. That works fine but it is time consuming. I have to wait for the videos to convert to the right format, then edit them and then wait for the movies to be formatted to be burned.Overall, i would still recommend this to people. I love the picture quality and the fact that i am at least able to add on different things which you can't do with a FLIP. The camera is good for someone who is looking to shoot home movies and for someone who is looking for something portable. I have loved using this around the house, out camping, and going to concerts.

Reviews.Title: Completely Let Down
Reviews.Author: pagreta
Reviews.Content: Let me start out by saying that I was truly excited for this item. I had done a lot of research of different models trying to get the most bang for my buck. It basically came down to a tossup between this zi8 and the Flip UltraHD. I decided to go with this model because of the removable storage. Let me start out with the good comments.Pros: This pocket cam is extremely easy to use. I'm pretty sure anyone can turn this on and figure out how to use it. The feature set of the camera is relatively small so you aren't overwhelmed with options. It boots up quickly and you're recording in no time. I like having removable storage so if I'm out on a long trip or something, I can take multiple cards and batteries and be able to record a lot. It is relatively small and although it is a little thick, I could still fit it in my pocket, or more comfortably, a purse. It does have a convenient usb connection that flips out on the side so you can plug it in. As far as the pros, that is about it.Cons: I bought this flip camera not only for the convenience and portability, but also to be able to record good quality video. Like the title says, I was completely let down by the quality of video this thing shot. I was so excited when I got this and opened it and started charging the battery. I almost couldn't wait until that was done to start using it, but when I shot the first few seconds of 1080p video and played it on my PC, it was like someone deflated me. I was so let down by the quality. Not only was the 1080p video grainy, but even slow movements with the camera caused choppy video and the colors were over saturated. I'm by no means a camera expert or a quality snob, but this was just not what I was expecting. I then spent the rest of the afternoon playing with settings, shooting in low light, outside in daylight, shooting at 720p and 720p 60fps and everything was disappointing. Maybe I was expecting too much from a $150 camera, but when I read something that says 1080p, I expect to see video in 1080p like I'm used to watching. Honestly, I couldn't even tell that much of a difference between the 1080p and the wvga videos. I'll be sending this camera back and just investing in a full blown video camera that does 1080p.Bottom line, if you're looking for a camera that shoots decent 1080p or even 720p video, don't get this one. If you're looking for a compact video camera that is easy to use, quick, and shoots mediocre video, then this might work for you.

Reviews.Title: Love this!!!
Reviews.Author: CheerCoach
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera because I am a coach and wanted to be able to film my team performing and easily share the video.  I love it for that and it is so amazing.The only thing I hate about this product is it doesn't come with an actual manual.  You have to download it.  Everything else is perfect.  Can't wait to use it all season.  Used it at camp and loved it.

Reviews.Title: Zi8 Camera
Reviews.Author: Dolores Huberts
Reviews.Content: The Kodak Zi8 is really a great choice for a simple hand-held camera.Good features:It is small and can fit in your pocket.Good picture (stills) quality.Good video quality.  You can select different options to have different video quality-- each will use a different amount of memory.Good sound quality-- it really can pickup sound well.Really easy to upload photos and videos because it has a built-in USB-- no need to remember a cord.It is compatable with Macs. :)  And other computers.It has a big viewing screen, which I like a lot.The battery life is good for a camera of its size-- about two to three hours if you film continuously on the lowest quality video.  It comes with a power cord (recharable battery).You can hook it up to your TV (it comes with the cords).Bad Features:You must buy a memory card separately.There are not a lot of options on it.  It is very simple.You cannot take pictures or videos in the dark.Hard to set down and just film stuff.  The sides are not flat, so it is hard to just place it somewhere to film something.  One might need to get a tripod (which are available).

Reviews.Title: Worth the price!
Reviews.Author: Romesh B. Trivedi
Reviews.Content: I got Zi8 recently before my trip to Disney Land. With one extra battery and one 8Gb SD card, I was able to shoot video for whole day.Transfering video is easy. One thing I did not like and still having problem with is that it saves file in .MOV format. Microsoft does not support .MOV, Roxio does not support.MOV (directly) and I had to download bunch of driver/conversion freeware. I am still unable to burn a DVD for movies I shot. Still looking around for help.Support from Microsoft, ROXIO has been crappy!Since I am unable to save file in avi or other format.. I gave it a 3. Otherwire Camera by itself is worth the price. If someone can figure out a way to burn DVD using .MOV file, then I would recommend buying this.

Reviews.Title: A good camera if...
Reviews.Author: Faith
Reviews.Content: When I purchased this Kodak camera, it was a gift for my dads birthday. He absolutely loved it! Here are the pros and cons:Pros:Excellent quality videoThere is a place to plug up a microphone for better sound qualityIt's small and handy... fits in your pocket!Battery life is pretty goodI love that you can switch between video sizes (1080p, 720)Cons:The picture quality is not good at all. If you're looking to take some pro pictures on your vacation, I recommend you take a separate camera. After all, it is a Kodak VIDEO camera... it wasn't made to take pictures. But, that is a nice small feature in case of emergencies.Without a microphone, the audio isn't THAT great. It's alright. I know this because I own a Flipvideo and my dad and I were comparing our video quality one day and we decided that the audio on the Flip video was better than Kodak.Overall, with all it's pros and cons, I would have to say it is a good video camera and something that could be used around the house to document the kids playing in the mud or out on the busy streets interviewing people (provided you use a mic).

Reviews.Title: The best today?
Reviews.Author: Kevin
Reviews.Content: I bought this as a cheap way to shoot slow motion! 720p at 60fps is nice and smooth.Be sure to update to the latest firmware. Image quality could be better.By the way, you need to have a beefy computer to edit video. This applies to all cameras.

Reviews.Title: Kodak Zi8 a lotta bang for the buck
Reviews.Author: rockinchar
Reviews.Content: I researched for weeks before making my decision. Read a lot of reviews and threads talking about the pocket cameras. This one seemed like it had the most bang for the buck so I ordered it. The video and still pictures are awesomely clear. Convenience of using an SD card (only used SDHC card so far) is great (my last camcorder took mini tapes and was a hassle). Love the portability and spontaneous usability. Also, seems pretty rugged as it got hurled lens down from the trunk of the car onto a paved driveway. I thought for sure it was toast, but it was fine. Only a small scratch too. Definitely ordering the rubber sleeve from the Kodak site ASAP.

Reviews.Title: Kodak Zi8
Reviews.Author: Jim Lomanto
Reviews.Content: I think that its best one that I ever have  Its easy to carry and very thin  I use it almost everyday

Reviews.Title: Great HD Camera - Buy This one!
Reviews.Author: Paul Cline
Reviews.Content: Great Camera ... saw a video review on it and bought it. I used it with a green screen setup and PowerDirector Pro 8 ... Fantastic and EASY results!  I love it so far. Battery lasts 1hr and 15min .... so by extras ... you can get then as cheap as $2.50 each on amazon! Still camera is a little disappointing ... not very good focus for a 5 megapixel camera.

Reviews.Title: Good, portable movie camera for the price
Reviews.Author: Hari Nair
Reviews.Content: This is a nice little camera.  The main problem is a lack of image stabilization.  If you are going to be still while shooting your movie, the image quality is quite nice.  However, even walking slowly will cause your movie to be too shaky to watch comfortably.It is very light, convenient, and easy to use.  It is very easy to copy the movie files to the computer and upload to YouTube.  It is also easy to edit in iMovie.As long as you are aware of its limitations, this is a good camera.  We use it much more often than our bulky camcorder.

Reviews.Title: Love the Zi8
Reviews.Author: C. Miller
Reviews.Content: This is the first video camera I have owned and I love it. It is very easy to use and is so compact that I carry it in my purse all the time! You never know when you might need to shoot a little video!  It shoots really sharp and clear video, even in 720p. The zoom is limited and not as smooth and sensitive as you might like but I haven't found that to be too big a problem so far. It is also true, as other reviewers have noted, that the internal mike is not great. For day to day use though it is adequate and the camera does have a jack for an external mike (which I have not tried.) I will be travelling to Africa with my daughter and son-in-law for an international adoption in the future. My assignment is to document the trip and that's why I wanted a video camera. I wanted something that would be very easy to use, easy to carry around and easy  to upload to the internet while we are travelling. The Zi8 meets all of those criteria. This camera has a very easily accessible USB connection to plug into the laptop and I expect it to be very easy to keep the home folks informed--not to mention all the fun when the grandchildren come home!

Reviews.Title: An incredible sign off the times.  So good.  So cheap.
Reviews.Author: Doug Saylor "from DesignSmythe"
Reviews.Content: I have used this for informal video and for more planned testimonials using a wireless lapel mic and am completely satisfied by both.  I'm no videographer and would never be a prospect for even a traditional video camera, but this thing is so inexpensive and easy to use, it was an easy decision to give it a try. Earlier, I also bought a zi6. The big (huge) difference is the ability to hook up an external mic.  I am very pleased.

Reviews.Title: Great camcorder
Reviews.Author: Mattie Brady "Pixie"
Reviews.Content: This is a great little camcorder.  Image quality is very good.  Convenient, built in usb connector.  Instructions are simple and very easy to follow.

Reviews.Title: Great video quality at a great price
Reviews.Author: Theodore A. Wolff
Reviews.Content: I use this camera indoors to record live music and post it on my website. The video quality is very good as long as I provide enough light. The external mic port allows me to plug in an inexpensive stereo microphone, which improves the audio quality. A superior quality camera at a very inexpensive price.

Reviews.Title: Kodak Zi8 video camera
Reviews.Author: L. VanZandt
Reviews.Content: I love the size of this camera and it is cute and very easy to use.  The pictures aren't top quality but I knew at the price I paid they wouldn't be.  It fits in the same camera case with my digital camera so it is easy to use which ever one I want for the occasion.  My first pictures were blurry until I realized that you must keep camera very still and if you want to scan do it very slowly much more so than my old camcorder but for what I wanted it for I am pleased with it.  The software was easy to use also.

Reviews.Title: FANTASTIC!
Reviews.Author: Denise Galat "Proffesor Tumbleebums"
Reviews.Content: // To view this video download Flash Player (version 9.0.115 or higher)'); } } catch(err) { fp_resizePlayerSpace('cv_mo3E1JKWB7JENV6', 0, 0); } return false; } function _cv_mo3E1JKWB7JENV6loadSwf(movieID, playerVersion) { var swfLocation = "http://g-ecx.images-amazon.com/images/G/01/am3/20120510035744301/AMPlayer._V148501545_.swf"; } cv_mo3E1JKWB7JENV6preplay.onmouseout = function() { cv_mo3E1JKWB7JENV6preplay.src = "http://ecx.images-amazon.com/images/I/81z6tau1zvS._SX320_PHcustomer-video-vignette_PIvideo-reviews-bottom,BottomLeft,0,43_OU01_PIcustomer-video-play,BottomLeft,130,-12_CR0,0,0,0_.png"; logTag.type = "text/javascript"; logTag.src = "/gp/customer-media/du/log.html?ie=UTF8&p=CustomerImage&s=CustomerVideoPlay"; head[0].appendChild(logTag); } if (cv_mo3E1JKWB7JENV6currentClick) { return cv_mo3E1JKWB7JENV6currentClick(); } } } Length:: 0:31 MinsI bought this about 2 months ago. I have used it to film many things like a play,home movies,things for fun, and much more. The internal mic is decent. I would recommend buying an external mic(you can find one for about $40 on amazon). the video quality is great. It shoots in 16:9 aspic ration(wide screen). It has the options of 1080p, 720p, WVGA, and Picture modes. There is no auto focus,but it has a macro mode. I think they all do a great job. The pictures come out a little blurry but they look alright. The camera feels like a phone in your hand. I would recommend buying a case for it(about $10)on amazon. It can get scratched easily. Also buy a screen protector(comes with some cases). Also you should buy a Class 6 SD card for fast transfer to your computer. The flip out are s great. It is flexible so there is no strain on the arm when hooking up to a desktop computer. One thing I do not like about this camera is that you cannot zoom while in Macro mode, you must switch to normal and zoom then switch back. I love that you can hook it to your HDTV. The picture quality is amazing. I would recommend this camera to anyone. the video is filmed in WVGA, using macro and normal modes.

Reviews.Title: Great camera, poor construction quality
Reviews.Author: R. V. Hatcher
Reviews.Content: Enough people have written about the picture quality which is exceptional, but I wanted to touch on the feel of the device.  The Zi8 couldn't feel flimsier.  It seems to be made of cheap plastic and every corner has been cut.  Because the cover is a very slick plastic it gets dirty quickly from fingerprints.  Also, the cover is really hard to get off to get to the battery compartment.  Why they didn't put some ribs on there I don't know.  I had to put on a rubber dishwashing glove to get some friction.  Then, the cover for the SD card is so flimsy I am glad it doesn't have to come off regularly or it would surely get torn off.  The buttons for Delete, Play, etc, are very, very small so they are hard to press.  Oh, and they don't tell you in the instructions that you have to press and hold the off/on switch for a few seconds to get it to turn on.I had bought the Flip Mino HD and returned it because it didn't have an external mic connection and I am glad the Zi8 has one. But, the construction on the Mino was much sturdier.  I would be worried about this thing breaking in a backpack, or on a bike ride, and it would certainly not survive a drop onto a tile floor.Bob

Reviews.Title: Review from a mac user
Reviews.Author: Mollie D. Young
Reviews.Content: So glad I didn't get a flip camera!I love this little camera. It's as small as a blackberry (maybe a inch bigger) fits in a pocket and isn't bulky.I was leary being a mac user to purchase this but it works flawlessly. You just flip out the usb plug (also takes a memory card) and upload your videos, then you can save it to your computer, upload to facebook. flickr, you tube, mobileme, email. The quality is really good and it is easy to hold the camera securely getting no shakes on video.

Reviews.Title: Great little video camera
Reviews.Author: SteveR
Reviews.Content: This is a great camera to take anywhere you go since it is about the size of a deck of cards.  I picked this up for my girlfriend as a gift.  She is not a techie, but I taught her how to use it in about 5min.  The picture quality is superb in well lit conditions (outside).  When the lighting is low are pretty much anything inside the video starts to get a little bit blocky.  For what it is it is fantastic, this is not for video production, however it is great for capturing vacations and family gatherings without having to haul around a larger much more expensive camera.  Got a 8gb flash card on ebay for $20 and that's good for a few hours of recording.  The editing software it comes with is very limited and that is the only area this comes up short.  Long story short she LOVES the camera, I think it's pretty cool if you're looking for a video camera you can't go wrong with this one as long as you don't expect make movies that are blu-ray quality.

Reviews.Title: Kodak Zi8 Camcorder
Reviews.Author: B. Wischnefski "New to Amazon"
Reviews.Content: I purchased this for my mom as a Christmas gift.  When she told me the things she didn't need for gifts this year, a camcorder was one of them.  I wanted her to be surprised.  All I can say, is WOW.  She was surprised.  She loves the portability and quality of the recordings.  She never had seen anything like this before.  She's still playing around with it, but so far is totally in love with it.  She has a grand kid that is graduating from high school this spring, and I wanted her to have some modern and easy to carry around.  She still has an old VHSC camcorder from the early 1990's that is not the best at taking movies.  This way she can just hook it up to her computer and use the software that is installed on the camcorder and burn movies to CD or send them to people via e-mail.  The only 2 unfortunate things that I didn't care for, is that it didn't come with any memory.  Had to buy her an 8GB HDSC memory card.  The microphone isn't the best.  May have to get her an external microphone to hook up to it.  I also purchased an extra battery when I ordered this.  That way when her and my dad go on vacation, she can take this with and record memories of their trips.  Overall it's a great little piece of electronics and was very impressed.

Reviews.Title: Eh....
Reviews.Author: Michael Petronino
Reviews.Content: Not terribly impressed with the Zi8. Picture quality is quite grainy for my taste. I tried 720p and found it quite lacking. I only shoot on 1080p now and it's acceptable. Terrible in low light. Don't even bother trying. I also don't like the "auto-USB" connection. I'd much rather have a usb input on the unit than the male connector that pops out.But it is extremely handy. Turn on in 2 seconds, press button and you're shooting. Plug it into your computer, copy the files and you're done. I'd prefer it record in mp4, but converting from .mov is quite easy.So if you're looking for good video quality (even in good lighting): pay more money. If you're looking to shoot quick videos that don't need to be perfectly smooth, the Zi8 is a good buy for the money.

Reviews.Title: Best in class!
Reviews.Author: D. Bouley
Reviews.Content: In this class of video capture devices, the Zi8 comes out above all others.  Just read reviews, and know that any Zi8 that is purchased now will have the latest firmware (1.06), which fixes all of the bugs people complained about early on - lines, whine, audio quality, low-light performance are all fixed.  It's a great little camera.Try it in 720p/60 mode - it's fanTAStic!

Reviews.Title: A great value in comparison to others in its class
Reviews.Author: Terri M. Siegel
Reviews.Content: I wanted a pocket camcorder to fit in my purse and be ready to use at a moment's notice.  But, my initial use was to find out which of my two cats was urinating in the living room and where they were going.  I ordered the Flip HD and was bitterly disappointed in the lack of any controls and to have to sit through two hours of video and 2X speed was horrible.  After checking the gadget review websites, I decided to return the Flip and try the Kodak Zi8.  I was very pleasantly surprised at how flexible the contols are and the high quality of the video output.  At 16X fast forward it was a breeze to go through 4 hours of video and the included software makes it simple to upload videos to Facebook or YouTube.  I am very glad I made the change.  What people need to keep in mind is that this is NOT a professional camcorder to take wedding movies; it IS a great little camera for catching those spur-of-the-moment videos that we all wish we had a camera on us to catch.

Reviews.Title: Great on the go mini camcorder
Reviews.Author: Ky Mom
Reviews.Content: I love this camcorder!  I found that I had stopped making home video due to having to lug around my big camcorder. I was hesistant about which to purchase the flip or the new kodak.  For me, the Kodak was a better fit.  I haven't been disappointed.  Keep in mind this has no optical zoom so you won't be able to zoom in on your subjects.  However, the portability and picture quality offset this for me.

Reviews.Title: An objective small review
Reviews.Author: F. Burzi "Frank"
Reviews.Content: The quality of the Zi8 produced video is outstanding. But let me say something very clear here. Image stabilization, even if it's a desired feature, isn't perfect. If you plan to grab videos in a travel without using a tripod or monopod you'll be disappointed, but if you plan to use the camera in a tripod to record yourself for a podcast, create some effects or whatever else then you'll be happy with it. The new firmware 1.06 fixes some of the reported issues with the Zi8, but there is something left: when you zoom in, there is a moment where you can clearly see a brightness change and an annoying jump on the image. To resume, I think that Kodak Zi8 isn't a camera for the family videos, but it's a camera for people with their own little in-house video studio for web publishing, and for this last application the Zi8 has all the features you'll need.

Reviews.Title: Awesome camera for its price and portability.
Reviews.Author: Vinay Varma
Reviews.Content: Amazing camera for its price and portability. The build quality is good too except for the macro toggle switch.PROS: Video quality, price and portability.CONS: Battery life and macro toggle switch.Note: Please don't decide by watching videos on Youtube/Vimeo as the quality of original videos is much better. Also use the latest firmware 1.06. (mine came with FW-1.03 so had to upgrade to FW-1.06)Overall a great pocket HD video camcorder.Rating - 8/10

Reviews.Title: Had unit for a about a month.
Reviews.Author: V. Coghlan
Reviews.Content: The unit is sturdy and very easy to use. Love it. Transfering pictures or video could not be simpler. Image is crisp whether zoomed in or out. Wish a case came with it. The only thing that makes it not a 5.0 is the battery life is awful. About an hour and half when using it. Doesn't really need focus. Using camcorder to shot gymnastics of a 12 year old. These are very fast shots and hav had no problems.

Reviews.Title: On the verge of returning. Can't purchase the remote anywhere
Reviews.Author: GB
