Reviews.Content: The quality of outdoor video/photo is pretty good, indoor is (as to be expected) rather poor. My biggest critique is that the remote control functionality (something I intended to use a fair amount) is effectively useless because I am unable to purchase a remote control for the device. Kodak doesn't have them and doesn't know if they'll continue the item... many places list the item but it is out of stock and has been for at least 2 weeks. Advertising functions that are then not supported is bad marketing. One chooses a camera based on quality and functions that might set it apart from its competitors. One expects that those listed functions will then be made available!!

Reviews.Title: kodak rocks
Reviews.Author: Stanley J. Zielinski
Reviews.Content: Ez to take with anywhere. Does a great job on all basic functions a camcorder is supposed to do.Can't believe the picture quality in all modes. Needs lens adapter provision to allow use of filters extra lens.

Reviews.Title: HD in your pocket
Reviews.Author: George Hellmer
Reviews.Content: Just picked this up and shot with it over the weekend. It is a great lil camera that fits all of my needs. I can't wait to get some concert footage with it.I did a ton of research before ordering the unit. Some of the people I work with have different models of the flip camera's, but the kodak won me out.The Zi8 has all of the following reasons to buy it:- Swappable memory. Just shot for two hours (at 720p/60fps that is how much a 16gb sdhc card will hold) and still have more to go? just slide in a new sdhc card and keep shooting!- Swappable battery. Same as above.- External Microphone input. I can use a wireless mic up near the stage or even come right in off the sound board.- Flexible USB dongle. this thing actually has a little play in it. On my Macbook that is imprtant if I have something else plugged into the usb next to it. I would still recommend a usb extension though.- HDMI/AV outs - I can hook this up to any TV and use that TV for daily's or as a monitor as I shoot! that is something way too cool.- Size. As big as my cell phone or a pack of cigarettes.- Big Screen. Easy to see and read. I recommend a screen protector though this thing loves the oily fingerprints!In short if you are looking for something to have in your jacket and makes it a blast to pull out and use in a second this is what you need!G

Reviews.Title: Travel Camera
Reviews.Author: William Eubanks "poor traveler"
Reviews.Content: Great little travel video camera. You will need a steady hand, but otherwise great video. I have used in the first week of buying it for my grandson's contert and niece's wedding. Just slip into your pocket and you are ready for any sponstaneous video opportuntity. Be totally prepared with a case containing charged extra battery and SDHC card. Hook up to PC or TV; ENJOY!!! Great camera at great price.

Reviews.Title: It's HD in broad daylight...
Reviews.Author: W. Sturman
Reviews.Content: Think of the camera as fully high definition camcorder on a bright sunny or cloudy day. The darker you get from there the worse the quality is. In my house with bright lights on I found it to be worse then my standard definition camcorder when on my large computer monitor. To summarize other reviews the Zi8 has a lot of great features that it's rivals lack. One thing to note is that the 1080p literally zooms the camera in, whereas the other modes are wider. It is a drawback to people wanting wide 1080p HD, but it can also be used as sort of a fake optical zoom. When you go to import it into editing software you can make it all 720p if you want.Unfortunately my Zi8 had a "dead" gray pixel on it. What was weird is that the pixel would die and come back to life and die again whenever it felt like it. I decided to return the Zi8 instead of playing the exchange game. I think I will spend on a product that is built to last, has optical zoom, better low light, and more features.

Reviews.Title: Kodak Zi8
Reviews.Author: FrankieP77
Reviews.Content: This is a compact video camera with picture taking ability.  I love the memory expandability by use of SD/SDHC cards.  This camera requires ample lighting for best performance so it works pretty good outside on sunny days.  The problem comes when there is not enough light - the video will be very dark and the pictures are very grainy.  You also need to have a very steady hand when snapping pictures otherwise they are blurry.  Hopefully the next version features a video light, flash and maybe "night vision" that will resolve these issues.  For this price it is a convenient little gadget for carrying around and not missing "life's little moments" but by no means will this replace your high-end camcorder and camera.

Reviews.Title: Buy it!
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I bought this recently and for the money it rocks. I have a good friend who owns a new model flip and wishes he would have purchased one of these. The deciding factors for me where the expandable memory, the external mic option, the option for higher quality HD (which I have never needed or used since I like the quality of the lower ratio HD fine) and the stabilization feature.I have recommended this to several friends.For the money I don't think you can match the features and quality of this little guy... buy one.

Reviews.Title: Quality device
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I was looking to buy one of the many models of pocket camcorders out now, and I stumbled upon the Kodak Zi8. After trying out the Flip, a friend's Creative, and the checking a bunch of Zi8 video reviews, I decided to buy it.It is outstanding. The video quality is absolutely superb. There are a few issues with 1080p if you are moving the camera around a lot (blur effect), but for the most part, it produces a downright gorgeous picture compared to (at least what I've seen) every other competing product out there at the moment. The Zi8 has some image stabilization with taking videos, which definitely makes it better than Kodak's zi6.Its incredibly easy to use. While this is in no way near a professional camera, I find it very useful and easy to make videos with. Its simple, point, click, record, click, and you're done. Viewing and deleting videos on this is a snap too. A lot of complaints I hear about other products is that viewing and deleting files from your device is a pain, but with this, its easy.The biggest selling point for me on this product is its expandable memory. The Flip only offers built in memory (either 4gigs or 8gigs), and frankly, that could fill up quickly if you aren't careful. I did some black friday shopping and bought a 16 gig sdhc card for 20 bucks, and thats plenty of starting space. Since it takes SD cards, it'll be really easy in the future to buy more memory.The only major complaint i have is audio. Its not *bad*, but its not great either. The device does offer that mic jack, but i have yet to have a reason to try it. It also has a place for a tripod mount on the bottom for those interested.All in all, I love it, and am incredibly happy that I bought it. I would highly recommend it to anyone seeking one of compact camcorders these days.

Reviews.Title: Works Great
Reviews.Author: Moe Priell
Reviews.Content: I've only tested this camera for the last few days but so far, so good.I read many reviews before buying the Zi8 and I don't agree with many of the negative comments I've read.First off, when I placed my order I also ordered a Kingston 16GB class 4 SD card and spare batteries and a charger ([...]).  The batteries arrived first so I had fully charged batteries ready to go when the Zi8 arrived.  Immediately after unpackaging the Zi8 I upgraded the firmware to 1.06.  This took all of 5 minutes to do.Almost all of the test video I have taken has been at night or in low light.  I have been using the 720p/60fps setting.  My first videos were taken while I was driving at night holding the camera in my hand above the dashboard and only the headlights and street lights and signs for illumination. Video looks great and smooth.  No problems with color or brightness.Macro mode works great also.  Took a few test close-up videos and the color and details were perfect.The internal mic works well but I have an external on order.Turn it on and it is ready for instant action.  The controls are simple to use; HDMI works great with my 40" LCD TV, the USB, SDHC slot and charging options are all good and so is the tripod mount.  The camera build does not seem flimsy, quite tough actually.  I carry it around in my back pants pocket all day without worry.  It does not pick up lint like I read in another review and the actual lens is recessed so it does not get scratched or dirty.Transferring vidoe to the pc is easy but I haven't played with all of the software features yet but I did transfer video from the Zi8 that I converted to play on my Sansa Fuze and it looks great.Overall I am quite pleased with the Zi8.  I'm going to try it tonight at my son's basketball practice.  Easy to use point and shoot video.

Reviews.Title: Excellent pocket flash camcorder
Reviews.Author: 911 Czar "jlim911"
Reviews.Content: Completely satisfied with the Kodak Zi8. Took it on vacation to Hawaii and captured beautiful video of paradise and vacation events. Easy to use, compact, high quality video. Set it for 720P 60f, took clips while driving through two islands, ocean views, sunsets, in both outdoors and indoors, day and night, while riding in a golf cart, and in a boat. Easily made DVDs and downloads to PC and uploads to websites. Kodak media manager easy to use and has all the features to create and edit. Very pleased with choice and the ease/reliability of shopping through Amazon.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera for everyone who wants to carry and shoot
Reviews.Author: Gerald Jones "JJ"
Reviews.Content: 1. Love this camera; Kodak has finally got it right. Buy one you will love it.

Reviews.Title: Better than I expected. Very good picture and quality sound.
Reviews.Author: W. Connell
Reviews.Content: I am pleased with the Zi8. the picture quality was very good even in low ligh. In a college theater. The sound was really good, I did purchase the external mic as suggested in one of the previous reviews. I do have a question does anyone have issues uploading to YouTube? My first 4 tries were great now I have time out issues.

Reviews.Title: Could not be better for the price
Reviews.Author: Juke
Reviews.Content: This Pocket Video Camera is great for the price. The picture is top notch for the type of small portable handheld camera. It is extremely light, and about the same size of my cell phone. The external mic input is a strong plus on this model over others. Be sure to keep up with kodak's firmware updates as they have fixed some other the customers concerns already, such as the zoom and the internal mic noise. I am very happy with my purchase, and I went into it not expecting to have an expensive movie production camera quality out of this simple inexpensive application. You wont be disappointed unless you are unrealistic.

Reviews.Title: No Go
Reviews.Author: Sunguy
Reviews.Content: I am very disappointed with this camera.  I took it to my grand-daughter's wedding.  Used it.  Came home and downloaded it into the computer.  Everything came out in slow motion and the sound cut out after about 10 seconds. Thoroughly a waste of money.

Reviews.Title: Kodak Zi8
Reviews.Author: M. A. Mccutcheon "isellwalnutcreek"
Reviews.Content: This product is much easier to use and more convenient than my Canon videocam, although not quite the hi-def.  I find I use it much more and the usb plug in allows me to upload video quickly.  I love it and think I made a wise choice

Reviews.Title: Comparing zi8 to other camcoders in it's class
Reviews.Author: Steve J "TRUST JESUS"
Reviews.Content: I recently purchased the zi8 and would like to write a review comparing this unit with three other units I own.  The other units are the Kodak zx1.  RCA 300ezHD and the Flip Ultra 120 min 2GB(not mino or HD.Before I begin let me explain what I use the cameras for.  I am not a professional by any means.  I use the cameras for use only on occasion, the same as probably most of you reading this.  I might use it a lot for a 2 week period but then I'll go weeks or months with very minimal use.  I'm just your average person looking for a small camcorder to fit in my pocket, take pics/vids on demand, and all of this at a decent price.To start off, let me say that all of these camcorders are pretty similar to one another.  Each unit has a feature or two that the others do not have.  For example, the Flip has the ability to turn off the red recording light when you are recording.  A nice feature if you are "spying" on someone.  The RCA has a flip out lens that allows you to record yourself and see yourself in the LCD screen.  A nice feature.  The kodak zx1 has a weatherproof shell, making it ideal for some extreme sports fanatics.  And the zi8 has the external mic jack, unique only to this camcorder right now.One huge negative about the Flip is it's limited storage.  Depending on the model (I had the 120 min model) you are limited to the amount of video you can store.  Once the unit is full, you must transfer the videos to a computer before you can record.  There is no expansion slot - so no SD cards.  This is no big deal if you KNOW you are not going to go beyond 2 hrs, but in my case it was a deal breaker and was sent back.  The video on the Flip was good, no complaints.  I would say it was near the top, if not the top, in terms of audio/video quality at the comparable settings.  The audio was very good.  I like the fact that the unit runs on 2AA batteries or a flip battery pack.  A nice feature.  I don't know much about video size but I do know all the other units, except the RCA, stores the moves in .mov or mpeg4 which for some reason are LARGE files.  The RCA is in .avi and the files are pretty small. I don't really like the large files but it's workable.  I would recommend this product to someone if, again, they KNEW they were not going to need more than 2 hrs. of video before being able to transfer.The RCA 300ezHD was the first camera I got.  It is a nice little camera and retails now for less than $100.  As stated before, one nice thing about the RCA is the flip around camera lens.  It also has an expansion slot.  You can get A LOT of hours of video on even a small SD card.  For some reason the videos on the RCA are "smaller" in total size than all the other models.  It must be a quality thing.  Although the quality of the RCA does not match the other units, it is definitely decent quality.  The biggest problem with this unit is it's audio.  The audio on this unit is HORRIBLE.  Very, very bad.  I did keep this unit because of the expandable memory but the audio is really bad.  It is by far teh worst audio of all the units.  Where the other units are still easily heard, this unit is non-existent.  You just can't hear it unless the volume is high or the speaker is close up.  It does not run on 2AA but you can buy a few cheap rechargeable batteries which are nice.The Kodak zi1 is a nice camera.  The video quality is comparable to the Flip and zi8, though the zi8 is better than both.  The audio on the zx1 is not as good as the flip but not as bad as RCA.  It's acceptable though for most any type of regular video shooting.  The zi1 runs off of 2AA batteries, just like the flip.  I like that feature.  Plus you can buy a few rechargeable batteries to make sure you have enough juice.  This unit does not have a flip out usb like all the other units, but that wasn't a big deal to me.  Just like the flip and zi1, the video files are large.  I don't know why.  A minute can give you a 300mb file on the low setting.  Again, not a big deal.I purchased the zi8 after owning all the other cameras.  I would not say the zi8 is really better than the other cameras, except the RCA.  The video and audio quality is comparable to the Flip and Zi1.  It does have the ability to do true HD but that feature doesn't matter to me.  I like the external mic option, which is why I bought it, but after taking some video with it, I don't know if it is really necessary for what I plan do use the camera for.  The internal audio works very well.  It does not run on AA's but runs on batteries similar to the RCA.  A few extra batteries will ensure enough juice.  I do not like the usb flip out on this camera.  It is not rigid like the RCA and Flip.  It is flimsy and seems like over time it might break.  Time will tell.  The video files are similar to the flip and kodak zx1, they are very large.  The one big negative about this unit is that you have to buy an SD card for it and because the files are so large a 2GB SDHC card only gives you about an hour of video (on the lowest setting).  So be prepared to spend a decent amount of money on the SDHC card.  Although this is a good camera, depending on your needs, this camera doesn't seem to be much better than the zi1 or the flip, of course it does offer a few more features.All in all, I like the zi8 but again, it's not tremendously better than the flip or zi1.  I'll be keeping the zi8 but for the money I don't necessarily think it is worth it, but again, depends on your needs.If you have any questions, feel free to email me at steveessie123 at yahoo.UPDATE:I have owned the zi8 for several months now and have been very happy with it.  Although I still agree with my original post, I would probably give it 4 stars now.  The clarity of this thing is great, even in the lowest mode (which is all I ever use it for).  Also, when combined with a wireless mic system (kodak customer support says a wireless mic won't work...it will) this system is awesome.  I would definitely recommend this unit.

Reviews.Title: An okay camera for beginners
Reviews.Author: Kenneth Michael Mcneil
Reviews.Content: The Kodak zi8 is part of a new popular type of camcorders. The "pocket" camcorder caught on with the flip video series. Their cameras are practically the apple ipods of the camcorder world. These are designed for taking video whenever you need to. The Kodak is here to compete with this. The Kodak zi8 has many, many more features than its rival, the Flip MinoHD Camcorder  2nd Generation, 120 Minutes (Brushed Metal) NEWEST MODEL or Flip UltraHD Camcorder, 120 Minutes (Black). This camera has a lot of advantages over these. If you are NOT looking for an easy camera, and want a more professional video, then don't buy this or any pocket camcorder. Here are some pros and cons.PROsVery Good quality (1080p FULL HD!)Very portableDifferent shooting modes including 60FPS 720p videoAbility to also take picturesSomewhat stylishMicrophone JackCONsHORRIBLE CAMERA SHAKE4x Digital (aka unusable) ZoomPlastic body (not good build quality)Can't do anything until a few seconds after startNot very responsiveThe quality is positively amazing for its size, so that is probably the foremost feature of the camera. The other shooting modes and picture options are also great. The reason I took away 2 stars is the camera shake. It has electronic stabilization but there is hardly a difference while using it. You may not see any problems while previewing it, but on a large screen it makes the video hard to watch. For some people it can make you dizzy.The zoom is also awful, It would have been easier to not put in any at all. Digital zoom does not adjust the optics at all. Optical is actually like looking through binoculars on the camera. Digital is basically just taking the picture and enlarging it. They have made it so you can zoom while filming but at 4x the video gets really blurry.As mentioned in the first paragraph, this camera is for beginners. You will not get anything professional out of this becausea) it looks like an iPodb) There are no options in the menu for manual things.c) EVERYTHING is automatic.The reason it is for beginners is because of C. As soon as you record the camera auto adjusts. If you would like a little control of your camera, don't buy this.Over all, the camera's HD quality is impressive for size and price, but it lacks any tools of a professional, or even amateur video maker's camera.

Reviews.Title: Excellent video quality for money
Reviews.Author: Kumar Veetrag "Veetrag"
Reviews.Content: had a long debate on which camera to buy Flip Ultra HD or Zi8 and finally I decided on Zi8 and I am happy with my decision for following reasons -1. I had no idea how hard it would be to keep a pocket camera stable while shooting. Zi8's inbuilt image stability is not great but its better then Flip. I have shot videos of some play at Disneyworld and even on a roller coaster. I was satisfied with the results. here is one sample video - [...]2. I wanted a camera that can hold longer videos and flexibility to add any SDHC card into the Zi8 is an advantage. On my 10 days trip, I just had to switch my card twice. (16 GB) And I was shooting in 1080p or 720p/60 fps.3. Zi8 does not work properly in low light conditions. I took my camera out few times at night and was not able to capture anything even in street light settings.4. I though was able to capture fireworks and it came out pretty good. I hope Kodak would have given some settings in which we can do low light shooting. Fireworks video came out as follows - [...]5. I am disappointed with the battery life. I believe only after shooting 80 minutes of video battery dies and since its a propitiatory battery, one has to order another one from Kodak if he plans to swap.6. macro mode of Zi8 is a big advantage, shooting closeby stuff is really cool and I was able to capture some nice videos.7. Taking 5MP still images is a nice feature too, not great images as compared to my DSLR but still a handy camera to have.

Reviews.Title: More for the "Techies" than the casual user
Reviews.Author: Patrick "PSW"
Reviews.Content: I just returned my Zi8 to the store. The issues: Videos downloaded to my Mac G5 (2 GB Ram) and well as to a new Powerbook Pro played in a jerky fashion.  The firmware upgrade from 1.03 would not load into the camera either from the G5 or the Powerbook Pro. After more than an hour on Help Line Chat with Kodak (2 different techs) and using two different SDHC cards we decided that the camera was defective. DVDs cut from the video did not play on any of my 3 DVD players. Based on other reviews, I now understand that there are formatting issues related to making the videos compatible. This is too much trouble for the casual user and involves buying more software.The camera is very easy to use and the video is exceptional at the price. From my experience, however, one can only view the video through the television on the camera's 2.5 inch screen. (I'm not into posting on You Tube.) This severely limits the camera's use.

Reviews.Title: THE SIZE OF A CELL PHONE, BUT...
Reviews.Author: C. Merighe "Charlie Boy"
Reviews.Content: So, it's a cheap pocket camera, and that's what you get.  The digital zoom is usually worthless, unless you have plenty of light.  Zooming in indoors is terrible!!!  The still pictures are terrible, don't bother.The image stabilization is also digital, as opposed to optical, so don't expect much there either.  So the movies are shaky, and zooming in means losing quality, so zoom out and walk closer to the subject.  It's the size of a cell phone, which is why I got it.  White Balance can be weird at times.  I got a short clip inside our bathroom to see what it would look like, and the color was horrible in the movie.  Ours walls looked like they were bright yellow, which they aren't.  So I ended up using a movie editor to correct the white balance.  I'll keep it for a a while.  But I like the idea of a compact camera, and the fact that it is the size of a cell phone is very appealing to me because I actually take it in my pocket.  Sometimes, it's too intimidating to take a normal-size camcorder with you, so the Zi8 can be very helpful.  You walk into an arts store with a normal camcorder and someone might approach you quickly with a "sorry, sir, no camcorders allowed."  But you can walk right in with your Zi8 in your pocket, quickly turn it on, capture a quick clip and nobody will even notice. :)  (I don't care for taking camcorders in those places, it's just an example.)  I use mine to capture home video of my family.  The file format is .MOV, which is perfect for iMovie and Windows Live Movie Maker users.  By the way, I started using Windows Live Movie Makers until I tried iMovie, which is about a million times better.  The combination of iMovie with iDVD takes you to a better world.

Reviews.Title: Why no USB to Mini USB Charger Cable
Reviews.Author: drbobo
Reviews.Content: Nice camera overall. Bigger than my iPhone 3GS but WHY WHY WHY do these companies refuse to use standard USB charging cables!!!The Zi8 charging cable has USB on the charger end and some stupid plug that goes into the camera. Plus, no charging with the internal USB connector.DUMB setup!

Reviews.Title: A safe bet and fine camera for the money
Reviews.Author: LA Musician
Reviews.Content: The Kodak Zi8 is a fine camera; I recommend it highly.  I ended up purchasing it after trying an Insignia (which had to be returned due to a defective auto focus) and almost purchasing the Sanyo Xacti (which was tempting due to its 5x optical zoom, which the Kodak does not offer).  I ended up with Kodak because my colleagues use it and have been consistently satisfied with the quality.  The camera does not disappoint.  It is superior to the Flip in that it has a memory card reader; this makes it infinitely easier to share the camera and the files.  The picture quality is good, and there has been no microphone problem.  The Insignia had the flip-around screen, which would have been nice, but I haven't missed that feature too much.  Despite the immovable screen and lack of optical zoom, I think this is the best camera out there for the money.

Reviews.Title: Sent one back under warranty after it wouldn't power up - they sent back a refurb of someone else's problem.
Reviews.Author: Dean Peters
Reviews.Content: I purchased this video camera based on reviews I read hear on Amazon.This is not my first camera, nor even my first Kodak product.It will not be my last camera, but most certainly be my last Kodak purchase for some time to come.Here is why:After 6 weeks of very light usage, where the camera was never exposed to the elements, never dropped, never subjected to extreme temperatures nor changes in environmental conditions - the unit simply wouldn't power up.I took a volt meter to see if it was a battery issue. It wasn't. I went through their online protocol for testing the product. No joy.I got online and engaged in a chat session with Kodak support. They walked me through the exact same protocol, even though I mentioned I had tested everything.I should note, some of their test steps are quite generic, for example, their battery has a notch in it so there is only one sure way to insert the unit. Still, you're asked to make sure you insert the battery the right way. But I digress ....After a 20 minute online session, they instructed me to return the unit, they emailed me a code. They also informed me --- rather sternly --- that though the unit was under warranty, that if in any way they felt I was at fault, I'd be charged.Adding insult to injury, the cost of shipping was on me.Two weeks later, in the mail, we received a 'refurbished unit', meaning it was a repair of someone else's return.What did I learn from this experience? The following:1. wait 2 months to buy a refurb at 1/2 the price - and is also under warranty.2. figure in $15 to the price of the unit for repairs/returns3. figure in an additional $10 for the cost of accessories such as batteries as they are proprietary4. not to buy a Kodak product for at least the next several years until their product management and/or client support modifies their approach5. when I see a product has 4 star reviews out of 440 reviews - carefully read the 40 negative reviews to see if there are repeating patterns of problems ... such as units not powering up after mild usage.

Reviews.Title: Incredible...but why bother...
Reviews.Author: Danny Mack
Reviews.Content: I own it, use it, love it. Amazing video, display, macro, ease of use, playback, speed..everything about it is awesome, except two things:1) it's pretty big2) Kodak just released the Kodak PlaySport which is the same thing, but much smaller, waterproof, drop proof, and $50 cheaper [it's $149]....so there's no sense buying this.The only two differences that I know of:1) The Zi8 has a switch that allows you to go to macro for ultra close-ups [inches away]...the playsport doesn't.2) The Zi8 has the ability to plus in an enternal stereo mic or lavalier.

Reviews.Title: Absolutely Love the Zi8
Reviews.Author: Kibo
Reviews.Content: I wasn't really in the market for a pocket camcorder but one day I found a deal for the VADO HD until amazon cancelled part of my order and tried to charge me $213 for a $99 pocket video recorder that I ordered for $59.  Anyways, so I was able to grab this with a $100 discount through the Audible promotion.  It took a while to receive it but when I got it, I charged it and started using it the next day.Zi8 actually feels very light as if it was cheap plastic, but it's not.  The lightweight actually works well if you have to hold it to film something.  Quality is awesome if you have a tripod and sufficient lighting.  The EIS improves image stabilization marginally but what can you really expect from a sub-$180 pocket camcorder. (1 star deducted for EIS not doing too much)Overall, it's very easy to use and the software that came with it makes simple editing very easy.  There's option to save the edited video on your computer, upload to youtube or facebook and other options.  The battery doesn't last very long but eventually, I'll buy replacement batteries.  What I love about it is the ability to use SD card to expand video capturing capacity.  I'm currently using a class 4 16gb SDHC and there's still so much space left (using 720p60)! (1 star deducted for battery life)Other important features is that it comes with two cables (hdmi and normal rca), the software for video editing, and most importantly, an external mic input.  If I ever want to record some video gameplay, I just have to output from my xbox/ps3/tv and plug it directly into the Zi8.  Or I can attach an external mic which makes recording voices better in an outdoor environment.  Indoors, using the internal mic is actually good enough.

Reviews.Title: Set expectations
Reviews.Author: rocketscience
Reviews.Content: 1) it's less than $2002) it has a fixed lens3) the sensor is TINY (this affects low light performance)4) the whole unit is small, great for travel, but limited features (no optical IS, processing, screen)5) it's less than $200I'll start right away by noting I do not have a high pitched whine in my recordings.  Maybe a bad batch. If I did, I'd be exchanging mine immediately.  What I DID notice is a hot pixel on the screen but not in the videos.  Annoying but not a deal breaker. I tried the 1080p and 720/60fps modes. The 60fps requires a bit more workflow to upload it and have it play smoothly.  I would not upload it AS 60fps and rely on youtube or whomever to convert it to 30.  I'd convert myself, then share the file.For having it around and being able to quickly record what my kids are doing it's great.  Use the foot zoom.  The IS (image stabilization) I kind of ignore.  I hear it doesn't work too well and it likely eats up batteries and makes the unit hot.  It's so small I don't imagine IS helps with the shaking. Use a mini tripod or some temporary support.If this is your only method of recording video for your important memories, I suggest purchasing a separate HD camcorder. The zi8 is great but it's purpose to me is somewhat narrower even though it has the portability aspect.Things I don't like:1) the SD card door feels like it will fall off or at least not close tightly2) joystick easy to press when not wanting to3) curved back (I mount this on things like rc cars and helicopters and it's always tilted)4) face detection slow to detect faces, may or may not expose for it5) CMOS technology will no doubt suffer rolling shutter effect during fast movement or vibration or when subject has a frequency similar to the shutterMy other video equipment experience: panasonic dvx100a (2 of them), canon hv20, canon eos 5dmk2.I am using a kingston 32gb card - class4. Works fine.Quicktime plays the videos a bit shakily.  VLC does not.  I did not install any of the included software.  I have my own workflow for video.I left the plastic screen protector on, seems to do a good job.If lanyard hole was center top you could wear it around your neck and walk around with it.  Alas it is not, it's on the bottom.Great outdoors, don't expect to use it indoors with great quality footage. Again get a separate HD camcorder if possible - 3 chips always great.

Reviews.Title: 60 fps only really available in daylight
Reviews.Author: D. Christian Campbell Jr.
Reviews.Content: I bought this for its 720p60 with IS. Unfortunately, when you shoot in too low light the camera overrides the framerate to be 30. That is possibly an acceptable response... except that it does so without notice, let alone without a low light indication to inform you prior to shooting. You first uncover the lowered framerate later when examining file metadata.This is not documented anywhere, and in over an hour with tech support I only found it out incidentally when I happened to shoot a video in diffuse sunlight --the first time I attained 60fps-- rather than indoor evening lighting.

Reviews.Title: don't even bother
Reviews.Author: Enrique
Reviews.Content: i was looking for a video camera and I was between the Flip HD and the Kodak zi8. I decided to go for the zi8.I got it yesterday and in summary: it is a piece of junk. It is my first return trough Amazon after years of purchasing all kinds of stuff online.The camera freezes all the time, the power button doesn't work 90% of the time, so the only way to turn this camera was by removing the battery. I could not download videos into my PC. I contacted Kodak customer service, i installed the software upgrades and the camera still freezed all the time. I even bought a new Kodak SD memory card thinking this could have been the problem, and nothing got solved. Kodak customer service suggested that I got the camera exchanged. And yes, I am exchanging it for a Flip or something else!

Reviews.Title: Its a pocket camera that works well...Other reviewers unrealistic.
Reviews.Author: Bfunk
Reviews.Content: When something in your review is "The sd card slot is difficult to get open" you know your picking a little bit.  A lot of these reviewers expect 1000$ camcorder quality out of this little device and thats just not gonna happen.  Not only that, realize the market.  Its for people who want a portable solution for on the go movies and not bust out the 700$ one to take a quick vid they are posting on youtube or to catch your kids first steps when they happen unexpectedly.  Personally mine is a vacation cam that wont break the bank.Overall I'm happy with it, windows movie maker in windows 7 will probably support .mov and if not there is a lot of software that isn't garbage for pennies.  I don't get the high pitch people are complaining about but thats just me.  I am getting a sony mic from ebay for like $4 that i'm going to plug in just to get the best sound when I have it with me.720p 60fps is infinitely better than 1080p.  Bottom line your getting a lot for 150$ (I got mine elsewhere) 200$ would be way too much for what it is, but to get really good quality video and just have it when you need it is well worth it.  This may change my mind slightly on the kodak brand.

Reviews.Title: Wonderful easy cheap way to do 1080p videos !!!
Reviews.Author: Fred R. Jerina
Reviews.Content: I received my Zi8 a couple of days ago and I love it.  I had a problem at first with a memory chip that did not allow recordings of 1080p longer than a couple of seconds but after working with on-line chat with Kodak I discovered it was my old 1 gig chip (that I used in my digital camera) that was not working correctly.  I reformatted the chip and now all is fine.I am recording some great 1080p videos (which I prefer over the 720p ones) and they play great over my Samsung 1080p LCD HDTV via the included HDMI cable.I was also pleasantly surprised that I can play my 1080p video clips via an HDMI cable from my Sony Vaio laptop (that has a Blu-Ray drive) in 1080p!!!  I upload my videos via the ArcSoft MediaImpressions software program (included) to my laptop and can play them back in 1080p via the program itself.  Easier than using the camcorder for playback to the TV.  I can easily upload the 1080p videos to YouTube (but are then optimized within YouTube for their 720p mode).If you want an easy way to take video clips on travel or at parties you should consider this camcorder.[...]

Reviews.Title: Nice, but locks up after charging
Reviews.Author: Jeff Lorenzini
Reviews.Content: The camera is great, and at a great price. It's got an annoying firmware bug that makes the camera lock up. When I'm done charging it and I pull out the plug and turn it on, it turns on but it's immediately locked up. I have to pop the battery to reset it, then it works fine. Does this every time, so you would think Kodak QA would have caught it.The video quality at 1080p is a bit grainy, but the lens is a pinhole, so it's amazing it's as good as it is. I don't think this is a good camera for 1080p, so if you're thinking of buying it just for that, you'd probably end up happier with the 720p quality.The video quality at 720p is great. The zoom is funny, though, zoom in and out in chunks, not smooth. That's the first zoom I've seen do that.I wish I could make the movies less compressed, though, there's plenty of compression artifacts in the video. With a 32gb SD card, I get about 5-1/2 hours of video on it.The image stabilization is pretty useless, it seems. I have a Canon GL2 with optical image stabilization, now that's image stabilization. It's very easy to shoot useless video with this camera that will be so jerky you won't even be able to watch it. If you have a tripod, use it.Overall, I'm happy there's a zoom, even if it does zoom in and out in chunks, and I'm happy there's image stabilization, even if I can't tell it's doing anything, and I'm happy there's 1080p video, even if it's so noisy you won't want to use it, because I recognize the limitation of the form factor of this camera. However, the locking up has got to go.--- Update ---It turns out the locking up was because of the SDHC card. I had bought a 32gb A-Data card (class 6) from Amazon, and it worked for a while, but now the camera doesn't turn on all at unless I pull out the card. I bought a Transcend 16gb card (also class 6), so we'll see if that works. Right now I've got a Kingston 8gb card (class 6) in there and it's working great.

Reviews.Title: First Camcorder
Reviews.Author: Cheri "Cheri"
Reviews.Content: This little camera got top reviews on the web on [...] for example. It's my first camcorder. I wanted one to learn on and to decide if I would really use it. I was able to make a small video immediately after the camera was charged. It is easy to use and my videos were sharp enough to satisfy me. I panned the camera without any visible shake (it has image stabilization). I carry it around in my purse. It doesn't bulk up my life. I expect half the buyers will outgrow this camera and want to get a larger camera with more manual operations. But a lot of people will have everything they need in this little camcorder - zoom, HD, flash memory, and image stabilization. For the price this is a great value. Oh, and I'm hooked on making videos now.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera!  Get it before it is replaced by "touch" line!
Reviews.Author: Momar Sizlak
Reviews.Content: This is a great camera!  Try to get these before they completely discontinue for the new "touch" line.  The picture quality is great.  Any issues with sound in the past have been resolved.  Ease of use is fantastic.  The video  is much better than any of the flip cameras I have used.  Taking pics is ok.  I would consider it a little better than a cell phone.  Also, be forewarned that you have to keep extremely steady when using as a single shot camera.  The only other complaint I have is with the editing software (arcsoft) that comes loaded on the camera.  It is horrible.  I have had great results editing with Vegas and iMovie.  Here is a video that was shot completely with the Zi8:  [...]  I think it exemplifies how good this camera really is.

Reviews.Title: Won't turn on unless plugged in.
Reviews.Author: Engela Edwards
Reviews.Content: I have two great HD cameras, but I wanted a small one that I could keep in my purse for impromptu video moments.  I also killed an expensive HD camera when an underwater case leaked while snorkeling, so I'm nervous about ever taking another video camera into the water.  I liked the idea that I could get an underwater case for the Zi8, and if for some reason the case failed while snorkeling I would only be out $100 for the zi8 and not $1000.  I also have a little pocket Kodak still camera that I like.  So I ordered the Zi8 along with a 16gb class 10 memory card, the remote, and an extra battery.  Luckily I waited to order $250 underwater case, because the Zi8 wouldn't power on unless plugged in.  I'm so happy I purchased this through Amazon and not directly through Kodak!  The following chat with Kodak took about 20 minutes!  Note:  I've purchased tons of things from Amazon, but this will be my very first return.Me: I received the Kodak zi8 yesterday from Amazon, and charged the battery through the camera. The problem is that the camera will only power on when the camera is plugged in.Kodak: Hello, Engela. I understand that your video camera won't turn on when not plugged in to a wall outlet. Let me assist you with that, before we proceed I need to gather some information.  Please give me the serial number of your camera. The serial number is located at the bottom and starts with a letter "K".Me:  Serial Number is xxx...Kodak:  Let's try to charge the battery. Please tell me if you see a light indicator.Me:  While it is plugged in the screen says it is fully charged. Where would this indicator light be?Kodak:  Please disconnect it from the wall outlet and the charger, turn on the camera and tell me exactly what will happen.Me:  Nothing happens.Kodak:  Please remove the battery and wipe the contacts with a clean dry cloth then, re-insert it and turn it on again.Me:  I've done that already, but will do again.  Done. Nothing happens.Kodak:  I see.  The problem with your product appears to be something you cannot fix yourself. We recommend that you send your product to an authorized Kodak repair center for evaluation. What battery are you using?Me:  The Kodak klic-7004 that came with the camera.Kodak:  That is the correct battery.Me:  Yes.Kodak:  When did you purchase the camera?Me:  3 days ago. Arrived yesterday. It has never worked.Kodak:  It is your option to turn back the camera to the store and have it replaced, or we can set up a repair for this camera and have it fixed.Me: I will return to Amazon for a refund.

Reviews.Title: Only good for very few situations
Reviews.Author: Mr. Chris
Reviews.Content: The only use for camera is a portable means to film interviews with people in well lighted areas.  The camera is a poor fit for any other event.  Do not buy a large SD card.  The camera only films ~30 min.  The zoom moves in short punchy spurts rather than one smooth constant speed.  The camera lens requires you be right up on your subject.  "Across the table in a restaurant booth" is a distance that would fill the screen with your subject's face.

Reviews.Title: Great HD results with key features that set it appart from crowd
Reviews.Author: Robbster
Reviews.Content: The balance of features in this camera is very nice, better than the low cost HD pocket cam alternatives to date.  I'm using these cameras in research, which requires a few key features:+External mic input - essential for getting understandable voices in many environments.  I use the Olympus ME52 voice mic and a mono-stereo adapter and it works very well, slighly emphasizing the spoken word and de-emphasizing background noise.  A good cheap mic that also works well is the jWIN stereo computer mic.+Range of video resolutions including 1080p, 720p, and, importantly, a wide SD mode (WVGA).  I shoot mostly WVGA as this balances quality of the video with manageable file sizes.  Much of our research and video work is fast cycle, so the speed and ease with which we can manipulate and edit the long WVGA video files is a big plus.  Editing MOV files is also easier than some of the other encoding alternatives chosen by other camera manufacturers, for example, AVCHD with high bit rates.+Wide angle lens option - essential for many indoor shots.  Using the Kodak Zi8 0.45x Wide Angle With Macro (Modification Style) Magnetic Lens + Cronies Micro-Fiber Cleaning Cloth which fits perfectly and does the job at .45x magnification.+Records to SD cards vs. internal memory - essential for managing multiple days of research back to back.  To enhance speed of download and just to ensure smoothest possible recording, I'm using the SanDisk 16gb Extreme 30MB/s Edition SDHC High Performance Card.+Removable battery - again, needed for shooting long research hours over multiple days.  Nice that this battery is also the Fuji NP50, making for broader availability and more charger options.  I'm getting 100+ minutes of recording on a full charge and fresh battery.+VERY easy to use!  Menus, controls, ports, all easy to find, intuitive to figure out and use.  Essential when introducing new folks to the camera under the pressure of field research.What I wish for in the next version:-USB/webcam live video out - would make capturing live video directly to computer much easier.-Model with Optical image stabilization - Electronic helps, but there is really no comparison to OIS.-Model with Optical zoom, say 27 (wide) to 100 mm (35 mm equivalent).-Separate start/stop button from the zoom controller/joystick.  Too easy to accidentally start or stop a recording when you don't mean to.-Option to disable the red tally light - distracting-Model with Bluetooth audio in/AV out - take in a BlueTooth mic like the Sony ECM-AW3 for even better audio, monitor live audio via bluetooth headphones or headsets, and stream AV to a computer.-Small clip on external battery to extend run time (without making any ports or the tripod connector unusable).-Less finicky about which SD cards work for extended recording.-Headphone jack to monitor audio if the BT bandwidth is taken up with input.I'd pony up another 50% increase in the price for these improvements!Additional key accessories besides those above:+Kodak 1047398 Pocket Video Case - very compact, but fits camera, extra batteries, the external mic and the wide angle lens.+Kodak Li-Ion Rechargeable Battery/KLIC 7004  10x Kodak Li-Ion Rechargeable Battery/KLIC 7004 or Fuji NP50 and a good, compact travel charger.+TrekTech TrekPod mono/tri pod - most versatile pod there is, and carrying it with your camera mounted stabilizes shots to a remarkable degree, sort of like a poor person's steadycamBut all in all, a great product for the price, with critically important (to me) features that set it apart.  Nicely done!  Now lets see the Zi8 *Pro* added to the product line with all the above :-)

Reviews.Title: doesn't work on a Microsoft Windows machine
Reviews.Author: Patrick O'Malley "617patrick"
Reviews.Content: It will be a huge waste of your time if you have Microsoft Windows.The files it makes aren't even recognized by Windows, so you have to start downloading new software to even see the videos.  If you use QuickTime, it will make a Window too large for your screen (and mine is 22 inches), so you will have to resize it every time.Then, for mysterious Windows/Kodak reasons, the video is choppy when it plays.I did a video of a speech in a nice room, and the video was so dark it was useless.This isn't just a waste of money, its a waste of time.

Reviews.Title: Defective product
Reviews.Author: Frustrate
Reviews.Content: Brand new out of the box first time used, discovered that pictures can not be viewed on TV. First time used after camera was exchanged for a new one, discovered that it can not record HD 1080p.  Just sent to Kodak for repair. Both time defects were certified by Kodak help specialists.  Is there such a thing called Quality Control?

Reviews.Title: So far so good
Reviews.Author: A. Harris
Reviews.Content: Have had the zi8 for a few weeks. I'm an experienced still photographer. The camera works well--picture quality is excellent, zoom is fine, but the camera is not as "intuitive" for novices as I would have expected from Kodak.  The documentation is inadequate,as are online instructions, I had to wait, several times, for at least 15 minutes each time, to reach a phone rep for help. I have no idea how to edit. No info on what kind of external mic to use, or how, or how to set up the camera to shoot from a distance, or attach to a tripod and as result, had to pay to have sound enhanced. I would also appreciate instructions on how to post on line. As a communications consultant,  I will offer my services to Kodak! Anita Harris, Harris Communications Group, Cambridge,MA. [...]

Reviews.Title: Awesome with a BIG A!!!!!
Reviews.Author: Cathi Carpenter "picturemommy"
Reviews.Content: I soooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooo love this new toy in my life! It is so easy, so fun and so practical for what I use it for! (ball games, day trips, craziness in my house with an 8yr old boy! LOL!) I just love it! The picture quality is TERRIFFIC too.... I have ZERO complaints! I researched this little bugger and I did see some not so glowing remarks and at first thought "oh oh...what did I get myself into".....but no worries whatsoever! Installation is a snap, the camera is virtually idiot proof and for a computer loser like me...I am not very savvy saddly, it was a DREAM! I love this little gizmo and cannot say enough good about it! I am totally planning to add an additional mic to it and extra rechargeable batteries because with summer right on my heels I KNOW I'll be using this alot more!

Reviews.Title: Kodak Zi8 Aqua Blue, newest model
Reviews.Author: Todd Firkins "XTV guy"
Reviews.Content: The request to do a survey was timely, as I was getting ready to return the unit for several reasons. First, the files this thing produces are huge and difficult to manipulate, even with well established video editors like Sony Vegas. The file format is MOV and is a high end H.263 format. After a lot of experimenting, I found out that I could rename the file extension to MKV, and then VideoLan (VLC) would play the files perfectly. But to edit them, I had to convert to a different format. I have been using a program called SUPER which does a nice job, BUT, I'm unhappy with the 720p 60fps mode. This is supposed to be for sporting events, where the high frame rate helps to reduce motion blur. But no player or converter I have found yet can handle this frame rate. I have two young boys in a wrestling club, and the Zi8 is perfect to take matside to record the events, and freeze motion, but I have not been able to take advantage of this. Also, the unit claims to be a 5.1 Mpixel digital camera. It is marginal in outdoor lighting and terrible indoors, especially in fluorescent light. It does record 1080p, but you need a high speed SDHC card, and frankly, unless you can hold your little Zi8 perfectly still, nothing looks worse jiggly video shot at 1080p! This is a tripod only mode! I'm still deciding weather to keep this guy. I must admit the video shot at 720p 30fps is amazingly good, and holds up well even in low, fluorescent light. That alone may be worth $130 bucks.

Reviews.Title: Kodak Zi8 - Flimsy usb, impossible firmware update
Reviews.Author: Julie Reynolds "JuJu"
Reviews.Content: I was disappointed in the Zi8.  The interface was terrific but the usb was so flimsy, it was a complete pain.  I could not get the images to show on either of 2 computers and was unable to manage the firmware update.  I returned it.  Amazon was terrific.

Reviews.Title: Good but could be great
Reviews.Author: Producer "Producer"
Reviews.Content: Having an external mic input is a big plus. Support for full HD and stills is terrific but why Windows only software? That makes no sense in today's market. What could have been a rave review is merely a B+.

Reviews.Title: Worth the wait
Reviews.Author: C. W. Robertson
Reviews.Content: I've been looking into getting a small camcorder for the better part of two years now, and after reading reviews from a number of online tech organizations, settled on the Zi8. The camcorder was on back order, but has proven to be worth the wait.The Zi8 is extremely easy to use, if you bother to do a quick once over on the included pocket guide (and it's a brief guide, so there's no excuse if you don't look through it). There were a couple of icons I wasn't readily sure of, and it answered those questions easily. Operation is simple, the microphone is placed out of the way of my fingers, and the screen is very sharp.The battery life is pretty short, much less than the amount of footage the 8 GB card I put in can record. I would recommend a second battery pack. Outdoors, it can be pretty hard to see the screen. My test run was at an air show in San Diego, so it was phenomenally bright out, but I still didn't have that hard of a time tracking speeding planes, and the menu options were still easy to read.When I did some test recordings, there was a high pitched whine on playback. However, once I hooked the camcorder up to the TV, or loaded the videos to my computer, that disappeared. The internal mic actually did a very good job of recording sound, without blowing out on loud sounds or losing very soft or distant ones.Still photos are only okay. Better than on my smartphone, way weaker than on my regular digital cameras. And there's no flash. This is really just a bonus feature, as it won't replace a "real" digital camera.Transfer to my Mac was simple. The files were already in .MOV, so I could open them in Quicktime, or readily import them into iPhoto/iMovie. If you're on Windows, there's software built into the camcorder itself.

Reviews.Title: Zi8 is best in class, see some footage
Reviews.Author: Aleksas "alexas"
Reviews.Content: I highly recommend this camera for all new videographers. I started this april with zi6 and was amazed what this camera do, but noticed that want more features like, external microphone, remote and some stabilisation, so as soon zi8 became available I returned zi6 back to target and purchased zi8 directly from kodak. I really very happy with this camera, more than words can be a short movie I made last Sunday > search youtube for "chicago river zi8". The one that was made by stanovoy

Reviews.Title: A Great Little Pocket Video
Reviews.Author: K. Spice
Reviews.Content: What a great little video camera. Its nearly perfect in every way. Very easy to use, produces stunning pictures - particularly when you plug it into the HDMI input of a large screen HDTV.I can only pick 2 things that could be improved - it is a fingerprint magnet - a bit like the iPhone, and the Arc Soft Media Impression editing software supplied (in the camera)is very very basic. But when you consider what it costs, these two points fade into the background. Well done Kodak.

Reviews.Title: Decent
Reviews.Author: Brad Conner
Reviews.Content: This little camera takes decent video. Don't kid yourself, it's not a pro image by any means, but it certainly takes better video than our gopro and the audio capture is fairly good as well. I'm glad we bought it even though I use my iphone more these days...

Reviews.Title: Kodak Pocket Camera  Admirer
Reviews.Author: Ted San
Reviews.Content: This Camera Works  OK,  but sometimes has  Glitches like:  shutter button  Delays Before  taking the picture, (sometimes upto  15 seconds or so ) for some unknown reason.  This is during the daytime  in  plenty of light.  Battery is  fully charged.  So  you  may  lose  the  photo you were trying to get.I have used Kodak Pocket Cameras  for  several years and like the  easy use  and  portability of it.  But  Since  there is no longer  technical support  from  Kodak for it,  you  take a  chance  on how  long  the  Camera  will Last  You.  Don't  drop  it  or  bang it  around -  and  take  your  time  transferring  photos to  your  P.C.  for  safe keeping.  IT TAKES BEAUTIFUL  PHOTOS AND VIDEO.

Reviews.Title: I love it but I don't want to marry it
Reviews.Author: jabbar20 "jabbar20"
Reviews.Content: One thing for sure, it is a great traveling companion but I am not really sure that I want to live with it.  I mean, we are compatible, nd it fits well in my hand which was injured when I worked as a parakeet beak pruner, but I am not totally convinced we are right for each other.  I mean fifty years with the same pocket video camera?  That is a huge commitment on both of our parts!

Reviews.Title: Was a great device in its day
Reviews.Author: Cris H. Dahlgren "Cris D"
Reviews.Content: This was a cool little camera in its day.  Bad is its day didn't last long.  Difficult to process the videos.  May work for things were it doesn't matter because you can buy these cheeap now used.

Reviews.Title: Camera was okay, but didn't last very long
Reviews.Author: Blll Rehm
Reviews.Content: I got this camera a long time ago so I'm sorry for the late review. Anyway, the camera took pretty good video when lighting was good. Not that great in low-light conditions. Its greatest features included being able to carry it in a pocket and the very fast bootup time. Sadly the camera just flat out stopped charging one day - it would heat up to where it was extremely hot to the touch, then blow out the charger. I bought two new chargers for it before it was obvious it was the camera. I never really got the chance to run it through its paces.

Reviews.Title: qulality purchase
Reviews.Author: leo kerr
Reviews.Content: i am pleased with the products i have purchased on amazon. recently i purchased a camera  a kodak zi8 thanks

Reviews.Title: Great Price New
Reviews.Author: Brian A. Markelonis
Reviews.Content: I got this for a very good price as slightly marred or dinged. It came good as new with no noticable defects.Works great with the ability to change out the battery and SD card filming possibilities are almost unlimited.Also with the external mic jack it allows you to recored high quaility audio for sound at a distance as well.+1

Reviews.Title: Great product
Reviews.Author: Julieanne van Zyl
Reviews.Content: Thanks so much for the extra work you went to, with making sure I had everything required.  Sorry I took so long to give you a review.

Reviews.Title: A Lot In a Little Package
Reviews.Author: Milton
Reviews.Content: A good choice for the casual videographer who wants a good image but accepts the limitations of a point-and-shoot video camera. . Also a good choice for YouTube and Facebook clips.

Reviews.Title: Kodak camera
Reviews.Author: Linda
Reviews.Content: I've had this camera for about 5 years now and I really like it.  I use it every now and then.  Takes good videos of homes and as I am a Realtor that is important.  Doesn't jiggle a lot either.

Reviews.Title: Great little video recorder
Reviews.Author: wendycgibson
Reviews.Content: Love this video recorder but now I am wondering how do I get the video off the camera so I can burn it to a dvd? Any tips would be appreciated!

Reviews.Title: It's okay
Reviews.Author: Paige Turner "Yes, it was I who puked up the ...
Reviews.Content: It's an older camera that they don't manufacture anymore and the software for the Kodak is also old with very slow processing time. However the video quality is good and it captures sound well.

Reviews.Title: Great!
Reviews.Author: Rick Shultz "rs99cool"
Reviews.Content: My wife discovered this and now won't give it back.  Great videos, great still pictures.  A marvelous device for the point 'n shoot crowd!

Reviews.Title: Perfect for the low-budget user
Reviews.Author: Lynnette Bates
Reviews.Content: This little camera has served me amazingly well in the past 2.5 years. The video quality is phenomenal, although it does degrade a bit in lower lighting. I took this with me to document a 3 week trip to Japan, and I've ended up with a massive collection of beautiful memories. I've also used this to film music videos and school projects. For the price I paid, I really can't complain.I did buy a couple extra batteries and a battery charger, seeing as I didn't know how long the batteries would last, and I would be traveling a lot daily without access to a charger. The batteries last about an hour or so depending on video settings.The only downfall of this camera is lack of image stabilization. I know it supposedly has some sort of stabilizing system, but it just doesn't work. I once used a tripod with a hitch in the turning mechanism, and all of my videos turned out jumpy with ugly split frames everywhere. Movement and this camera aren't best friends, but they're well mannered acquaintances.

Reviews.Title: Kodak Zi8 Pocket Video Camerea
Reviews.Author: Betty White
Reviews.Content: This is a handy camera for a quick video anywhere anytime.  I use it almost daily. I like the zoom.  holding the camera against a mounted item like a post, when in movie mode is recommended.  Photos work geat also.

Reviews.Title: exactly what i need
Reviews.Author: RolandB. "RolandB"
Reviews.Content: i use this for blocking choreography for fight scenes and recording my practice with my bullwhip for critiquing my own technique. Which is where the really high frame rate helps!

Reviews.Title: Good for what I need.
Reviews.Author: Larry Burton
Reviews.Content: I needed a video recorder to record football player interviews, but it had to have an external mike jack and this one did. Video is good and clear and HD like advertised, but pictures are not so hot. Also the mike comes out of the jack very easily. But overall, it's a good choice for what I needed it to do.

Reviews.Title: Great camcorder.
Reviews.Author: Terry L. Howard
Reviews.Content: I got this camera a couple of years ago and take it everywhere.  It is easy to use, small and very portable, and the built in software makes editing and uploading very easy.

Reviews.Title: JUST LOVE IT
Reviews.Author: Robert J Grandon
Reviews.Content: Works great and had no problems with this camera. Use it all the time. Over and over again. If you need one just get it.

Reviews.Title: Good qulity for a small camera
Reviews.Author: D339
Reviews.Content: I got this camera to shoot behind the scenes footage and it is good enough to use as a second camera. I looked at the Zi10 but it really is not worth it for a touch screen. The Zi8 is the best choice for durability and price.

Reviews.Title: Love this Camera
Reviews.Author: Carmin Wharton
Reviews.Content: I use this video camera to film videos for my business.  It sits easily on a tripod and comes with a remote control so you can videotape yourself.  Wonderful, clear crisp video.

Reviews.Title: I bought this as a replacement for one I had broken...
Reviews.Author: Pebbles
Reviews.Content: Yes, there are plenty of other shoot and point video cameras out there, but after reading reviews, I wanted to stick with that which I knew word work and serve my purpose. I bought a used one that came with a 30-day guarantee, and am very happy wioth my purchase, it works as well as my other camera worked before I broke after having it for three or four years.

Reviews.Title: Amazing!
Reviews.Author: Happy Customer
Reviews.Content: Forget the 1080p: this camera has 720p/60 frames per second. That makes for incredible, fluid video. I've had this camera for YEARS, and it's never given me a single problem. This will last you for a decade at the least.Only problem is that the battery might not be able to last if you don't charge it for a couple of days, which is why I have an extra battery.Like I said, AMAZING!

Reviews.Title: Ok for a backup camera or home user.
Reviews.Author: Nelson Estrada "The Pictorialist"
Reviews.Content: This is awesome as a backup camera. I am a photojournalist and sometimes need a different camera angle for quick cut. I can also attach an external mic with the input. I must admit it isn't the best video quality but if your a home user or a pro in need of a backup camera or an extra camera for a quick cut this works. Don't use this as a photo camera , rhe images are bad quality.

Reviews.Title: great for the price
Reviews.Author: FekketCantenel
Reviews.Content: This takes good-quality video. The battery life is good. I would recommend buying a small tripod to go with it, so you get steady video.

Reviews.Title: didn't last even 3 yrs
Reviews.Author: Lokkens "schlokken"
Reviews.Content: I bought this in Nov 2010 & didn't take a ton of videos, but I was pleased with those that I did take.  However, even with limited use, the videos are very blurry now no matter what setting I choose. So I assume this is a lens/focus problem.  The camera is apparently no longer made & is no longer under warranty, so the cost to repair this is going to be similar to what I paid initially for the camera.  I will most likely just switch to using a cellphone or a digital camera for my videos from now on.  I am disappointed with the less-than-3-years that this camera has worked, especially with pretty limited use over the 2.5 years.

Reviews.Title: Love It!
Reviews.Author: Rufdog "Total Jam Old Skool"
Reviews.Content: Back in 1999 Old Skool went on a cruise, I had a video camera that was big and had this little tape, talk about old skool. Now I have this Kodak Zi8 pocket video camera. I take with me wherever I go. It's lite weigh and fits in my pocket. It takes pictures and video. You will have a lot of fun with it. I highly recommend the Kodak Pocket Video Camera!

Reviews.Title: Wouldn't be without it
Reviews.Author: Betty
Reviews.Content: I carry this camera to all of my kid's sporting events.  It goes with me in my purse so it is readyanytime I need it.  It is generally used for video although it takes still pictures also.  Most of thetimes the video quality is excellent.  Occasionally, it jumps or the light is a little off but that couldalso be me because I do little adjusting; just point and video.  Love it!  Great for grandchildren also.

Reviews.Title: Awesome product!
Reviews.Author: Dotbo_1978 "Dotbo_1978"
Reviews.Content: Takes 1080p, which is great.But wait - 720p60 is even better - more fluid.The picture quality is not professional.But for a handheld, it's great.I got a great deal, here on Amazon.  Couldn't be happier.

Reviews.Title: Ditch the Handphone for a Pocket Camera
Reviews.Author: Dracoflyer
Reviews.Content: I bought this for my son who is a YouTube fanatic. He was using my Nikon Coolpix and I wanted him to have his own camera. The Kodak Zi8 is very easy to use and can take abuse too. We hiked the rainforest with a guide to a waterfall and took all kinds of cool jungle shots (stripping bark, insects, leeches, etc) and then did interviews with everyone. It turned out to be a great family project!I also used the Zi8 for my son's soccer games and kept my big SLR camera at home. Just pop the Kodak in and out of your pocket and stop lugging around all that equipment. Overall I'd recommend the Zi8 for anyone wanting to take and make movies without all the hassle of hauling gear everywhere.

Reviews.Title: Photographs for insurance
Reviews.Author: K. Roberts
Reviews.Content: I actually use this to document possessions for insurance purposes. I record and transfer a record of charity donations: furniture, clothing, household items...

Reviews.Title: broke with no solutions available but to repair for more than it cost new
Reviews.Author: valerinatheballerina
Reviews.Content: I've owned for a couple of years. I haven't used in at least 18 months. Wouldn't turn on when I pulled it out recently so I purchased a new battery in hopes mine just went bad. Screen flashes on for a half second then goes black. Meanwhile the thing heats so hot in a minute that I can barely touch it. Have searched for more than 5+ hours online; contacted repair professionals, kodak and consumers all with zero explanation or offer of help except Kodak said to send it to their recommended (3rd party) repair center which wanted more money than it was worth new. Discontinued product so Kodak won't help.I guess I'm frustrated because it was stored in a padded camera bag with my professional photography equipment (well cared for). There is no reason it shouldn't work and no reason that I've found the same complaint online in tons of places and no one else has gotten any answers.Don't waste your money. Especially when its used. Apparently they have a very short shelf-life.

Reviews.Title: Perfect for casual video-taking.
Reviews.Author: Kacie Senna
Reviews.Content: I use it mostly for home videos, or to make silly videos/music video covers with my friends. I love the size, I can throw it in my purse and take it pretty much anywhere.

Reviews.Title: Awesome camera.
Reviews.Author: Chris Benjamin
Reviews.Content: I was developing a course for online and originally bought a different handheld camera.  I quickly learned the other one wouldn't suffice for several reasons - first it wasn't HD, second it had no mic input.  After looking around it seemed my options were limited.  This Kodak though was one that kept coming up.  For the price, its awesome.  Even for more it'd be awesome.  Excellent quality, lightweight, holds a charge forever, has the external mic input.  Can't go wrong.

Reviews.Title: very nice little camera,
Reviews.Author: Ray
Reviews.Content: I got a great price, I don't think it was used much. I updated the firmware and software and was making videos in no time. It is small and easy to use, the only thing was the recording light, a bright red glowing light interfering with unwanted reflections, a bandaid covered it.

Reviews.Title: Love
Reviews.Author: pholland22
Reviews.Content: This is a great product.  Very mobile, easy to use, and really a lot of fun.  Capture lots of memories.

Reviews.Title: Kodak Zi8 (only one flaw)
Reviews.Author: Jupiter
Reviews.Content: Best HD pocket cam, friendly menu, easy to use. Takes a steady hand though (or a stand).The only problem I've had with it is the external mic input jack stops working after too many manipulations, very fragile. But since I need this feature and it is the only HD pocket cam offering it, I keep replacing my Zi8 with another one when the jack goes bad, since fixing it would not be cost efficient enough to make sense...  I'm at my third Zi8.

Reviews.Title: Best pocket cam you can get, destroys Flip and iPhone
Reviews.Author: Cameron
Reviews.Content: // To view this video download Flash Player (version 9.0.115 or higher)'); } } catch(err) { fp_resizePlayerSpace('cv_mo1HU9Z9TMLMKAX', 0, 0); } return false; } function _cv_mo1HU9Z9TMLMKAXloadSwf(movieID, playerVersion) { var swfLocation = "http://g-ecx.images-amazon.com/images/G/01/am3/20120510035744301/AMPlayer._V148501545_.swf";
