} cv_mo1HU9Z9TMLMKAXpreplay.onmouseout = function() { cv_mo1HU9Z9TMLMKAXpreplay.src = "http://ecx.images-amazon.com/images/I/81rE9%2BLO8sS._SX320_PHcustomer-video-vignette_PIvideo-reviews-bottom,BottomLeft,0,43_OU01_PIcustomer-video-play,BottomLeft,130,-12_CR0,0,0,0_.png"; } var node = cv_mo1HU9Z9TMLMKAXpreplay.parentNode; var cv_mo1HU9Z9TMLMKAXcurrentClick = node.onclick; node.onclick = function () { var head = document.getElementsByTagName("head"); if (head[0]) { var logTag = document.createElement('script'); logTag.type = "text/javascript"; logTag.src = "/gp/customer-media/du/log.html?ie=UTF8&p=CustomerImage&s=CustomerVideoPlay"; head[0].appendChild(logTag); } if (cv_mo1HU9Z9TMLMKAXcurrentClick) { return cv_mo1HU9Z9TMLMKAXcurrentClick(); } } } Length:: 3:55 MinsThis camera is great for LOUD concert footage (see video above). I bought this camera specifically with the intent of having something that I could fit in my pocket that would give much better results compared to a phone. Yes the video can be shaky at times, but train yourself to shoot steady and you'll be rewarded for it.The low light is quite decent considering how tiny of a sensor this camera has, yes you get blocky artifacts when it gets too dark, but this cam was made for youtube and youtube compression makes everything blocky regardless. The internal mic is amazingly good for being mono, all my videos are of very loud metal concerts, and theres very little clipping in any of my footage, hardly noticeable to the average viewer. With a little audio knowledge (stereo imaging, compression, and reverb) you can actually get very useable audio from the internal mic, not to mention the ability to use an external. When shooting a concert environment, I have to use the 720p/60i setting because when you use the 30p settings strobe lights cause tearing between frames, the 60i frame rate avoids this (that is an issue with any cmos based camera really). Lens flare is very prominent, so pre-composing shots is recommended.The feature set of this camera far outdoes anything in its category. a high SPL microphone, an external microphone input, HDMI output, replaceable batteries, macro mode, and SD cards (that is a HUGE plus) so running out of memory is a non-issue.There are definitely downfalls of this camera, but bear in mind the features and functionality of this camera (not to mention fitting in your pocket) are miles ahead of any competitor. it won't have the dynamic range, low light capability, resolution, 4:4:4 chroma space of a RED camera (obviously) but it beats the rusty circuits out of your phone for just a little over $100.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: Nittany
Reviews.Content: Great Camera.  Picture quality better than expected. Would recommend this Camera. Convenient and functional. Easy to operate.  I highly recommend this product.

Reviews.Title: I love it
Reviews.Author: Becky
Reviews.Content: I love this camera . It is very clear and also easy to use unlike most cameras I have used.

Reviews.Title: Too much zoom
Reviews.Author: Jordan Smith
Reviews.Content: A great little camera and the only pocket model at the time with an external microphone jack. I used it for recording interviews and talking to the camera, but for casual video "taping" it's a disaster because of the zoom. Too much of it even when completely zoomed out. You won't even want to try capturing a landscape... I've stopped using it which is a shame.

Reviews.Title: Good Quality
Reviews.Author: AdNap
Reviews.Content: This is a great one-use machine. Most phones can match the camera quality, but I really love the video camera quality. It is very high and has a pretty good frame rate. I would recommend buying this for anytime you need to record something! And it is very durable, surviving drops with only maybe the battery compartment sliding off. Good Buy!

Reviews.Title: cool
Reviews.Author: Kevin
Reviews.Content: I hope everyone purchases one of these babies. These dudes are awesome, fit perfect and look so cool. good job!

Reviews.Title: Find another video camera
Reviews.Author: Corrie
Reviews.Content: Seemed like a great buy.  Advertising said it would do all the things I wanted it to do. It did do those things while it worked.  However, it broke shortly after I bought it so I sent it back for repair.  Kodak replaced it with a refurbished model.  They essentially sent me someone else's problem.  This one turns it self off about every 10 seconds. The second one had a very short warranty, so by the time I discovered this one didn't work either, I was out of luck.  Don't bother with this camera.

Reviews.Title: Kodak Zi8 Pocket Video Camera - Black
Reviews.Author: mopar109 "GT"
Reviews.Content: This little camera is easy to use and works great.  I bought it when it first came out for just over $100.  It takes great video and the pictures are very good if you have sufficient light.  It's so portable it fits in my shirt pocket.  It's a nice alternative to a conventional digital camera.

Reviews.Title: Decent but there are better options . . .
Reviews.Author: Josh
Reviews.Content: I played around with the Zi8 for a while to see if it would work for ENG (electronic news gathering). I wasn't blown away. The video quality was nothing special and the controls felt clunky. If you're thinking about tracking down one of these guys forget about it and buy the newer, cheaper, and better Zi10 (playtouch). However, major points for having an external mic input (I don't know why only Kodak seems to be doing that!)

Reviews.Title: Broken already!
Reviews.Author: M. Carter
Reviews.Content: It has already stopped working and I haven't video taped but a few times with it.  I'm very careful and gentle with my electronic purchases but this item just died without anything I did to cause it to fail.

Reviews.Title: very good camera for the money
Reviews.Author: K. Showkeir
Reviews.Content: You don't really need the stereo capability the onboard mike works pretty well. But never did try a stereo one, may be even better?

Reviews.Title: Convenient
Reviews.Author: Chris G Hallgren
Reviews.Content: Knowing that you get what you pay for, this has been a life-saver.  The video quality is good, not great, but the convenience of having this in your pocket balances that out.Quick and user friendly, this is a must for any parent.

Reviews.Title: Does the job!
Reviews.Author: SeeRayMoo
Reviews.Content: I no longer use this since I upgraded to a DSLR, but for the price and the compactness, it sure has a solid resolution. If you take a lot of miscellaneous videos on your down time or anything of that sort, then the Kodak Zi8 is definitely worth getting. Don't go for the Flips, trust me!

Reviews.Title: It's great.
Reviews.Author: R. Ignacio
Reviews.Content: we have been using this camera for a while now, both for personal and business uses.I appreciate that it does 1080p and has an external audio jack so you can hook up your own mic.my only gripe is that it's usb connector is a bit of a pain to use.

Reviews.Title: Kodak Zi8
Reviews.Author: abe miller
Reviews.Content: I have found it very handy, but even when taking VGA quality videos it uses up a lot of storage space.The photo option works okay in outdoors, but not so well in doors.

Reviews.Title: Great for a fun camera
Reviews.Author: Ariana
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera on a whim and didnt want to spent a bundle on a hand-held camera so this one stuck out to me. I was very nervous it wasnt going to perform well but it has surprised me quite a bit. I have had it now for over 3 years and its still works fantastically. I will admit the sound quality isnt top notch but for such an inexpensive and small camera it is pretty good and I am very picky about audio quality let me tell you. The on/off button is a bit odd to me simply because it is rubbery and slightly difficult to press down but it isnt enough of an issue for me to dislike the camera at all. The WOW FACTOR is the storage which is awesome since you put in the card you want. I have over 2 hours worth of video saved on the camera right now and it still has room. Another WOW FACTOR is the battery life to me which when I first got the camera worried me because it was so inexpensive but I havent been disappointed. My mom was able to film my entire graduation ceremony without stopping which came to over an hour of filming without the battery giving out or the camera getting hot. Its also got a pretty stable lense- I went horseback riding and filmed a little while doing so and the video came out steady. Over all a great camera if you are looking for something inexpensive and for fun. :)Edit January 2014: Still loving this camera. Just wanted to say that when I bought it the cost was only around $60. The current price listed is almost $500. That seems like a giant mistake to me. This is a great camera- yes- but it isn't a $500 camera. Maybe $150 is the max I would spent on it. The one thing I would add is that I can't seem to find a tripod or stand for this camera. I realize its handheld but even most handhelds have a stand option or ability. This camera even has a notch at the base that seems like it would be the place for a tripod. I guess I'll keep searching.

Reviews.Title: High quality video, great price
Reviews.Author: @benasmith
Reviews.Content: Love this camera. Chose it over a Flip Cam and very happy I did. Travels with me everywhere and has been great for recording presentations, shooting interviews, and capturing other great content. I've been truly impressed with the quality of image captured, even in some challenging lighting conditions. My only issue, slightly disappointed with the internal mic for capturing the quality audio I need. However, the camera allows an external mic to be used, and I now take advantage of that feature with much better results. Ive had options to upgrade, but a after a year of using the camera (with external mic) it's still my #1 choice. @benasmith

Reviews.Title: Kodak Zi8 Pocket Video Camera from Amazon
Reviews.Author: Paulette A. Brooks "Shorty"
Reviews.Content: I purchased the Kodak Zi8 about two years ago and have enjoyed it so much.  Makes beautiful pictures and excellent videos.  I mostly like that I can plug it into my tv and watch the videos.  I checked out many places before purchasing and Amazon had the best price.  I have noticed this about a lot of their products.

Reviews.Title: Gone But Not Forgotten
Reviews.Author: Bob Carper
Reviews.Content: I had a Kodak Zi8 and I have used it to shoot some videos.  The quality of the images was excellent.  Regrettably this camera was either lost or stolen.  I have tried to replace it with a Sony Bloggie Duo whish was an utter flop.  I next bought a Kodak PlaySport ZX5 which is looking very good in my efforts to set it up and use it

Reviews.Title: Great Until It Died
Reviews.Author: Level Mike
Reviews.Content: Loved this camera. Ordered a refurb unit and quality was excellent. I also ordered an external mic to plug in which made sound as good as the pic. Really beautiful image quality for the size. Then just after a year (and having used it a total of perhaps a dozen times), the unit just froze up. Was ready to hit record and none of the buttons worked. I couldn't even power it down. The unit was super hot. All I could do was let the battery die. After that, fully charged, it wouldn't come back on. Toast. Maybe that's my punishment for buying refurb. I dunno. But I expect things to last longer than 12 months, especially when they're not $20. Now the price is insane for new and I'm wary of buying used in case it dies again. 5 stars for when it worked. 1 for reliability.

Reviews.Title: Kodak Zi8 Rocks
Reviews.Author: Klee
Reviews.Content: Easy to use. Light weight. Super clear video and really clear audio although I did buy exterior microphone that works great w/ it. If you are recording your own video get the remote. Superior product for the money. Love the color too.

Reviews.Title: Insane how much the price has jumped!
Reviews.Author: D. R. Silva
Reviews.Content: I got this in 2010 for $100. How has the price gone up almost $400 since than? Don't prices usually go down on older items?This is a good camera if you want to take decent quality "HD" video. It's pretty grainy in low light situations, but looks "OKAY" when you are in a brightened room (obviously). I don't think it's TRUE HD.The sound from the on-board mic isn't that great, I bought a $20 lapel mic by Audio Technica to get better, less hollow sound--that is one bonus to this mic, it has a mic input!There are a few separate add-ons to buy to really use this thing to it's full potential. If you can afford a professional quality microphone with a stereo input, than you are in business!The fact that there are so many extras to buy to really make this thing beneficial, I think makes it not worth $450 (that is crazy!). It is a good little camera, and it does what it's supposed to very well, plus the 720p @ 60fps looks REALLY good. But again, $450, plus however much for a memory card, and you will most likely want a microphone which means more money, I don't think it's worth all of that. For a little extra money you can get a true HD camcorder that will have way better picture quality.Pricing aside, I would give it 4 stars. It's easy to use, and takes decent quality video and pictures. The price is just not worth it! I check back here every couple of months and the price seems to keep going higher and higher.

Reviews.Title: Very good for on the go HD
Reviews.Author: Jawknee
Reviews.Content: Theres not a lot of bad things i can say about this camera. But there are things.The external mic port is fantastic, especially since the internal mic is borderline useless for recording concerts(main reason i got it).Video quality is okay, i wouldn't say as good as i thought it would be when it said 1080p, seems a little grainy to me. 720 60fps seems a little better, but still not quite as good as i expected it do be. I also had a little problem with video fading to dark and coming backFile sizes are INSANELY large. It took so long to load a 6 minute 720p video onto my computer that i just ended up canceling it and kept it on the camera. If i do want to watch it, ill just plug it into my TV.All in all, its worth every penny. Would i buy another one if it got destroyed? Maybe not, id probably spend another 100 on a higher quality camera.

Reviews.Title: Excellent Camera Except
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer "MaxiMediator"
Reviews.Content: This tiny camera takes amazing images. I bought it so I could use an external mike (amazing in one so cheap and small) but the sound is so good I don't use one much.My "except" is that although it can even be attached to a monitor so you can view the video's on it, the external monitor doesn't work during filming, so if you're shooting yourself, which I do a lot when I'm teaching, you can't see if you're in the frame.Also the included software is awful! I just use it to see what's on the camera, and then click and drag into a folder. It is nice that you can download an hour-and-a-half video in a minute or so.

Reviews.Title: AMAZING
Reviews.Author: Jschar87
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera mainly to use at concerts and live shows to record songs. I could not be happier with the performance. Small and lightweight it is easy to carry in my pockets. The microphone is able to record high quality sound even in a high noise atmosphere such as a rock concert.

Reviews.Title: I own three of these
Reviews.Author: J Lee
Reviews.Content: I own three of these and they work great. If you need a cheap way to shoot video and to cover multiply angles this is the product to own!

Reviews.Title: Best Video Camera
Reviews.Author: Yep2Happy
Reviews.Content: I love my Kodak camera. I have never loved a gadget so much. I can slip this in my pocket, the video is crisp and clear, and I can't say enough good things about this camera as far as video. The photo quality isn't perfect but for a quick shot it's fine. Photos can be blurry if you try to take a quick shot of something. But the video is wonderful!

Reviews.Title: Fantastic Pocket Video Camera - But What the heck happened to the price!?
Reviews.Author: J. L. Wood "Media Engineer"
Reviews.Content: I have had my Zi8 for about a year now. It has been coast to coast about four times, taken videos in clubs, at outdoor music festivals, through the windows of the California Zephyr, out airplanes, while attached to the tripod in my car and even on boats. I have used it to shot videos for clients, sporting events and darn near everything. I love it, but I will be putting it away until I can get another due to the 300% price increase now that it is discontinued. Just say no!This devices SHINES at 720/60FPS. That is where I shoot most videos because of the smoothness that 60FPS gives when panning or shooting action. 1080 30FPS and 720FPS is just not smooth on any HD device if you do not pan or follow action smoothly. If the action is fast, forget the smooth anyway. At 720/60FPS, it takes a bit more of your card than 1080/30FPS. No big deal since battery life tends to mirror what an 8GB SDHC card can record. There is still "judder" which is probably more a technology issue than a Zi8 issue, but not as much.Speaking of SDHC cards, I use the Class 10 Transcends with exceptional results. I also have a Kodak ZXD as my "glove box" HD and although it does well, I just like the feel of the Zi8 better. The little control knob is easier to manage as are the men functions.One note, if I was to be picky, manually operating the zoom can create two issues.1. The zoom is very hard to operate in a linear, or smooth fashion on the device. I just resist zooming while recording.- The cure is the cheap little remote. The remote zooms much smoother. If I have both hands free, I will control it with the Kodak zoom.2. In marginal lighting situations, if you zoom, you will cause the camera to shift it's response to light conditions. That almost never changes for the good. In low-light conditions, I do not zoom unless it is absolutely necessary.Also, I have used it as a camera, but if it is weak across the board, it is as a camera. No settings to help you there. I didn't buy it as a still camera so no big deal. Main issue with the camera is sharpness.This is still a 5 Star device and that is after one year and literally hundreds of hours of video in all conditions all over the USA. I have a "real" HD camcorder coming, the Panasonic HDC-TMC900 and will do a comparison. That Panasonic better kick the hell out of the Kodak so I can put it in my safe 'cause it is golden around these here parts.For YT examples, look up "JohnTheWudman" & Kodak Zi8Early Video with 30FPS versus 60FPS: [...]

Reviews.Title: kodak camera
Reviews.Author: vanessaaa "whoseyourdaddy"
Reviews.Content: love my camera i looked everywhere for the best price & definitely amazon had the best price around & i received it within the same week of ordering it.

Reviews.Title: Died just after warranty expired
Reviews.Author: JeffM
Reviews.Content: Purchased the camera 14 months ago and it died.  It won't power up anymore and is no longer covered by warranty.  After some research, it appears that many people have been having power issues as well.  I paid $115 for it 14 months ago, now it appears to be $360!!  It was nice while it worked, but I couldn't justify buying another one at today's prices.

Reviews.Title: Kodak Zi8
Reviews.Author: Flying4905
Reviews.Content: Just have a few comments on the Kodak Zi8 HD pocket camcorder, and I think it's a real bargain for the results you can get from this camera. But remember that it is a pocket video camera, not a professional video camera.  That being said, the camera is well made, very simple to operate, and slides neatly into your shirt or pants pocket.First of all, I haven't experienced any problems with the built-in microphone, no noises, hiss or anything else. A unique feature of this camera that you can't find in almost any other camera of this type is the external microphone jack.  This is the reason I purchased this camera.  I use it to film flights in light aircraft, and the external mic jack allows me to connect a cable to the intercom/radio system, so you can hear the pilot and passengers as well as air traffic on the radio (and eliminate the noise of the engine and wind blast). It works wonderfully for this purpose although you have to be careful to set the gain properly on the source end of your signal.The camera starts up and shuts down quickly.  The simple menus are icon driven and very easy to operate.  Buttons could have been a little larger instead of the thin, silver ones on this camera.The picture quality is stunning at 1080p, although as mentioned in other reviews you must take care to use high-speed, high capacity SDHC cards, not only for the speed but 1080p will devour card memory like nobody's business.  I set the camera on 720p to conserve card capacity, and the video results are still breathtaking. I started out years ago with an 8mm video camcorder and the difference in the quality between that and HD is incredible.  Low light obviously will increase grain considerably, given the tiny lens of the camera, but video taken at night with this camera is still much better than the old camcorders I used to use.  Of course in very dark situations you won't see anything on the recording but black (where is Sony Night Shot when you need it).Battery life was acceptable for most purposes. I found that turning off the camera between uses, and not taking super long video shots makes a big difference in battery life.The camera also takes still images, and like the video, even at 720p the photos were fantastically detailed and sharp, with super realistic color and contrast.A few cons:  Of course, as a pocket camera, the zoom capability is extremely limited.I would prefer that the camera not have an internal/proprietary battery. I realize that is done to make the camera smaller, but it would be nice if it just ran on AA's.One other annoying trait (although this won't bother 99% of the users out there), when filming through the windscreen of a light aircraft, the camera blurs the propeller into an odd, stacked-sickle shape. My old Mini-DV Samsung camcorder would record a very normal looking propeller blur, by comparison.  One other thing, when the camera was mounted in the airplane and the IS (image stabilization) was turned on, the image would do this swimming kind of distortion all through the frame. The vibration of the airplane didn't mesh well with the IS in the camera. Switched the IS off and the image returned to normal.Overall I appreciate the very high quality of the video and photos this camera can produce, its light weight and pocket size, and I find the auxiliary microphone jack to be indispensable.  I would buy another Kodak Zi8 immediately if this one were lost or stolen.

Reviews.Title: Cutt off when youre running low on battery!
Reviews.Author: Mike
Reviews.Content: I would give it five stars but the battery light was flashing on and i was trying to record what i could till it ended, then the battery went out. and it WOULDNT COME BACK ON. SO MAKE SURE TO RECORD WITH IT BEING CHARGED UP OR CHARGE BEFORE IT RUNS OUT OF BATTERY, OTHERWISE IT WILL GO OUT ON YOU COMPLETELY!

Reviews.Title: Great Camera for the price!
Reviews.Author: Ben
Reviews.Content: I actually bought mine on eBay for about $100 cheaper refurbished. Then I bought the remote and wide angle lens for this camera and it makes this camera worth getting. The only problem is that you have to be quite far away to get many things in the shot, but that is why i got the wide angle lens. But buy it on a cheaper site. I would recommend a refurbished one on eBay or something. There is a setting for filming video that is 720p/60fps which I use most of the time and works great! The only downfall this camera has, is that you really need "ok" lighting for your videos to look good (but what camera doesn't) all in all, I give this a 4 out of 5.Pros: Great picture quality, good variety of filming settings, worth more than what I paid for, many accessories you can buy for itCons: Short battery life, need to be far away to get full picture, kind of bulkyHope this review helped :)

Reviews.Title: Best Pocket Camera Yet!
Reviews.Author: mike
Reviews.Content: I have owned 4 different pocket camcorders in the last 4 years, all high mid range and have found the Kodak Zi8 to be far ahead in performance and features. I have 2 one is a backup for replacing the one I now use.  The best Pocket Cam I have used Yet!

Reviews.Title: Great Camera - SOOO Convenient!
Reviews.Author: KDD515
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera about a year ago and haven't stopped using it since.  We have 4 boys that never stop and this camera is fantastic!!!!  I bought a memory card that holds about 2 hours worth of video.  It needs to be charged frequently, but has a wall charger so it's not a big deal.  The picture and sound quality is really quite good.  There is one main button and it's so simple all of our kids can run it - even the 4 year old!!!  The best thing is that it plugs right into the laptop through a USB port and instantly downloads.It's about as big as a black berry and fits in a back pocket.  WISH I would've had it years ago.  I take it every where!!!  It goes in my purse every time we leave the house now.  Worth every penny!!

Reviews.Title: Great Camera for action.
Reviews.Author: Bob Lane
Reviews.Content: A great camera for portability, quality and the pictures edit well.We are enjoying using it to fine tune my sons juggling.

Reviews.Title: Kodak Zi8 meets expectations
Reviews.Author: Chad Crawford
Reviews.Content: I ordered this product on the recommendation of a friend for making short videos pertaining to a business endeavor. It is simple to operate and makes great quality videos for the price. I had previously purchased a camcorder for more money and was not satisfied with the video or audio quality. The Zi8 does a much better job, in a smaller package, and is easier to operate.

Reviews.Title: Very disappointed
Reviews.Author: Gregbray
Reviews.Content: I have owned one these before, but it was stolen, so I bought a new one and it doesn't work at all. You turn it on and you can't turn it off. It won't snap a picture or record a video either. Very sorry I bought this new one.

Reviews.Title: Excellent product!
Reviews.Author: Aluxe
Reviews.Content: I have had this camera for over a year and love it! It fits in my back pocket, in my bags (big or small), and is always a hit no matter where I go.It is extremely easy to use. I purchased a 64GB memory card and it has saved everything I have ever recorded! My family members love receiving video of the kids and even the most mundane activities are easily recorded.I definitely recommend this product. I purchased it over the Flip cameras because it was better ranked at cnet and many other electronic places I checked. In fact, I spent months researching this purchase and weighing my options. I have even had people offer me money to buy it when they watched what I recorded. Instead i told them to come to Amazon and find the product themselves.Great product!

Reviews.Title: Kodak Zi8 digital camera
Reviews.Author: wilross
Reviews.Content: I have been using the Kodak Zi8 video camera to record short lectures for our business website. The best feature is the addition of an external mic that can be worn on the shirt and pluged into the camera. The quality is great!

Reviews.Title: Satisfaction with a Smile
Reviews.Author: whiterail media
Reviews.Content: Kodak Zi8 Pocket Video Camera (Black)I bought the Kodak Zi8 today. I have fairly high standards and I needed the camera to produce relatively good looking video. I didn't expect much from this machine quite frankly because of the cheap price point, but the camera had what I needed. It had a jack to connect an external microphone, it had a tripod mount at the bottom to attach a tripod. I will tell you that the Kodak Zi8 really surprised me. I am satisfied at the quality of audio and video it produces, and I love the features that make it stand out among other cameras at its price point. I don't expect magnificence at this price, but I certainly don't mind being satisfied.I highly recommend the Kodak Zi8 pocket video camera to anyone looking for a quick, easy and flexible way to capture life going by, and at a damn good price.

Reviews.Title: Good Pocket Camcorder But Falls Short On Expectations
Reviews.Author: DjPLaTiNuM
Reviews.Content: After doing a lot of research on this camera and seeing a ton of YouTube reviews that this camera was the next best thing since sliced bread, it was hard not to be disappointed. I really wasn't expecting a $3,000 camcorder but after looking at the stats and the price, it would be hard to fall short. The only thing I have to compare it to is two cameras that I own (Fujifilm FinePix S9100 and Canon Powershot SD940 IS) which neither are designed for video. However, they both at least shoot a solid video without interruption and don't yield bad results. The Kodak Zi8 is a fairly small design which is nice and fits easily in my pocket (roughly the size of my iphone) which I did like. The problems I ran into were in the recording firmware. I purchased a 16GB Class 10 SDHC Memory Card which I assumed would work great for a camera of this caliber but I was wrong. The Kodak Zi8 has issues with most lighting settings I've encountered so far while shooting. Unless I am in the sun and shooting in the sun, it doesn't even take 720p/60fps. It usually cuts off after :02 seconds of recording. I've noticed that in 1080p/30fps and 720p/30fps it does the same thing but can last a little bit longer before shutting off. The only format that doesn't have issues is WVGA which is not what I purchased the camcorder to shoot in. After looking online through some forums this is a known issue from other users and Kodak says it has a build in shut off when the sensor doesn't pick up enough light because it gets grainy with low light settings (which is understandable), however, their should be an option so that your videos don't get cut off in the middle of shooting. It's very frustrating because there were numerous times I was recording my daughter dancing around being goofy (moments that I want to remember) and instead of getting one full shot, it took three shots for one single song (so sad). I've done everything from formatting the card in the Kodak Zi8, on a computer, and updating the firmware on the Kodak Zi8 and nothing has worked so far. Another major downfall in my opinion is the very narrow lens which requires you to stand pretty far back to get a decent shot of anything. Ultimately, I am going to try to sell it or return it as I'd rather save up an extra $100 and get a real camcorder that allows you to control the settings and won't cut out in the middle of recording.

Reviews.Title: Video
Reviews.Author: ERose
Reviews.Content: Really enjoy it. Compact and works well. Makes taking short videos fun. Works best in bright lighting, but given the size and price- I couldn't ask for better. Also the battery lasts a long time.

Reviews.Title: good HD camera
Reviews.Author: James H. Kim
Reviews.Content: Now this is my first ever purchase for a HD camera so I "ain't" no expert by any stretch. But I will tell you that this camera is very easy to use. All the packaging was labeled and had illustrations. I didn't really need them but that extra little labeling just makes things go a bit faster.The camera itself also takes pictures in addition to having 720p, 1080p HD etc. One small downfall compared to the flip camera is that it doesn't stand on it's own. In that regard, you can simply buy a cheap tripod, which I did.There is a built in USB cable that is awesome. I love it. Less cords/wires, the better. The camera is fairly thin and looks fairly sleek from afar. Upon looking closely at it, it almost looks like a weird outdated smartphone (take that for what it's worth). But it gets the job done and i'm happy with it.

Reviews.Title: Not the best, not the worst
Reviews.Author: James Pointer
Reviews.Content: I have had my camera for over a year now and have not had any complaints with the quality but have noticed a couple of issues. First, this camera loves light and can't do well with just so so lighting. It doesn't handle strong backlight well either.. Second, while filming driving down the interstate I noticed that the playback ran normal speed then excellerated briefly and continued doing this the entire length of filming. Distracting but quality wasn't effected too much.I like the camera and it does do the job it was intended for reasonably well.

Reviews.Title: Great Camcorder!!!
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I really do love this thing! Using it to improve my golf game, record family events, and looking forward to using it to record our baby daughter when she arrives in October. Very user friendly! The red multi-function button is a little touchy tho.

Reviews.Title: Good value for money with mic input
Reviews.Author: Vince Law
Reviews.Content: Very few pocket video cameras allow you to plug in your own mic. The Kodak Zi8 does and it helps to improve the sound quality of your videos.For such a low price, this is truly good value for money for casual video people like me.I bought a couple of spare batteries and it allowed me to record many hours of some speeches I went to. I would recommend that you record at 720p to save battery. The full HD 1080p uses up more battery life and the files are huge.I also bought a 32 GB SG card for the Kodak Zi8. Don't think I will run out of space any time soon!

Reviews.Title: Decent camera with great picture quality!
Reviews.Author: Ray F. Mihulka III "Ray F. Mihulka III"
Reviews.Content: Bought this to knock around with.  Has a great picture and sound but beware of sudden movements.  I shoot 720p/60fps and use EIS for best results.  I bought a monopod to hold it steady for certain situations.  I don't use it much.  I'm going to get a Canon digital camera that shoots HD video as the lenses are much better.

Reviews.Title: Value for Money
Reviews.Author: MrigKash
Reviews.Content: Good camera. It is easy to use. Zooming is reasonable. Battery life could be better. I always carry an extra battery in my camera pouch. Extremely easy to use. Nice appearance although I'd have liked it a little bit more compact. The downside is that it cannot stand on its own due to the rounded bottom; therefore, a tripod stand, small or large, is a must for vibration-less video.-Regards-

Reviews.Title: Good camera for a beginner photographer
Reviews.Author: Randal J. Mcmasters
Reviews.Content: Bought this digital / video camera for my daughter to replace another digital camera. I was excited to see this camera operate with both video and still photos. Quite pleased with the quality pictures (5MP) and the video quality is good as well. The camera size is large enough to grasp it, yet small enough to fit in a pocket. Really it is the size of most cell phones so one has to get used to keeping hands still while taking video/pictures. And if you want even crisper videos, it includes the place to attach a tripod. My daughter is still a little skeptical about camera since she was used to a more traditional camera, but I think she will enjoy it in the long run. So far we are pleased with it.

Reviews.Title: Great model
Reviews.Author: White Mouse
Reviews.Content: We looked at many newer models out there before getting this one for my company. The video quality (especially at that price) is definitely hard to beat for the average user. The interface is easy, the camera is small, and the battery life is fairly good. We expect to hold onto this for quite a while.

Reviews.Title: Bought for Bloggin
Reviews.Author: Rodney A. Watson "rawdawgy"
Reviews.Content: I like it so far havent done any bloggin yet but worked great at Easter and Birthday for Grandchild. I still have to work on its settings recorded Video in camera photo mode so it was outa focus. Worked alot better on Birthday on proper setting. I think it is priced a little high when I bought it. Amazon Rocks

Reviews.Title: Nice but issues
Reviews.Author: James Stewart
Reviews.Content: I wish they had told me that this camera was unusable without a SD card. It would have saved ordering one after I received the camera. It works well now that I bought a 18gb SD card

Reviews.Title: Lots of bang for the buck!
Reviews.Author: Hgw
Reviews.Content: It does what it is supposed to do.  Picture quality is good. Great stills with almost instant focus so you get the picture you intended to get. A great value!

Reviews.Title: Kodak Zi8
Reviews.Author: wgodbold
Reviews.Content: Easy to use. Only wish it had a screen where I could watch myself on camera.I know there are other cameras out there that do that, but I wanted the quality of this Kodak. I went for quality.

Reviews.Title: ZI8 camera
Reviews.Author: Okcr2g
Reviews.Content: Purchased this for a wedding in Niagara Falls.  Installed a 32 Gig card and went at it.  With the exception of the Jet boat ride it did a great job.  Lots of photos and video were taken and all were done well.  spring for a good external mic and a lighting system if you are taking video indoors in low light. For the price it was an excellent purchase.  It is headed to Europe for a another wedding in July.

Reviews.Title: Great quick home use camcorder
Reviews.Author: Girish Srinivasan
Reviews.Content: This is a great pocket camcorder to carry around and take home videos in 1080p if needed. But in 1080p mode, there is some lag when you pan around the camcorder too fast. But there is the 720p 60fps mode to compensate for this and very much sufficient for general home use. The construct is pretty good and its easy to learn and operate. Video quality is very good. Specially in general home lighting conditions and at night with yellow light, the video comes out fairly good. I was happy with it. Much better than the cell phones or some of the point and shoot cameras. Battery longevity is not great. But should be sufficient for a couple of hours of off and on recording. The power switch is a little bit difficult to operate. You surely would need a good size card for long recordings. Depending on use, I would suggest a 16 GB or may be even a 32GB to do both videos and photos. I have not taken too many photos, but the few I did came out quite good. You surely need good lighting conditions for good quality photos. The image stabilization seems to work fairly well.The transition between different video modes / photo mode is little slow. So it will not work if you are in hurry to switch modes.Only major drawback that I see is that zoom is completely useless. As you zoom, the picture because video becomes very grainy as this is just a digital zoom.

Reviews.Title: Craptastic
Reviews.Author: tf
Reviews.Content: I bought this in August and have barely used it, but now that I really need a video camera, I realize this is junk. I didn't expect the sound and picture to be anything other than adequately mediocre. But the camera is not that easy to use; the battery drains after 15 minutes of use and takes hours to recharge; and when I try to upload videos, I often have to reinsert the cable multiple times trying to get the camera to register with the computer. I wish I had used it more right when I got it so I would have known that I should return it and get a real camera.

Reviews.Title: Good camcorder, but has some issues
Reviews.Author: James "Code Warrior"
Reviews.Content: I bought a Zi8 a couple of years ago directly from a Kodak promotional e-mail.  It has some good points and bad points.  I liked the compact size and the fact that I could use flash cards instead of buying tapes or disks.  It has OK or fair battery life.  Some of the problems, however, are that for one, the audio circuitry becomes very noisy after it has been recording for about 3 minutes, and is so bad that it almost drowns out the sound you are trying to record.  The microphone is not very sensitive, either.  Another problem area is the picture quality.  If used with ambient lighting indoors, the picture fidelity is a lot worse than that of a standard-definition camcorder.  With any of the recording modes while using indoor lighting, you get video quality that resembles a runny water-color painting.  If you are shooting outdoors, however, it will give you great, true HD quality.  Another thing; the fixed-focus lens was not very sharply focused.  I guess it was not bad for the price, but not the quality performer I have come to expect from Kodak.  Please note that I am speaking for a Zi8 model purchased in 2009 when the Zi8 first came out.  If the models made since 2009 have been improved and updated, hopefully these Zi8's will be better.  Kodak makes excellent digital still cameras that also shoot very nice video, although not in HD.  Personally, I would have been better off getting one of Kodak's newer digital still cameras to replace my old 3.1 mega-pixel EasyShare (which shot way better videos than the Zi8).

Reviews.Title: I love this thing!
Reviews.Author: Casey's Mom
Reviews.Content: I went to Arizona for a week and used this every day, taking about 272 videos and photos. This was the first time I'd ever taken any videos.  When I got home, I made a 45 minute movie DVD using the Kodak Media Impression software. I used photos, videos, and incorporated bunches of music in my video and it came out awesome.  I'm definitely no computer whiz kid, but I had a blast editing my photos and videos.  I had planned to purchase a separate photo and video editing software, but this free software did everything I needed it to.  (There's also an awesome woman on YouTube who gives step by step instructions on all aspects of this camera if you have any problems that the instruction manuals don't address.)Regarding the camera, it's very easy to use.  At first I didn't like the little red "roller ball", but got the hang of it eventually.  I went back and forth from photos to videos constantly, and I sometimes chose the incorrect format accidentally, but overall it was simple to change formats.  All of my photos and videos were very good quality.  The only problem with the videos was there was horrible shaking when trying to record a video while walking.  I'd never done videos before, so live and learn...The last night of vacation, I did a lot of recording and the camera did freeze up after continuous recording of about 10 or more minutes.  It wouldn't shut off, no buttons would work, etc. and it felt really hot.  I just let it sit and it ended up shutting itself off.  I was worried that I'd lost everything in it, but I charged it that night, and the next morning I turned it on and everything was there.  I haven't had a problem since.  I guessed that I'd over-worked it that night.  I'd have given this review 5 stars except for this snafu. It hasn't happened since, but I haven't tried to record anything over a few minutes at a time.Overall, I'm in love with this little camera and I take it everywhere with me.  Can't wait to take another vacation with it!!

Reviews.Title: Bad Luck Camera
Reviews.Author: G. Gray
Reviews.Content: I have yet to make the first video.  Every time I try it I get the internal memory is full message.  WELL.....how can that be, as I do not have anything on it.  I'm guessing they just want me to buy another SD card.  Not sure if I will do that yet as I would like to make sure the camera works first.  I'm really frustrated with it.  It seems very simple to operate, so why can't I get it to record???  YES..the battery is charged duh!  Should I EVER get the thing to work, I will come back and change my review.

Reviews.Title: Kodak Zii8 Pocket Video
Reviews.Author: MJO
Reviews.Content: Learning the ropes, but when this model was found to be better than the latest, it appeared to me that the technology had to a certain extent reached a plateau. Small and compact for a pocket, but has a nice images despite its size--resolution not as great as a regular resolution, but it captured the moment well enough--to capture the latest spontaneous moment which are rare and of interest. CNET rated it well. Can augment with a audio cord. It's really inexpensive.  Just think if everybody had this om 11/22/1963.

Reviews.Title: Better than I ever expected!
Reviews.Author: A. "Ang"
Reviews.Content: The video quality is really impressive especially if you shoot at HD mode.  You choose the quality each time you turn the camera on.!This camera could not be much simpler to use, so you will not struggle even if you are new to video cameras as I am. I have heard that the other flip type cameras are notoriously bad for their sound.  This camera has good sound but it has the external jack too so you can get an external  microphone with a long cord or even cordless if needed.  I got a very inexpensive one and it works great wirh the camera. The battery lasts only about one hour so make sure you get an extra one for any longer filming. Also, the zoom is strong but I wish it moved smoother. Overall I am very impressed!!

Reviews.Title: very easy to use!
Reviews.Author: Michael Berry
Reviews.Content: software?  who needs the software?  they are all MPEG 4 files.  just pull them off!handy, nice size.  only needs a lense cover!!  I use plastic wrap to keep off dust.

Reviews.Title: Great HD 1080p video for the price!
Reviews.Author: bill8931
Reviews.Content: This is a really great, inexpensive, HD 1080p video camera! It has a mic input that I have used to attach a clip-on lavalier mic that dramatically improves the audio quality. You can also use it to take 5 mega pixel still photos. It's very easy to download the video or photos with a built-in USB connector. The automatic stabilizer helps to reduce hand movement and it also mounts on a tripod. It's light weight and can be put in a shirt pocket. You can't beat it!

Reviews.Title: Gone in 30days !!
Reviews.Author: Girish Nair
Reviews.Content: I learned my lesson - Do not buy electronics from Amazon - Cameta camera gives you only 14day return policy and mine has gone bad in 30 days . It gets the video is not HD but HG ( High Grainy). The camera is built like toy camera and behaves the same as well. Now I have to contact the  Kodak customer support to get it repaired and I don't think it is worth the effort.If you plan to buy the same camera buy it from somewhere else not from a Amazon Seller,Thanks

Reviews.Title: My favorite new camera!
Reviews.Author: rokman
Reviews.Content: This HD cam rocks!  I've been using it for 11 months and it has never once failed me!  It takes amazing HD video and takes great pictures. I LOVE THE MACRO SETTING!!  It's so simple to use too!  I have been telling so many people about this thing.

Reviews.Title: Would be more perfect if...
Reviews.Author: JohnDoe
Reviews.Content: This is a simple to use camera with excellent picture quality for the price range.Playback through TV or monitor is OK. But one obvious thing missing is ability to use it as a video monitor - just plug in a video monitor (TV, whatever) and it would show what the camera sees continuously. I mean all the hardware needed is there. How about a firmware update?I had monitor ability in an ancient 20 year old camcorder. Why not in Zi8?

Reviews.Title: Good buy
Reviews.Author: Carol Nc Wong "carolove"
Reviews.Content: It's a user friendly video camera for people on the go. Best of all, can't beat the price. The picture quality is not the best on the world, but the two different modes of caputer (close up and zoom) really help in certain situation. I wouldn't buy it if you want to take new-born video or some very imporant gathering, but if you like to take video on sport event, family gathering. it will be a great choice.

Reviews.Title: Good but not great.
Reviews.Author: DirtRider "I like to play in the dirt"
Reviews.Content: I have purchased this camera (from Amazon) in hopes to find something better than the Flip HD Ultra and Sony Bloggie Touch that I also own. Here's the skinny.Pros:CheapImage StabilizationSD Card SlotRemovable rechargeable batteryEasy to useHDMI outExternal Mic port (selling point for me)Can Take picturesGood low light performanceImage is right side up when recording upside down (recorded video still upside down)Cons:Cheap PlasticImage stabilization not that goodExternal mic pics up RF Interference at timesVideo quality lesser than comparable devicesPictures quality behind most cell phonesYou get what you pay for. This is not a great device by any means. In my opinion, the Flip HD Ultra and Sony Bloggie Touch provides a much better quality video however, they both suffer from other problems.  I have all three and will keep all three because they are all pretty cool and all do what they need to do. If you want better, spend more money on something else.  Any of them are absolutely perfect for carrying around with you at all times.  I favor the Zi8 when i need something to be recorded with better sound due to it's external mic capability.  This unit has so far survived multiple dirt bike rides and has gotten VERY dusty as a result. So far so good.For the price, you simply cannot go wrong however, do look into other, newer devices as well.

Reviews.Title: good lil camcorder
Reviews.Author: S. Zoucha
Reviews.Content: good picture and ease of use in such a small and easily carried camcordermy wife loves it for home for the kids

Reviews.Title: Not too shabby
Reviews.Author: Malibu Bandit
Reviews.Content: I'm a professional video production artist, and I use HD cameras all day. I wanted something to have at my hip that was HD so I never have to say "I wish I had a camera right now". The chip in this thing is teeny, so the quality won't be the best, but you can only have certain expectations when buying something like this - I know it won't have the same quality as my 5D MKII. For what it is and what I use it for, it's just right. I only wish it was a little bit smaller - besides that this thing is great! Good buy!

Reviews.Title: Good camera at affordable price
Reviews.Author: Shawn Lee "Slee"
Reviews.Content: Camera takes sharp video and has little shaking even when filming when walking. example of video made can be seen on youtube @ [...]It's easy and fast to use with good quality and decent editing tools with effects like the one seen! I recommend it! I'd give it 5 stars if it could stand on a flat surface alone, bottom of camera has a curve to it.

Reviews.Title: Better than I thought
Reviews.Author: Ed
Reviews.Content: The picture quality and ease of use is amazing. Mic input is a bonus not seen in camera in this price range. Built in mic is so-so, but so are most of them.

Reviews.Title: Great but problems with long videos after 1 month
Reviews.Author: J. A. Diz
Reviews.Content: I bought this Kodak Zi8 last Oct-2010. I will comment only to warn those who tape a lot.This is my first HD video camera, and first video camera in years, so I used it more than usual. In a month of vacation with my nephews I recorded many times a day (along with a Gorilla Tripod). Videos of between 10 and 60 straight minutes, too much for this kind of camera. I probably recorded 40 hours in total, not sure. My camera lasted about 4 weeks, now it turns itself off after 8 to 20 seconds, always, and never keep those videos.Important note: I bought this camera here and the lens are not as shown in Amazon main photo, that photo for me was manipulated. The glass is quite difficult to clean, it is not flat as shown. In Google Images search for "zodak zi8 lenses" and see how it really is.Anyway I do recommend this Kodak, but I'm buying this time a Panasonic SDT750K camcorder :)

Reviews.Title: A real surprise
Reviews.Author: Richard M. Rollo
Reviews.Content: I hadn't thought about getting a video camera, but Instapundit gave a favorable mention and linked to this camera.  I was surprised at how little it cost.I had put up a golf net in my backyard last year.  I wanted to see what my golf swing looked like, but I didn't want to spend a lot of money for a video camera.  I have several cell phone cameras but they were not suitable for doing what I wanted to do.Then, I saw the Kodak remote.  That settled it.  I could put it on a tripod and start it with the remote. So, I bought the remote and the camera.  I already had a tripod from my 35mm still camera days.  It did exactly what I wanted it to do, although I still need to work on getting the shot framed better.I don't have much experience with video.  My only experience with motion picture cameras was taking film movies when I was 12 years old of the neighbor's cat with a hand me down Bell & Howell 8mm camera.  So, I'm still learning how to get the right tripod set up.  But this should be pretty easy to use as a hand held camera.The picture quality was much better than I expected.  The depth of field is great in outdoor light.  Maybe I'll try doing some You Tube videos.

Reviews.Title: ZI8
Reviews.Author: Big Apple
Reviews.Content: Kool in a box. This little, easy to use camera puts High tech in the hands of everyone. Simple to use with outstanding quality. Love my ZI8

Reviews.Title: For what it's worth...
Reviews.Author: Daemon_DBA
Reviews.Content: This is a pretty decent camera, all complaints aside. For a simple end user, who isn't in it for high quality, it does what it is meant to do fairly well. Takes pictures and records footage in a small enough package that it can be slid into your pocket.We bought the camera when we found that our first child is on the way. I (the techie) had little difficulty with the device, but my wife (not as tech-savvy) had a rough time learning how to transition between the different modes that the camera offered.The camera itself is exactly what you would anticipate from a product in its price range. "Better than some, not as good as others" is a good way to describe the results that we received, but "your mileage may vary" on that point. It's a great camera to have with you, considering its size. But, if you cannot find a good deal on it, I would consider looking elsewhere, as there are better cameras for about the same price.

Reviews.Title: Great Little Video Camera
Reviews.Author: Carl D. Porter "Author"
Reviews.Content: This is a great little video camera. My only hardware complaint is that the audio is very faint. My other complaint is the difficulty and lack of explanation of the software. For unknown reasons the software locked up the camera and would not allow the power switch to turn off the camera even when disconnected from the USB port. I had to remove the battery to reset the camera. The software also locked up my desktop and I had to totally remove it and go back to an earlier "restore" point. I did get it to work without incident on my laptop. Strange.

Reviews.Title: Nice little camcorder
Reviews.Author: Doug
Reviews.Content: This is a great little pocket camera for the money.  It doesn't cost much and the picture is in line with the price.I bought it to record my golf swing and I carry it with me on the course.  It: starts right up; easy to use; easy toplug into my computer, and extremely portable.  Now I just leave it in the car for anytime use. Just don't expect greatHD pictures because you didn't spend a fortune for it.

Reviews.Title: Great camera, but...
Reviews.Author: ZahirO
Reviews.Content: This is a very good camera but my only problem with it is that it doesn't have a flash or a light so it can't be used at night or in dark areas. I am a spoken word artist and one of the reasons I bought it was so that I could record some of my performances and put them on youtube. Some of the places I perform at are very dark which makes it hard to do. Otherwise I love it. Great clarity, great microphone, etc...very good bargain.

Reviews.Title: Nice cam
Reviews.Author: Gustavo Solera Alfaro "tavvo"
Reviews.Content: I am very happy with it. Night video is terrible but I had read about it before. Day video is awsome. Very simple product, very easy to use. Software is not Windows 7 compatible.Picture option is not very nice. Photos are not the best but anyway it is supposed to be ca video cam, not a photo cam.

Reviews.Title: Outstanding value for the money
Reviews.Author: RonB
Reviews.Content: I find this little camera has outstanding value as something I can carry in my pocket and video som high quality stuff.

Reviews.Title: Great extensibility, but lacks video quality
Reviews.Author: JohnnyFive
Reviews.Content: It is the geeks version of the Flip. It handles external mics, removable storage, stands, and takes video as well. The video, however, isn't the greatest. 1080 recording is huge, but again, the quality leaves a lot to be desired. Also, audio is terrible, so I bought an external mic. The mic only records in Mono (left) so I end up editing every video I make and copying the audio to L/R tracks.It's small, lightweight, and very easy to use. I wish there was a way to change more settings, such as the exposure level. That would make this thing perfect!

Reviews.Title: Zi8 Gives Great Video Quality, Extras - Performs Poorly In Low Light
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer "onebigswede"
