} } } Length:: 2:22 MinsI bought the Zi8 a couple of weeks ago after reading many positive reviews of it online. Some of the things I loved about it:- 60 fps 720p video, great for fast moving sports/etc.- external mic input - good for blog interviews- great quality footage for such a cheap camera.- Expandability of SD cards.- Many accessories included in pack.- Remote not included, but very handy - suggest getting one at only $10 or so. Kodak Remote Control for Zx1, Zi8 and PlaySport Pocket Video CamerasSome of the things I didn't like as much:- Poor image quality in lower light situations.- So-so implementation and quality of standard photos.All in all a great camera, and I'd highly recommend it, as long as you don't plan on using it a ton in low light situations, or as your main still image camera -as it doesn't perform that well in those situations.The video included has some footage I shot at the Mall of America's theme park. Lots of fast moving roller coasters and other rides.

Reviews.Title: Portable, easy to use
Reviews.Author: Alfonso Priale
Reviews.Content: I need a camera to record the growing of my little baby. I was looking for something portable, easy to use, who can share videos, a plug and play kind of thing. I stumbled into Kodak Zi8, read some people experience with it, and then buy it. Now that I have it, I have nothing to regret. It's hard to find an HD camera in that price range. Go for it!.

Reviews.Title: Filming BJJ and Life
Reviews.Author: Derek D. Bergey
Reviews.Content: I bought this Camera mainly to film Brazilain Jiu-Jitsu classes and tournaments. So far, it's worked wonderfully, when people where black gi's (or dark clothing) you have to make sure the light is bright enough so that they don't bleed into becoming a blob. I have mainly used this camera indoor's and have had no problems at all. Audio is good, video is great and it's easy to use. I imagine if someone were to film any sporting event, this camera would more than meet their expectations. UNLESS it were a night time football game. EVen then, the field is well lit enough for you to capture everything, I would suggest sitting as close to the field as possible.If aimed directly at light, is does blow the source out, meaning, if you take a video of someone standing next to a bright lamp, it might make part of them disappear, in that case, don't aim directly at the light, and the problem is solved. Just of center it a bit.I got this camera for $100 dollars, I have a Kingston 16 gig class 4 card that can capture 2 hours and 9 minutes. I also bought an extra battery for 15 bucks, and a remote for 10. All in all, it would have cost me 160 or so. Which is the same price for a Flip, which personally I don't like a much. I think their video quality is good, maybe even similar, but this shoots amazing video in both 1080p and 720/60 frames per second, (which is where I tend to keep it) that coupled with the fact that I could buy external mic's for this thing. Great stuff.Can I shoot a block buster film with it. No. Can I tape auditions, BJJ matches, and day to day life of watching my neice and nephew run around. Yes, and can do so easily and amazingly.Well worth the money, could not be happier.

Reviews.Title: Kodak Zi8 Pocket Video Camera (Black)
Reviews.Author: GregRocket
Reviews.Content: I bought this on sale for just under $100. For the price it's a lot of fun to make quick HD movies. The mic jack is a great feature of this camera. For the price it's a lot of fun.

Reviews.Title: Great, Inexpensive way to capture short home videos
Reviews.Author: N. Ourada
Reviews.Content: This product is fantastic for the price. I bought it just to get home videos of my daughter. Very easy to use. My only complaint would be the battery life, but it is not a huge issue to me because I am not filming for extended periods of time. I would suggest this to new parents looking for an inexpensive way to capture special moments!

Reviews.Title: LOVE this camera!
Reviews.Author: lhobbs67
Reviews.Content: Purchased two of these for my school library.  Video quality is out of this world.  Also takes still pictures.  This is a great replacement for those out-of-date video cameras...

Reviews.Title: I'll let the video speak for itself.
Reviews.Author: RGDDesigns "Willie D."
Reviews.Content: I'll let the video speak for itself.[...]I shot this video with my Kodak Zi8.  I carried this thing with me all around New Orleans and hardly noticed it in my pocket.  The image stabilization is a bit weak, but other than that, the image looks great.  Night shooting isn't the best but then again, that's normal for this class of camera.  I LOVE that it comes with an HDMI cable.  Video shot at 720p and 60fps looks the best in my opinion but still suffers from some shuttering as well.  The video was shot in 1080p which is the worst when it comes to image stabilization, but I think I was able to keep it still enough to get some good video.  I was even contacted by the band and they ended up using the video on their homepage!

Reviews.Title: Great little camcorder on the go
Reviews.Author: C. L. Greene
Reviews.Content: I was really pleased with the quality of the pictures and videos that this compact camcorder took.  The display on a HDTV is incredible.  I absolutely love it.  Wish there was more info about creating a dvd, but it's a great little camcorder for those on the go.

Reviews.Title: Coaches must have!
Reviews.Author: Anne M. Wieber "DaWiebs"
Reviews.Content: This little camera makes coaching much easier than ever before.  The ability to record in 60 fps for real slow motion analysis of the athlete's technique and the quick and easy software for downloading and analyzing the clips make this camera a must have for any coach.  It is so small and lightweight that it is easy to carry around.  The little toggle button makes it fast and easy to zoom in and out while recording.  It is the most simple, easiest to operate, and reasonably priced video camera with 60 fps slo-mo I have ever seen on the market, and it works great!

Reviews.Title: Kodak Zi8
Reviews.Author: SW Productions
Reviews.Content: Great picture quality & color when there is a lot of light - outdoors or in well lit gyms.  My footage of a nephew's basketball game came out very well.  The colors were gorgeous.  This camera does not work well in low light situations.  I filmed another nephew singing in his school's talent show - the audience shots were totally dark and my nephew's face was washed out.  Be advised that this camera has a circular base so it does not stand up by itself - you'll need a tripod.  However it is very easy to carry around and to hold while filming.  The audio quality is much better than the reviews led me to believe.  For the price - this is certainly worth it and I'm happy to own one.

Reviews.Title: Just love it
Reviews.Author: Donald W. May
Reviews.Content: Product works as stated. good battery life. Even works with my original tripod. Devivery arrived the date stated dispite the weather we have been having.

Reviews.Title: Great camera.
Reviews.Author: Jimmy Becca
Reviews.Content: This was my 2nd camera. I had gotten a flip for Christmas and it broke, this is what I could afford, and I was not dissapointed.I picked this camera because of how you could choose what to record in, and it had a place to plugin a mic, which is a very handy feature.This is a really good camera for a vlogger, youtuber, concert go-er or someone who wants to catch those random moments. The mic that comes on it is very good for concerts, the picture quality isn't as good as my camera now, but it's almost as good as a flip, and can shoot in 1080p.GREAT CAMERA!

Reviews.Title: Flip Mino H who?
Reviews.Author: samsiteone
Reviews.Content: The Kodak Zi6 killed the Flip mino+Ultra+HD and the Creative Vado, so the Zi8 has no competition.With all the options available like: External mic, mini/HDMI and rechargeable + removable batteries (can carry several batteries with you). Not to mention removable SD memory up to 32gb (carry several also if you want), there is no competition.It also has the best video quality or I would have chosen another pocket cam, Bad video quality is a deal-breaker...After all that's what the camera is for.Kodak Zi8 has it all above the others.

Reviews.Title: Great camera, difficult software
Reviews.Author: Sheri Jacks "researcher"
Reviews.Content: The camera, itself, is very easy to use, however, I've had a heck of a time with video playback on my computer.  The software has been difficult to understand and there isn't much information in the accompanying manual.Picture quality is great.  Video quality is great (in regards to playback on the camera itself - playback on my computer has been choppy)

Reviews.Title: Dead out of the box
Reviews.Author: J. Wood
Reviews.Content: After reading numerous reviews of simple videocams, I ordered one of these.  It was a refurbished unit and was non-operational from the beginning. The battery would charge just fine, but the device never turned on.  The biggest disappointment was that mine came directely from one of Amazon's selling 'partners,' who refused to make good with a replacement.  I had to spend my own money to return the item for a refund, which I'm not sure I ever got, come to think of it.  Thankfully not a lot of money was involved.

Reviews.Title: Great quality!!!
Reviews.Author: Rebecca Graf
Reviews.Content: Easy to work, great videos and stills.  Even the 720 looks great on our big HDTV.  The HD recordings look awesome!

Reviews.Title: HD video in your pocket
Reviews.Author: sixstringstrummer
Reviews.Content: You won't be filming a movie with this... but how many of us are looking to shoot movies. Works great for family memories. USB transfer directly to the computer to view and edit the video. HDMI cable included to view on your HD tv. For less the $100 you can't go wrong.

Reviews.Title: Fantastic!
Reviews.Author: T. Ward "love to shop"
Reviews.Content: I bought the Kodak Zi8 for my teenage daughter. Her and her friends have so much fun with it. We love it so much, the whole family now want their own. The picture quality is AWESOME and the sound quality is really great. This is much better than the Flip Ultra HD. Not to mention you can add up to 32GB of memory, unlike the Flip which sticks you with whatever memory size version you purchase. I just wished it had more features built in but, I can always do any editing with PC software.

Reviews.Title: Great quality and ease
Reviews.Author: Bryce Miller
Reviews.Content: I am in a group called EpicFilmsVideo on YouTube where we all own our own zi8 and it has proved to be the best camera we could find for the kind of stuff we do. If you want to make your videos look pro for a low price then this camera is for you. I love it's nice feel in my hand and the smootheness of the EIS. Don't pass this deal up!

Reviews.Title: Small, affordable, and efficient
Reviews.Author: Christina Blanchard-horan
Reviews.Content: I have enjoyed working with the Zodak Zi8 pocket video camera. It served me well in tight situations where a large camera would have been intrusive. Use a tripod, otherwise the video is not so easy to stabilize.

Reviews.Title: Love it
Reviews.Author: Steven Gotts
Reviews.Content: Great Video Great Price. Pocket Size. Needs a skin shell, their only $15. Tons of demonstration video on youtube that say it all.

Reviews.Title: Zi8
Reviews.Author: Don Young
Reviews.Content: I plan on returning to Asia and we are on the road quite a bit therefore it would be good to be able to charge the battery outside of the camera. I plan on having an extra battery.(we have all the adapter plugs.) At least the charger will operate on 240v. Earlier rechargers that I had for still camera batteries were only 110v and we had to continually buy batteries.

Reviews.Title: Extreme quality and value
Reviews.Author: PaulC
Reviews.Content: Great picture quality and audio control.  You can shoot a documentary on this camera with an external mic input you could even conduct interviews.  I would invest in the nifty little wide angle lens adapter as the lens is a little narrow.

Reviews.Title: Great pocket video camera
Reviews.Author: Chico
Reviews.Content: So far I have been satisfied with the Kodak Zi8 camcorder. it takes great video and it simple to use. The great feature that I love is the mic input connection. I use this to take video of my band and so I can connect the sound from the mixing board to the camera.

Reviews.Title: ZI8
Reviews.Author: Chris
Reviews.Content: Not bad for the price,but not great either. It is not very good in low light or with motion, but it shines with the sunlight.

Reviews.Title: nice Cam for the price, easy to use, and very good pictures.
Reviews.Author: Julio W. Barreto "camafala"
Reviews.Content: For the price it is very good cam, Amazon have the best price and fast delivery. Easy for use by children, nice result, nice pictures and easy to handle it. I recommend this cam.

Reviews.Title: fantastic product
Reviews.Author: tricia
Reviews.Content: This camera is very easy to use.  We love being able to plug camera right to computer.  There's no trying to keep up with another usb cord.

Reviews.Title: This camera is the sheezy
Reviews.Author: xiojester
Reviews.Content: Ya heard me? This camera is hot. I forgot who told me about this camera but I'm glad they did cause for this little amount of money you can't do better than this camera I'm telling you

Reviews.Title: Mini Cam
Reviews.Author: Porge
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice little video camera.  Still photo option is not as good as I would expect from Kodak.

Reviews.Title: Nice cam, feature packed !
Reviews.Author: SCMark
Reviews.Content: This little camera packs a punch ! The aux jack for microphone was the deal maker. Plugged in an external microphone and we were cutting outdoor videoswith clarity and minimal wind noise. Also has the threaded hole in the bottom for tripod mounting. Both pic and vid quality are nice. Mov / quicktime format....so don't expect to edit in Windows easily.... but that's pretty common for most of these. MUCH more sophisticated than a Flip, IMO. Get one!

Reviews.Title: I Flipped Over This Video Camera
Reviews.Author: Rick A
Reviews.Content: I was going to get a FLIP for Christmas but found out about this product purely by accident. I checked out its reviews on YouTube and was blown away with its superior quality over the Flip. I especially love the fact that it came with 99% of the accessories needed and it has a rechargeable battery to boot. I was fortunate, and got it on sale and so it cost me the same as a Flip (if not cheaper) and (although I've used a Flip and it's good) this Kodak is totally superior in every way.However, the only slight problem I have with the package is that the editing software that comes with it was a bit cumbersome to use for me. Even after checking out YouTube tutorials and other things it was a bit awkward for me to get all of the use out of the software (of course the problem could just be me). I will be checking online for a version that will edit .MOV files or even see if Windows Movie Maker will do the trick. But even with that said, I still wouldn't trade my Kodak for any other video camera even if they gave it to me for free. Oh, I forgot the Kodak uses SD cards to store its files which you have to purchase. It uses the regular sized ones - I suggest you get a 8gb SD card minimum.You Rock, Kodak!

Reviews.Title: So far, so good!
Reviews.Author: Eli Newsom "Eli"
Reviews.Content: Just chiming in with another 5-star review for this camera, which has, for its price point, gotten just about everything right.  Easy-to-use, great battery life, multiple recording quality options, and, for me, the biggest draw, the ability to add an external microphone.  So with a lav mic added you suddenly have HD quality video with excellent audio quality.  This combo (HD + microphone audio) will soon be the standard/expected quality in even the most amateur of videos, whether it be for Youtube, a blog, Facebook, or sending videos to a family member.  Amazon offered this product for an amazing price of $99 and I scooped it up for use in my instructional dance videos.

Reviews.Title: Kodak Zi8 Video-Cam
Reviews.Author: Robert Turel "The Presentations Coach"
Reviews.Content: A better choice in my case compared to the "Flip" line of HD-Cams because of the external mic port on the Zi8. This feature works extremely well, as well as the promised high-def resolution options in shooting video. The still shots are just okay, but since I did not buy the camera for that option, I concentrate on the video. I am using an SDHC card for the availability of shooting lengthier video.All-in-all, an excellent camera at a very reasonable investment.

Reviews.Title: Great little video camera.
Reviews.Author: mamainparadise
Reviews.Content: I ordered the Kodak Zi8 Pocket Video Camera from Cameta Camera for Christmas and used it for our holiday trip.  It takes great videos, fits easily in my pocket, and is easy to use.  I haven't had any problems.  It's easy to connect and watch on our TV.  The only thing I didn't like was the short battery life, but that is to be expected for such a small camera.  Continuous video recording uses up the battery in less than an hour.  You should purchase an extra battery or batteries if you expect to video record for an extended period.  I definitely recommend this Kodak Zi8 Pocket Video Camera for its quality, ease of use, portability, and price.

Reviews.Title: Joels camera
Reviews.Author: Kitty
Reviews.Content: I bought this for my husband but he could not make the video work on our older home computer. We gave it to our son who loves it! He posts to us and to u-tube! The quality is very good, and the size makes it easy to travel with.

Reviews.Title: Pleased, very pleased
Reviews.Author: S. Morris
Reviews.Content: I received my Zi8 about a week ago. Paid $99.00usd. Bought a 16gig card. Probably only needed an 8gig. This camera works, and works well. I'm not going to nitpick anything about it. Yes, I wanted an external memory input. Yes, I wanted a removeable battery. Yes, I wanted an external mic plugin. No, I don't care that it has no flash unit. Most of the others don't, either. Buy one, before they're gone.My thanks to those with knowledge of this type of equipment and the information they provided in their reviews. I had not seen the camera. I ordered the Zi8 and some accessories based on what I read. I wasn't disappointed. Thanks again.

Reviews.Title: good product of the price
Reviews.Author: Viera95
Reviews.Content: the ZI8 is a cool little camera it has good picture quality a few basic features that work well, and is all around a great product for the price.but if your expecting professional quality video or plan to use it mostly indoors this is not the camera for you.pros.60fps video, 1080 video recording, Fast auto focus, face detection, good image stabilization, external microphone jack, cheep price.cons.narrow angle lens... (i find my self shooting from farther away to get the subject in frame.)no optical zoomsuper grainy image indoors (when shooting inside with room lights the image gets real fuzzy)mono sound (unless you use the external jack)final thought...this is a great portable "pocket" video camera for day time filming and for the price that's all it has to be.

Reviews.Title: Field of view
Reviews.Author: John H. Adams "Jussi"
Reviews.Content: The Zi8 camcorder took excellent videos when the light situation was right. My turnoff was the limited field of view. In many cases I could not get back far enough to get the view I wanted. A wider field of view would have add a real plus to this camcorder. I returned the Zi8. I don't know if I will find a pocket size camcorder with a wider field of view that does not exceed my budget but I will continue looking. An optical zoom would also be a plus.

Reviews.Title: You get a lot at such a bargain price. Definitely a top notch pocket video camera
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I've had this product for almost a month now and I have to say that it contains many features for such a decent price. I mainly shoot using the camera's 720P 60fps setting. Even though this camera has image stabilization, it is not a fix all. Sure, this camera boasts a 1080P resolution at 30fps and it is quite crisp.......... IF you use a tripod or you plan on having the steadiest hands on the planet. The EIS doesn't do much justice for this camera when shooting at 1080P. Even with the steadiest hand, at 1080P - you get a crisp but very very shaky picture. For some reason, the 720P 60fps resolution is the best and the EIS seems to work a tad better at this setting.  The still pictures at 5mb a shot are pretty decent too.  The option to have up to 32gb of SD memory cards is a plus. Although, I never found myself filming more than an hour's worth of short videos. The macro feature is decent too. Not the best, but this is a pocket video camera and it's pretty decent overall.  I sold my Flip Ultra HD after getting this camera. Why? It just seemed to offer more in regards to features, picture quality and compact size (the Flip Ultra HD is a pretty thick pocket phone with only 8gb of space to show for it). This camera does shoot in an older video format of .mov, but it's not a big deal since ArcSoftware (the software that comes with the camera) gives you the ability to convert to .MP4 and other formats. You can also upload videos and pics from your Kodak Zi8 to YouTube and Facebook using the software. Overall, for about $100+ here on Amazon, it's well worth the purchase.

Reviews.Title: Best little portable videocam around!
Reviews.Author: Elisabeth Szentkereszty "belgian book lover"
Reviews.Content: Do not have much video cam experience, but this little nifty gadget is more than that! Quality is excellent and it's so much fun (and easy) to use. My daughter is loving it and yes, you need a tripod for most occasions, but if you have a steady hand, good too. If you want an easy inexpensive (though excellent quality) videocam, this is it! The raspberry is not as pink as I would like, but it's nice anyway. Thanks Kodak for coming back with such a great product!!!

Reviews.Title: I like it!
Reviews.Author: Julie A McCartney
Reviews.Content: Takes good quality video! Very easy to use!Cannot take video in the dark.Also a little difficult to email videos if you do not have Microsoft outlook. Maybe I'm just not tech savvy enough to figure it out, but doesn't seem easy. Very easy to upload to youtube or facebook.

Reviews.Title: Kodak ZI8
Reviews.Author: Paulsur
Reviews.Content: Got this one just before Christmas 2010. It is absolutely amazing for the price. Great video with good lighting. I prefer 720p mode most of the time. It seems best and easy for You Tube. The pictures are crystal clear sharp, and the audio is more than acceptable for this price range. My camera already had the lastest bios update, so I did not need to flash it at time of purchase like earlier purchasers did. You will note some negative reviews about the audio. Those came out prior to the firmware update. Audio is fine now.

Reviews.Title: I'm impressed
Reviews.Author: JW
Reviews.Content: I bought this to replace an older unit for my daughter who has found herself recording events wherever she goes.This is a far better device than I expected and way better than the last one.  The ease of use is amazing and the picture quality is superb.Audio is good but nothing spectacular, but this is a minor gripe considering that the video is the focus of her recordings.

Reviews.Title: Kodak Zi8 Pocket Video Camcorder
Reviews.Author: CatLoraine
Reviews.Content: I wanted to make sure that people know that the Zi8 does have image stabilization and can record at 760/60 fps. In the advertisement on Amazon when I purchased one for myself and son, I read that the Flip by Cisco had the image stabilization and ability to record in 60 fps, and customer reviews said that the Kodak did not. When the Kodak arrived I read the instruction booklet and the online User Guide and found out it does indeed have the 760/fps plus image stabilization. It also comes with the HDMI and A/V cords to enable connecting to the TV and a battery charger with USB cord which plugs into the wall or computer to charge the included rechargeable batteries.It took experimenting until I figured out that the left/right, up/down arrows have to be "rolled" rather than pressed. It should say that in the User Guide. I spent a while pressing on the arrow keys, having them work sometimes and not others until I discovered it takes a rolling motion to make them work.Thus, the Kodak Zi8 has it all but somehow all this was omitted from the earlier reviews. Because of the reviews saying that the Kodak did not have those and the Flip by Cisco did, I purchased the Flip for my other son and now I wish I had given him the Kodak too. I purchased the remote control separately.

Reviews.Title: the best for the price
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: This is good pocket camcorder grate picture and video ease to use my wife (who is technically challenged) was take pictures and video in a matter minutes the reason I gave 4 and not 5 starts is the zoom not usable you will get poor quality video with the zoom but this is not a high-end camcorder bottom line I love this camcorder

Reviews.Title: Great for people with pets!
Reviews.Author: Courtney Ellison
Reviews.Content: I received this camera for Christmas and I adore it!  We have a ton of small pets that move around a lot and/or are too small to capture with a regular digital camera.  The lighting never seems to be right and the lag time while digital cameras focus usually ruins the shot.  The reviewer who said the zi8 is great in low light is correct.  I've gotten clear video and pictures of pets that I've never been able to get a shot of before.  I also received a magnetic macro lens that is just awesome.  My husband was able to take clear pictures of his spiders, scorpions, and insects by using it with the camera.Other than being great with pets, It took me approximately 1 minute to figure out all of the controls and start using it.  I would consider it very user friendly.  I also found it to be better than the Flip, which another family member received.  The view screen is much larger, it is more user-friendly, the picture quality is better and it was a lot less expensive.  My only complaint is that the zoom when it is in picture mode is inadequate, but can be corrected if you are willing to buy additional lenses.  The macro lens helped immensely in this regard.I have had no technical or software difficulties with this product, as other reviewers have had.  Maybe I just had good luck.

Reviews.Title: Great Day Videos, Good Night Videos
Reviews.Author: A. Walczak
Reviews.Content: When looking around comparing cameras I chose the Kodak Zi8. From its first use I was highly surprised in the superior quality the camera produced. In the daylight, the camera produces flawless video and audio when combined with an external compact microphone. Nighttime and dark setting videos are good but are fairly grainy. As other user reviews have stated, an external microphone is highly recommended as there is a whinny background noise without it. Having the removable SD card for storage allows for expandable storage and simple transfer of videos if you do not want to deal with the Kodak software. Just be aware that my camera only accepts 16GB cards but the camera freezes after 8GB are occupied by files/videos on the card. I have tried multiple 16GB cards and the camera will only record a max of 8GB to a single card. Due to the large bitrate and file type of the video, an above average computer is required for smooth playback. A laptop with a core2duo and 3GB of RAM can't even smoothly play the videos without problem. The compact size and lightweight of the camera allows you to carry the camera around with ease. Overall there are a few faults of the camera, but at a hundred dollars this easy to camera gives you high quality at a rock-bottom price. If you are looking for a simple and portable camera that provides full HD videos, then this is the camera for you. I cant wait to see the improvements of this cameras successor and hopefully purchase it.

Reviews.Title: Not that great
Reviews.Author: CP
Reviews.Content: I am not sure if I just got a bad unit or if the video quality is really that bad but I'm not impressed with this unit.  It looks OK at best when recording on the screen but when playing it back on my TV it just looks plain terrible.  I did not expect the video quality to be that of a full size camcorder but it did not come close to meeting my expectations.  If you want good video quality and plan on burning the video to DVD just save your money for a good HD camcorder.

Reviews.Title: Amazing quality from an itty bitty camera
Reviews.Author: Kris
Reviews.Content: Got this for my husband for Christmas.  He had a ball playing with it all day.  The quality of the video is really amazing, especially from such a tiny camera.  He has really enjoyed this gift.  Score one for me!

Reviews.Title: Great camera, great HD quality (but not in low light)
Reviews.Author: Corndog1337
Reviews.Content: So I tried to do a lot of research on this camera before I bought it, everything seemed great so I purchased it.  The only draw back is the camera requires a lot of light to look great.  Inside in low light conditions like if you dont have a lot of natural light or few lights on in the house is very poor.  I would say if you are looking for a indoor camera you might check out other kodak products or competitors.  Outside though, this camera produces some really really great video.  I only knocked it one star because its a great camera, great features, just doesn't do the best indoors at low light (which is what I needed).

Reviews.Title: Recommended for the video enthusiast
Reviews.Author: Peter
Reviews.Content: Best Uses:HD Shooting, Documentaries, Travel, Movies/Short Films, Home MoviesI am currently using the Kodak Zi8 to film a documentary for a film festival. Both my friend and I own one, and we are currently using two of these to film the movie, in addition to a higher-end $800 camera. The only difference between the two cameras is 3mp and a difference in lens size. The Kodak is obviously not quite as good, but it becomes extremely handy for filming footage on the go. For a student filmmaker, who wishes to create real quality footage, this should be your number one choice, unless you happen to have at least $500 on you.PROS:I couldn't ask for a better camera within this price range. It beats any model of the Flip any day, and for a significantly lower price, too (you will save aprox. $40). I did tons of research to try to find a cheap full HD camera with external mic input, and this was only one of two I could find with both of those features. The other option was the Kodak Playtouch. Perhaps the most intriguing feature of the Zi8 predecessor was the big awesome touchscreen, but other reviewers say that its glitches outweigh its pros. Many prefer the Zi8 over the Playtouch. I for one actually strongly prefer the physical buttons over a touch screen, because these make the more important features easier to access. Using the buttons, I can quickly switch between video capture and browsing photos and videos. The built in settings allow me to adjust all the bare necessities, including the amount of audio captured through the built in mic and external mic. This makes this camcorder much easier to use than most. The Zi8 can film in WVGA, 720p, 720p (60fps), 1080p, and take 5mp stills. I can transfer my footage into my computer using the built in USB plug. The computer only recognizes the SD card (which is totally fine with me. much faster too) and opens by default in iPhoto. I usually just open it up in Finder, where I open up a folder to reveal all the SD card's contents.Large Clear LCD, Quick Focus, 1080p Full HD, Lightweight, Tripod Mountable, External mic input, Easy to Use, Audio Output, HDMI Output, USB, SD Card Slot, Great Picture Quality, Strong BlacksCONS:The screen quality does not reflect the video quality, so I am not able to watch my movies in full HD after I have filmed them. When shooting in low light, the dimmer spots are almost black, and the video becomes very grainy. I wish it had flash, but if I really need that feature, I just pull out my iPhone 4. As a high-schooler, I cannot afford a lot of gear, but possibly in the future, I see lighting and bounce boards being very helpful. The Zi8 sports a 5x zoom: not quite ideal for filming objects from a distance. Instead, I have to move myself and the tripod up to the actual scene. When I take the camcorder off its tripod, I find it difficult to hold the device completely still, as opposed to a traditionally shaped camcorder. The fact that the Zi8 is thicker on top makes it slightly more so.Limited Zoom, Top Heavy, Poor In Low Light, Only 5mpAccessories I Recommend:Polaroid 72 inch TripodOpteka TH20 Ball Head with Quick Release Plate for TripodsAudio Technica ATR-55 Condenser Shotgun Microphone

Reviews.Title: Good for the money
Reviews.Author: PhotgraphicLee
Reviews.Content: This camera is a good product to have around like an additional cellphone. It has zoom that's not that great but the clear HD makes up for that. If you want to catch quick clips of things you see everyday this is the toy to get the job done. This camera in my opinion is not going to replace a camcorder but it does a great job for the price.

Reviews.Title: Great camera for the price
Reviews.Author: colton stiles "colton"
