} } } Length:: 0:30 Minsthis was shot in 720p mode at 90fps and the eis is on. the quality is good for a hundred dollar camera. would use an external mic if i had one available, but the ausio isn't bad. all in all, its a great camera for the money.

Reviews.Title: Ok Little Camera
Reviews.Author: J. Juele
Reviews.Content: So I was excited to get this camera based on reviews and video samples on vimeo & youtube. This product got mixed reviews. But I wanted to see for myself.I was looking for an upgrade to my 2 year old Flip Ultra, which shoots in SD quality.Pros:External mic (the main factor that led me to buying this)Macro modeSD expansion slotYou can use the power plug to power up the camera without the batteryCons:Very bad in low lightVery grainy pixelsI see streaks in fluorescent lighting (which what I know majority of you will be shooting in)I was planning to use with for interviews so I tested it with hot lights.Even when I put alot of lighting in an area you can still see the streaks.I have the latest & last firmware preinstalled (1.06). Some reviewers on youtube with sample vids said that that problem was gone but...Maybe I got a bad copy....

Reviews.Title: Pros clash with Cons
Reviews.Author: Truth
Reviews.Content: Pros: Great outside video quality (as it should have with all the natural light), audio is exceptionally good, and can be complemented by an external microphone. It fits in your pocket. Good white balancing. Ability to shoot in 1080p full HD. As well as 720p (30fps & 60fps).Cons: Photo quality usually comes out horrific; most of the time it either gets really bright or really dark and grainy when the photo is taken [in doors]. Low-light isn't too good. Camera has absolutely NO internal memory, so you'll have to buy at least an 8gb sdhc to get 1 hour of footage out of 720p. Furthermore, using zoom deteriorates quality 3x in.

Reviews.Title: Easy to use
Reviews.Author: "E"
Reviews.Content: Bought it a year ago and it still works perfectly. The video quality is great, especially if you shoot it in 1080p mode. However, the 1080p mode won't work if you use a generic memory card bought on Ebay as I have done. Works fine with the Sandisk SDHC memory card bought from Costco. This camcorder is easy to use as well as uploading videos to your computer and online.

Reviews.Title: Helpful tool for the classroom
Reviews.Author: spanishteacher321
Reviews.Content: I use my video camera for recording student presentations.Likes: Portability! I can take it home and view videos later while I'm grading presentations. Easy, easy, easy for me and my students to use! Now that I've found a solution to the quietness of the audio, I'm very happy with this purchase.Dislikes: Audio playback is pretty quiet. I finally found a way to fix this issue when I plugged the camera into my TV (needs to be one with audio and video plugs on the front) and turned the volume WAY up. This finally allowed my students to hear themselves on the video. Before, when I plugged it into my ancient computer and tried to play back the video, the computer bogged way down and wouldn't let me show the entire video.Teachers - I suggest you make sure you have a TV with audio and video plugs ready for playback because having the kids watch themselves on the device itself is too risky - 1. They can't hear themselves when you play back the video on the device itself. 2. The camera is small enough to walk off.Disclaimer 2: It looks like there's a port to plug in a microphone on this camera, but so far, even the people at BEST BUY tell me they don't know what microphones are compatible with this device. All the one's I've seen online are $40 and up, so I haven't tried to buy one to experiment with. Just FYI, this may be a better solution to the audio quietness problem, but I haven't tried it myself.

Reviews.Title: Great for portability
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I bought this video camera because it seems like every time we go on vacation our "heavy video camera" gets left behind because it's just that - heavy. I was able to use this at my son's school for his Halloween party the other day. Worked great and is so easy to operate. The only reason I didn't give it 5 stars is because there is no way to put the date on the video while you are taping. I checked the manual online and didn't see that you could do this. If you can, someone please let me know how. I'll just have to remember to say the date when I'm taping I guess.Update - the files are saved in .mov format and can't be saved to DVD without software. Fortunately we can use our DVR to save the files for archival.

Reviews.Title: Its just fun to have, fits in your pocket
Reviews.Author: Kjmartin
Reviews.Content: Its a great toy to have, I used it to video my trip to Toroweap on the north rim of the Grand Canyon. Worded great, simple to use and fits in your pocket so its there when you need it. Great quality video, sound is OK but could be better.

Reviews.Title: Zi8 Kodak video camera
Reviews.Author: David A. Robins
Reviews.Content: The only problem I had was it looked like this product was already used.  The only other thing was a pixel on the screen was burned out.  I can live with it seeing how I paid less than half for the product.  It also came very fast in less than 1 week.  I do enjoy the product and will get plenty use out of it.  I would recommend someone wanting this camera to consider buying reconditioned.  The price you pay for what you get is awesome.

Reviews.Title: kodak zi8
Reviews.Author: bigbluesfan
Reviews.Content: Decent features for the price & size. Battery should last longer. A little difficult learning how to use all features, but should be ok after a few uses.

Reviews.Title: Best Bang For Your Buck
Reviews.Author: Jean P. Josil
Reviews.Content: [...]for the money and your on a budget this is the perfect camera,besides taking excellent quality video footage the pictures are even better. heres a link to a recent video I made.

Reviews.Title: External Microphone jack came defective
Reviews.Author: Alsina S. Jorge
Reviews.Content: After a few days of testing the nice video features of the Zi8, I received an Amazon shipment with two microphones to be used with the Zi8, so I decided to test the external microphone sound.The jack was defective and sound was not being recorded. Gain level remained at the 3rd or 4th line. Sometimes I was able to record, if I moved the 3.5mm plug about 1-1.5 mm out . I tested with four different microphones. Finally I decided to go for a RMA.Video features of the Zi8 are very good, except in low-light conditions. The zoom is almost useless as the video at 3 or 4X becomes very grainy. On-board sound is not good either.The problem is that while I expended $115 for this camcorder, I expended twice as much for accessories, some of them non-useful if I decide to buy another brand in the near future.I never have problems with devices purchased and delivered from Amazon, but this camera was from Willoughbys. I thing there is some possibility that this camera was dispatched used or refurbished by Willoughbys. They should have made some functionality testing before shipping.

Reviews.Title: Kodak IZ8
Reviews.Author: eric Chun
Reviews.Content: I like the Kodak IZ8. Its worked out great in the studio to be able to connect studio grade mics and pres for great audio... pictures clearon both 720p and 1080.. and the flexability to connect with USB and HDMI and RCA out very nice... I use both a stand up tripod, a home manufactured pole for horizontal and vertical stand up and a spyder small tripod for field... For the price and flexability, a great buy. It is what it is... Im a little nervous using the mic input with the wear and tear on the small 1/8" adapter.  The mics we use are all studio industry level xlr out so care has to be used when connecting the adapters to the mic in jack...also be aware of using the zoom in when indoor shooting and lighting is an issue... the light can change with the zoom and affect the picture.... otherwise a  great buy for the dollar !

Reviews.Title: just what I needed
Reviews.Author: Kevin
Reviews.Content: I was looking for a pocket HD video recorder and this was the best value for money currently out in the market.I wish it had a little more zoom. But this meets my need.

Reviews.Title: I love my Zi8!
Reviews.Author: Linda Halladay
Reviews.Content: I ordered this video camera based on recommendations from other Internet marketers.  They were right!  The picture quality is absolutely fantastic!  I wanted to have the camera before I went on a short vacation to Pagosa Springs, CO.  We were taking the Toltec-Chamas train ride in breath taking mountain country.  The camera arrived in time and I was able to get beautiful short videos all along the train route.  The camera hardly weighs anything. It's easy to use. I am totally delighted with the results. Later I will add a video review so others can see the results.

Reviews.Title: Awesome little Cam for the money !!
Reviews.Author: Joseph M. Souza "Joey"
Reviews.Content: I've been using The Camera for a few weeks .. My main reason for buying it was that it had the external mic jack. The internal mic was ok, but with high def picture I needed good stereo sound .. I purchased the Sony ECM-DS70P Electret Condenser Stereo Microphone, and it works great. No complaints yet ..

Reviews.Title: Good but...
Reviews.Author: TW
Reviews.Content: Bought Refurbished. Great little camera, but not a great refurbish job. Locks up, and I have to remove the battery to get it started again. If battery gets low, or card gets full, there is no warning, it just stops working. Great little camera for the money, but frustrating when you are told it is in perfect, like new working order when it obviously is not.

Reviews.Title: Great for making political videos
Reviews.Author: LindenRed64
Reviews.Content: Set Zi8 on pedestal--connect up lapel mic--and make perfect videos with great sound.  Had more expensive camcorder but bad audio and it had no mic connection--so choose Zi8 which has mic connection. Great picture.  Only small camcorder that had the mic connection--definitely needed.

Reviews.Title: redefined the camera experience
Reviews.Author: Matthew Marlowe
Reviews.Content: Best camera purchase ever.  Completely replaced our Cannon PowerShot G5, Sony Handycamcorder, and Phone cameras.  Both video and still image quality is very good.  The colours in particular are quite sharp.  No issues with sound.  Transfer to computer is fast.  We purchased an additional battery, carrying case, tripod, and class 6 32GB memory card.  Using both batteries, we can pretty much record all we want during a day of traveling/vacation/etc and then recharge at night.  A week of vacation resulted in ~25GB of mpeg4/quicktime video.  The only drawbacks to the camera is a relatively limited user interface, the need to be careful keeping it clean, 2-3 second delay when taking still pictures, and that the exported video files are in .mov format which may need some extra conversion/processing by software when creating a dvd/blu-ray disk.  In general, these are all minor points.  Going forward, the only thing I would have done different is get a class 10 memory card in hopes of reducing the delay between still image snapshots.  The quality of the stills are amazingly good though.

Reviews.Title: a terrific small movie camera
Reviews.Author: Anna Gandour "book diva"
Reviews.Content: I needed a smaller camera to make films to publicize where I work. this worked perfectly and was very easy to download onto my computer.  I also took it to a class reunion and had a lot of fun with it. Light and easy to  work, somewhat like a smart phone. I am still learning about it.

Reviews.Title: Kodak zi8
Reviews.Author: H. Walter
Reviews.Content: I got this flip-style camera because my other one did not have an external microphone port. I love this one, though I have to sit down and figure out all the ways to use it. I got a Sony mike, as I felt I had to shout at my other camera in order to be heard and with this camera, I can speak in my natural voice. I like the picture quality and the fact that it's HD. I have only done 4-5 videos with this camera and shall do many more, so perhaps my review will be updated. Much prefer it to my other flip-style camera.  Plus, the monitor to view the videos is much larger and easier to see.

Reviews.Title: WOW, what a great little camera
Reviews.Author: emailchrishall
Reviews.Content: WOW, what a great little camera. I have to be honest, I had my doubts about this camera when I bought it. I couldn't imagine such a small camera being able to deliver the kind of video I was looking for. I was wrong. This camera puts out amazing video. The HD video has to be seen to believe. I was shopping for a camera for months. I couldn't find a camera with the features that this camera has for under $500. You will be amazed at the sound and the image stabilization. I highly recomend this camera.My only complaints are that I wish the viewing angle was a little bit wider and I wish there was a way to put a wind screen on the built in mic. It would also be nice to pick what kind of video output this device gives but even high priced cameras don't provide this option. It would just be nice to be able to switch from .MOV to .AVI. These are very minor issues that would in no way stop me from buying this camera again.

Reviews.Title: Not Bad but Not Perfect
Reviews.Author: xBryMilx "Bryan"
Reviews.Content: The performance of the Kodak Zi8 is just OK.  A couple of gripes.  First, the sound recording is very sensitive.  If you zoom in/out or touch any buttons while recording, you hear click noises during playback.  I also do not think that it records sound all that well.  Some of the still pictures I have taken are grainy (could be my lack of understanding the more advanced settings).  As for the good, I love the portability of it.  The video is pretty good but not as good as I expected.  Admittedly, I don't really have a good point of reference as to what to expect from similar products.  I would recommend trying out several competing models if you can get your hands on them before buying from Amazon since you cannot return it once opened.  Or, just buy from Walmart and use their return policy if needed.

Reviews.Title: Great Pocket Camera...a must have if you have little kids
Reviews.Author: K. So "KSO"
Reviews.Content: It properly happen to every parent...you wish you can capture different moment your kid has.  Yes, you will never forgot the first time they walk...etc.  But, with this little camera, I can carry it with me all the time and capture many things that I will normally missed.  Yes, Indoor/low night quality is not that good, but I don't need the picture to be perfect to enjoy footage of my kids.When my first child was born, I already have a Sony Hi8 camcorder sitting around, so I use it to capture his birth and a few special trips.  But, the Sony Hi8 camcorder was too big to carry around with me all the time.  I got the Zi6 over one years ago, it was wonderful, I am able to capture many moment about my kids.  I heard that the indoor/low light get a lot better with Zi8, so I got it last week.  It was great.  The picture quality improved (a lot) for indoor and outdoor over Zi6.These are what I love the most...- small and proable, I have it on me everyday...- take good quality video for the camera of it size- removeable SDHC cardThese are what I have issue/concern-  I love Zi6 that use AA batteries to power.  I use rechargeable AA and I can prechage ton's of them before trips.  Also rechargeable AA is relative low cost and record time are very good as well.  I can record 2 hour of 720p 60fps in 1 set of 2700mA AA batteries. The AA charger and batteries can be use for other electrics as well.  But Zi8 use Li-ion, I end up need to spend an extra $40 for extra KLIC-7004 batteries and charger.-  I have a little concern about the heat, I continues recorded for about 1 hours, the camera was on a tri-pod.  When recording was finish and I try to remove the camera from the tripod, I feel the camera was quite warm/hot.  Normally I only do shot clips, so this should not be an issue for me.  But this is something to keep an eye on.

Reviews.Title: It takes amazing HD videos BUT...
Reviews.Author: KS Review "KS Review"
Reviews.Content: The Kodak Zi8 takes amazing HD videos. Out of all the portable pocket HD camcorders I would say that this has one of the best quality. Personally, I like it better than the gunstyle camcorder like the Sanyo because the device looks like a cellphone and it won't make people around you nervous when you are filming.That being said, if you are getting this camcorder to also take photos, don't expect much because the photo quality is less than great. I would go as far as to say that it is unusable for taking pictures. The lens for the camcorder has no real focusing abilities so your photos will come out blurrier than a digital camera. It does have a facial recognition feature so that when you are taking portrait shots, it will attempt to focus on the person of interest, but it will still be blurry. If you are outside in good lighting, you can maybe get away with the picture quality as it does take 5 megapixel photos, but taking pictures indoors or less than perfect lighting conditions it will be not as good as a cheap digital camera. *(In fact in low lighting conditions I would actually suggest shooting 1080p videos and then just taking the screenshot out of the video. It will have more grain on it but it seems to be sharper in my experience.)I still think this is a great camcorder and people should get it, but the Zi8 is for people who wants to shoot videos and I would recommend ignoring the picture mode.

Reviews.Title: Does what it said it would
Reviews.Author: M. H. Plungjan
Reviews.Content: Have used this for some time now and am quite happy with it in proper light.That means not too dark and preferably no light source behind the subject.My biggest annoyance is the uncertain overall colour of pictures. Even a hint of a light wall to the side of the subject, may change the tone of the pictureAnother weirdness is proportions of the subject change dependent on angle or orientation of the camera. However the speed of the picture taking (down to the hi-speed memory card I purchased too I imagine) makes it possible to take many many photos of the subject and choose the best.Overall good value for money

Reviews.Title: Impressive
Reviews.Author: Valeri Colyer
Reviews.Content: Very easy to use and makes great photos.  The video capability a great feature.  highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: ok video for the money
Reviews.Author: Jill Jarvis
Reviews.Content: It's a little on the flimsy side, but for the money that is to be expected. I find the center piece hard to use to zoom in/out. When I try to zoom in/out, I either turn it on or off, so that is frustrating. I think the key is not to tap the center button, but rather to hold it. Regardless, the center button is a bit tricky to use to zoom in/out. The positive side is that this little camera takes great quality video in HD 1080 and it is super easy to upload them to your computer.For so little money it isn't bad.

Reviews.Title: great product
Reviews.Author: King911
Reviews.Content: its a great camera, records in 1080p at 30 fps and at 720p at 60 fps (my personal fav setting, its great for recording fast motion.  its standby battery life is really good and lasts over a month.  fits a tri-pod in the bottom.  its really easy to use, you dont even need to look at the directions and you will figure out how to work it right away.

Reviews.Title: Cool little pocket cam
Reviews.Author: audrey
Reviews.Content: I've had the zi8 for about a month and I'm really pleased with it. It's a fun little thing to keep around with you all the time. The video quality is just OK, but considering the zi8 is a pocket cam I honestly can't complain too much. It is what it is, and for the most part it does well.

Reviews.Title: It Has It's Uses
Reviews.Author: Jack Adrian
Reviews.Content: The picture and sound are good and this rig definitely has it's uses.  I would recommend buying a color rather than black.  It is easy to lose.  Another color would show up better.  It's shape, lightness and small size make it difficult to hold steady but that is the nature of the animal.  The tripod socket is a plus.

Reviews.Title: Best purchase I ever made
Reviews.Author: Limavel "Savy Amazonian"
Reviews.Content: We had purchased a camcorder which we hardly used many years ago.  Now we won't go anywhere without our Zi8.  We love that we can view it on the television, its ease of use, its lightweight and the fact that it replaces both our camera and camcorder.  We made this purchase to take videos of my mother-in-law (now 95) and have accumulated many memories which we'll be able to enjoy in the future.  She loves viewing herself on the television.  You will not regret this purchase and will be amazed at how much use you get from it.  There is obviously a major difference from viewing a photo as opposed to a video.  My only suggestion is that you purchase the memory card with your purchase because the Zi8 does not have enough memory to enable you to use it right away.

Reviews.Title: Kodak doesn't give you enough information.
Reviews.Author: skippy
Reviews.Content: I was looking for a lightweight camcorder to take videos of my grandson.  I researched the FLIP and the Kodak Zi8.  The Flip has 2 hours of internal memory, but you can't add additional memory ( SD Card).  When the Flip memory is full you have to download or erase to record further video or pictures.  I thought the Kodak would fill my needs with internal memory and the SD card option.  The Zi8 has only 128MB of internal memory about a 20 sec video.  If you buy the Kodak be sure to purchase a SD card because you are going to need it.

Reviews.Title: Great Buy!
Reviews.Author: lyndsey
Reviews.Content: This is a great video camera. It is so clear and vivid. I just bought it and tried it outside in very bright sunlight and thought it might have a glare but it doesn't. It's very user friendly- a 90 year old could use this! It comes with HDMI cable so you can plug it right into an HD tv. You do have to buy a seperate SD memory card which is about $50 for decent camera time (3 hours). Battery seems to be pretty good as well. Microphone could be a little better. Slightly difficult to hear if people are more than a few feet away. For the price and great picture quality, this is a great bargain!!

Reviews.Title: High Quality, Low Price, Small Package
Reviews.Author: kumu
Reviews.Content: This camera is extremely easy to use. It may not have lots of fancy gadgets and tints that full-sized recorders have, but its half the price and records in HD quality. The battery life is decent, and the removable memory means that you can have as big or as small memory card as you desire. It plugs straight into your computer - the USB cable is literally hidden inside of the camera case. I am no tech expert, but even I have no problems capturing video, deleting it, and transferring it to my computer. Its also very small - smaller than my regular camera. I am using this to make a professional Do-It-Yourself video in HD, and it has been a smooth ride. I would highly recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: Kodak Zi8-best small video recorder in the world
Reviews.Author: mhk "ada"
Reviews.Content: The Zi8 is great!  If you want a simple easy to use video recorder that is small and easy to carry around this is the best around.  Download to computer is siomple as well. Get rid of your Cannon hand helds...this is the best.

Reviews.Title: Kodak Zi8 Pocket vedio camera
Reviews.Author: msc
Reviews.Content: I like the size of the camera, I don't like  the camera/vedio  is that it does not have a built in flash. When you take picture indoor it will be dark. The video is ok but I am not that happy of how the video comes out when it is downloaded to the computer to watch. It is more of a still picture then a movie style.

Reviews.Title: couldn"t be easier
Reviews.Author: Trish
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera to video a wedding - easy, easy, easy!!! It took about 10 minutes to figure out, record a test video and voila!!! played on the TV. The picture quality in both video and still camera format was great.  The download of the "viewing" software took a bit longer - not very non-geek friendly, but I managed it on the 2nd go round.  I would recommend this product to anyone wanting a simple, easy to use and understand video camera that it a hair bigger than my blackberry - I should have gotten a different color because I tried to answer the camera when my phone rang.  By the way, the price was $50 less than the same model at Best Buys.

Reviews.Title: kodak
Reviews.Author: happycust
Reviews.Content: I have used the camera very little so far, but it has been fun. I love the easy to learn directions. It is so easy to use.

Reviews.Title: OK for the price but has limitations
Reviews.Author: Paul
Reviews.Content: At this price range, the Zi8 is probably a good buy, but after using it for a few months I wish I had spent a little more money and gotten a better camcorder.The lens angle should have been wider.The still photos are not very good quality.The image quality of the video is not very impressive.If you are going to do any taping outdoors, you MUST use a external microphone. I did some taping on a sunny day with hardly a breeze, but when I downloaded the video onto my PC there was a lot of wind noise picked up by the built-in mic. Wind noise is notoriously difficult to remove from an audio track, so I am going to have to do the taping all over again.The Zi8 has almost no built-in memory, so you will have to buy an SD card. Be sure to factor the cost of an SD card into your price.The battery life seems a little short.The zoom feature isn't all that impressive. The button used the control the zoom makes it a bit tough to zoom in and out smoothly while holding the camera.The outside of the Zi8 gets smudged pretty easily.If you can't afford anything more expensive, then the Zi8 may be a decent choice. But if you can afford to buy a camcorder in the next highest price range, then I would recommend doing that.

Reviews.Title: I LOVE my Kodak zi8
Reviews.Author: M. Wilson
Reviews.Content: I have had camcorders in the past, but the zi8 is my favorite.  It is so small that I carry it in my purse, the HD quality of the videos is beautiful, and it is very simple to transfer videos to my PC.  I am very happy with this purchase.

Reviews.Title: Shaky
Reviews.Author: Revdawg
Reviews.Content: Great camera but when you record the video comes out shaky...unless you put it on a tripod

Reviews.Title: Kodak Zi8
Reviews.Author: regular guy
Reviews.Content: Ideal handheld photo and movie camera.  Easy to use and uploads are a snap.  Price and performance match.

Reviews.Title: Great little camera for the price.
Reviews.Author: P-Nasty "Chocolate Milkman"
Reviews.Content: While most of the other reviews about the great features of this camera have been mentioned, there are a few not so great things that are worth noting.1. This camera is next to useless in low-light conditions. I know night vision or a light is asking a little too much with this price, but it is something worth considering.2. The lens should have come with some sort of protection; it is completely exposed at all times. Invest in a good case if you buy this camera.3. If you have hard to reach USB ports on your computer, you are going to need a USB extension cable.4. I recommend buying a 32GB SDHC card for this camera as it has VERY little internal memory. Cheap 32GB SDHC cards are around $80. This makes the great price not seem as great anymore.5. Video clips are recorded by default in the Apple proprietary .MOV format. The average non-technical user may have trouble playing/converting/editing these files on their system.6. I have noticed that some of my video clips randomly come up as "corrupted" when I try to play them back on my machine. As this has happened on multiple SDHC cards and computers, I can only blame the camera.These points are not a deal breaker by any means. I am still giving this awesome camera 4 stars.

Reviews.Title: Highly recommend the Kodak Zi8 and the Sport Models
Reviews.Author: David F Tidwell
Reviews.Content: Very easy out-of-the-box usage. Versatile shooting formats and high-picture quality at 1080p. True video enthusiasts may find something to complain about, but for the average consumer this is a home run, no-brainer.The new Kodak Sport model has all the same features as the Zi8 and is waterproof. There is an "underwater mode" and the color and clarity of both the picture and the sound is amazing.

Reviews.Title: I love my camera
Reviews.Author: alanni
Reviews.Content: Bought the camera a few weeks before leaving for Europe, and after I had good practice and was ready to go, it disappeared. Lost, misplaced, stolen?? Who knows???? I immediately ordered another one and it was sent overnight and got here in time for me to snap away. The only thing I do not get and that is smooth running video, but my granddaughter says it must be my computer as they are running just fine on hers. Both pics and videos are soooooo easy to take and transfer to the PC etc. The pictures are sharp and crisp looking and I can only have praise for this little camera that fits into your pants pocket.Thank you for a very good reasonably priced product.Now I can visit my hometown Berlin by watching a video anytime.

Reviews.Title: Superb HD video on a shoestring budget
Reviews.Author: Daniel Limbach "Reader, writer, gadget guy"
Reviews.Content: This device is a Flip killer (until Flip comes out with their next-gen device)Love:1) Video Quality is excellent given adequate light (as with most cams)2) External mic option - always better than the onboard mic3) Size is exceptional - pocketable4) Battery life is fantastic5) Controls are extremely simple and intuitive6) Tripod-friendly7) External power option - great for long shootsDon't Love:1) Small size makes it hard to keep steady, and the image stabilization is only ok2) Zoom is digital only - no optical zoom3) Photos are not as hi-res as a dedicated camera - but still OK for most needsFor the price they are asking for this now, it is a no-brainer.

Reviews.Title: Awesome HD video camera, can't beat the price!
Reviews.Author: Danny Creech "RetiredDan"
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for my daughter 1 week ago. She love to make short "movies" and take pictures (previously with my smartphone). So far, I am extremely impressed with the Kodak Zi8. My daughter and I have both used the camera, and found it easy to use. I have been very impressed with the picture quality as well. The only thing I did not realize based on the product description is that you do need to buy an SDHC card (at least a class 4) to use this. The bulit-in memory is basically non-existant.A few reviewers mentioned an issue with sound, but I have not noticed any issues with the built-in microphone and the sound. We have taken about 40 minutes of video so far in multiple places including area with a lot of background noise.Overall, I would highly recommend this to anyone looking for a pocket HD video camera.Pros:* Has multiple video modes (720p, 720p with 60 fps, and 1080p)* Has still camera (5 MP)* Has image stabilization* Extremely easy to use* Great priceCons:* Need to buy an SDHC card (at least a class 4 SDHC)... there is basically no available memory on the Zi8

Reviews.Title: love the Zi8
Reviews.Author: Penny Viers
Reviews.Content: I am not the most techno savy person out there, but I really love this new toy!  I took it with me on a recent trip and found it so easy to have handy to use at any time.

Reviews.Title: KODAK ZI8 CAMCORDER
Reviews.Author: Terry LeeTusing
Reviews.Content: I ORDERED ONE OF THESE CAMERAS AND LOVED IT SO MUCH THAT A ORDERED A SECOND ONE FOR BACKUP.I HAVE TAKEN MANY VIDEOS AND THE QUALITY IS EXCELLENT.I AM LEARNING HOW TO LINE DANCE AND I VIDEO MY CLASSES AND PRACTICE AT HOME.YOU CANT BEAT THIS CAMERA FOR THE PRICE.YOU WILL LOVE IT AS I DO.

Reviews.Title: Cool Toy
Reviews.Author: Doug
Reviews.Content: I love this little video camera. It is ewasy to use. Takes great footage that looks great and easy to carry around. This video camera has great great resolution and is perfect for those family events. Because it is so easy to use, I have started to capture quit a bit and enjoy putting together brief clips for family and friends.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: Jay M.
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent little camera, great value.  Image quality is excellent as long as you have enough lighting. In low light the quality quickly degrades. Audio quality of the internal mic leaves something to be desired ( watch out for windy environments ). That said, when you consider what you pay for this it's a great camera for capturing home videos and for just carrying around for those unexpected "wish I had a camera" moments.  Very easy to use, light and portable, means you'll definitely use it more often than not. Can't wait to see what future generations will offer, but for now I'll be content with this.

Reviews.Title: good cam
Reviews.Author: R. K. Martin
Reviews.Content: it is, what it is, a low price camcorder. i've had it for over a month nowwork well best part is you dont look so geeky like with a big camcorder at partysmost people think it a phone

Reviews.Title: Kadak Zi8 Pocket Video camera
Reviews.Author: Donna Smith
Reviews.Content: Exceptional value for the money. I was very impressed with the picture quality from such a small pocket video camera.

Reviews.Title: Working ok
Reviews.Author: sherylsplace
Reviews.Content: I just purchased the Kodaki8 for use primarily in taking videos to upload onto a blog, youtube, etc. A few things I've learned so far....Although the 720P setting is supposed to be your commonly used setting for videos, I have found the 720P/6fps (for sporting events) to be much better in quality for general use.The image stablizer is average. I had hoped it would be a bit better. I'll be using a mini-tripod frequently.  So I can live with it.Also the typical camera setting for still shots leaves portions of my photos blurry even when varying the distances away from the objects.  The focus range must be pretty small as part of the photo is in focus and part of it is blurry.  My iphone takes better still shots.I've had the camera for a week now and so far it seems to work well with no vertical lines, etc. that others have talked about.I think this model and the Flip brand cameras need some refining.  It will take another year or so to get them to function at a higher level of quality overall.

Reviews.Title: Great camera for traveling
Reviews.Author: Eric H. Choi
Reviews.Content: Awesome product. Took it with me to Thailand on vacation and it didn't fail me once. The video quality was great. The photo option is pretty meh, but that's not it's intended function. The only setback is the image stabilization, which, unless shot in a stationary position, is a bit shaky. Ended up getting it stolen by the end of the trip, which was a bummer, but bought a new one right after! It's affordable and great for carrying around and capturing on the go moments. Haven't had a chance to use the mic in input, but the standard audio capture is not too shabby.Pros:AffordableGood picture quality (don't need anything more than the 720p)PortabilityCons:Standard audio could be betterA little shaky when movingI definitely recommend it.

Reviews.Title: Love It!
Reviews.Author: C. Mosher
Reviews.Content: I'm very happy with my new Zi8. The video quality's amazing, and it's easy to use. The only downsides are the exterior of the camera (it's a fingerprint magnet, but you can buy a silicone skin and solve that problem), and the audio. I think the audio's shortcomings were even more obvious when compared to the picture quality,  the audio just didn't come close. That can easily be remedied, though, by purchasing an external mic like I did (do some shopping around and you can get one cheap) - it made a big difference. Otherwise, I'm satisfied with my purchase, and would recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: A little big
Reviews.Author: Luis Gerardo Mendez Lacayo "AquaMan"
Reviews.Content: The product has nice features and works well.  However, the Flip is easier and smaller.  This may be better for Mac users and perhaps this is why other reviews are better.

Reviews.Title: It shoots great oudoors!
Reviews.Author: Alexis Dominguez "The Realtor"
Reviews.Content: It works great outdoors.  Poorly litted Indoor shots are a little grainy to watch but anything you want to shoot outdoor will give you a brilliant, accurate color.  The stabilization is understandably not as great in an equipment this light and small but good to have.  The zooming in and out can be smoother.  Overall, it's a satisfying experience shooting with Zi8.

Reviews.Title: Love it!  Replaced a Sony Handycam HD
Reviews.Author: open24hours
Reviews.Content: The Kodak Zi8 is a great video camera.  Features that made the difference for me:- Full 1080p resolution.- External microphone jack.- Removable flash storage.- Removable battery.I use it for 2 purposes:  Making YouTube videos of myself (straight shot from a tripod indoors) and also family videos (indoors and outdoors).  It works well for both.Some reviews have said video is too shaky.  My response: use two hands and pan SLOWLY as you move from subject to subject.  For the price and what this camera is, I am very pleased with results in my own hand-held videos.  Due to small size of the Zi8, I catch more spontaneous family moments than if I were still relying on the Sony Handycam HDR-HC3.Also, I am satisfied with low-light performance.  While at Disneyland, I made two sets of videos shot in dark conditions:- The entire length of Small World (which is fairly dark inside for a camera).- The "Celebrate" parade at night.Both sets of videos came out well and memorable.  We enjoyed watching them at home on our 46-inch Sony Bravia HD television, running the videos from a Mac Mini which is our media center connected to the TV via HDMI cable.Based on another review of the Kodak Zi8, I bought the Audio Technica ATR-3350 Lavalier Omnidirectional Condenser Microphone, for making YouTube videos.  Low cost and the sound quality is very good.  Reminder: this microphone is mono and Zi8 supports stereo, so remember to get a mono-to-stereo adapter if you use this microphone.I use the Sandisk MicroMate for SD - Card reader ( SD, SDHC ) - Hi-Speed USB.  This is much more convenient than connecting the camera to the PC each time you want to copy your video files over for permanent storage.This camera replaced my Sony Handycam HDR-HC3 (HD tape) because the LCD on the Handycam display suddenly stopped working.  That put me in a squeeze, just when I needed to make YouTube videos.  So I bought the Zi8 because I was in a hurry and assumed I would get a full-featured camcorder later.  Now I'm thinking, the Zi8 works so well, I probably won't get a fully loaded camcorder.This little camera is so cool, why not get 2!  I'm planning to get the new Kodak PlaySport so I can shoot video in the pool and at the beach!

Reviews.Title: What's more important?
Reviews.Author: eightysicks86
Reviews.Content: Small size or High quality?  You can only have one.Ultimately, like the others are saying, you will pay a price for quality.  At its best, the Zi8 captures video like a cellphone with a mic input that does it's best at 720p 60fps.Camera came with latest firmware installed, version 1.06Filmed at the beach the other day. Set on 1080P. Played the MOV files raw (just dropped them onto the desktop) through quicktime. Viewed on work monitor, home monitor and on my 40" sony 1080p set. They all had the same results.  Choppy & blurry playback.I did a test of both 720 & 1080 with & without Image stabilization & Face Detection. I did not notice much of a difference with IS & FD. The video seemed unchanged whether they were on or off. I didn't like any 30 fps format (720 or 1080). The 60 FPS is the best format to record in. I found the 60fps dramatically reduced the motion blur and the video was much more smooth.The pictures it takes are really no different then a cell phone at say, 3.2 mpxs.In fact, the video, also reminds me of the vid my cell phone takes (lg envy touch/Dare). If my cell phone took video at 1080, the performance would be comparable to the zi8, or perhaps any pocketcam.The user interface, imo, is terrible. They could have easily put text on the screen to explain the icons. Very basic control. the Macro button is in a weird place. Macro adjusts whether you want to focus on near or far objects. I would imagine if you had to change this while you are filming you would hear the "click" as you move the slider and it would be impossible to keep the cam from moving.I just cannot keep this thing steady at all. Before this I shot on a Panasonic MiniDV and the filming was tight. Maybe a little too stiff. Was the panny THAT much better at image stabilization or was the style easier to hold which helped I.S.? I cannot keep the zi8 steady while walking at all.An interview with good lighting on a tripod, assuming the people aren't moving around a lot, 720p 60fps, is where this camera is at.Considering its price point, I think it would serve well for "fooling around" video. If I were to get something for personal use, I would splurge for a handheld and not go pocketcam route, hoping that the image stabilization and blur reduction would be better. I would also stay away from this MOV format. Never again!

Reviews.Title: Solid digital video camera with microphone jack
Reviews.Author: Joseph L. Kashi
Reviews.Content: This Kodak does the job and is very portable.  It's major benefit is the availability of a standard jack for an external microphone, which greatly improves audio quality.  I purchased an Olympus ME-52 from Amazon to use with the Zi8 and the combination provides decent 1080p  HD video.

Reviews.Title: Kodak Zi8 is an excellent choice!
Reviews.Author: T. Rumberger
Reviews.Content: Bought this for my fiancee for Christmas. She loves it. The camera is very easy to use right out of the box. It fits in a pocket or purse. The video and sound quality are even better than I expected. So far the battery has never run out on us during an event, we've even recorded one of her son's soccer games start to finish and still had battery power left.(about an hour of straight recording)  The Zi8 easily takes the recorded video and posts it to facebook, which is exactly what my fiancee wanted. The setup was easy. The initial uploading of a video to facebook is a little slow, but the video looks and sounds great. She uses a HDSC memory card and the videos come out nice and clear.  I chose this over the flip mino because of the price and ability to use memory cards instead of built in memory. Also I like the amount of add-ons available for the Zi8. In my opinion, the Zi8 is an excellent value and the best available pocket digital video recorder in it's price range. The only thing I don't like is the lack of manual focus for taking still pictures. Other than that small gripe, It's great. She's happy, I'm happy, I highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: Great video camera with excellent video quality.
Reviews.Author: Omar Waheed "Discover Islam"
Reviews.Content: I love everything about the camera but wish there was a built-in flash making it good for taking images in low light. Overall video and pictures are great when taken with enough light. The video resolution even in 720p is amazing. The camera is compact enough to fit in the top pocket... but you have to be careful it doesn't drop out when you bend down :)

Reviews.Title: Kodak Zi8
Reviews.Author: Roman Lizunov
Reviews.Content: It is my first camcorder, and I can't compare it to other ones. So my review might be not as objective as you'd like. My excuses.Pro:- Video quality in good lightning is awesome! It won't beat pro camcorders for sure, but for its price quality is just stunning! 1080p/30 gives you lots of details for steady views, while 720/60 provides stability on the go.- Camera is compact and perfectly fits my pockets. I can take it wherever I want, without the need of case.- It is very easy to control: just power it on and press "red" button! That's it! All camera settings are at the distance of 2-3 clicks.- Camera supports external microphones through standard 3.5mm jack. I haven't tried this feature yet (I just don't have external microphone), but from "YouTube" videos which I saw, nice external microphone definitely improves the quality of recorded sound. So I consider this feature as a plus.Contra:- Low-light shots aren't perfect: video becomes noisy and details are lost.- Camera comes without memory card, and internal memory size is ridiculously small - just 15 megs. So if you plan to buy Zi8 consider to reserve some additional 20-30 bucks for SD card.- Zi8 construction does not provide any protection to the lenses, and there's always a risk to put some dust and scratches on it.- Camera has nice macro (~15cm) and landscape mode (~2+ meters away). But if you'll try to film something in between 15cm and 2m away from Zi8, then camera just won't focus on it. Yep, clear self-vids are impossible, unless you're not as tall as a Navi. :)Not sure:- Someone says that battery life isn't enough, but it's OK for me, I can barely imagine the situation where 1+ hour of continuous filming won't be enough.Overall:If you're planning to use camera in nice lightning conditions, and you're not the fan of self-vids, and you already have SD card or some extra money for it, then go and buy Zi8! You won't regret!

Reviews.Title: Pretty good, but no optical zoom.
Reviews.Author: John Smith
Reviews.Content: It works well, and has a nice satisfying solid feel.  It's only real drawback is the lack of optical zoom.  I was aware of it when I bought it, but thought I could live without.  I guess I can.  Easy to use, works best in an evenly lighted area.

Reviews.Title: Awesome Portable Camera!
Reviews.Author: Dr Dan "RockStar in Life!"
Reviews.Content: I own this camera and a HD Cannon HV30. You cant compare the two since the kodak is a portable flip type cam. The Kodak is the best portable cam I have used and perfect for anyone that wants something small, portable, and easy to use.I also bought a hard shell case from officemax for $10. Best buy carries them for about $20 also. Make sure to get a hard shell case that is meant for portable hard drives. Much better quality case and will also fit a couple little cables or lapel mic if you got one.Amazon has a perfect lapel mic for this. Its only $25 by Audio Tech. I have it on my blog here: [...]It also takes decent still shots much better than most phones. I recommend you get this cam for portable use. Get the Cannon HV30 if you want a better all purpose camera though.

Reviews.Title: Handy, easy to use camera. Good buy
Reviews.Author: Joseph Zamenick
Reviews.Content: Just slip it in your pocket and you will be ready to take photos or videos of any occassion. Easy to use!

Reviews.Title: Sweet camera, Just make sure you have a Beefed up Commputer
Reviews.Author: F. Viteri "Kevin V"
Reviews.Content: Great little camera, the only issue is uploading and editing onto your computer. My computer is a little dated (2005) and seems to struggle when loading and editing these huge files.

Reviews.Title: Kodak Zi8 Pocket Video Camera
Reviews.Author: Dave K "GoArmy11"
Reviews.Content: I really like the Kodak Zi8.  It is easy to use, and the video quality is amazing for such a small, simple little camera.  The 1080P videos look great on an HD TV, and the sound quality is remarkably good.  The built in software makes it very easy to upload my videos to my Facebook, and my family and friends have enjoyed the Christmas videos that I've posted.  I bought three of these cameras for my family this Christmas, and I couldn't be more pleased with my purchase!

Reviews.Title: Great for the Money!
Reviews.Author: Ghosts
Reviews.Content: I wanted something easy and simple to use.  This fits the bill. Just turn it open on and you're recording in just a few minutes.  No learning curve.  The value for the money is great.  Even my non-techie hubby was able to use it right out of the box! Although the image is great, I wouldn't count on it for award winning videos . . . you cannot be very creative with it.  Again, I got what I expected.

Reviews.Title: Very Happy customer
Reviews.Author: W. Kane "Big Will"
Reviews.Content: This Kodak Camera is everything that I expected after reading reviews. I purchased it for my wife, who likes how easy it is to use. I purchased another one for my daughter.

Reviews.Title: good little camcorder
Reviews.Author: Abayomi Adejokun "coffeeman"
Reviews.Content: This product is way cool.  Its worth the money just to be able to carry it around and be ready to shoot any scene worth seeing.  I carry it in my pocket and can't even notice its there.  The SD cards are kinda expensive...a 16MG is all you should need.  Picture quality is cool..I just wished i could zoom in more than what is allowed and also upload everything i shoot immediately would be nice.  All in all...not bad at all.  Glad i got it.

Reviews.Title: Overall a Good Choice
Reviews.Author: T. Winegard "JerryandCynthia . com"
Reviews.Content: Opted for this instead of the Flip and glad I did.  Lots of features especially image stabilization even though it is not as great as on higher end units. Very easy to use and love how simple it is to download videos. If you are considering a Flip, you might want to get this one instead.

Reviews.Title: A promising video camera
Reviews.Author: J. Huang
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed this video camera for its ease of use, ability to post videos onto youtube, and it's high definition high quality footage.That said, I was really happy with the videos I made with this camera. I bought a plug in mic for extra sound quality.This video I made was made using the zoom - [...]You will notice one problem that I ran up into when I bought this zoom- sometimes it makes weird clicking/tapping noises in my videos. I contacted kodak customer support and we will see what happens to fix this. They gave me some instructions for fixing the firmware or something like that. I am technologically not too good with these things so I am waiting for my fiance to help me fix it.

Reviews.Title: I give it 3.5 stars
Reviews.Author: S. Perkins
Reviews.Content: This is a nice digital video camera for the money, but it lacks in two categories; sound and zoom.  Like other reviewers, I found the sound to be not so good so I guess I'll invest in an external mic.  I also wish it would zoom in more.  Our Canon digital camera has video and zooms in better and has better sound, but the video quality is not as good as the Kodak.  I'm happy with the Zi8 and would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: Love this Pocket Video Camera
Reviews.Author: Phyllis Vincent
Reviews.Content: I absolutely love this handy small camera-camcorder.  It makes the best pictures and videos and it is so easy to use once you get the hang of it.  It couldn't be simpler to download onto your computer...no extra cords..just plug it directly into the computer.  And the quality of the pictures are really good for this size of camera.  They are clear and the HD makes them so real looking..like your right there.  Perfect for anytime or vacations...whatever.  It's so small I just carry it around in my purse with me all the time.  And the price can't be beat!!!

Reviews.Title: Not as good as the review state...
Reviews.Author: Stephen H. Greene "AVIATOR"
Reviews.Content: On the basis of reviews and on-line reports, I simply had to get this little camera.  It was a good value but so far I am disappointed.  It shoots at 1080p, which seems to be the only resolution worth using, but that comes with its own problems.  If you use the digital zoom in the camera the resolution and crispness of the image is horribly degraded.  my old VHS tape are better.  the 1080p videos do not work well on my old MAC laptop computer and the still pictures are of very poor quality.  I bought an ipod nano video and except for its inability to shoot in as low light conditions as the kodak, it is way better to use.  Even my iphone does a better job.  I would save my money and not buy this one again.Kodak Zi8 HD Pocket Video Camera (Raspberry) NEWEST MODEL

Reviews.Title: first time handheld video/picture Camera
Reviews.Author: PShackett
Reviews.Content: Great size and portability.  Don't like the small battery life and with low light the picture is pixilated.  But in the day time the picture is great with little frame jitter.  I also don't like the fact that it doesn't come with any memory card.  Memory cards are expensive for high speed SD cards.  Other than that the camera is great for video and pictures for anything within 20 feet.

Reviews.Title: Impressed wih the picture quality
Reviews.Author: Alan Chau
Reviews.Content: After reading all the rave reviews this camcorder got, I decided to buy it, even though I was convinced I didn't need a camcorder at all.The video quality is awesome. I keep on watching all the recorded videos over and over again and the quality impresses me everytime. I'm using 720p@60fps, the result is much more smoother and impressive than any of the other options. I'm planning to use XVGA for my college classes though, as they look crisp as well but use a lot less memory.Unfortunaly there is not an easy way share the video quality since youtube or any streaming site limit the frecuency a lot.The only drawback I found so far is the MediaImpression software, it's kinda slow even for simple tasks as cut or trim videos, I wish this function would be available directly on the camcorder, of course I understand that for this price it would be impossible.I would really like to have the lens in 45 degree angle so you could record while you watch the screen as a cell phone.I'm very happy with my purchase

Reviews.Title: Kodak Zi8
Reviews.Author: Bridget M. Walker "your name here"
Reviews.Content: This is my first pocket HD camcorder. So far it is working out well. I did lots of research before buying. The picture quality is excellent in good lighting. Took it to the Oregon Coast and got great footage. One negative is that there is a blur space from about 2 to 5 feet. Anything that is about 2 feet or closer to the camera, you can use the micro focus. Anything past roughly 5 feet and you use the macro. The problem is between about 2 and 5 feet things are not as clear or crisp.I did not get the flip because it does not record in true HD and you can't expand memory and you can't swap batteries. You can do all of these with the zi8 and it is less expensive than the mino HD Flip.For what I paid, the zi8 is a great camera.

Reviews.Title: Kodak Zi8
Reviews.Author: Beth LC "Beth"
Reviews.Content: I bought this video camera because of the small size.  I have been very pleased with the picture quality and sound.  Love the color! Overall I recommend this camera.Kodak Zi8 HD Pocket Video Camera (Raspberry) NEWEST MODEL

Reviews.Title: Great little pocket camcorder
Reviews.Author: Theodore Bock
Reviews.Content: I read all the reviews like you are probably doing right now. This is a great little uncomplicated camcorder. Very easy to use. Takes great video and still pics. The other reviews are right, you need an external mic for good quality sound. You might also want to buy the new silicon sleeve from Kodak to protect it. It's small and easily fits in your pocket so there's no reason not to carry it with you to catch those great unexpected "Kodak Moments"

Reviews.Title: good news
Reviews.Author: John Emrich "Tata"
Reviews.Content: Easy to set up, use, and the picture quality is outstanding.The company should have stated, on the outside of the package, that it did NOT come with a flash card.  The internal memory is good, but not enough for Christmas video's.  This was a surprise and we could not get a card on Christmas day.

Reviews.Title: My husband's favorite gift!
Reviews.Author: J. Sullivan "JSULL"
Reviews.Content: I did alot of research on this type of product before buying for my husband for Christmas.  He loves it....hasn't put it down since he opened it.  It is perfect for videoing the kids.  So glad we have it to capture our special moments!

Reviews.Title: Great HD camera for les than $150
Reviews.Author: Rene Palacios Duarte "BLOX"
Reviews.Content: It's a great camera, outstanding picture quality but the battery life is too short. Maybe when you buy it you have to spend a little bit more on an extra battery. I love the portability.

Reviews.Title: Works even after being left in the rain for a whole day!
Reviews.Author: D. Humphries "3Tmom"
Reviews.Content: I have loved this little camera ever since I got it.  I bought a BUILT neoprene case for it which slides right onto a belt so it will be easy to carry around at amusement parks, etc.  A couple of weeks ago I misplaced the camera and searched everywhere for it.  After looking and praying, my husband found it laying in the middle of the backyard.  The case was soaked through thanks to the mid-winter monsoon that had been on the east coast for the last day or so.  We took the camera out of the case and it was a bit damp, but the battery compartment was completely dry.  We waited a few hours before we tried to power it up.  It worked perfectly even after being outside in the rain and at near freezing temps.  I love the versatility of it and the ease of use.  I am not as thrilled with the software, but I haven't had a lot of time to work with it yet.  While I wanted a 32 Gb memory card, I opted for a 16 GB due to the cost.  Right now there is about 180 clips of video and photos on the memory card from the Christmas festivities.  Great product, Kodak!

Reviews.Title: Handy little HD video camera
Reviews.Author: James Ambrose "JAmbrose"
Reviews.Content: Bought this for my daughter for Christmas. She and I love it. Very compact but does a great job at video. Make sure that you update the firmware to the latest which will help in low light situations. I selected this model over the Flip model for two reasons, Image stablilization and the external mic input. My only suggestion is to go to [...] and buy the body wrap for it to protect it. Great camera.

Reviews.Title: Great purchase
Reviews.Author: Frederick J. Nelson Jr.
Reviews.Content: This was a present for my daughter. She absolutely loves it. The product is great.

Reviews.Title: Love It!!!
Reviews.Author: Sherry Daniels "Sherry Daniels"
Reviews.Content: This thing is really the coolest, most affordable pocket camcorder we've seen to date. The picture quality is great, plus it's so small, you can carry it anywhere! My son really loves the direct link to You Tube feature. It makes it so much easier to download his cool skateboard videos. The only features I don't like it the fact you have to buy a memory card because there's no internal memory and there's not a case that comes with the camera. Other than that, this is definitely the best rated pocket camcorder they have on the market right now.

Reviews.Title: Wow... old boy comes back
Reviews.Author: rajivpsf "rajivp"
Reviews.Content: I didn't think I would buy a kodak... but then my friend asked me to check it out... and a few days later I got it.  Works seamlessly with the mac by the way.

Reviews.Title: Great Picture, but don't try to zoom
Reviews.Author: M. Schaub
Reviews.Content: I bought two of these cameras for work.  We had previously used a Flip and it worked pretty. However, after reading the reviews decided that the picture taking capabilities along with the digital video was a feature we wanted.  The Zi8 is comparable in size to the Flip.  The picture & video quality is wonderful - clear, sharp, vibrant colors.  Didn't expect much from the microphone, and got what I expected.  The biggest frustration and disappointment is the zoom feature.  While filming the camera zooms in jerky-stages.  There is no smooth transition while zooming, the camera essentially zooms in start-stop steps.  And when the camera gets the the highest level of zoom it does something weird to the lighting, in that the picture goes dark.  When I try to zoom in on faces in a group in the distance, the brightness is cut in half, until I zoom back out and then the lighting goes back to normal.  I can't figure out if there is a setting I'm missing, or it's just a quirk of the camera.So other than the zooming issues, we're happy with the camera.  Pretty simple, with great picture/video quality.

Reviews.Title: Great pocket camera, but...
Reviews.Author: Nick
Reviews.Content: The camera works well, but it has some trouble focusing when using lower-resolution images.  Also, the light detection works best at 720p.  I'm not sure why the auto-focus and light meter are tied to the resolution...Works great at 720p, less well on other settings.

Reviews.Title: Easy to download to a computer!
Reviews.Author: T. Burgess "Harley's Rule"
Reviews.Content: For the price, it is a great product! Is very easy to download to a computer. Looks good hooked up to a HD television! I only wish that you could use this as a cam for on like msn chat also.

Reviews.Title: The audio is too low...otherwise pretty sweet
Reviews.Author: George
Reviews.Content: I finally had a chance to play with my new ZI8, and the video is outstanding, especially in 720P 60fps mode. My only complaint is that the audio records too low at the camera's default setting, and you have to remember to adjust the mic gain every time you turn it on- there's no way to save your changes. Using an external Sony ECM-DS70P mic helped a little, but not much. With the mic gain raised, audio is pretty good, both the internal and external mics....

Reviews.Title: Totally Pleased with Purchase
Reviews.Author: JQ
Reviews.Content: My only suggestion would be to include a monitor to guage the approximae time left on a memory card.

Reviews.Title: Very pleased!
Reviews.Author: Indigoze
Reviews.Content: I've had this camera for about a day now and it has so far been exactly what I expected. The video quality is excellent for the price of the camera. The audio is a bit soft but I haven't tried increasing the gain yet. Mine also came with the 1.06 firmware already on it, so I can't comment on that issue.As for the playback/recording issues others have reported, I've had no problems at all using a class 4, 8gb  kodak SDHC card in the camera, and playback/editing on a MacBook Pro 13 inch with a 2.26ghz intel core 2 duo processor and 2gb ram. iMovie did tell me that if I imported 1080 video it might suffer "Degraded playback on this computer". I imported it of course just to see, but it looks fine to me; no jerking or stuttering during playback of the video.The only issue I have had is with the power button on the camera, which has to be pressed exactly right to turn on or off. I don't know if that's intentional to prevent accidents but I find it a bit annoying.Overall, if you're looking for a good, budget priced video recorder I think the Zi8 is a good choice.

Reviews.Title: LOVE, LOVE, LOVE this Zi8!
Reviews.Author: Kimberly Teague "Kimber67"
Reviews.Content: Kodak has done it again!!  I love my Easyshare camera, but was wanting an inexpensive camcorder for the kids school programs.  This is above and beyond what I was expecting for this price.  PLUS I discovered that it does still photos, which is a BIG bonus!!  I have only had this product for 1 week, but I have ZERO regrets!I would recommend this to anyone looking for an affordable, yet quality camcorder.  HD is great and it did work w/our Bravia system excellently.

Reviews.Title: Good camera but be prepared to spend more $$$ on the extras
Reviews.Author: T. Basan "T.B."
Reviews.Content: The camera is awesome. The battery life is good although I did buy an additional battery for when I know I am going to be using it a lot. The picture quality is really good in well-lit conditions. The problem I am having is turning my videos into dvd's. It seems the software that comes with the camera is limited and allows you to make dvds only to playback on the computer, not on your tv's dvd player. Therefore I am now forced to buy a new program that allows me to turn my video clips into dvd's. So when you calculate the total cost of the camera, plus the memory cards, extra battery, and computer software...this camera cost me a lot more than I was planning on spending.

Reviews.Title: Very Good Easy to use Quality video
Reviews.Author: Eric B. Dewitt "Eric"
Reviews.Content: I haven't used it a lot yet but it is easy to use and the saved video is good. I am disappointed in the HDMI video when hooked directly to the TV.

Reviews.Title: Grate video
Reviews.Author: Brent Mealer
Reviews.Content: The video on this is awesome, with a tripod that is. If you use it by holding it it will be shaky, like all compact camcorders. I ran the up date and it fixed the zoom problem. However I bought this for a trip to India and when I got there the unit would only record for a few sec and then shut its self off. I dont know if the xray or anything else could have made it mess up because it was working before I left. All in all its the best compact camcorder out!

Reviews.Title: No regrets purchasing this one!
Reviews.Author: Heather Mclaughlin
Reviews.Content: Like it all, except that it doesn't come with a memory card and the sound is very soft.

Reviews.Title: Nice little recorder
Reviews.Author: Short
Reviews.Content: For the price, this is a nice little recorder.  I believe the craze of these HD pocket recorders is on the rise and this is a good place to begin.  I bought an external mic, haven't used it yet, we'll see how it works.

Reviews.Title: Cool Toy
Reviews.Author: M. R. Figueroa
Reviews.Content: Overall, I am very happy with this purchase. It is not the best HD camera, you could pay $600 for something much better, but I think the price was excellent considering its an HD pocket camera, and does record very nice 1080p videos. Compared to other HD pocket cameras, I think its the best one based on it features and performance. Lighting and zoom are an issue, but there is an system update available online that does a nice job fixing some jitters, especially the zoom, which was really awful at first. There is no case for this camera and this is a big problem for me because if its a pocket cam, intended to be carried around in your pocket, the lens and the glossy body, get all the furry particles and dust from your pockets. Its been hard to find a case that will fit in you pocket, most of them are small since digital cameras and phones are getting tinier and tinier, so I would really like to see a case for this cam that will still allow you to fit it in your pocket. Other than that, video is great, but loses quality if you zoom in too much, something I hope the nex firmware update can fix.[...]

Reviews.Title: Nifty Camera
Reviews.Author: Ronald Kuchera
Reviews.Content: I received this camera as a gift and just love it!  I take it everywhere I go and the small size is very handy.  Movie quality is excellent.

Reviews.Title: Great camcorder for a great price
Reviews.Author: BethNC
Reviews.Content: I looked at this camera and at several of the Flip options.  I settled on this one because it seemed to have addressed some of the shortcomings of the Flip and generally to have more features for the money.This is my first video camera.  I didn't want long, boring family videos that would collect dust, but I did want to capture little moments in my newborn son's life to share with family (via Facebook and DVD) and to keep for the future.So far, this camera is exactly what I wanted -- it is tiny, intuitive to use, and full of features (given its size and price).  I have found installing the software and uploading clips to Facebook to be very easy.  One really cool feature is that the USB connection flips out of the side of the camera -- no need to carry/remember it to upload software/video clips.  The picture quality and the sound are very good so far.Definitely buy a memory card.  The internal memory held one 10-second video clip only.

Reviews.Title: Kodak Zi8 HD camera reveiw
Reviews.Author: laminate21
Reviews.Content: I have had the Kodak Zi8 for almost 2 months now, and am very happy with it.  It replaced an older JVC mini dv camcorder.  The picture quality is very good.  The widescreen aspect ratio, compared to the old format is awsome.  I can't get over how crisp and clear the videos are on my HD tv.  The low light videos of my daughters birthday are great. Since it slips into my shirt pocket, i take it everywhere, and now have lots of videos that I would never have taken with the older, larger camcorder.  No sound problem, as the sound works great.  My advise is buy it, you wont' regret it for the money.  A more expensive camcorder will not get you a better picture, just a better zoom lens.  This lens is fine for what it's intended for.

Reviews.Title: Great, unless you're editing with Sony Vegas
Reviews.Author: D. Wendt "dwendt"
Reviews.Content: Pros: clear image rendering.  The image stabilization is no joke; it's awesome.  Lots more settings.  Just fantastic video quality for the price, outdoors at least.Cons: on/off harder to use than the Flip's and a longer lag time to power up. You'll need to update the firmware. Also, NOTE: the Zi8 generates .mov files, which if you live in PC-world and plan to edit using your new Sony Vegas software will leave you scrambling to buy new software.  :-p

Reviews.Title: Good quality, needs some more functionality
Reviews.Author: B. Spears
Reviews.Content: Having the ability to control the focus would be a nice feature add. The low-light capability leaves something to be desired as well. Overall it is a good camera if you have a well-lit subject and use a tripod. Really nice picture quality. Wish that the camera had more onboard memory from the manufacturer for the price!

Reviews.Title: This camcorder is excellent
Reviews.Author: Gem
Reviews.Content: // To view this video download Flash Player (version 9.0.115 or higher)'); } } catch(err) { fp_resizePlayerSpace('cv_38857791', 0, 0); } return false; } function _cv_38857791loadSwf(movieID, playerVersion) { var swfLocation = "http://g-ecx.images-amazon.com/images/G/01/am3/20120510035744301/AMPlayer._V148501545_.swf"; var swfWidth = "320"; var swfHeight = "100%"; var flashVersion = "9.0.115"; var bgColor = "#FFFFFF"; var swfParams = {}; var flashParams = {}; var embedAttributes = {}; swfParams.amazonPort = "80"; swfParams.allowFullScreen = "true"; logTag.type = "text/javascript"; logTag.src = "/gp/customer-media/du/log.html?ie=UTF8&p=CustomerImage&s=CustomerVideoPlay"; head[0].appendChild(logTag); } if (cv_38857791currentClick) { return cv_38857791currentClick(); } } } Length:: 0:13 MinsI bought this camcorder on urge expecting to realize my 10 years old daughter cinematography interest but after testing it I planned to have another one for my self. Am I wrong!! This little camcorder has all the feathers of my need. It produces amusing and excellent video and pictures, easy to use and pocket size to carry everwhere. The sound quality is fine too. Firmware updating is kind of difficult. I followed all the steps at web but can't figure it out.

Reviews.Title: Good camera ...tough firmware update
Reviews.Author: Desert Heat
Reviews.Content: I had the Vado HD camera and was happy but felt it would be a better camera if it had a stabilizer. When I noticed the new Kodak had that feature I purchased same. Love the various options the camera gives you with choice of picture resolution. The camera does take a bit better picture and my shaking hand does not show nearly as much as it did with the Vado HD.The only part I feel could be more "user friendly" is the updating of firmware. Would like to see them provide their firmware updates with the usb conection provided on the camera rather than loading the data to a card and then inserting it into the camera. Had a tough time gettingh the update on the card.

Reviews.Title: Zi8, not ready for prime time
Reviews.Author: J. Watts
Reviews.Content: I just got my Zi8 yesterday direct from Kodak, and after some test videos with the camcorder in both 720p, 720p 60fps and 1080p, it's going back to Kodak. Here are my problems:1. Electronic Image stabilization makes the video very unstable, a constant quivering in the lower left and right corners at all resolutions.2. God Awful high pitched whining noise in all videos when the internal mic was used.3. Very hard access to the SD card slot, you have to have nails to get it open.4. Feels very fragile in your hands.I really wanted to like this product and I was very excited when I heard it was shipping. I love the concept, but trust me, this camcorder isn't ready for prime time. It needs more refinement in my opinion. By the way, my Zi8 came with firmware version 1.01.

Reviews.Title: Terrible Software, External Mic Not Lined Up With Video
Reviews.Author: DSH
Reviews.Content: The hardware design of this camcorder is very good.  I bought it for the HD and the external mic function.  Recording is easy but when you try to edit the video on the computer, it is very counter-intuitive and extremely user un-friendly.  Coming from Flip, which makes editing so easy, this proprietary Kodak software is just a nightmare!!!  You can't view your Zi8 video with other generic software and the software that comes with the camcorder -- for lack of a more civilized word -- simply sucks.Also the video does not always line up with the sound coming in from the external mic.  Sometimes it's ok, sometimes there is delay.  Sometimes the video is choppy.  Plus the quality control is questionable because my charger will not charge.So back it goes!  I will not waste my money on this.  I'm buying the Flip HD instead even though it does not have the external mic fuction.

Reviews.Title: Bugs? slow customer support from Kodak
Reviews.Author: K. Bell
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera in August and have only used it a few times.  I tried to video some tree removals at my house and the files managed to intersect each other somehow and I wound up with split pictures.  When I went to Arizona last December the camera kept freezing up on me and also doing those split pictures.  When I used it this May for my grandson's eighth birthday it wouldn't take pictures, it wouldn't turn off and it became very hot to the touch.  I thought the battery was going bad when I kept getting the internal memory full message.  I ordered a new battery and replaced the original one.  Not the problem.  I had a 32 gb sd card in the camera and it bypassed the card to put 5 pictures and one two second video on the internal memory.  This camera is painful and the response time from KODAK inadequate.  I have since purchased a sony camera to replace this monster and am returning the camera to KODAK today for repair.  (They won't replace it or give me my money back.  I could go through Amazon maybe but I want KODAK to know about this shoddy work.)  I would not recommend or repurchase this camera.

Reviews.Title: worth it for the right price
Reviews.Author: PC Mountain
Reviews.Content: Pros: small, lightweight, easy to use, good battery power & video quality (in the non-HD mode which is what we use), decent audio quality, expandable memory (lots of storage capacity)Negatives: In the HD setting you have to use a tripod or hold it very still and move it slowly or else it appears shaky, overall I'm not sure the video quality is any better than what I get on my camera, the zoom function is just okay.Bottom Line: it was worth the $180 we paid and I'd buy it again at that price but not for any more.

Reviews.Title: Faulty for a second time around.
Reviews.Author: Wicked Buddha
Reviews.Content: Now on my second Zi8. The first Zi8 had a faulty mic and was returned for a replacement, received replacement over 2 months later.As far the second Zi8 goes, mic may work properly but the camera does no charge. After a couple of hours on chat with Kodak customer reps the unit has to be sent in for repair, on a BRAND NEW camera. Kodak expects the customer to pay to fix a BRAND NEW camera. Which is obviously ridiculous. Not wanting to wait another how many months for another replacement from Amazon, and after a few emails back and forth with Kodaks Director of Customer reps, they have set me up to send the camera in free, provided I have a box it can be shipped back in.So far, I have no idea i this is a good product or not, simply because I have yet to receive a Zi8 that worked properly.

Reviews.Title: Avoid Like the Plague
Reviews.Author: A. Taft "Technophile"
Reviews.Content: I bought this camcorder 6 months ago, to capture the special moments as my young daughter grows up.It has turned into the worst tech product I have ever owned. And that's saying a lot... I'm a gadget guy, I custom build computer systems, I've played with a ton of tech.The unit stopped working correctly two months ago. I left it on the shelf for a while, then last night I tore through the 'net looking for how to fix it. Could it be the SDHC card? I used an Amazon Basics Class 10 on it. That probably isn't it. I formatted it on my windows system, then let the camcorder format it itself. Twice.It can no longer record video longer than ~30 seconds. It freezes and loses the entire video. What a piece of junk. No wonder Kodak is going downhill... this product can't even do the sole function it was designed for. A total rip off, avoid it like the plague.

Reviews.Title: Pricing?? Huh?
Reviews.Author: L. D. Smith II "deved"
Reviews.Content: In Feb 2011 I bought this camera from Amazon for $99. My how things change! The only real difference between this camera and any Flip/Bloggie style - and the primary reason for my purchase - is that it has an external microphone input.

Reviews.Title: Zi8 Review
Reviews.Author: Zi8 Reviewer
Reviews.Content: Though I am a novice with video equipment, I an very pleased with my purchase. I would recommend the Kodak Zi8.

Reviews.Title: Total Waste of Money AND TIME
Reviews.Author: dd
Reviews.Content: The reviews suggested this was the camera to buy for my upcoming vacation. Compact, ease of use, price, et., etc.First Issue: You don't simply remove the media card and plug and play on your computer. Although the video files are there the computer (HP Touchsmart/Vista Home Premium) does not recognize them, nor does Windows Media Center. So now you have to search out a media conversion software... OK... Search out and download VLC Media player software, I should be set.Second Issue: I went out and shot some test clips. The lens is not "normal". To get a decent shot of what you want set the camera on full wide angle and walk back 20 feet, then MAYBE you'll get a decent, full framing of your subject matter. For what I'd be shooting, I'd never have to use the telephoto.Third Issue, Even with "stabilization" ON, and full wide angle, hand-held shots are bouncing all over the place. Note, I can shoot a SLR, hand held, down to 1/8 sec., without blur, so it's not my hands causing the problem, it's solely due to the Kodak camera and lens.Fourth Issue: Back on the computer and I find no simple way to edit the clips.
