Again, Windows Movie Maker doesn't read the files and VLC doesn't make it easy to basic editing (merge clips), if at all.Fifth Issue: The Kodak Z8i continually freezes up. The ON-OFF button doesn't even allow turn off. You have to remove the battery over and over again.IMO this camera is JUNK.

Reviews.Title: Looks nice, works poorly
Reviews.Author: cbpearson3
Reviews.Content: I heard great things about the Kodak Zi8 so i bought one. I didnt realize the captured video would only be useable in certain environments - it creates a *.mov file - that absolutely nobody uses. I could not get it to make a *.wmv file or something that I could convert to *.WVM.  It now sits on the shelf in the box. Wanna buy it from me?

Reviews.Title: "Refurbished" shouldn't mean "Broken", don't buy from New Harbor
Reviews.Author: Alex
Reviews.Content: This camera was sent to me with a broken recharging port, so whenever I plugged the camera into the wall the battery did not recharge. A red light is supposed to come on when the camera is plugged in and charging, but nothing happened when I did this. I thought it might be a faulty battery, so I bought a brand new battery and once the power ran down I plugged the camera into the wall and it would not recharge.After doing my own trouble-shooting and becoming really frustrated, I emailed New Harbor (the company I bought the Zi8 camera from) asking if I could return or exchange the camera for one that works. New Harbor told me to contact Kodak directly to figure out what is wrong with the camera. So I spent an hour on the phone with Kodak trying to figure out what is wrong and they told me to send it in for repairs. I sent it in 2 weeks ago and haven't gotten it back yet.New Harbor, aside from sending out faulty products, has no sense of customer service. Instead of allowing me to return the product, they told me to figure it out on my own. I will never buy anything from them again and recommend no one else does either, unless you like to gamble with your money.

Reviews.Title: AWESOME
Reviews.Author: becca873
Reviews.Content: I really like this camera.It is really worth the 99 dollars u pay on Amazon. The picture quality isn't great but the video quality is really nice. Overall, I really would recommend this camera to someone.

Reviews.Title: TWO STRIKES YOU'RE OUT!!!!
Reviews.Author: KHICKS
Reviews.Content: This camera was rated 4 stars out of 571 reviews, so I thought statistically I would NOT receive a second crappy camera.  I was initially interested in this camera for student project in my classroom.  Another staff member had purchased a FLIP video camera with good results except for the audio quality if the video was shot from more than a few feet away; the Zi8 was one of two pocket c.corders on market with mic jack, which would be better for intereviews(I thought). The first camera seemed simple enough for a kid to use, HOWEVER when it came time to upload software and video from USB plug on camera, no go! I tried it on THREE different PC's with Windows 7, and the camera turned itself on and then off.  I contacted Kodak through chat and through a 30 minute waste of time, the rep informed me what I'd already figured out 5 minutes into the chat---the camera was a piece of crap! I had already received a charger, mic and silicon sleeve for the camera, but checking into things a little more found out I could use earbuds for a mic, so I returned the camera and mic, and ordered another Zi8 to replace it. I received the second camera and it DID THE SAME THING!!!When you get on the Kodak website, I found they didn't beat around the bush like the chat, I clicked problem and it informed me right away this is a problem you can't fix yourself.NO Kidding!  Kodak,what happened to you?  Your rep has totally gone in the trash for me and thankfully Amazons policy is to give me a refund. No more Kodak products for me ever.

Reviews.Title: I have THREE of these Cameras
Reviews.Author: Rex Turner
Reviews.Content: This will be an oddball review.  I apologize for it in advance but it is all true.I am an electrical engineer that designed automotive, handheld & aviation GPS systems for consumer electronics for over 20 years.  I'm sure a number of you reading this will own products I designed.  So I guess you could say I am a technical user.I initially ordered one camera.  You can get all the pros and cons from other reviews.  In my opinion, the Zi8 is great for what it is.  The external Mic was a must for my applications.  The original camera worked fine. I was happy enough to order more.I ordered two more cameras from Amazon because I wanted one for my wife and one for a teleprompter.  (I am now a full time internet marketer and use the Zi8 for online videos.)My order was for 4 items.  Two cameras, a battery and an SDHC card.  The cameras came in the battery and the SDHC card never did.  Strike one for Amazon.Of the two Zi8s that came in 1 was defective upon arrival.  One was fine.  I saw a picture on the defective one for about 2 seconds...literally.  I got a replacement sent from Amazon immediately no problem and the defective camera is replaced.  Kudos to Amazon for such quick turn around.Unfortunately, it took a MONTH to get the battery.  The SDHC card never came in.  It still shows in route from 2 months ago from the tracking info on them. I called the battery company (Thememstore) & was told "nothing they could/would do about it."  Great customer service.  Amazon did resend the SDHC card, overnighted it and I got it.  As I said the original SDHC card NEVER came in.Next I got billed for never returning the defective camera.  Only problem is I did and have all the tracking info to prove it.I call customer service to straighten it out and get someone from who knows where (India?) and she didn't even know how the return policy worked & I could hardly understand her.  Good grief! Strike two and three.  I got off the phone and still don't know what she said.  I will wait to see if my credit card got charges reversed.Happy with the Zi8s.  Not totally happy with Amazon.  I am a prime customer and have MANY orders with them.  So I MUST say this is the first order they have messed up and they TOTALLY messed this up front to back.  Hopefully this is not a new trend because I love Amazon and have always gotten fantastic products at fantastic prices with fantastic service.So don't be scared of the Zi8.  It is a fantastic camera and anybody can have a defective product.  I know.  I am satisfied with all three cameras ESPECIALLY for the fantastic price!Rex

Reviews.Title: If It Weren't a Little Black Video Camera I Would Marry It and Have Its Babies
Reviews.Author: Femme Fatale
Reviews.Content: This is an adorable video camera that I was able to use right from the box.  It is perfect for those who are not particularly computer savvy.  The Kodak Instruction Guide is clear and easy to follow, but, if truth be told, most of the features are able to be easily intuited.  I had the most difficulty with opening the SD slot (which is actually quite easy, since it slides off), since I kept thinking I needed to pull something out.  I shot some video of my daughter, downloaded it to the computer and then to Facebook without a problem.  Downloading was a breeze, since the camera comes with a slideout USB.  Very convenient.  Did I mention how cute it is? Can't wait to take this on my cruise.  The only flaw I can discern is the inability to adjust to lowlight.  I had a higher-end camera that could do that, which is very useful for nighttime soccer games and such, but it was so big that it made it a chore to take anywhere. It was also a lot more expensive.  With the Zi8, I can put it in my purse and go. At $129 bucks, this is a great little device.  I'm a fan.  Moreover, when the UPS driver screwed up my order, and accidentally delivered my device elsewhere, Amazon provided hassle-free customer service and shipped me a new one out right away.  I can't think of a company that provides this stellar level of customer service.  In sum: awesome device, spectacular customer service.

Reviews.Title: HD Quality Option Doesnt Work Always
Reviews.Author: Awn Rizvi
Reviews.Content: This is a nice handy looking toy with good features if they all worked good for me. But they didnt. I could only capture in low web quality mode or it would freeze or would refuse to tape the vids. I had to turn off and on back again to make it work. The two/three days I had this cam, I could only use for lowest res vid shooting.

Reviews.Title: The Kodak ZI8............
Reviews.Author: Just Saying "Just Saying"
Reviews.Content: This is a nice little camcorder that takes good video with sufficient sound. But, what I don't like about is- how it gets hot when in use. When I'm using it without a tripod, I can feel it getting hotter and hotter in my hands. Other than that it's pretty ok!

Reviews.Title: Cool Video Camera
Reviews.Author: P. Angell "Doc"
Reviews.Content: The Zi8 is a very easy to use video camera. The HDMI output connects straight into my 1080p TV and the video picture is great. The camera software is average, gives you the basic features. I use a extended USB cable to connect to the USB port or just remove the SD card and install it into the PC. The video picture on 720, 720@60 or 1080 looks great. Not a lot of difference between 720 and 1080. The file size is about the same for 720 and 1080? The difference may be due to 1080 mode has a smaller field of view than 720 mode. It can be charged by using the USB on the PC or buy the charger power supply. The power supply can also run the camera for those long family events. Works very well on a tripod. In camera mode the pictures look bad (again needs a tripod).Good points - small, light, easy to use, good video picture, good display, OK battery life.Bad points - poor zoom, must hold very still, does not replace a camera.

Reviews.Title: Kodak Zi8
Reviews.Author: C. Manns "C Manns"
Reviews.Content: Love my new Zi8. I only use it for simple family videos. Great for recording the kids, the pets etc. It is very easy to use and does not feel like the hassle that a bigger vidoe recorder is. I can just grab it and go. I don't have to worry about tapes, batteries and the like. I have not attempted to put the recordings on to my computer yet. I am looking foreward to using this great little camera on my trip tp Europe. Oh and the still pictures are GREAT!! Overall very happy with the purchase. I would buy it again in a minute!!

Reviews.Title: Good Quality Camcorder
Reviews.Author: SM1983
Reviews.Content: I was looking for a small portable camcorder, something I can carry around without too much weight and of course great quality.  I came across this and I think it's great.  Video quality is clear and pictures aren't too bad either.  Uploading takes a while because I'm using the full 1080p quality, but that's not a surprise.  The software with this camcorder (can't remember the name) allows me to email these videos using windows live hotmail and that's great too, I can do all that while I have the program on.  I like it overall.

Reviews.Title: Kodak Zi8 pocket Video Camera
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer "kitteartha"
Reviews.Content: I bought this for a friend who likes to upload youtube videos.  I thought this was an amazing purchase considering the size, quality and price.  I was disappointed to find that the files were not compatable with Windows Movie Maker causing the reciever of the videocamera not to be able to use it. I researched before buying and hadn't read about this problem.  So if you like to use Windows Movie Maker don't purchase this product.  The video camera does include software for movie editing. I would be interested in knowing if this software is as easy to use as WMM.

Reviews.Title: Excellent product
Reviews.Author: Lee Carter
Reviews.Content: It is hard to believe that such a small video camera has such great pictures.  Very easy to download the videos to your computer, and then upload your completed video to facebook or youtube.  Even my wife is posting videos of her horses without me sitting there showing her each step.  This alone is a great feature.  Great.  The video editing program that comes with it is very rudimentary, but that also translates to easy to use, and a very small, intuitive learning curve.  PCWorld rates this number one over the Flip, so buy with confidence.

Reviews.Title: superb quality
Reviews.Author: Robert kiri "jess"
Reviews.Content: I am surprised with the picture quality.. of course you can not compete with $ 3,000.00 cost camcorder. i am not a professional just needed for here and there.Also it has 5mp still photo feature. i can not not believe this little can be so wonder, absolutely love it and will recomened others to buy it.

Reviews.Title: Love it
Reviews.Author: Andrew Lyons "stcroixdrew"
Reviews.Content: For the money....ease..and portability..this is a nice little camera...great 1080 playback as well.....nice upgrade form the zi6.

Reviews.Title: VERY disappointed
Reviews.Author: G. Miller
Reviews.Content: Couldn't wait for it to get here. At the same time I ordered the camcorder I ordered a 32gb class 6 sd card. The two together cost some $$$'s.When you play the movies back there's jumps and stutters. That happens if you watch it on the camera screen, TV, or on the computer. So play back get's zero stars! It's just not what I expected from a brand name like Kodak. I'm not one to pack stuff up and ship it back, so i guess it will end up in a drawer someplace and collect dust. Bottom line, I'd say... Save your $$.It's back to my good old JVC mini dv camcorder.

Reviews.Title: great small digital video camera
Reviews.Author: Franz Kafka
Reviews.Content: I haven't fully put it through its paces, but so far it looks like a winner. . . .

Reviews.Title: Love it!
Reviews.Author: L.M.C.B
Reviews.Content: Love the picture quality and ease of use. This is my portable "camcorder" and I couldn't be happier with the product.

Reviews.Title: Great little camera -- great video quality and great value!
Reviews.Author: M. Hunt
Reviews.Content: If you want to record in HD, but don't want to spend an arm and a leg on a video camera, this is the camera for you. The quality is great -- looks good even when played on your HD TV, especially at 1080p -- and the camera is extremely easy to use.  It doesn't have a lot in the way of fancy features, but you don't really expect that for less than $200, do you?  If you want point and shoot ease with great affordability, this is the camera for you!  BTW, shop around -- I don't know what's going on with the price, but I got the raspberry one for $179.99 on Amazon a couple of weeks ago.

Reviews.Title: Crazy cool and functionally great.
Reviews.Author: Astrovium "Undauntable Pessimism"
Reviews.Content: Perfect little camcorder/camera for casual use. The quality is really good for what it is. There isn't a lot of forgiveness of low lighting, and the zoom is useless without a tripod, but I didn't expect much from either of those things in a camcorder this small.From where I sit, it's a gizmo worth having, and for the price I feel great about the purchase.

Reviews.Title: 3 weeks of use and really liking it
Reviews.Author: Rodney Black "Rodney"
Reviews.Content: The Zi8  is my first pocket video camera and I have not tried any others.  I have to say that I was impressed with the video quality from a video camera of this size.  I have already used it much more than I used my conventional camcorder due to the convenience of size.  The menus are easy to use, it turns on quickly and shooting video is  quite easy.  I have found that I like shooting at 720p/60fps in most situations.  I took some video of a night time radio control car race and was impressed with the fairly low light performance.  As long as I'm standing still, which covers 90% of my shooting needs, I have no issues with camera shake.  The colors look reasonably good, but not perfect.  I have had no issues with the internal mic (no high pitched noise that others have complained about).  I find the internal mic to be quite useful though voices far away are a little hard to hear.On the down side, the lens needs to be wider angle.  I find that I am constantly backing up to get everything I want in frame.  Also, when shooting in low light conditions, after zooming 3 or 4 steps the exposure goes dark.  I have learned not to zoom to far when shooting low light.  The digital zoom moves in steps.  It is not too bad when shooting something that is moving or when zooming in small increments, but when you go to full zoom while focused on a static object it is distracting.For the price and the size I am just loving this camera, and would recommend it to friends.

Reviews.Title: Not the Best Camera Available
Reviews.Author: Mediaman "TVviewer"
Reviews.Content: This video camera is a bit of a disappointment.  It has a REALLY small zoom button that is the same button that is used for on/off, which means that sometimes when you zoom it stops the recording.  It also did not have a card in it when purchased.  It doesn't focus well on close-ups.  And it runs on its own unique battery, which means if you fail to charge it you are stuck.On the positive side, it looks nice.  And the biggest plus is that it has an outside microphone plug as well as a place to attach to a small tripod.If I had to do it over again I wouldn't have bought it (the  cheaper Flip video camera is easier to use and usually captures a better picture).  This is a little pricey for what you get. Those that are giving this a five-star review must not have ever used another video camera.

Reviews.Title: Almost there
Reviews.Author: Mr-T
Reviews.Content: This camera is almost there. I know it's cute and small but it just doesn't get the job done.  I wanted it to be great and easy and it Almost was.----Look it comes down to the picture STABILITY.  Unless you use this camera on a tripod your picture will shake all over the place.  I think kodak has tried their best but I'm sorry it's not good enough.  Just Like the FLIP; stability is the main test.---Stay away from them if you want professional results; or valuable family memories.

Reviews.Title: Could be so much better
Reviews.Author: Ram "Deal Hunter"
Reviews.Content: I bought this (my first handheld compact camcorder) after I read a recent review that the latest firmware (1.06 at the time of writing this review) fixed issues with digital zoom issues and better low light recording. My first attempt at recording something was in an outdoor situation in the middle of they day with the camera mounted on the dash of my car. The camera performed ok but I did not feel the EIS (Image stabilization) was anything to write home about. The picture quality when I was stopped at red lights was decent but nothing comparable to my old Canon HV10 (both recording at 720p). The biggest letdown for me was when I took the camera to record my Daughter's recital (in an auditorium) where the stage was pretty well lit (at least that's what I thought). Since I was sitting right in the front row, I thought I will be able to get some good footage. The footage was adequate when I had it at no zoom. But the minute I zoomed even a little bit, it pix-elated like crazy and the resulting video had so many artifacts that the video looked terrible. The issue was compounded by the fact that the small screen did not show any noticeable issues (when recording) and I saw these issues after I got home and hooked up the camcorder to the computer to download the .MOV files. Boy, what a let down. Thankfully, I was able to sell the camera locally on craigslist. I will wait until someone comes out with true optical zoom lens on these compact camcorders at a reasonable price before purchasing a "compact" camcorder again. Back to my tried and tested HV10 for now.

Reviews.Title: It would be great If it wasnt Kodak
Reviews.Author: S. Njezic "the tec man"
Reviews.Content: Maybe I had a lemon . . .  Looked at a lot of reviews before making up my mind between the flip and ZI8. ZI8 has the 60FPS that the camera handles well. Kodak has an issue with the firmware they use and change it all the time. Their customer service is poor and they don't have any technical people and try to help you with scripted responses that DO NOT make any sense. Once again this might be an isolated issue but for now I will be returning to amazon and wait for the new flip, coming out next year with 1920x1280

Reviews.Title: almost perfect so far...
Reviews.Author: CylonCheese
Reviews.Content: I've had this for a couple of months now and so far it is 97% perfect. The only weak point with this camera is low light video recording. If the area or room is well lit or you are outside, no problem at all. This is a very minor issue though.I ordered a 32gb memory card at the same time I ordered the camera since that was the max it recognizes. I was interested in testing the maximum recording time on 1080p, so I did. I changed the settings to 1080p resolution on the menu, started recording, set it down in a room plugged in to the ac power and got a video over 16 hours long! I have not tested the battery life yet but I'm sure that's only in the couple hour range on a single charge.I have not experienced any of the sound problems others have described. It's working perfect so far and sound is clear with no background whine or buzz.The menu system is easy and fast to navigate. The built in mini HDMI port is very convenient. So far I would give 100% recommendation for this model.

Reviews.Title: THECHNICALLY, it's a camcorder...
Reviews.Author: Anna
Reviews.Content: So technically this IS a camcorder, however, I was greatly disappointed on many fronts - which I will address.Firstly, I am a stay-at-home mom and I think that the way in which I was hoping to use this camera is the way that 90% of consumers will be using it.  I wanted something that I could carry around and use to take quick videos of the kids and occasional pictures so that I would NOT have to carry around a separate small digital camera.  I wasn't expecting it to be like an $800 camera or anything, just simple and easy.  Here are my issues:Camcorder - It is a camcorder in the sense that it CAN take videos.  HOWEVER, you have VERY limited features in taking said videos (and even less in pictures).  The actual picture quality on the VIDEOS is wonderful.  I have no complaint there whatsoever.  My complaint is with the stabilization of the picture.  Unless you have the camera on a tripod, your picture is going to be shaky.  On playback (especially on a television) it actually makes you quite dizzy.  If you happen to be walking while shooting video, forget it.  You have to be as still as possible.  There is an image stabilization setting (it's either "off" or "on") which is useless.Still photos - This is where I have the biggest problem with this device.  Here is what I expected:  To just be able to get a clean image that can be viewed on a computer.  No big deal.  I know that there is no flash, fine - I'll take my pictures in well-lit areas; I know that I don't have ANY options for the lens (save landscape and macro mode) - fine I don't need a professional image, just a normal picture.  The problem is that any photo you take between 2-5 feet away is BLURRY!  Actually, a better description is probably fuzzy.  I took dozens of photos of my children - all of which looked fine on the tiny camera screen, but when I uploaded them onto the computer, they were completely useless!  They look exactly like a picture taken with a cell-phone.  All I want is a clean, clear image - nothing fancy.  When I contacted Kodak (on the phone for 1 1/2 hours) they told me to turn on the EIS (which was already on) and then they told me that they didn't know WHAT to tell me!  I even e-mailed them 4 separate examples of my photos and do you know what they said??  This:"...unfortunately this cannot be corrected by a repair. The Zi8 is a pocket video camera and its capability to capture still images is just an added feature on this video camera that other pocket camcorders does not have. The lens type of the Zi8 is limited to fixed focus only while the CCD total pixels is only 5.3 MP."So basically, they say that the quality of the camera is crummy.  It's funny because Kodak brags in all their descriptions about the still images like this: "Start bragging with amazing 5 MP, 16:9 widescreen HD still pictures".  All Kodak said to me was, "sorry, but if you need help in the future, let us know."  I NEED HELP NOW!It's disappointing because the video quality is great, but you just can't watch them afterwards because it's so shaky and obnoxious.  The sill photos are useless UNLESS it's a wide shot from 10 feet away or more.  The things I loved about this camera were the fact that you could plug it straight into the computer and it could even charge that way; I love that you can use memory cards instead of internal memory like the Flip camera; I liked the accessories that it came with (cables to hook it up to the TV).  I know that Kodak is coming out with another camera in September, but the description says that the still pictures are just 5MP just like their current models.  Too bad.  Maybe the picture stabilization will be better.By the way, I was able to return it to Amazon so I'll keep looking for a better product.  Thank you Amazon!!!!

Reviews.Title: not great
Reviews.Author: K. Papadakis
Reviews.Content: spent money but the picture is not good, sound of course terrible and now I still need another camera for my work. Save your time and money!

Reviews.Title: To expensive!!!!!!!!!!!
Reviews.Author: Trang Khanh Nguyen
Reviews.Content: I was watching this video for a good camera cause I'm a beginner on YouTube and when I looked at it I assumed it was like $150 but this is ridiculous

Reviews.Title: Ok
Reviews.Author: Todd D Heugly
Reviews.Content: I am a golf instructor and this product is good for recording on the golf course.  It records in Hi def at 60 fps, which is good for casual recording, but not hardcore in depth instruction.  Your smartphone will do the same job and you can download golf instruction apps.

Reviews.Title: This camera  heated up heavily out of the box.
Reviews.Author: A.Right "Nothing is what I seems. So check tw...
Reviews.Content: I just read in amazon.com that Kodak is phasing out its video camcorder dept. How come a camera that was less that half this price NEW and will have no support is now over $300? Mine cost me around $130 NEW, was not a year old when it went dead. I don't care about buying a battery if it is a dead battery case because I have bought batteries in the past and they either don't charge or arrive defective. So... I may have to buy another camcorder or risk buying a battery ($25 +)  and find out it doesn't work with a new battery or/and find out that the battery is a piece of junk.This camera  heated up heavily out of the box. After recording a few seconds it was so hot I had to turn it off for fear of it  getting damaged. so I seldom used it. The video is great and I shot good videos in outdoors and indoors. Stills were not that sharp, its a camera made for video.  The menu is not that user friendly and I had trouble changing between different resolutions. In Summary, I don't recommend it and would not buy another Kodak pocket camera.

Reviews.Title: SD SDHC CARD CONFUSION?  -IMPORTANT READ-
Reviews.Author: Richard Feynman
Reviews.Content: Here is how you can figure out exactly what kind of SD/SDHC card you need for your device!Someone stated on here it's about 9 megabits per second or just a little over 1 megaBYTE per second.  That's pretty close.  A class 2 SDHC card writes at a MINIMUM of 2.0 megaBYTES per second (or 16 megaBITS per second).  A lot of people are getting the two different units of speed confused, and it is confusing to the novice.These are not super high end products they are consumer grade and the video bit rate of the 720p/1080p is around 9 to 12 megabits per second.  You can DO THE MATH yourself.  Here's how:1) Format your SD card in your camera2) Select either 720p @ 60 fps / 1080p (they'll give you roughly the same)3) Write down how much time on a BLANK SD card you will have in minutes (example 1:33 would be 93 minutes)4) Write down how many gigabytes you have and multiply it by 1000 (the cards are 1000 megabytes per GB not 1024)5) take the number of megabytes and divide it by the number of MINUTES6) take this number and divide it by 60 (to get it in seconds)7) The NUMBER you have is how many MEGABYTES / SECOND your device ESTIMATES it will write at.NOTE) The actual data rate (the number you got) can be slightly more or a lot less depending on compression.My device tells me it will write 1.48 MEGABYTES / SECOND.  This translates to a Class 2 SDHC card (which write at 2.0 MEGABYTES / SECOND MINIMUM).See guys and gals?  NOT TOO SHABBY!!!

Reviews.Title: Easy Peasy Lemon Squeezy
Reviews.Author: Haunted_lady "Singing Siren"
Reviews.Content: You want easy, quick, basic something your parents or your child can figure out because their are not ten million features  or you want something no frills get this!See reviews below talking about the used of the HD memory card for longer movies and the upgrades for mic problems other than this it is an amazing little camera.We took it with my older Cannon on a trip to Montana and on a swing bridge in high winds it did an awesome job. The pictures were better than my Cannon, more vivid and colors are more to life and vivid instead of muted like Cannons colors are.You can edit your stuff later you do not have to do it in your camera more time to have fun. Love the fat you can put in a huge memory card and have no limitations.. Great to keep on you for joting  down ideas if you are a creative person like the person I bought it for :) Taking a video of you paying a song, painting,humming lyrics whatever whatever...It is so easy to use and the buttons don't get you lost in the "doing" of the machine but in the creating of the act which is how it should be.

Reviews.Title: Not what I expected
Reviews.Author: Fish Sticks
Reviews.Content: I purchased this Zi8 around Christmas and can honestly say I am thoroughly disappointed with it. The recording quality of the videos isn't as great as it is made out to be. If you dare shoot in micro mode you must be within an extremely close proximity of your target to get clear footage. I just personally expected so much more from this camera based on the superb reviews it received. Unfortunately I cannot trust the judgment on Amazon's behalf for all products. All in all, this purchase was a huge let down.

Reviews.Title: Stopped working
Reviews.Author: Louis C. Gardella "Lou (Guitar Man)"
Reviews.Content: I used this camcorder about a dozen times. It was never dropped or mishandled in any way. When I went to use it recently it would not turn on. I made sure the battery was charged. I had bought extra batteries when I purchased the camcorder and they were fully charged and tried but no luck. The camcorder will not turn on. I don't know if other people have had the same problem because this has got to be a defect!!

Reviews.Title: Defective upon receipt....
Reviews.Author: PJD "smart shopper 30144"
Reviews.Content: On Fri. Feb. 11, I read the book and inserted the battery in the camera and plugged in the wall charger after double checking connections. It is supposed to charge in 2 hr. or thereabouts at which time, the red charging light goes out to let you know the battery is fully charged.After being plugged in for almost 8 hrs.the red light was still on,so I unplugged the unit. Read a couple of reviewers who have had this same problem. Turned out to be defective circuitry in the camera's charging system.I'm returning the camera. I will not replace.I ordered this camera so I could record an important community meeting on Tues. Feb. 15th. That will now not be possible. No time for a replacement to get here. I will have to borrow a camera I guess. Just did not count on a defective camera.....

Reviews.Title: Great little camera
Reviews.Author: James Porter
Reviews.Content: Great camera.  Still learning all the features.  It takes SD cards and because it is HD so it will fill them up fast.  Good thing I have an SD Card case from eporterinc.com.  It holds 3 cards and Itake it with me anywhere because it is always on my key ring.

Reviews.Title: Kodak Zi8 Pocket Camera Review
Reviews.Author: Willie0503
Reviews.Content: Camera is nice, portable, and takes excellent videos. Definitely a good camera for the money. The only reason why it gets 4 instead of 5 stars is because the internal memory is not good at all. It is only enough to take like a 2 second video or a few stills. You will need to purchase a decent SD card in order to use this camera at all. Other than that, excellent value.

Reviews.Title: Very good pocket size camcorder
Reviews.Author: Krish
Reviews.Content: I bought this one for my dad as a Christmas gift for $99. He wanted something that will fit in his shirt pocket. Sony Bloggie Touch and Flip UltraHD were very alluring choices, but my dad does not like fixed internal memory. Kodak Zi8 looked a very good alternative since it uses micro SD/SDHC.Just received it a few hours ago. Video quality looks good (viewed 1080p recorded video on Sony 1080p HDTV). (FYI: It takes about 124MB per minute in 1080p and about 73MB per minute in 720p mode.) Took a few camera shots. Don't look so very good. May be because just 5MP camera or low light condition (inside home in fluroscent lights at night time) in which I took shots?Camcorder build is good and is light weight. Buttons are somewhat inconvenient/small for my dad's thick fingers! Not an issue, just needs a little practice to get used to.Quicktime .MOV files generated of recorded videos. You need a free software like Any Video Converter to convert them to DVD-NTSC/PAL or mp4/avi so that you can burn to a DVD or transfer to mobile devices.Seems like my dad (me too) will be happy with the choice I made.Will update the review if I have any more information.

Reviews.Title: THE BEST FOR THE PRICE
Reviews.Author: Victor
Reviews.Content: If you compare the price of this camera and the quality you will notice this is the best choice. Excellent product!!!

Reviews.Title: great little video camera
Reviews.Author: K. Schomberg
Reviews.Content: Great little video camera for the price.  Takes very high quality video.  On board audio is okay, but it gives the option of an external mic if you want to improve the audio on your videos.  It also takes 5.0 mp digital pictures.  All in all a nice little camera.

Reviews.Title: Kodak Zi8 pocket video camera
Reviews.Author: James T. Cook
Reviews.Content: IN ALL, I PURCHASED 6-- ALL WERE GIVEN AS GIFTS,I HAVEN'T RECEIVED ANYTHING BUT POSITIVE COMMENT.

Reviews.Title: sent it back
Reviews.Author: picguy
Reviews.Content: The video quality was terrible when loaded on to a cd. The sound was inaudible. Plus I had to buy a memory card as the memory it comes with is worthless. I returned it.

Reviews.Title: Nice camera, but has limitations
Reviews.Author: Fat Fritoman
Reviews.Content: The advertized free battery did not come. You also must buy a SDHC memory card or you will not be doing much filming without one. I wish the sound playback was louder. Unfortunately there is no speaker or headphones out jack.When filming I could find no way to pause. Downloading to my laptop was easy. I have not yet figured what the macro switch does.All in all I like this little camera for the money. Picture quality is not pro quality. My SLR's are for that. This is a fine carry around camcorder.

Reviews.Title: Not bad, but could use improvements....
Reviews.Author: jpogar
Reviews.Content: Owned this for a week but ultimately sent it back to Amazon for a refund.  A lot has already been said about this product so I won't bore you with same details.  Here's my specific thoughts:Good:Larger display than competitors;Like the controls and button layout;Easy software interface;External microphone jack (big plus);Video quality was good in outside, bright light.Bad:Did not perform well for me in low light, very grainy images;Audio had a "tape hiss" sound to it even when using a high quality, external mic;SD card was cumbersome to eject because of attached rubber cover.Don't get me wrong, this is a decent camera and very comparable to the Flip product, even better if you need an external microphone.  However, I shoot often in low light or indoor light and just didn't work for me.

Reviews.Title: Kodak Zi8 : Hardware ok.  Software/Firmware/Customer Service HORRIBLE
Reviews.Author: S. Smith
Reviews.Content: From a hardware point of view, the Zi8 is a good product.  Unfortunately Kodak's firmware, the software that runs the video camera, is as buggy as hell and so what you get is a $175 doorstop.  Zooming in and out in the high-def mode causes a variety of glitches to your video the most freaky is a jello-effect. (Google "Zi8 Jello" and watch the video.) Kodak is aware of these problems, but has chosen not to correct them.  Only after purchasing the Zi8 did I learn that Kodak has problems with earlier model the Zi6.  Those also went uncorrected.Do you really want to trust your precious family videos to a piece of hardware that might ruin the very images that you are trying to save?Learn from my mistake.  Go with the another product like the FLIP series.My first camera 30 years ago was a Kodak X-15.  This is the last time I ever purchase a Kodak product.  Sad to see another company fall by the wayside.

Reviews.Title: Video on the go
Reviews.Author: M. Kaufman
Reviews.Content: The picture quality and ease of use are excellent.  Our family has had a lot of fun with this camera because it is small enough to carry along almost everywhere we go....

Reviews.Title: Love it!
Reviews.Author: mom to 4
Reviews.Content: We love this thing! We use it all the time. It's the perfect size to tuck in your pocket and go. The only thing is that the video shakes when you don't use a tripod, especially with any kind of zoom. Also, it's a bit more expensive than the competitors, especially once you purchase the super-speed SD card. But my husband had to have the 1080p. . . I've used my sister's flip mino and I like that too. . .Lots of drama from Amazon about getting this thing in time for Christmas, but in the end, Amazon came through and I got it on 12/23!

Reviews.Title: So easy a caveman, or cavewoman can use it!
Reviews.Author: John E. Ainsworth "JohnDM90"
Reviews.Content: Really, it is soooo easy to shoot videos for my podcasts.Just plug & play...Remember, keep it on a solid tripodor you'll get HiDef shakes!Have fun!

Reviews.Title: almost it
Reviews.Author: Eileen A. Farr
Reviews.Content: If any other company made this camera it would be a 5 star winner in all categories. Unfortunately, it comes from Kodak. With a century of experience, the company clearly knows how to build a great product. However, it still hasn't learned about customer service, support or software. There is no editing software included. You can simply import the video in its proprietary format and send it to Facebook or two other social network sites. Suppose you simply want to string together a few clips, add a title, delete a bad spot in the video and email it. or that you need the competitor's lip camera which comes with great software and customer support. Forget about it with Kodak. The thinking behind the Zi8 (who came up with THAT catchy name ???)begins and ends with the hardware. With all the features built into the unit it outshines every other similar unit in the marketplace. But the team fumbled before they got to the goal line. One good firmware update and some decent editing software which includes easy email, and this is a complete winner. As it is currently, it's an almost great video camera.

Reviews.Title: Great Product
Reviews.Author: Feñita
Reviews.Content: Great for what it is meant to do: small HD camcorder, good res, great for quickly catching memories... But don't expect it to replace the big HD camcorders.

Reviews.Title: Kodak Zi8
Reviews.Author: John Hardy "Mallard"
Reviews.Content: The Kodak Zi8 is a well thought out pocket size video camera. It hassettings for HD 720p and 1080p, it's easy to use and takes great video and decent pictures. the software included with the video camera works great and you'll spend many happy hours taking videoof whatever.

Reviews.Title: Very easy to operate.
Reviews.Author: Kaye Currey
Reviews.Content: My wife wanted an easier to operate video camera. Have had a Sony minicam for years but she could never figure out how to operate or even have it ready when needed. The Kodak is very handy and only has 4 or 5 buttons to figure out and is sooooooo handy. The battery life is a couple of hours or so and we ran it for that after the first charge during Christmas and it was still working. It has hung up 2 times and we have had to take the battery out to get it to reset, but that is pretty much a normal for my wife who has the magical gift of touching computers or anything electronic and they do weird things.

Reviews.Title: Very good quality and portability
Reviews.Author: Ronnie
Reviews.Content: I got this for my husband for christmas and he loves it.  He is able to record video of his guitar playing when he brainstorms new ideas or riffs, anywhere.  It is very handy and easy use. The battery life is good, we got a 4 GB SDcard and it stores plenty before you need to upload, remember to get class 6 or higher SD card for quality and speed.  The only negative is that although it does zoom, the lighting must be bright inside for visible recording, outside is great. I even got one for my son who likes to make little movies with family members, from scripts that he writes.

Reviews.Title: good overall
Reviews.Author: Mark Twain "Huck Finn"
Reviews.Content: makes good video. looks nice. battery lasts enough. the biggest problem is that its zooming isn't very good and when you zoom while taking a video, it is not smooth. and i wish the software had more options for switching the video in more formats with various resolutions.

Reviews.Title: I love this camera
Reviews.Author: Brainhat
Reviews.Content: I'm pretty frank if I don't like something, but I really like this camera!  It powers up and down in a snap.  It's simple to use.  The video is very good--especially for a camera that fits in my pocket.  I take it everywhere and churn out videos.  I have had no complaints about quality or function.  I'm happy for Kodak too.  I thought they'd go the way of the buffalo when film became passe'.

Reviews.Title: henner2002
Reviews.Author: M. Stevens "dog lover"
Reviews.Content: Love everything about it but did have a little problem with downloading onto DVD off computor. Very easy to use, just point and shoot!

Reviews.Title: Amazing!
Reviews.Author: Jerry Kokich "Be Bold and Mighty Forces Will ...
Reviews.Content: THIS CAMERA IS AWESOME! I showed some friends some footage I shot, on a 50" HDTV and they couldn't believe it came from this tiny camera, and a Kodak to boot! I intend to shoot a feature film with the ZI8 (yeah, you'll be laughing out of the other side of your face when I start winning festivals!). The colors, the sharpness, simply amazing, and it is the currently ultimate Guerrilla Filmmaker's tool. You could shoot entire scenes without anyone knowing what you're doing, and if the authorities come around, no one is going to think you're doing anything other than playing with your new camera!Anyone who criticizes this under $200 camera that can shoot 1080p that looks like broadcast quality, and with a film transfer will look like 35mm, is an idiot.

Reviews.Title: kODAK zI8
Reviews.Author: Barry M. Schwartz
Reviews.Content: eXCELLENT IN ALL FEATURES EXCEPT THE DOWNLOADBLE SOFTWARE, YOU NEED TO GO ONLINE TO ARCSOFT MEDIA IMAGES TO GET FULL PACKAGE SO THAT YOU MOVE YOUR CREATED MOVIES TO DVD, ETC. INSTUCTION MANUAL IS SPARSE AT BEST.

Reviews.Title: upload problems
Reviews.Author: S. Mortimer
Reviews.Content: I like this camera but I have trouble uploading to facebook or even making a dvd or e-mailing some clips.  How can I get my videos out there to select relatives and friends?

Reviews.Title: Nice video cam
Reviews.Author: Joseph R. Fuentes
Reviews.Content: Great pocket videocam.I like the fact it's 1080p, so far the only one on the market that does this beating out Cico's Flip. It's small and does its job.However, it blurs when panning, has tiny built in memory and doesn't come with an external HDMI cable.  That, the lack of an HDMI cable, I see as its biggest drawback.On the wish list it would be great if it had optical zoom.For the price, a good deal.

Reviews.Title: NEWER MODELS ARE ALL UPDATED...EXCELLENT Zi8 ..READ THIS!!
Reviews.Author: Peter Sindo "BIGRUCK-US"
Reviews.Content: JUST TO IMFORM EVERYONE THAT THE MY Zi8 CAMERA I ORDERED ON THE 5TH  AND GOT ON THE 12TH IS ALL UPDATED WITH THE NEW FIRMWARE FROM KODAK AND WORKS GREAT..NO PROBLEMS WHAT SO EVER...SO FAR.....I THINK KODAK FINALLY GOT CAUGHT UP WITH ALL THE ISSUES. GREAT VIDEO CAMERA FOR $144.00 W/ FREE SHIPPING..BEST DEAL AROUND FROM AMAZON...I THINK IT WAS SENT FROM CLUTCHFIELD..AS INDICATED ON THE AMAZON LISTING. I ALSO WENT TO KODAK AND READ IN DETAIL ALL OF THE INFORM ON THE CAMERA..THE BOOKLET THAT CAME WITH THE CAMERA IS SHORT AND SWEET..GO TO KODAK AND SPEND A HOUR CHECKING ALL THE INFO ON THE CAMERA. ( SEE LINK BELOW)...I'M VERY HAPPY I BOUGHT ONE AND I'M GLAD I WAITED....[...]

Reviews.Title: Great Camera, but think about buying it elsewhere!
Reviews.Author: Keith Routley "NWChecker"
Reviews.Content: Great camera, but Amazon sent me one in packaging that had obviously been opened. Was it a used camera? Who knows and that's the point. If I'm paying for a new camera I want to know its new with sealed packaging. So I sent it back and asked for a NEW one. Got the same thing-packaging had been opened. I kept it b/c I couldn't wait, but next time I'm going elsewhere for electronics. You might want to do the same...

Reviews.Title: Just what I expected
Reviews.Author: Jonathan Lesser
Reviews.Content: You get great quality video under good light and pretty good quality under low light. I shot some video on a recent camping trip in sunny Shenandoah National Park that looked amazing on our HD TV. The Macro mode was a nice surprise too.My camera doesn't have any high pitch sound like other people have been complaining about. It's a very small and light camera, so of course there is a fair amount of camera shake. The biggest con for me so far is that Flickr doesn't yet support the Zi8 (or Zi6), but I was told it's coming in the future. In the meantime, HD uploads to YouTube and Vimeo worked fine.

Reviews.Title: Discontinued after I bought it
Reviews.Author: Karen W Bridgewater
Reviews.Content: I rated this two stars because the product was discontinued soon after I bought it and the night time pictures are beyond terrible

Reviews.Title: Excellent Service
Reviews.Author: Sue
Reviews.Content: Didn't actually get the product due to an illness, but the customer service from was excellent.  My account was refunded immediately.

Reviews.Title: If you edit...big warning
Reviews.Author: GIS Trainer
Reviews.Content: Great camera, great mov files. The problem is that this is a MAC format. If you want to EDIT it and you use WINDOWS then I have very bad news for you.

Reviews.Title: Absolute Garbage!
Reviews.Author: Sergio
Reviews.Content: This pocket cam is absolute garbage!  The picture quality is NOT HD - it's just flat out terrible.  My cell phone records better video than this thing.  Spend a little more and get something decent.

Reviews.Title: Bad in Low Light
Reviews.Author: Reysbro
Reviews.Content: You get what you pay for. It's basically ok as an all-round pocket HD cam, but low-light results are simply bad. I am trying to video family members indoors with average artificial light (e.g. ~180W / 6 sq.m) and the results are unacceptable. I'm getting better quality on my smartphone camera in these conditions.Outdoors in full hard light you get great results, but that's not what I bought this for.

Reviews.Title: Child proof
Reviews.Author: j chan
Reviews.Content: Gift for gifted 7yr old.  Exhanged the comparable Kodak [terrible].  Amazon handled the entire transaction swiftly.  Yeaaa, Amazon.

Reviews.Title: Value for money.
Reviews.Author: User
Reviews.Content: This product is loaded with features and its very easy to use. Amazing picture and voice quality.

Reviews.Title: No Internal Memory?
Reviews.Author: Ronald H
Reviews.Content: As I read and re-read the product literature, nowhere does it say how long it will record without "expansion memory".  I think this is a bit misleading, because you get a full 6 seconds of recording without "expansion memory".Unlike other devices, this one has no internal memory, so you must buy an external card --- sorry,  "expansion".  Not much help when you try to do recordings and don't have that expansion card because nowhere in the product description does it say "will only record 6 seconds without an expansion card".  I don't have problems with buying external memory - but say so in the product literature:  "Must purchase memory card".very frustrated.

Reviews.Title: Kodak Zi8 so for very good only had about a month
Reviews.Author: Charles L. Simpson
Reviews.Content: I can only review the way I have used this camera in the short time I have had it.

Reviews.Title: I hoped for better image quality
Reviews.Author: J. Gekov
Reviews.Content: Summary:  This camera is for people who don't care about image qualityImage Quality: The Kodak Zi8 image quality is quite poor compared to what I was hoping for.  If a camera is advertised as having HD video capability, then I would expect it to be less grainy and pixelated in average light conditions.  It performs very poorly in lower light conditions (e.g. inside a house).The image looks really good on the small screen on the camera itself, but on anything larger, such as my 46" plasma, it makes me want to dig my eyes out with a spoon.  I have not tried the still image function and don't plan on wasting time using thie Zi8 as a still camera.Ease of Use: It is pretty easy to use and turns on quickly.Image Stability: Also, the camera is supposed to have image stabilization, but it seems that the IS doesn't help.  I have a steady hand and make great effort to keep my panning smooth and my still shots steady, but I think that since the lens is in the same plane as my hand (picture the difference between the longer, larger video cameras vs. the little flat ones like the Zi8 and flip), any slight shakiness in the hand transfers to the camera and this slight motion is exaggerated by the very quick radial velocity of the motion.  I thought about this for a while, because I just couldn't figure out why things were so jerky.  When I use a "normal", old school video camera with a hand strap, my shots are super smooth and stable- none of that Blair Witch jerkiness that makes it look like a toddler was filming.  Sure, it has a tripod provision, but I use the camera to capture quick moments and don't have time to set up a tripod.Bottom line is that you sacrifice SO MUCH quality for the convenience of the small size and ease of use.  It is my first compact video camera and my last, until the quality of compact CCD, lenses, and video processing produces an image that is pleasing to my eyes.

Reviews.Title: zi8 review
Reviews.Author: Richard L. Steele
Reviews.Content: video quality-exelent...picture quality lacking.in frame capture mode off video stills came out better.

Reviews.Title: just ok
Reviews.Author: Makio Sato
Reviews.Content: I've got a baby on the way, and thought that this small unit would be perfect. Its super portable, i can carry it in my pocket to catch any moment. While that is all true, be warned that the image quality is only good on a computer monitor, and even full screen sucks. If you view on a 20" monitor or bigger, it is very grainy. The motion is very poor as well. If your pan across your room, it is VERY choppy, even at the highest setting.IS this a good replacement for a real camcorder? probably not. But because of its portability, you will be able to catch all the little moments that you normally wouldn't, because you don't carry your bulky camcorder everywhere you go.I don't have any real experience with any other HD mini cams. But because its considered HD, i expected a lot more. I won't return it because its convenience and relatively cheap price, although i've considered it, but i now know I need to spend the big bucks a real camcorder as well.So i guess its all in what you're looking for. This will make due, but definitely not a replacement.

Reviews.Title: Not what I was looking for...
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I purchased this after returning the Aiptek HD pocket camcorder.  The Kodak was easier to use (menu settings) and took instant pictures without any delay like the Aiptek's.  However, the picture quality was fair to okay in daylight; terrible in low light situations.  Also had no flash capability.  Video was same as pictures.  I returned it after a couple of days and purchased a Nikon Coolpix S570 which is what I probably should've gotten first.  My digital camera stopped working so I was looking for decent photo quality with video capability.  I have a five year old and wanted to have something light and easy with me at all times.  It depends upon what your purpose and intention is for these cameras.  The reviews all seemed positive and that's what pushed me in this direction.  I feel they were a bit misleading.

Reviews.Title: Don't be blindsided! Great camera, crap software!
Reviews.Author: C Wren
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera to film some video clips for a business presentation. The camera is great - wonderful picture quality and sound.  Super easy to use, right out of the box. That's where it all ends. It records in a format that ONLY Kodak's ArcSoft Media Impressions software can open and read. The software downloads for free the first time you upload video to your computer. Then you're on your own. This is where "ease of use" goes straight downhill. There is no help button, no "getting started" - nothing. The software is not intuitive either. When you go to the ArcSoft website, all they try to do is sell you an upgrade. The FAQs are a joke, and support is only available for the upgrades. I was furious! After hours of trial and error,then searching websites for help, I finally found a set of tutorials on You Tube done by a woman for the Zi6.  She saved me! Then I had to watch all of the tutorials - time consuming, but worth it. There are some workarounds to get the video into a format that Windows will read but I had no luck getting them into Windows Live Movie Maker. I would not have purchased this camera if I had known it only worked with Kodak software. They should make it very clear up front. How can they make such a great camera and then tie it up with such lousy software? I would not recommend this camera until Kodak makes it compatible with other software.

Reviews.Title: Not ready for prime time?
Reviews.Author: Dave in Las Vegas "Dave"
Reviews.Content: I got this directly from Kodak.  Arrived in about one week.  I am less than pleased with it at this time.  It has different resolutions available to shoot with. In all but the 1080p mode (the highest resolution), the low light capability seems to have a problem with it. In low light when shooting with 720 and wvga modes, when you zoom in on something, the lighting decreases at about 1/3 zoom, stays low, until you zoom out, and then the light jumps back up, to brighter than where it was when you started.  I have posted an example of this on my website, I sent the link to the examples to Kodak, I am waiting for a response from them.  It is possible I have a faulty camcorder; if so, I will send it back and amend this review later once I get another one from them.  If I do not have a faulty camcorder, then they are going to need to do a firmware revision to fix this thing.  //8-26-09 After receiving no reply from Kodak after I went through the trouble to start a case # and post videos for them to look at, I am going to let you people look at my example video with what I think is a low-light problem in 720p mode (only). I am wondering if this is a problem with my camera or if others have it as well.  [...]

Reviews.Title: Choppy play - do not buy.
Reviews.Author: Rick Demings "Douglas Hatteras"
Reviews.Content: When videos are played, they are very choppy.Plus colors are not good.So essentially any video taken is "junk" using standard players (I'm on Ubuntu and Quick Time).But if you use Kodak's ArcSoft player, it's ok.So you are stuck with Kodak's player and they do this purposely.They want you to be "dependent" on their software -bad bad bad for us...This company really has a bad attitude towards consumers.Stay away.Don't believe half of the 5 star reviews too. They are written by Kodak.PS: I'll be trying Creative 3rd generation next week and will be back reporting.Stay tuned...

Reviews.Title: Good except for video quality
Reviews.Author: Blue Ridge
Reviews.Content: I have had my Kodak Zi8 for a few weeks now.  After reading the reviews, I was worried about the sound quality.  But the sound is fine.  The problem is video quality.  When I record indoors with fluorescent lighting, the video washes out in white and then returns to norm.  That happens about once per minute.  The video images are grainier than I expected.  The camera is logically designed, and very easy to use.  I wish that it had or came with some kind of protection for the lens.  One of the first videos that I shot went bad, and I lost it.  That's bad for me.  My videos are critical.  I formatted the card and have not had that problem since.  I got a Kodak SD card - just to be safe.  While disappointed about the video quality, I am happy with the camera overall.

Reviews.Title: Get the Zi6 instead
Reviews.Author: A. Petrone
Reviews.Content: I have had a Zi6 for a year and found it to be a great little camera. It has been used and abused but works like a champ. Wanted a second camera and figured I would get the latest model the Zi8. In this case I found the Zi8 a big disappointment. The Zi8 uses a Li-Ion battery verses the AA batteries used in the Zi6. With the Zi6 a pocket full of AA batteries kept you shooting video all day. I have two of the Li-Ion batteries and in 90 minutes I have discharged both batteries. The audio on the Zi8 has a lot to be desired. Bottom line: Get a Zi6 before they are all gone. In this case newer ISN'T better!

Reviews.Title: Missed the mark
Reviews.Author: B. Fuller
Reviews.Content: Cons are the same as a majority of the reviews. High pitched sound (adjusted the MIC gain and this helped but did not correct). Zoom happens in stages. Wider angle lens would be a big + in my opinion.Pros, image Stabilization is nice when you are recording video statically. I think a good overall value for a 1080p recorder.Will probably go back to the Creative Vado unless anyone knows of something coming soon that I should wait for. In any case this is already on it's way back to Amazon.

Reviews.Title: I would not Recomend
Reviews.Author: S. kang "USMC"
Reviews.Content: Somehow My 32gb SDHC is NOT compatible with this Kodak Zi8. Keep getting Memory Error.Terrible,1080p quality in Low Light setting..My Canon SD890IS 10MP Digital Camera does better in low light setting...Movie format is NOT compatible with Window Media Player(mpeg,avi), it use Quicktime.can't edit using Windows Movie Maker. I had to Convert Quicktime format to Mpge,avi.high pitch noise on most of videos I records,after talking to Kodak Live Chat Customer Service.Problem solve.(go to setting,and adjust Mic Volume to lowest setting)Image stabilization, is just OKAY,,it could be much better.Poorly written Manual..

Reviews.Title: this thing smells so bad.
Reviews.Author: ChristButt
Reviews.Content: This thing could definitely be the winner of the trilateral horse escarpment.thanks. amison..thanks os much amison : ////

Reviews.Title: Not worth it
Reviews.Author: meisenburg
Reviews.Content: I wanted to like this little camera.  Resolution was horrible!!  I tried all the different settings and none looked any good.  Had to return it.  Too bad because it's a great idea - haven't perfected it yet. . .

Reviews.Title: Not great for a mom
Reviews.Author: J. Davis "mom of two"
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera to replace a 10 yr old video camera that weighed a ton and therefore got limited use.  This camera is nice and small but just not what this mom of 5 was looking for.  It works great in bright light and on nice sunny days.  But I took it to my daughters dance class today (which i thought was well lite) and all it recorded were silhouettes and the volume is way to low.  It's nice that it fits in my purse, same sz as my iPhone, easy to plug it into tv, battery seems to last long, love the sd card as you aren't limited in the amount  you can record.  If only the lighting was better and volume was better it would be a good camera.  I don't know if I'll keep it or return it yet.  I wouldn't recommend it to a friend though.

Reviews.Title: Disappointing
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I am on a tight spot right now. The quality of the movies is horrible, though the still picture is even worse. I did my research before, including watching movie reviews etc. However, I was not expecting it to be so bad. I am not sure if I should keep this camera or not.The main point of buying this camera was portability. However, it is larger (and uglier) than my phone, ipod, etc. I do feel cheated for giving 100 bucks away and getting basically nothing useful in return.Would anybody have any suggestion of a small camera which can deliver good movies and still pics for under $300? Or it is impossible and I should just forget about it?

Reviews.Title: Would be great with optical zoom
Reviews.Author: Marc
Reviews.Content: This is a good product that with a couple of improvements would make it great.  First, a 3 or 4x optical zoom would make this camera a far better product. Also, the still camera is only 5 megapixels when many camera phones are as much as 8.  It seems to me increasing the mega pixels would be an easy improvement to make.  Even with these shortfalls, I still like this purchase since it's easy to carry with you, easy to use and takes good quality video.

Reviews.Title: basic portable camcorder (great for outdoors)
Reviews.Author: CrateB.
Reviews.Content: Pros: portability, great for the outdoorsIn the middle: image quality (depends on lighting; can be great with natural light)Cons: flimsy construction, ease to use, battery life

Reviews.Title: 15 minute wonder
Reviews.Author: Ram
Reviews.Content: If you want a video camera that will last all of 15 minutes and only that, this camera is for you! Out of the box, I tested it and then charged for two hours. After inserting a SDHC card I shot about 15 minutes of video and ten the camera died. I managed to review the video shot on a HDTV before the end of its life. Picture was grainy even at normal zoom. I like the Flip picture quality.

Reviews.Title: It is OK, kinda
Reviews.Author: Maverick "health2100"
Reviews.Content: Make sure that you use ultrafast class 10 card. Class 6 memory card gave me problems: video came out jumpy. They would not tell you that you really need the fastest memory card -- class 10 (expensive). Camera uses its own video format: MOV. Editing video with the software that came with this camera is mission impossible. Battery was good for 40 min of shooting only. Otherwise is OK.

Reviews.Title: NO FLASH
Reviews.Author: pawtoki
Reviews.Content: Although given a light, the light doesn't work for video or flash.Basic camera or video is more than acceptable for a cost effective system. Lots of fun. Battery life is short, so have extra batteries available. Need fast SD card. USB port is great for download and will recharge. It will record video while plugged in to wall outlet, but will not let you see live video on HMDI outlet.

Reviews.Title: Eh..... Not too impressive
Reviews.Author: Marcus T. Brody
Reviews.Content: I'm not going to do a video review like a lot of other people did, but I can say that I'm not too impressed with this camera.  As you can see, this is a verified Amazon.com purchase, so I did my homework.  I read the good, and the bad reviews before buying.  I came away from reading the reviews, thinking this was a worthwhile investment.  Well, I only paid $100-something bucks.  I didn't go broke buying it, but I expected better than this.The quality of the build of the camera is very poor.  It's almost seems like it's hollow on the inside.  Made of cheap plastic, very light material.  Not impressive.  It also looks pretty outdated.  Looks like one of the first ever Blackberry models or something.  Lastly, I still haven't figured out (in about a month), how to take good videos.  They're either too quick (especially on the 720p setting), or they're too jumpy (especially on the 1080p setting), or the quality isn't good (on the lower settings).720p - The shot is just too fast, especially in the sports mode, which it becomes a ridiculously fast shot.  Even though it's in normal mode, it almost seems like it's in fast motion when you play back videos.1080p - The quality of the picture is very good, but forget it if you have ANY sort of movement whatsoever, or you're doing a panning shot.  The SLIGHTEST quick movement looks jumpy and awkward, and if you don't hold the camera 100% steady, the quality is all jumpy and all over the place.In the lower settings, the quality just isn't good enough, but the timing is a little more on point.  If I wanted low quality shots, I would have just used my Blackberry Torch, which has a 5.0 Megapixel camera, and a standard video camera in it.All in all, not impressed at all, and I may consider selling mine while it has some retail value.Who are the 2 bozos who gave me a negative review?  I thought the idea of the rating system here was to give feedback, so people could make a proper buying decision.  How is my review a "bad" review?  I'm honest, open, and forthcoming.  Morons.

Reviews.Title: Nice Camera for the Price
Reviews.Author: Dennis
Reviews.Content: It doesn't have all the "bells & whistles" of a $500.00 HD Camera but it's compact and performs well.

Reviews.Title: Kodak - Review
Reviews.Author: Eric Mayorga "Players14"
Reviews.Content: For the price, Camera is Awsome! I like it due to the screen is much bigger than the Flip and quality is just is good!

Reviews.Title: Kodak zi8 Excellent camera
Reviews.Author: Mayra E. Guzman
Reviews.Content: I like so much.You can add more memory with SD card.  The cuality of video and photo is excellent

Reviews.Title: Dismal Stabilization
Reviews.Author: C. Waddling "duckieboy"
Reviews.Content: I'm really not sure why Kodak even claims that this camera has image stabilization (EIS).  Unless the camera is held completely still, video shot with EIS is just as shaky as if it were shot without (I've done some test shots to see if this is the case).  My Apple iMovie software, when analyzing the resultant video for stability, rejects most of what I've shot because it's simply too bouncy.  This includes video shot while sitting still and moving the camera as carefully as possible.  I'm using the latest version of the firmware (v1.6), so can't blame it on that, either.  If this is a firmware problem, then I hope Kodak gets it together and figures out a solution to this.  Otherwise, I feel as though I've just wasted a couple of hundred dollars.

Reviews.Title: Would be better with autofocus
Reviews.Author: Scott D. Stephens
Reviews.Content: As received, the low-light video quality was relatively poor.  After updating the camera software it improved.  The camera is quite easy to use and well designed in most ways.  However, it is a fixed-focus camera.  Therefore, even though it has good depth of field, many of the things you video will be either too close or too far away to be in good focus.  Therefore, the benefits of HD are lost a lot of the time.  Actually, the focus is switchable between normal (mountains symbol) and macro (flower symbol), but the macro position focuses too close up to be useful for filming people.  Autofocus would make this a much better camera.Sony makes a similar pocket-size camcorder that includes autofocus.  (I saw it demonstrated in a store.)  I recommend that you check it out before buying this camera.

Reviews.Title: Kodak ZI-8, are you kidding?
Reviews.Author: Howie Feller
Reviews.Content: Well i should have known better.  It's actually a really cool device... However, EIS.....stinks!  It simply does not work for me... my son used it and all i got was jittery video... fast moving, jumpy, yuck!  The only time it was good is if you put it on a tripod and let it go.  Other than that, walking around with it is very tricky and works if you are just very slow to move the device, else, when you play it back, you'll get dizzy!Low light is another story... very grainy.  Your better off with a nice digital camera that takes video, or a HD video camcorder with good low lux capability.I returned mine.

Reviews.Title: Great concept...poorly made.
Reviews.Author: J. Wendling
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera for our 10 year-old, very responsible, daughter for Christmas. She has experience with a friend's Flip camera and after doing much research, the Kodak seemed like a better design especially the removable memory card and battery. She immediately started making videos. A few days after Christmas, while on vacation, the display went out. Nothing but blue lines show up on the screen. Thankfully, Amazon is allowing me to return. Still not sure if we will replace.

Reviews.Title: Just good enough - bad software
Reviews.Author: H :-)
Reviews.Content: First impression: The camera seems just good enough for easy use. What I really dislike is the software for editing film. I have some experience producing film from my good old Canon DVI and Pinnacle Studio software. It works. ArcSoft does not. I recomend that you should have a pretty fast processor and lots of RAM to make  film in a smooth way from your Ai8 with the following software. It is really to bad. A pretty fast portable (XP) did not run at all. My stationary PC moved veeeery slowly. Besides I found the software little intuitive, so sitting there waiting for something to happen was a real down-trip for me. Sorry. I cannot recomend this camera with the added software. H :-(

Reviews.Title: Handy, Fun, Does what I wanted it to.
Reviews.Author: Toy Boy "Toy Boy"
Reviews.Content: I am pleased with the Zi8. I have several Sony, Nikon, etc. photo, camera phones and camcorders. This fits in a niche. My first Kodak digital of any kind. Well done. Would have preferred an external SD card slot but 8 GB is plenty for what I do. Battery life is good,too.

Reviews.Title: No Charge.
Reviews.Author: A. Bartashevich "ab21"
Reviews.Content: We were very excited to get the camera in the mail and though it worked well while testing it around the house, we ran into a problem when we had to charge the battery.  For some reason we will never know, the batter would not charge.  We tried the generic trouble shooting on Kodak's site and had no luck.  We tried contacting Kodak through their instant chat and got not only the same generic trouble shooting, but a computer or person that was extremely frustrating! In how many ways can you say you tried all the given cables before someone understands that the battery is not charging.  I then called their support and was presented the same generic trouble shooting until she said I should contact where I purchased the product for their return policy.  Now I know that all products have their problems, but I would think that Kodak would have tech support that was more familiar with their products and issues that may arise. A quick fix would have most likely been to get a new battery or for them to send us a new battery but we were instead not treated much like a customer that just purchased their product. Though this product would probably work great for someone else, it was a HUGE waste of my time.

Reviews.Title: Cool Kodak Zi8 HD Pocket video camera
Reviews.Author: John T. Morita
Reviews.Content: Got this camcorder for my girlfriend. She likes it. Perfect for her. Still in testing stage. No problems.

Reviews.Title: Yuck - who rated this so highly?
Reviews.Author: Yogi Moore "YogiM"
Reviews.Content: I have owned the Flip and the VadoHD camcorders, as well as the Panasonic SD1 and the recent Panasonic ZS3 camera/camcorder. All (except the old Flip) do 720p. Did several comparisons among the cams at 720p although did compare the Zi8 at 1080 as well.The only good thing I can say about the Zi8 is that it is marginally better than the VadoHD. The video is shaky - it is disturbing to watch. The 1080 mode is worse. The stills are a joke. The zoom is digital only. I can't get over how bad the video was, in retrospect. The Zi8 needs a tripod to remain still - since the stabilization is useless.I can only say that one clear 720p video winner here was the Panasonic ZS3 - wow! It beat the SD1 in color, stablization, and convenience. It is a great 12MP camera as well, with a 12X optical zoom. Amazing video clarity. Sure, it is a $350 camera but this comes closest to the one convergence product out there. Not much bigger than the Zi8 either.The little camcorders are cute and easily carried, but look at digicams as well - especially the ZS3. It does it all.

Reviews.Title: Picture quality very poor
Reviews.Author: Scomo
Reviews.Content: Purchased the Zi8 because I wanted a cheap and easy to use HD camera. I mostly ignored the reviews negatively reviewing the low-light performance to give it a try. I have now tried the Zi8 under a number of controlled conditions and have sent it back. In short, the picture quality in low-light conditions is simply terrible. Unwatchable terrible. It is dark, grainy and fuzzy. And by 'low-light' I am not talking about being in closet with the doors closed and the lights off. I am talking about anywhere indoors normally illuminated by traditional artificial lighting (like in your house). I repeat that...anywhere indoors. I even purchased a light to go with the camera and the indoor video is still terrible. The only place this camera works acceptably well is outside in the bright daylight-illuminated world. This makes the camera worthless in my opinion. Who wants a camera that effectively cannot be used indoors?  I thought I might be able to get an HD camera on the cheap. My needs are not excessive. I was not expecting to receive television-quality video. I only wanted to use it for easy family home movies. This camera is not even acceptable for taking home movies if you use it indoors. I have already purchased a higher end (and more expensive) HD camera.

Reviews.Title: You get what you pay for....
Reviews.Author: A. Cusenza
Reviews.Content: I guess I had to buy one of these to see for myself what standard of quality I'm dealing with.  When a product claims that it will do HD video, and take pictures, then that's what I expect.  There is no expectation here, I'm clearly basing my opinion on the products advertising. I don't understand how reviewers can hack other reviewers like they have no right to complaint about a product.  What gives them the right.  Trust me, these companies are interested in one thing only, "Market Share".  If someone does not like this product and either has to spend more for better quality, or just realized that a unit half the price does the same job, then that is the ultimate purchase, to each his own!Now being an amateur photographer and videographer, and somewhat of a tech guru, I can be a bit biased.  This is not going to be some long-winded review, I just would like to share my thoughts and hope that anyone who reads this will know what to expect when purchasing a Kodak pocket camcorder.So, for $100, it does a pretty good job of what it claims to do.  But, how well it does it is where I'm going to complain. I originally watched the video on my PC, using the SD card.  I find it completely useless connecting the Kodak with the built-in USB connector and have it physically hang down from my PC.  USB wired connectors are small and standard, not sure why these companies think that users can't plug a cable...  Anyway, video sucked watching through Quicktime.  So, then I proceeded to download the movies to my media player (Xtreamer), which is connected via HDMI to my 1080p Plasma.  And the quality was significantly better, but still very choppy.  Grainy I can understand because the video was not shot on a cloud-lit sunny perfect day.  I did not bother trying to connect the Kodak camera via HDMI directly to the TV because I won't be using it that way.  If I'm not satisfied with the quality of the video in the manner that I choose to view it, then there is no point continuing.  I will only sacrifice so much quality for size and convenience.I'm the type of person that would rather have a good quality 720p than having 1080p video for the sake of just having it.  My belief is that camera quality stems primarily from the lens.  And because I'll be shooting video indoors in low lit situations, I will look for or wait until a product satifies my basic requirements.  And for this $100 unit, I really wanted it to, but sad to say, I will have to spend a little more.

Reviews.Title: high def UNLESS you want to zoom in
Reviews.Author: NoLongerSleeping
Reviews.Content: what a JOKE!  I bought this reconditioned and was totally disappointed in the picture quality - which was WORSE than my old standard def DV camcorder!  I thought it might be a reconditioning issue.  WHen I discussed the issue with Kodak support they informed it that it is 1080p.... UNLESS you zoom in - then it no longer is!  WHAT A JOKE!  don't buy the 1080p 'full def' crap.If you are looking for a very portable, moderately decent camera - this will do.  It would be good for Youtube videos - but if you are looking for a camera to record family memories to play back on your HD TV... keep looking.I will not be buying Kodak again

Reviews.Title: Excellent Camera
Reviews.Author: D. Singh "Tech Guy"
Reviews.Content: I just received my camera today and can't wait to use it. I did purchase an additional memory card (16gb sdhc). I starting shooting some video and the quality is great. I have it set to 720p/60fps and it was excellent. I also realize when shooting at 1080p, it will drastically reduce your battery and storage. As for now, I recommend this camera to anyone.. Its great...

Reviews.Title: Kodak Zi8 don't buy
Reviews.Author: William W. Farley Jr. "Bill"
Reviews.Content: I received mine as a gift.  What a joke.  While the camera is easy to use, with only the zoom being poorly designed, the software to control the camera is a joke.  It would not upload correctly into the computer for editing or even reviewing the image.  Compared to a flip with its non sensical approach to the upload this software hardware combination should have never gone out the door at Kodak.The support at Kodak waa non existent but they do have my email three times and I think they got the serial numbe 4 times.  But alas no support.  This goes back today.

Reviews.Title: Easy and fun to use
