Reviews.Author: John B. Dehaas "pianojohn"
Reviews.Content: // To view this video download Flash Player (version 9.0.115 or higher)'); } } catch(err) { fp_resizePlayerSpace('cv_mo2FH8ZFR9QQ5OJ', 0, 0); } return false; } function _cv_mo2FH8ZFR9QQ5OJloadSwf(movieID, playerVersion) { var swfLocation = "http://g-ecx.images-amazon.com/images/G/01/am3/20120510035744301/AMPlayer._V148501545_.swf"; Reviews.Title: Disappointment
Reviews.Author: Harvgrl
Reviews.Content: The product did not turn on. I was gravely disappointed. No, I am not a dumb user, I know how to charge it. Even plugging the product into the charger without the battery was no use. I was gravely disappointed as this is my first time purchasing a product on Amazon.

Reviews.Title: Shipping is great
Reviews.Author: purple petunia
Reviews.Content: I purchased this as a gift and it arrived in great condition and in good time.  I haven't had any feedback from the recipient so cannot add anything about its functionality.

Reviews.Title: Handy and easy to use
Reviews.Author: Ken
Reviews.Content: A swell little camera.  The most negative aspect is that one cannot play directly from the camera to an HDTV, if one has taken a movie with the long axis vertical.  Well one could, but then would have to keep one's head turned sideways to watch.  Not really a comfortable thing to do.  I suppose one could watch while lying down.  Otherwise, the picture quality is great; the sound is a little weak, as others have reported.  I'd buy it again.

Reviews.Title: I'm disappointed
Reviews.Author: neithernet
Reviews.Content: After reading previous reviews, I really expected more.Unless you're on a tripod and shooting a well lit scene, the video quality will suffer significantly.  Video under ideal conditions is passable, but once you're outside that narrow set of ideal conditions, you'll wish you'd bought a better camera.  The only saving grace is that it's $179.  If your only criterion is cost, here's your camcorder.  If you care about quality, keep shopping.

Reviews.Title: Whine
Reviews.Author: G. Boardman
Reviews.Content: I spent four hours trying to download the firmware before they promised to send it to me on a card.  Why didn't they just include a card with the update when it shipped?  If they card doesn't come soon, or it doesn't fix the problem I'm sending it back and going for the flip

Reviews.Title: Zi8 Review
Reviews.Author: Gerard J. Duya "James"
Reviews.Content: I've had the Kodak Zi8 since early this month and I rate it 4 stars.The things that I dislike about the Zi8. Needs a mini tripod to stand on it's own.  Internal mic doesn't sound great outdoors, too much wind noise. No flash for indoor stills.Things I like about the Zi8. It has a mic input. WVGA mode 848 by 480 and 720p @ 60 fps. Records while plugged into the outlet without using batteries. Very portable and easy to use. Accepts SDHC cards.Improvements:It would be great if the settings I currently have are saved so when I turn it back on again, it would still be on those settings or save multiple settings. (edit: settings are saved except for mic gain setting) It would be also good if it were able to turn off the red light during recording and the snap sound while taking stills.Notes: Since the image stabilization is not that great (didn't expect it to be) I record video by attaching a mini tripod to it and grasp the tripod legs for more stability while shooting. I use the Sony EMC-DS30P microphone along with the Zi8 to produce better sound. It also came with a wind screen. I ordered on Amazon for 30 or so dollars. I also have a small bag/case that fits my mini tripod, extra battery, Sony mic, Zi8 and a compact Canon digi cam for my stills. Also I got the 3 dollar "back up" battery here on Amazon. Arcsoft or whatever software that comes with it is okay but nothing to write home about. I just drag the files from my Zi8 to my computer then use Cyberlink's PowerDirector 8 to edit video and upload straight to youtube! I got the black Zi8 but I really wanted the raspberry one. What I'm going to end up doing, since I'm going to the Philippines soon, I will be G masking it(custom skin) for a cool distinct look.  check out [...]All in all it is a great inexpensive video camera that takes nice video and great sound (from external mic) but does not replace my small point and shoot cam for stills. It doesn't matter much now since my carrying case can house both. My 2nd choice would be the Vado HD.

Reviews.Title: Ok camera
Reviews.Author: Charles D. Martin "dzldan"
Reviews.Content: The video is a bit shakey if you walk around. But I can live with it. The only thing I do not like is that you can not put date/time stamp on the video or the snapshot. This is lame. Why enter date/time on the camera if you can't use it. Simple software issue. I need the date/time stamp for legal issues when taking a picture. If on the video would be a bonus, but not a killer. But why not have the time stamp option to be on both.

Reviews.Title: No help at customer service
Reviews.Author: Beta13 "Beta13"
Reviews.Content: This camera is just OK. The video I took was at a dance studio with low lighting and it did well but if you use the zoom your pictures are fuzzy. Indoor pictures are OK but not great. Also, I thought since it had a USB that I could just plug it into my computer and I wouldn't need a card reader. This is only true if you own a laptop or your USB ports are at the bottom of your desktop. I have a desktop and my ports are midway up the tower. Kodak gives you 3 cables. One for recharging the battery and 2 to attach to TVs. I had to bend over and hold the camera to the USB port to download it. I contacted Kodak to explain the tower problem and asked if I needed to buy a cable of some sort to go from camera to computer. Their response was (a) what is a tower? Do you mean tripod? (b) there is no cable you can buy to help and (c) I should use pillows to hold the camera up to the USB ports. My solution - my son gave me a USB to USB cable that worked just fine to download the camera and I sent Kodak a picture of a "tower".

Reviews.Title: Not quite as good as the Flip
Reviews.Author: C. Harada
Reviews.Content: After reading reviews on how this was a better camera than the Flip, I purchased one to try out. I have several Flip Minos, a Zoom and this, that I use to create YouTube videos. The video quality is ok but I think the Flip is still a better camera. I've been using the Flips for 1 1/2 years for school projects and yes, I wish the mic were better but I'll stick by the Flip and maybe give the Kodak away. I was not impressed with the camera set at 1080P setting.

Reviews.Title: Good for the price.
Reviews.Author: J. Howard
Reviews.Content: I'll keep this short.  This camera is easy to use, highly portable, and the battery life seems to be very good.  The picture quality is very good in well lit areas (outdoors or in a very sunny room).  The picture quality suffers quite a bit in a fairly dark room.  All in all, this is a good pocket camcorder.  If the low light performance was better, I would give it 5-stars.

Reviews.Title: Shaky
Reviews.Author: Chas "Chas"
Reviews.Content: If used on a tri pod,  This camera is the best around.  However, if you need something thats portable, this camera is not the way to go.The Flip as well as the Vado perform much better as a stand alone.  The video quality on both the cameras are very good with sharp colors and crisp sound.Sadly, I sent mine back.BTW - Kodak's support center is so bad it's almost funny.

Reviews.Title: Go with the flipcam
Reviews.Author: spp5r
Reviews.Content: Please, do yourself a favor and buy another small hd camera. Yes, the 1080pi might sound nice, as does the ability to hook an another mic, but the picture this thing gives you is awful, not only grainy but often skewed by distorted lines. Its also too lightweight to hold still. Just get a flipcam.

Reviews.Title: Do NOT buy from Kodak online
Reviews.Author: J. Vrana
Reviews.Content: Kodak does not stand behind its products. I bought the Zi8 in November to take on a cruise. When I got home none of the photos came out. I started using it just for videos, then some of the videos did not come out. Then it died completely in March. I had to mail it to them at my expense. 2 weeks later it came back and still will not come on. They refuse to give me a refund, even though support told me to take it back to the store to get a refund. I bought it from [...] and they refuse to give a refund, claiming that they only do that for 30 days. So if your camera breaks after 30 days, you are screwed.

Reviews.Title: Lense broke in less than a month
Reviews.Author: Richard B. Shaw
Reviews.Content: Good product in concept.  After a month the lense broke off of the camera.  This lense is actually recessed into the camera.  For it to fail ment the clips that hold into place snapped off.Kodak no help in fixing.

Reviews.Title: Easily replaced by today's camera phone
Reviews.Author: Horace'sWorld
Reviews.Content: I bought this item a year ago (2010 christmas) and am finally getting around to writing a review. The device broke down and would not take videos after 3-4 months for no particular reason. To be honest the video quality is on par with any 1080p camera phone so why bother. This thing is totally obsolete. I wouldn't use it if it were under warranty and could replace it for free!

Reviews.Title: Camera is not for Casual users
Reviews.Author: Dona C. General
Reviews.Content: Physical size is good for a pocket camera; and picture is OK. Greatest "con" :  I have small hands and fingers, but the buttons are too small, even for me. Thus, one needs the remote control which takes away the obvious convenience for buying a pocket camera. Camera needs a case big enough for the extras that come with it. I have a Kodak Z612 point and shoot camera that I like very much which is why I bought the Zi8.Bottom line: I'm disappointed with the Zi8. I will use it, but likely not much because the memory cards are expensive and the camera is difficult to use. Wish I had more experience with movie cams before I bought this one.

Reviews.Title: Not good
Reviews.Author: Richard B. Wilson
Reviews.Content: I just opened this item and couldn't even get the battery cover off to get started.  Kodak chat support couldn't even follow my information to get a solution.  I shipped it back.  It's an inferior product with no support.

Reviews.Title: Recording time
Reviews.Author: Magsy
Reviews.Content: Kodak lies about their recording time.  They claim you can get up to 10 hours of HD video with a 32GB card and about 20 minutes of HD video per GB. In reality, you only get about 8-10 minutes of HD video per GB and a 32GB card only gets you about 5.5 hours.

Reviews.Title: BUYER BEWARE!!!!!--included IMPORT & EDITING SOFTWARE BUGGY/UNUSABLE
Reviews.Author: mashtato
Reviews.Content: ZERO stars. Bought this and happily shot over 200 photos and many many videos in reccomended 720 mode on a once in a lifetime island vacation. Have brand new laptop with lots of power, compatible w/ the included ArcSoft Software. Well, now I have these wonderful clips that the software will not handle,upload, burn, edit or anything. Computer and software freeze up. Had to take laptop to store to unfreeze it was so hung up. Non-existant FAQ or support for ArcSoft/Kodak. You basically will have to convert your files somehow-- they are MOV and NOT COMPATIBLE W/ WINDOWS MOVIEMAKER....See I am not a computer scientist as are the many many others that have been complaining on forums about this terrible, worthless software that comes with this camera. I liked using the camera but have spent over 6 nights, 20 hours trying to publish my files to Youtube or facebook. When you are finally able to piece together a few clips it won't even play them back properly in preview mode. The camera itself may be okay but you will PULL OUT YOUR HAIR with this ArcSoft software, and Kodak will not be any help to you. DO NOT make the mistake of buying this camera!!!

Reviews.Title: Don't waste your money
Reviews.Author: Mack
Reviews.Content: Got this at Target and it's going back tomorrow.  I was excited after reading the positive reviews, but once I got it home and started using it I was extremely disappointed.  The image stabilization is total crap, and shooting in anything other than full daylight produces dark, grainy images.  As far as still shots, I get better results with my cell phone camera.

Reviews.Title: Beware ordering from Amazon
Reviews.Author: Bill Meyer
Reviews.Content: I ordered this camera from Amazon for my daughter to get an early start on Christmas shopping.  Amazon was the seller and the condition was labeled as "new".  When I received the camera, it camera box had previously been opened, all the components removed and repackaged in their plastic and a piece of clear tape placed on the outside to reseal the box.Amazon Customer Service was quick to apologize and reshipped a new unit with the specific instructions to ensure the unit was new and unopened.  Well, three days later I've received the replacement unit and it, too, was previously opened then taped shut.Amazon Customer Service's only option was to refund my money and pull the product from their website until a full investigation can be done of all their distribution centers.So... buyer beware.  There seems to be a quality control issue at Amazon.  I'm placing my order with Newegg so hopefully they will be able to fulfill as promised.

Reviews.Title: everything good here
Reviews.Author: J. Adams
Reviews.Content: a present for my sister. she seems to love it.she isn't near me so i can't comment much.

Reviews.Title: Birthday gift
Reviews.Author: Ronald C. Greenhalgh
Reviews.Content: I charged item and as soon as it was opened it was used right away

Reviews.Title: zoom does not zoom smoothly, stupid design
Reviews.Author: S. Liu "Hiveraids"
Reviews.Content: the zoom of the video camera is stupidly designed, it can not move smoothly, if you want to zoom quickly, it only shows one step by one step, really uncomfortable. I am not sure if only mine has the problem, gonna test in the local store.

Reviews.Title: The only thing worst than the camcorder is the customer service
Reviews.Author: Hector Daza Jr.
Reviews.Content: Where should I begin.... I don't usually write reviews here on Amazon, because I'm just so satisfied with the product I decide to leave the positive reviews as they are.  But, this time around I experienced a very furious and frustrating experience.  I didn't purchase my product from this website, but this is just a warning to all potential buyers of this product to stay AWAY!The camera turns very darker once you start to ZOOM in, it's very irritating.  When I called Kodak for an explanation they kept telling me that it was normal and if I needed it repaired that I can send it back to them...?  If it's normal why would it need repair, so I can get the same thing back?  It was not worth the money and the I had the most updated firmware (even though they tried to tell me otherwise).Do yourself a favor and stick to flip camera's they will continue to grow in other large media categories.  The products they have are great and you can't go wrong!  Mark my words... KODAK CUSTOMER SERVICE WILL DRIVE YOU TO INSANITY!

Reviews.Title: the Zi8 ain't no Flip Mino
Reviews.Author: Elvis D'silva "independent filmmaker"
Reviews.Content: A lot of the reviews said that THIS was the camera that brought micro camcorders into their own. This is not true. The Flip does a better job than the z18 on every front - from video to low light video to audio recording.even the build quality of the zi8 is terrible. It feels terribly flimsy and the form factor does not aid on-the-go shooting the way the Flip does.I was very disappointed with this purchase.

Reviews.Title: Worked Fine, but couldn't get decent playback on my computer
Reviews.Author: Bit of a Geek
Reviews.Content: Bought two, sent them back. I liked the removable batteries and memory. The devices worked fine, but I couldn't get decent playback on my computer regardless of the media software I used.

Reviews.Title: Seriously the worst experience
Reviews.Author: Zzzzz
Reviews.Content: So I buy this particular pocket camera because it offers HD video and stills - the only one that offers still for now.  And, I bought it in anticipation of my son's birthday.  Lo and behold, the battery won't take a charge.  Like others in the reviews for this item, the box clearly had been opened before as it had scotch tape over the original manufacturer's tape.  I tried contacting Kodak and their customer service was useless.  It was my fault to count on being able to use this camera for my son's birthday so I returned it and went to a retail store and bought something else.  At least Amazon can see that there is something wrong with the disti supplying these since they are clearly refurbs or returns or something...the firmware was 1.03 and the current version is something like 1.05 also.  I was hopeful in making the move towards a Kodak, having seen some pretty good reviews for this camera, but now I think I'll be defaulting back to Canon and maybe even Sony and/or Fuji.  Thanks to Amazon for having a great return policy.

Reviews.Title: Don't bother with Kodak--Customer service is a JOKE!
Reviews.Author: B. Lupp
Reviews.Content: What a fantastic company to deal with (read: sarcasm).  After weeks of delaying this product's launch it was finally labeled "in-stock" on their website.  Just to be sure, I called, and an agent assured me that it was, in fact, available and ready to ship.  So after placing my order and purchasing all necessary accessories through Amazon (including a case and SDHC card) I learned that my order had been canceled.  The agent couldn't tell me why, but said "that's so sad" which was followed by background laughter.  Plus, they're backordered again.  As far as I'm concerned, any company that treats their customers like this certainly won't stand behind their product in case of problems.  As for me, I'm waiting for some of the new launches from Samsung, etc.

Reviews.Title: Must be fixing the product
Reviews.Author: Kindle Customer
Reviews.Content: I ordered the Zi8 in mid/late August from Amazon with an estimated delivery date if 9/15.  9/15 came and went and now they are saying 9/30.  Since I pre-ordered this product, it is not because they suddenly sold out of it.  I suspect Kodak had so many returns of the first release that they have held back shipment of this product to address the issues others have discussed in their reviews.  If it is delayed again, it may mean they are not able to solve these problems.  So, I can't provide a review based on usage, but it seems like this product was released prematurely and is now intentionally off of store shelves as determined by Kodak.A three star review is just a placeholder for now.

Reviews.Title: Do NOT recommend!
Reviews.Author: SchaeberleD
Reviews.Content: While this camera is pretty cool and would be very convenient to transport the camera is just not that great.  There is zero internal memory which I am sure Kodak does intentionally so you have to spend money on their memory cards.  I do NOT recommend this video camera at all.  Really think hard before you make this purchase!

Reviews.Title: My Purchase through Amazon
Reviews.Author: Nancy Blackman
Reviews.Content: Amazon has left me with a serious bitter taste over this purchase.  I got the unit and it was defective.  I returned it as they requested, then received a e-mail stating they would send me a new zi8 when they got it.  After two weeks I E-MAILED THEM WITH WHERE'S MY STUFF. I received an e-mail stating they would answer within 12 hours. A week later and no word. I canceled the camera and they are sending me my money.  In the interim I learned they have plenty of units, not in black my first request, so I asked why they didn't tell me about getting another color.  They said they can't change the order, but I could wait until I received my money, any where from 2 to 5 days later then re-order. In the beginning of this mess I told them I needed the unit for a publicity/interview for my business on the road and that this publicity was essential.  This entire episode has now entered nearly a full month.  I would fail if I ran my business that way. Buyers beware.

Reviews.Title: It did not work- new defective
Reviews.Author: Gary Showalter "parts washer guy"
Reviews.Content: I recieved it and found the buttons to change settings would not work.Returned it and decided to purchase a better unit to film the industrial equipment I sell.I think this is a cute toy for someone to whip out a party but not anything more.

Reviews.Title: Zoom Feature Is Horrible - Big Enough Reason to Not Buy
Reviews.Author: L. Frankel "lfrankel"
Reviews.Content: The zoom ONLY goes in staggered stages.  It looks awful.  It totally makes the camera unusable without horribly awkward viewing.  While this camera is better than the Flip in many categories, this alone makes me want to return this piece of garbage and get the Flip.

Reviews.Title: needs work... but better than expected
Reviews.Author: Kindle Customer
Reviews.Content: // To view this video download Flash Player (version 9.0.115 or higher)'); } } catch(err) { fp_resizePlayerSpace('cv_mo2MAN4UD25Q9MZ', 0, 0); } return false; } function _cv_mo2MAN4UD25Q9MZloadSwf(movieID, playerVersion) { var swfLocation = "http://g-ecx.images-amazon.com/images/G/01/am3/20120510035744301/AMPlayer._V148501545_.swf"; logTag.type = "text/javascript"; logTag.src = "/gp/customer-media/du/log.html?ie=UTF8&p=CustomerImage&s=CustomerVideoPlay"; head[0].appendChild(logTag); } if (cv_mo2MAN4UD25Q9MZcurrentClick) { return cv_mo2MAN4UD25Q9MZcurrentClick(); } } } Length:: 1:51 MinsIf you listen to the PR you know the good stuff about full HD that works nice in the Kodak lab. Now here's the rest...I'm not a pro. I'm just a dumb guy that wants the Kodak Zi8 camera to work right in the real world. Here's my experience...First, the sound sucks. I first used this Kodak Zi8 on the America's Cup sailboat Stars & Stripes. A once in a lifetime event for me. Couldn't hear very much.Note: If I get a good mic that might actually work--it's bigger than the camera! What's the point of going small!IMPORTANT: You can't see the screen outside in the real world. It's shinny black in the sunlight. So you can't frame the image or see the controls or see the camera turn off because the battery just died. No alarms.Plus the view is narrow. A wider angle could give you a chance to catch some of the action by pointing. But no such luck with this Kodak.Also, the Zoom is way toooo fast.Also, the battery is short, and you can't replace the battery with a tripod on. You must take the tripod off before you can open the camera.Also, try to hold this Kodak or Flip camera steady. Can't be done without a steady-cam.The idea of a small high quality video camera is great!--but the reality is not so hot.Do you think Kodak could develop a better mic?Sure they can.Do you think Kodak can develop a quick change battery system?Sure they can.Do you think Kodak can develop a better screen?Yeap. Sony and the other Japanese camera companies have them.Do you think Kodak can add a better selection of lenses?Sure they can.Do you think Kodak can come up with a reasonable steady-cam system?You bet.Do you think they can make the best little video camera in the world?Why not? They have a impressive history in still and motion picture film.Then thy don't they and dominate the market... ?The Kodak Zi8 is a good start., a good step in the right direction.Kodak Zi8 Pocket Video Camera (Black)

I purchased it through Amazon which is great!I called Kodak which I guess is in India because the little girl could barely speak any ENGLISH, so I asked to speak with her supervisor, again she was from India and could not speak "ENGLISH", so she is a "STUPIDVISOR". All they could tell me was to return the camera to Amazon, I said it was Kodak's mistake and not Amazon. They again said to return it to Amazon, which is not right!I own 2 Kodak cameras and 1 Kodak printer.These are the last products I will ever purchase from Kodak Company which must be in INDIA. Kodak your customer service is worst than Dell.I wish these big companies located in US would use people that can speak the American language "ENGLISH" and leave those Indian's speaking whatever they say over there!I am a proud USA ~ "German" American, but Canada is looking better!

Reviews.Author: wirebender
Reviews.Content: This camera comes with nothing worthwhile....You have to buy memory separately...It comes with about 30 seconds of memory...ad does not memtion that..It records in 30 second bits..No provision for an extended run...What a waste of money..jb

Reviews.Title: Kodak lies by ommission
Reviews.Author: Michael Bartlett "Income Coach"
Reviews.Content: Watch out - No where, that I can find, does it say that the camera WITHOUT buying an expensive memory card will not take more than 10 seconds of total video. An obvious and deceitful ommission.When you add the cost of the memory card this is a LOT more expensive than the FLIP - and FLIP doesn't lie by hiding the additional required purchases to make the video camera work at all. FLIP just works right out of the box as described.Kodak used to be an hones reputable company - All I can say now is WATCH OUT they can't be trusted anymore.

Reviews.Title: "The Once Great Kodak"
Reviews.Author: budwzr "budwzr"
Reviews.Content: I realize that Kodak has been reduced to a kopykat in the marketplace because they (like the cable TV and car companies) thought they were king here in the US, and failed to keep up with technology and consumer demand. It's a shame and embarrassment.Kodak has yet to come out with ANY digicam that ANYONE that's not a dullard would want to buy.Why would anyone want to record 1080i on a shaky, handheld digicam? That's just plain useless. 1080i AVC is extremely dense with compression, and editing it is a nightmare.It's clear that Kodak just wants to "have a bigger number" to throw around compared to Flip. The truth is that 1080i and 720p are indistinguishable even when viewed on a 52" LCD TV, so why bother with all the hassle of 1080?

Reviews.Title: Overcharged
Reviews.Author: H. Tong Too "HTT"
Reviews.Content: The Kodak Zi8 Pocket Video Camera was advertised $179.00 & I'm charged $219.99. I have lodged several complaints by email & are still waiting for my refund. Where is your credibility?

Reviews.Title: Kodak Zi8 Pocket Video Camera -- THE WORST EVER!!!!!!!
Reviews.Author: Kevin A. Green
Reviews.Content: THIS IS THE WORST CAMERA OF ANY KIND EVER -- IF YOU WANT TO QUICKLY CAPTURE MEANINGFUL AND IMPORTANT SHOTS.  Upon each and every start-up of the camera the user is forced to choose the picture quality/mode before the camera will begin recording; with the same exact action, the user is then required to use the thumb joystick to start the recording, which, if you try this, will likely result in a 50% success rate of getting the camera recording.....in any mode  But you won't know it until the next time you wanna record.  Sounds confusing, it is!  I missed a number of what I thought were great recordings of whales only to find out the camera was NOT recording.THIS IS THE WORST CAMERA EVER TO USE IN ANY KIND OF DAYLIGHT!!!!!  The screen becomes invisible with gray glare.  You cannot see what you are shooting from ANY angle, even if you try shielding the screen with your hand as you also try to focus on the shot and, god forbid, Kodak, enjoy the moment.  My KODAK Zi8 is now at the bottom of Puget Sound, with the fishies.  WHERE WILL YOU DISPOSE OF YOURS???????  Man, I'm pissed-off!!!!

Conveniently I could still order with expedited over night shipping ($$$) and get it by Christmas. Best Buy here I come...

I've not bought one YET but having trouble coming up with just $179 and now the color I want jumps to $239??? What's up with that???

Reviews.Title: Kodak Zi6 Pocket Video Camera
Reviews.Author: G. B. Plotkin "alcofribas"
Reviews.Content: I have owned my Zi6 (sorry, this is not about the Zi8) for about six months, and have found it to be very pocket-size portable, very useful. The images are excellent, I have uploaded videos to YouTube using both the VGA and HD settings. The original instructions indicated that VGA was to be used for YouTube, but when I inadvertently recorded a clip using HD60, YouTube provided the viewer the opportunity to see it either in HD or in standard video. As others have noted, its primary weakness is camera shake. I've taken what would have been some wonderful panoramic shots of the Blue Ridge Mountains, rendered amateurish by the jumpiness of the view. I have taken some videos with my good-sized tripod attached; it helped immensely to steady the camera, as I could hold the tripod between my arm and chest. Battery life is so-so, but any camera is going to consume current when being used - always keep a spare pair of AAs in your carry case! I have not run into sound-related issues. I didn't expect the Zi6's mic to be of professional quality, but it does a decent job. Sorry if this is not the review of the Zi8 - I would expect the successor to my Zi6 to be that much better!

ProductInfo.Features:
Record High Definition video (1080p at 30 fps with 16:9 aspect ratio)
Easily upload recorded footage to YouTube with built-in USB and software
Expandable SD/SDHC card slot up to 32 GB; Rechargeable batteries and charger included
Vibrant 2.5-inch viewfinder; Watch footage on HDTV with included cables
Edit and share videos with included software
